original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod na thabs mi mkhas par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bshad do //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod na thabs mi mkhas par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bshad do //
translated: The passage from “Venerable Śāriputra, when bodhisattva mahāsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom in that way” up to “they should be known as unskilled in means” explains this.

original: gnas zhes bya ba ni sems phyin ci log gis so //
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba ni sems phyin ci log gis so //
translated: “Dwelling” is due to the mind being distorted.

original: kun tu shes zhes bya ba'i 'du shes phyin ci log gis so //
analyzed: kun tu shes zhes bya ba'i 'du shes phyin ci log gis so //
translated: “Complete knowing” is due to the perception being distorted.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni lta ba phyin ci log gis so //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni lta ba phyin ci log gis so //
translated: “Dharma” is due to the view being distorted.

original: thabs kyi sgrub pa la chos mi dmigs par spyod pa ni /
analyzed: thabs kyi sgrub pa la chos mi dmigs par spyod pa ni /
translated: The practice of skillful means is to practice without observing phenomena.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing gzugs la mi spyod ces bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing gzugs la mi spyod ces bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: The passage from “Venerable Śāriputra, when bodhisattva mahāsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom and do not practice form” up to

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni thabs la mkhas par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bshad do //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni thabs la mkhas par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bshad do //
translated: The passage from “Venerable Śāriputra, a bodhisattva great being who practices the perfection of wisdom in that way should be known as skilled in means” explains the skill in means.

original: 'di la gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du bshad zin pas bzlas te bshad mi dgos so //
analyzed: 'di la gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du bshad zin pas bzlas te bshad mi dgos so //
translated: Here, since the emptiness of form is not form, and so on, has already been explained above, it is redundant and need not be explained again.

original: thabs kyi sgrub pa la chos kyi mtshan ma mi dmigs par spyod pa ni /
analyzed: thabs kyi sgrub pa la chos kyi mtshan ma mi dmigs par spyod pa ni /
translated: The practice of means is the practice of not observing the signs of phenomena.

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: When they practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: gal te chos 'ga' zhig dmigs na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: gal te chos 'ga' zhig dmigs na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: if they observe any phenomena, they are not practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye ba yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bshad do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye ba yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bshad do //
translated: The passage from “A bodhisattva great being who practices the perfection of wisdom in that way should be known as skilled in means” explains the skill in means.

original: de la dmigs zhes bya ba dang / mi dmigs zhes bya ba dang / dmigs kyang dmigs la mi dmigs kyang mi dmigs zhes bya ba dang / dmigs pa yang ma yin mi dmigs pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi yang mtshan ma yin pa dang /🔽spyod do zhes bya ba dang / mi spyod do zhes bya ba dang / spyod kyang @105a * //
analyzed: de la dmigs zhes bya ba dang / mi dmigs zhes bya ba dang / dmigs kyang dmigs la mi dmigs kyang mi dmigs zhes bya ba dang / dmigs pa yang ma yin mi dmigs pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi yang mtshan ma yin pa dang / spyod do zhes bya ba dang / mi spyod do zhes bya ba dang / spyod kyang @105a * //
translated: The four concepts of “it is observed,” “it is not observed,” “it is observed and not observed,” and “it is neither observed nor not observed,” and the four concepts of “it is a sign,” “it is not a sign,” “it is a sign and not a sign,” and “it is neither a sign nor not a sign,”

original: spyod la mi spyod kyang mi spyod do zhes bya ba dang / spyod pa yang ma yin mi spyod pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba bzhi yang mtshan ma'o zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: spyod la mi spyod kyang mi spyod do zhes bya ba dang / spyod pa yang ma yin mi spyod pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba bzhi yang mtshan ma'o zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: and the four concepts of “it is practiced,” “it is not practiced,” “it is practiced and not practiced,” and “it is neither practiced nor not practiced,” are also signs.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ngo bo nyid med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i gnas skabs na chos thams cad dmigs su med pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ngo bo nyid med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i gnas skabs na chos thams cad dmigs su med pas /
translated: “The perfection of wisdom is essenceless and not observed” means that in the phase of the consummate, all phenomena are not observed.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis med do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis med do //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is also not existent by way of its own entity.

original: de ltar brtson pa'i sgrub pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar brtson pa'i sgrub pa bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the practice of one who strives in that way,

original: da ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de yang gnyis su med cing gnyis su bar med ces bya ba la sogs pas myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sgrub pa ston to //
analyzed: da ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de yang gnyis su med cing gnyis su bar med ces bya ba la sogs pas myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sgrub pa ston to //
translated: now, in order to teach the practice of quickly attaining complete and perfect enlightenment, he says, “That knowledge of all aspects is also nondual and not divided into two,” and so forth.

original: sgrub pa 'di yang rnam pa bzhir bstan te ting nge 'dzin gyi dkyil 'khor la slob pa dang / chos thams cad mi dmigs par slob pa dang / sgyu ma lta bu la sogs par slob pa dang / thabs la mkhas par slob pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa 'di yang rnam pa bzhir bstan te ting nge 'dzin gyi dkyil 'khor la slob pa dang / chos thams cad mi dmigs par slob pa dang / sgyu ma lta bu la sogs par slob pa dang / thabs la mkhas par slob pa'o //
translated: This practice is also taught in four parts: training in the maṇḍala of meditative concentration, training in the nonobservation of all phenomena, training in the illusion-like, and training in skill in means.

original: de la chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de la chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therein, because all phenomena are entities that do not exist,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de yang gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de yang gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: that knowledge of all aspects is also nondual and not divided into two.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni ting nge 'dzin la bslab po //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni ting nge 'dzin la bslab po //
translated: up to “one should train in the applications of mindfulness” is the instruction in meditative stabilization.

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa'i tshe zhes bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob ces bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa'i tshe zhes bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob ces bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: “Śāriputra, when a bodhisattva great being is training thus in the perfection of wisdom” and “trains in the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha by way of not apprehending anything,”

original: sh'a ri'i bu stong pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i gzhung gis ni chos thams cad la mi dmigs par bslab pa bstan to //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu stong pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i gzhung gis ni chos thams cad la mi dmigs par bslab pa bstan to //
translated: up to “Śāriputra, you should know that emptiness, by way of not apprehending anything, is the departure for the knowledge of all aspects,” the passage teaches the instruction in not apprehending any phenomenon.

original: bcom ldan 'das la la zhig 'di skad du 'dri ste ci sgyu ma'i skyes bu 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la la zhig 'di skad du 'dri ste ci sgyu ma'i skyes bu 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
translated: The Blessed One, someone asks: Does this illusory person, having trained in the perfection of wisdom, go forth to the knowledge of all aspects?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ram zhes mchis nas zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ram zhes mchis nas zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: Does he attain the knowledge of all aspects?🔽 The Blessed One, it is like this: form is like an illusion, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are like an illusion.🔽The six sense spheres are like an illusion, and the six sense contacts are like an illusion.🔽 The six sense contacts are like an illusion, and the six sense contacts are like an illusion.🔽 The six sense contacts are like an illusion, and the six sense contacts are like an illusion.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar gzugs ni sgyu ma lta bu @105b tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ni sgyu ma lta bu ste /🔽rnam par zhes pa dang lags pa de ni dbang po drug go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar gzugs ni sgyu ma lta bu @105b tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ni sgyu ma lta bu ste / rnam par zhes pa dang lags pa de ni dbang po drug go //
translated: The six sense contacts are like an illusion, and the six sense contacts are like an illusion.🔽 The six sense contacts are like an illusion, and the six sense contacts are like an illusion.🔽 The six sense contacts are like an illusion, and the six sense contacts are like an illusion.

original: de dag ni phung po lnga'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni sgyu ma lta bu la sogs par slob pa bstan to //🔽rab 'byor gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa yin la /
analyzed: de dag ni phung po lnga'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni sgyu ma lta bu la sogs par slob pa bstan to //🔽rab 'byor gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa yin la /
translated: The six sense contacts are like an illusion, and the six sense contacts are like an illusion.🔽 The six sense contacts are like an illusion, and the six sense contacts are like an illusion.🔽 The six sense contacts are like an illusion, and the six sense contacts are like an illusion.🔽 The six sense contacts are like an illusion, and the six sense contacts are like an illusion.🔽 The six sense contacts are like an illusion, and the six sense contacts are like an illusion.🔽 The six sense contacts are like an illusion, and the six sense contacts are like an illusion.🔽 The six sense contacts are like an illusion, and the six sense contacts are like an illusion.🔽 The six sense contacts are like an illusion, and the six sense contacts are like an illusion.🔽 The six sense contacts are like an illusion, and the six sense contacts are like an illusion.🔽 The six sense contacts are like an illusion, and the six sense contacts are like an illusion.🔽 The six sense contacts are like an illusion, and the six sense contacts are like an illusion.🔽 The six sense contacts are like an illusion, and the six sense contacts are like an illusion.🔽 The six sense contacts are like an illusion, and the six sense contacts are like an illusion.🔽 The six sense contacts are like an illusion, and the six sense contacts are like

original: thabs kyang mi mkhas pa zhi ste dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi lag tu yang ma song na zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: thabs kyang mi mkhas pa zhi ste dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi lag tu yang ma song na zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas bzung ste /
translated: Also, if he is not skilled in means and does not go to the spiritual teacher, and so on, up to

original: rab 'byor 'di yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sdig pa'i grogs po yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sdig pa'i grogs po yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Subhuti, you should know that this is also a bad friend of a Bodhisattva-mahāsattva.

original: rig nas kyang yongs su spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar la thug pa'i gzhung gis ni thabs mkhas pa bstan to //
analyzed: rig nas kyang yongs su spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar la thug pa'i gzhung gis ni thabs mkhas pa bstan to //
translated: Having known, one should completely abandon. This passage teaches skill in means.

original: de la ting nge 'dzin la slob pa yang rnam pa gnyis su bstan te /
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin la slob pa yang rnam pa gnyis su bstan te /
translated: There, the training in samādhi is also taught in two parts:

original: ming bshad pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa bshad pa'o //
analyzed: ming bshad pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa bshad pa'o //
translated: the explanation of the name and the explanation of non-conceptuality.

original: de la ming bshad pa la ngo bo nyid skye ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin sngar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de la ming bshad pa la ngo bo nyid skye ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin sngar bstan pa ste /
translated: Among them, the explanation of the name is the previously taught samādhi of the non-arising of intrinsic reality.

original: chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de yang gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos thams🔽cad gnyis su med pa'i gnas la bya ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de yang gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos thams cad gnyis su med pa'i gnas la bya ste /
translated: The so-called knowledge of all aspects refers to the nondual state of all phenomena.

original: 'di ltar kun brtags pa'i chos thams cad la /
analyzed: 'di ltar kun brtags pa'i chos thams cad la /
translated: Thus, in all phenomena that are imputed,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis su med pa dang / yod pa dang med pa dang / dang dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang / rtag pa dan chad pa dan /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis su med pa dang / yod pa dang med pa dang / dang dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang / rtag pa dan chad pa dan /
translated: there is no duality of apprehended and apprehender, no existence and nonexistence, no entity and nonentity, no permanence and annihilation,

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dang / chos dang chos ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / gang yang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag dang bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dan ma zhi ba dang /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dang / chos dang chos ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / gang yang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag dang bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dan ma zhi ba dang /
translated: no compounded and uncompounded, no Dharma and non-Dharma, and so on, and also no permanence and impermanence, no happiness and suffering, no self and no self, no peace and no peace,🔽no emptiness and no nonemptiness, no sign and no signless, no wish and no wishless, no arising and no nonarising, no cessation and no noncessation, no purity and no impurity, and no abandonment and no nonabandonment.

original: stong pa dang mi stong pa dang mtshan ma dang mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa dang smon pa med pa la sogs pa gnyis po de dag thams cad ni kun brtags pa yin pas /
analyzed: stong pa dang mi stong pa dang mtshan ma dang mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa dang smon pa med pa la sogs pa gnyis po de dag thams cad ni kun brtags pa yin pas /
translated: All of these dualistic things, such as empty and not empty, with signs and signless, with wishes and wishless, are imagined.

original: na / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: na / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since they do not exist in the knowledge of all aspects,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni gnyis su med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni gnyis su med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: the knowledge of all aspects is called “nondual.”

original: rtog pas byas pa'i dngos po @106a * //
analyzed: rtog pas byas pa'i dngos po @106a * //
translated: Because of the nonexistence of the two things that are made by conceptualization,

original: rnam pa gnyis med pas gnyis su byar med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis med pas gnyis su byar med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called “not to be made dual.”

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi ming brjod pas /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi ming brjod pas /
translated: The names of the meditative stabilizations🔽having been expressed,

original: ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa bstan nas /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa bstan nas /
translated: the meditative stabilizations having been taught,

original: de'i 'og tu rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: after that, in order to teach the meditative stabilization of nonconceptuality,

original: des ni ting nge 'dzin kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: des ni ting nge 'dzin kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: he does not even see a meditative stabilization.

original: bdag ni ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so zhes bya bar ting nge 'dzin des rlom sems su 'gyur ba yang med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad do //
analyzed: bdag ni ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so zhes bya bar ting nge 'dzin des rlom sems su 'gyur ba yang med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad do //
translated: I am entering into meditative concentration and so on, he does not become conceited through that meditative concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i gnas skabs na chos thams cad kyang de bzhin nyid tsam du 'gyur ba'i phyir 'di ni ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i gnas skabs na chos thams cad kyang de bzhin nyid tsam du 'gyur ba'i phyir 'di ni ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: Meditative concentration is not perceived means that in the situation of the perfected nature, all phenomena are just suchness, so this is meditative concentration.

original: bdag ni mnyam par gzhag pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa kun brtags pa rnams shin tu med pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin du rnam par rtog pa dang / bdag mnyam par gzhag par rnam par rtog pa dus kyi dbang gis rnam pa gsum dang /
analyzed: bdag ni mnyam par gzhag pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa kun brtags pa rnams shin tu med pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin du rnam par rtog pa dang / bdag mnyam par gzhag par rnam par rtog pa dus kyi dbang gis rnam pa gsum dang /
translated: Since the imagined I am in meditative equipoise and so on are utterly nonexistent, there is no conceptualization as meditative concentration, no conceptualization of the self as in meditative equipoise, and no conceptualization of the time.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa de dag med do //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa de dag med do //
translated: There is no conceptualization of meditative equipoise.

original: de'i phyir de la rnam par rtog pa de dag med ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la rnam par rtog pa de dag med ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, Those conceptualizations do not exist for him.

original: de nyid kyi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang gzhan la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang gzhan la /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “The perfection of wisdom is not one thing,

original: ting nge 'dzin kyang gzhan zhing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin kyang gzhan zhing /
translated: and the meditative stabilization is another,

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang gzhan zhes bya ba med kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang gzhan zhes bya ba med kyi /
translated: and the bodhisattva is another.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The perfection of wisdom itself is the meditative stabilization,

original: ting nge 'dzin nyid kyang byang chub sems dpa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin nyid kyang byang chub sems dpa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: and the meditative stabilization itself is the bodhisattva.

original: chos thams cad ni de bzhin nyid tsam du bdag nyid gcig pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni de bzhin nyid tsam du bdag nyid gcig pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
translated: This is because all phenomena are of one nature, just suchness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so //🔽ting nge 'dzin bstan par nus sam zhes bya ba ni tha dad du byas te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so // ting nge 'dzin bstan par nus sam zhes bya ba ni tha dad du byas te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “because of the sameness of all phenomena.”

original: brjod par nus sam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: brjod par nus sam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: “Is it possible to teach the meditative stabilization?” means “is it possible to make a distinction and say it?”

original: byang chub sems dpa' nyid ting nge 'dzin yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro snyam nas dris pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nyid ting nge 'dzin yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro snyam nas dris pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: The bodhisattva himself is meditative stabilization, and asked, Are the bodhisattvas who are skilled in meditative stabilization those who are skilled in the names of meditative stabilizations?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de ni ma yin no zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de ni ma yin no zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The Lord said, No, Venerable Sariputra, it is not like that.

original: de nas gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus gal te ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi ming med na ci'i phyir de dag gi ming brjod snyam du @106b bsams nas /
analyzed: de nas gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus gal te ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi ming med na ci'i phyir de dag gi ming brjod snyam du @106b bsams nas /
translated: Then the Elder Sariputra thought, If the meditative stabilizations have no names, why are their names expressed?

original: ting nge 'dzin de rnams la 'du shes su byed dam zhes bya ba dris te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de rnams la 'du shes su byed dam zhes bya ba dris te /
translated: He asked, Are those meditative stabilizations conceptualized?

original: ji ltar nyan thos bzhin du zhes dris pa'o //🔽de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis de lta bu'i rtog pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar nyan thos bzhin du zhes dris pa'o // de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis de lta bu'i rtog pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: He asked, Are they conceptualized as the Sravakas are?

original: 'du shes su byed pa med do zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'du shes su byed pa med do zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Then the Elder Subhuti said, Because there is no such conceptualization, they are not conceptualized.

original: de nas bshad pa gzhan gyi ting nge 'dzin bshad pa bstan pa dang / bya ba gzhan gyis bstan pa'i phyir ji ltar 'du shes su byed par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba gsungs pa dang / de nas ting nge 'dzin dag dang / de dag gi byed pa rnams kyang kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyi sa ni yod kyi kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid spangs na mi dmigs te /
analyzed: de nas bshad pa gzhan gyi ting nge 'dzin bshad pa bstan pa dang / bya ba gzhan gyis bstan pa'i phyir ji ltar 'du shes su byed par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba gsungs pa dang / de nas ting nge 'dzin dag dang / de dag gi byed pa rnams kyang kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyi sa ni yod kyi kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid spangs na mi dmigs te /
translated: Then, in order to teach the meditative stabilizations and their activities, he says, “They exist on the level of the imagined nature, but are not apprehended when the imagined nature is abandoned.”

original: de'i phyir ji ltar rnam par rtog pa med pa yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar rnam par rtog pa med pa yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, he says, “How can they be non-conceptual?”

original: de nas bdag gi bsam pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nas bdag gi bsam pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Then, in order to dispel his own doubts,

original: chos thams cad med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: chos thams cad med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: he says, “Because all phenomena do not exist.”

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa rnams kyi nang na mchog tu bstan pa zhes bya ba la nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa la bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa rnams kyi nang na mchog tu bstan pa zhes bya ba la nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa la bya ste /
translated: Thus, in order to teach that the bodhisattva is supreme among those who abide in the absence of afflictions, he says, “In this way, among those who abide in the absence of afflictions, the bodhisattva is taught to be supreme.” Here, “afflictions” refers to conceptual thoughts.

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba rnam par mi rtog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba rnam par mi rtog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The meditative absorption in the non-conceptual, free from all conceptual thought, is called the meditative absorption in the absence of affliction.

original: de bas na rnam par mi rtog pa nyid la legs so zhes bya ba byin no //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par mi rtog pa nyid la legs so zhes bya ba byin no //
translated: Therefore, the Buddha said, “Excellent!” with regard to the non-conceptual.

original: de ltar ting nge 'dzin la bslab pa bstan nas dmigs su med par bslab pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar ting nge 'dzin la bslab pa bstan nas dmigs su med par bslab pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having taught the training in meditative stabilization, in order to teach the training in the absence of reference,

original: sh'a ri'i bu de ltar slob pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de ltar slob pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it says, “Śāriputra, one who trains in that way trains in the unshared qualities of the Buddha up to the absence of reference.”

original: dmigs su med par bslab pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dmigs su med par bslab pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the training in the absence of reference,

original: sh'a ri'i bu shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir bdag mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang zag mi dmigs par bstan nas /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir bdag mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang zag mi dmigs par bstan nas /
translated: it says, “Śāriputra, the self is not apprehended because of being utterly pure,” and so on. Having taught the non-apprehension of the person,

original: de'i 'og tu phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i chos rnams dmigs su med pa bstan te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i chos rnams dmigs su med pa bstan te /
translated: After that, the non-apprehension of phenomena such as the aggregates, elements, and sense-fields is taught.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa nas sangs rgyas kyi bar du mi dmigs pa bstan to //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa nas sangs rgyas kyi bar du mi dmigs pa bstan to //
translated: From the stream-enterer up to the Buddha, non-apprehension is taught.

original: thams cad la yang shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mthar phyin pa'i rnam par dag pa'i rgyur gyur pa nye bar bzung nas de'i ngo bo nyid zhu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad la yang shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mthar phyin pa'i rnam par dag pa'i rgyur gyur pa nye bar bzung nas de'i ngo bo nyid zhu ba'i phyir /
translated: And because of complete purity in all of them, taking the cause of ultimate purity, because of the melting of its essence,

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par dag pa gang lags @107a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par dag pa gang lags @107a * //
translated: he asks, Bhagavan, what is purity?

original: zhes bya ba zhus pa dang de nas yongs su grub pa dri ma med pa de bzhin nyid la rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba zhus pa dang de nas yongs su grub pa dri ma med pa de bzhin nyid la rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Then, in order to teach the purity of the stainless thusness that is fully accomplished,

original: sh'a ri'i bu skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / dmigs su med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa ni rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽sngon de bzhin nyid dri ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na ni kun brtags pas chos rnams skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar 'gyur te skyes pa rnams 'byung zhing byung nas kyang de lta de ltar dmigs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / dmigs su med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa ni rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste zhes bya ba gsungs te / sngon de bzhin nyid dri ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na ni kun brtags pas chos rnams skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar 'gyur te skyes pa rnams 'byung zhing byung nas kyang de lta de ltar dmigs par 'gyur la /
translated: “Śāriputra, non-production, non-cessation, non-affliction, non-purification, non-appearance, non-apprehension, and non-conditioning are called ‘purification.’

original: de lta de ltar mngon par 'du byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta de ltar mngon par 'du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Previously, in the stage of tathāgatagarbha with stains, imputed phenomena are produced, cease, are afflicted, and are purified. Those that are produced appear, and having appeared, they are apprehended in such and such a way, and in such and such a way they are conditioned.

original: dri ma med pa'i gnas skabs na ni de bzhin nyid de la chos thams cad kyi skye ba thams cad med de /
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i gnas skabs na ni de bzhin nyid de la chos thams cad kyi skye ba thams cad med de /
translated: In the stage of stainlessness, in that tathāgatagarbha, the production of all phenomena does not exist.

original: skye ba med pas 'gag pa yang med do //
analyzed: skye ba med pas 'gag pa yang med do //
translated: Because of non-production, cessation also does not exist.

original: dri ma med pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang rnam par byang ba med pa dang 'byung ba med par 'gyur ro //🔽'byung ba med pas dmigs su med do //
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang rnam par byang ba med pa dang 'byung ba med par 'gyur ro // 'byung ba med pas dmigs su med do //
translated: Because of being stainless, there is no affliction, no purification, and no arising.🔽Because of non-arising, there is no objectification.

original: dmigs su med pa'i phyir mngon bar 'du byed pa med de /
analyzed: dmigs su med pa'i phyir mngon bar 'du byed pa med de /
translated: Because of non-objectification, there is no formation.

original: 'di ni shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the extremely pure.

original: chos gang la yang slob pa med do zhes bya ba ni de dri ma med pa'i gnas skabs na chos thams cad ma mthong ba'i phyir chos 'di dag ni de lta bur yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: chos gang la yang slob pa med do zhes bya ba ni de dri ma med pa'i gnas skabs na chos thams cad ma mthong ba'i phyir chos 'di dag ni de lta bur yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: There is no training in any dharma at all. This is said because in the stainless state, all dharmas are not seen. It is said, “These dharmas do not exist in that way.”

original: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du yod pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du yod pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that they do not exist in the imagined characteristic,

original: sh'a ri'i bu ji ltar med pa de ltar yod do zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu ji ltar med pa de ltar yod do zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Śāriputra, it is said, “They exist in the way that they do not exist.”

original: kun brtags pa'i dngos po med pa'i rnam pa brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid du yod par bstan pa'i phyir de ltar yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir ma rig pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i dngos po med pa'i rnam pa brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid du yod par bstan pa'i phyir de ltar yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir ma rig pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the nature of the non-existence of imagined things is inexpressible, he says, “It is said to be ignorance because it does not exist in that way.”

original: rmi lam gyi rnam par shes pa bzhin du bdag nyid kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir med bzhin du yod pa ma yin pa'i don gzhan dag la yang 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi rnam par shes pa bzhin du bdag nyid kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir med bzhin du yod pa ma yin pa'i don gzhan dag la yang 'dzin par byed do //
translated: Like the consciousness in a dream, it does not exist as it appears, and so it is said that it does not exist while existing.

original: yang na yang dag par ma rig pa ste /
analyzed: yang na yang dag par ma rig pa ste /
translated: Alternatively, it is non-knowledge of reality.

original: yang dag pa ma yin par rig cing shes par byed pa ni ma rig pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin par rig cing shes par byed pa ni ma rig pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is the knowledge and understanding of what is not real.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad @107b du mchis pa ma lags pa la ma rig pa zhes bgyi zhes zhus pa dang / sh'a ri'i bu gzugs yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad @107b du mchis pa ma lags pa la ma rig pa zhes bgyi zhes zhus pa dang / sh'a ri'i bu gzugs yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The Lord was asked, “Why is it called ignorance with regard to what does not exist?” and he replied, “Śāriputra, form does not exist,” and so on.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The intention is as follows.

original: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams med cing yang dag pa ma yin pa yang /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams med cing yang dag pa ma yin pa yang /
translated: Thus, phenomena such as form do not exist, and yet they are🔽grasped as if they were real.

original: yang dag yod pa bzhin du 'dzin te de'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dag yod pa bzhin du 'dzin te de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: de yang dag par ma rig pa ste /
analyzed: de yang dag par ma rig pa ste /
translated: they are called “ignorance.”🔽Because they are not known as they are, they are called “ignorance.”

original: yang dag par ma shes pas ma rig pa zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams bka' stsal to //
analyzed: yang dag par ma shes pas ma rig pa zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams bka' stsal to //
translated: In order to teach this, the Buddha taught phenomena such as form.

original: don 'di nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don 'di nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify this very point,

original: de la byis pa rnams ma rig pa dang / sred pa dag gis mngon par zhen nas mtha' gnyis la chags zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de la byis pa rnams ma rig pa dang / sred pa dag gis mngon par zhen nas mtha' gnyis la chags zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “There, fools, through ignorance and craving, are attached to the two extremes.”

original: ma rig pa'i dbang gis yod pa'i rnam par mngon par zhen nas sred pa'i dbang gis ro myang bar bya ba'i sgo nas mngon par zhen te /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i dbang gis yod pa'i rnam par mngon par zhen nas sred pa'i dbang gis ro myang bar bya ba'i sgo nas mngon par zhen te /
translated: Through the power of ignorance, they are attached to the appearance of existence, and through the power of craving, they are attached to the experience of objects.

original: rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' gnyis la chags zhas bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de dag mi shes mi mthong zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'am /
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' gnyis la chags zhas bya ba'i tha tshig go // de dag mi shes mi mthong zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'am /
translated: This is what is meant by “attached to the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism.”

original: mngon sum mam /
analyzed: mngon sum mam /
translated: “They do not know and do not see” means that they do not know or see through inference or🔽direct perception.

original: yang na lung gi mthu'am /
analyzed: yang na lung gi mthu'am /
translated: or by the power of the scriptures,

original: rang gi mthus mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mthus mi shes pa'o //
translated: or by their own power.

original: 'di la 'gres gsum ste /
analyzed: 'di la 'gres gsum ste /
translated: Here there are three permutations:

original: ma rig pa'i rtsa ba las byung ba dang / rtog pa'i rtsa ba las byung ba dang / ma dad pa'i rtsa ba las byung ba'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rtsa ba las byung ba dang / rtog pa'i rtsa ba las byung ba dang / ma dad pa'i rtsa ba las byung ba'o //
translated: arising from the root of nescience, arising from the root of imagination, and arising from the root of lack of faith.

original: de la ma rig pa'i dbang gis ni med pa'i chos rnams la yod par bzung nas sred pas ro myong bar byed pa'i dbang gis mtha' gnyis su lhung ba'i byis pa rnams kyis mi shes ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni 'gres dang po'o //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa'i dbang gis ni med pa'i chos rnams la yod par bzung nas sred pas ro myong bar byed pa'i dbang gis mtha' gnyis su lhung ba'i byis pa rnams kyis mi shes ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni 'gres dang po'o //
translated: By the power of nescience, they grasp as existent things that are not existent. By the power of craving, they experience the taste of things. The childish who fall into the two extremes do not know and do not see. This is the first permutation.

original: de ltar shes pa dang / mthong ba med pas rtog pa mang du gyur te yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin pas rtog cing chos thams cad la mngon par zhen nas /
analyzed: de ltar shes pa dang / mthong ba med pas rtog pa mang du gyur te yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin pas rtog cing chos thams cad la mngon par zhen nas /
translated: Since they do not know and do not see in this way, they have many imaginations. Since they imagine things not as they really are, they cling to all things.

original: mtha' gnyis su rtog pa'i phyir mi shes mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis su rtog pa'i phyir mi shes mi mthong ngo //
translated: Because they imagine the two extremes, they do not know and do not see.

original: de dag chos thams cad mi shes mi mthong bas byis pa so so'i skye bo zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ste nges par 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gres gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de dag chos thams cad mi shes mi mthong bas byis pa so so'i skye bo zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ste nges par 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gres gnyis pa'o //
translated: They do not know or see all dharmas, so they are counted as ‘foolish ordinary people’, and do not go forth. This is the second permutation.

original: de bzhin du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du thos kyang don de la ma dad pas dang ba la gnas pa med pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub pa la mi gnas so //🔽sgrub pa la mi gnas pas phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba la sogs pa @108a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du thos kyang don de la ma dad pas dang ba la gnas pa med pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub pa la mi gnas so // sgrub pa la mi gnas pas phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba la sogs pa @108a * //
translated: Similarly, even though they hear the truth as it is, they do not have faith in that meaning, and because they do not abide in clarity, they do not abide in the practice of the perfections.

original: rtogs par bya ba'i chos rnams mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: rtogs par bya ba'i chos rnams mi 'thob ste /
translated: Because they do not abide in practice, they do not attain the dharmas to be realized, such as irreversibility.

original: de bas na chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa'i skyon gyis byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o zhes bya ba ni 'gres gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa'i skyon gyis byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o zhes bya ba ni 'gres gsum pa'o //
translated: Therefore, because of the fault of clinging to all dharmas, they are counted as ‘foolish ordinary people’. This is the third permutation.

original: de ltar gyur pa de dag la slob pa dang / nges par 'byung ba yang med do zhes bstan nas ci'i phyir slob pa dang / nges par 'byung ba med ces zhus pa dang / gang gi phyir thabs mi mkhas pa pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang /🔽sgrub pa'i chos rnams la rtog cing mngon par zhen par byed pa de'i phyir slob pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa de dag la slob pa dang / nges par 'byung ba yang med do zhes bstan nas ci'i phyir slob pa dang / nges par 'byung ba med ces zhus pa dang / gang gi phyir thabs mi mkhas pa pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / sgrub pa'i chos rnams la rtog cing mngon par zhen par byed pa de'i phyir slob pa med do //
translated: Having taught that those who proceed in that way have neither training nor definite emergence, he is asked, “Why is there neither training nor definite emergence?”🔽“Because of conceptualizing and fixating on the practices and phenomena of all the perfections and

original: gang gi phyir byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la sogs pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dag la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa de'i phyir nges par 'byung ba med do zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la sogs pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dag la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa de'i phyir nges par 'byung ba med do zhes bstan nas /
translated: because of conceptualizing and fixating on the dharmas of the wings of enlightenment and so on up to omniscience, there is no training and there is no definite emergence.”

original: de nas yang pha rol tu phyin pa de dag nyid la sgrub pa'i chos rnams mi dmigs par slob pa la zhugs pa'i ming du 'gyur ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / chos rnams dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi bar du mi dmigs pa nyid nges par 'byung ba yin no zhes bya bas /
analyzed: de nas yang pha rol tu phyin pa de dag nyid la sgrub pa'i chos rnams mi dmigs par slob pa la zhugs pa'i ming du 'gyur ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / chos rnams dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi bar du mi dmigs pa nyid nges par 'byung ba yin no zhes bya bas /
translated: Then, the very perfections themselves are the name of the practice of the non-apprehension of the dharmas of the practice, and the non-apprehension of the knowledge of all modes, and of the dharmas, and of all dharmas up to emptiness is the very going forth.

original: dmigs su med par slob pa bstan nas /
analyzed: dmigs su med par slob pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the practice of non-apprehension,

original: yang sgyu ma lta bu la sogs par slob pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang sgyu ma lta bu la sogs par slob pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the practice of illusion-like, etc.,

original: bcom ldan 'das la la zhig 'di skad du 'dri ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la la zhig 'di skad du 'dri ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, “The Lord, someone asks thus:

original: 'di la yang gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi dngos pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la yang gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi dngos pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here, the substance of the Elder Subhuti is this:

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te dmigs su ma mchis par sbyor bas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te dmigs su ma mchis par sbyor bas /
translated: “Lord, if by the practice of non-apprehension

original: chos rnams dngos po ma mchis pas /
analyzed: chos rnams dngos po ma mchis pas /
translated: the dharmas are insubstantial,

original: dngos po ma mchis pa'i chos rnams la bslabs nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis pa'i chos rnams la bslabs nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur na ni /
translated: then having trained in the insubstantial dharmas, there is the going forth.

original: 'o na ni shin tu ma mchis pa'i sgyu ma'i skyes bus kyang /
analyzed: 'o na ni shin tu ma mchis pa'i sgyu ma'i skyes bus kyang /
translated: “Well then, even a very illusory person,

original: sgyu mar bgyis pa rnams la dmigs su ma mchis pa'i yid la bgyid pas bslabs nas /
analyzed: sgyu mar bgyis pa rnams la dmigs su ma mchis pa'i yid la bgyid pas bslabs nas /
translated: having trained in the mental activity of not observing the illusory creations,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: would go forth to the knowledge of all aspects

original: rjes su thob par 'gyur ro snyam pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su thob par 'gyur ro snyam pa'o //
translated: and would attain it.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sgyu ma'i chos rnams dang / gzugs la sogs pa tha dad pa ni ci yang med de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sgyu ma'i chos rnams dang / gzugs la sogs pa tha dad pa ni ci yang med de /
translated: Then the Lord said, “There is no difference at all between illusory phenomena and form and so on.

original: ji ltar sgyu ma'i chos rnams la bslab pa'am /
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma'i chos rnams la bslab pa'am /
translated: Just as there is no training in illusory phenomena🔽and no going forth,

original: nges par 'byung ba med pa de bzhin du byang chub @108b sems dpa' la yang gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la bslab pa'am /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba med pa de bzhin du byang chub @108b sems dpa' la yang gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la bslab pa'am /
translated: in the same way, Subhūti, there is no training in form and so on

original: de dag la nges par 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: de dag la nges par 'byung ba'am /
translated: and no going forth from them,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid nges par thob par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid nges par thob par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: and there is no attainment of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sgyu ma dang mtshungs par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgyu ma dang mtshungs par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that they are similar to an illusion,

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: the Lord said, “What do you think, Subhūti?

original: sgyu ma yang gzhan la /
analyzed: sgyu ma yang gzhan la /
translated: And the illusion is one thing,🔽

original: gzugs kyang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzugs kyang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Is illusion one thing and form another?”

original: chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dmigs su med par mthong ba dag gis ni gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags pa'i chos rnams sgyu ma las logs shig na yod par ma mthong ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dmigs su med par mthong ba dag gis ni gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags pa'i chos rnams sgyu ma las logs shig na yod par ma mthong ste /
translated: Bodhisattvas who are skilled in the fact that all phenomena are by nature unreal see that imputed phenomena such as form do not exist separately from illusion.

original: de bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das sgyu ma yang gzhan ma lags rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang gzhan ma lags te /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das sgyu ma yang gzhan ma lags rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang gzhan ma lags te /
translated: To demonstrate this, the sutra says, “Bhagavan, illusion is not one thing and omniscience is not another.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang sgyu ma /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang sgyu ma /
translated: Bhagavan, omniscience is illusion.

original: sgyu ma nyid kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i gzhung gis gsungs te /
analyzed: sgyu ma nyid kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i gzhung gis gsungs te /
translated: Illusion itself is omniscience.”

original: thams cad kyang kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du sgyu ma dang tha dad pa med do zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma'i 'gres dang po'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du sgyu ma dang tha dad pa med do zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma'i 'gres dang po'o //
translated: Since all of them are the imagined reality, they are not different from illusion in being the realitylessness of the insubstantiality of the person and of the dharmas. This is the first permutation of illusion.

original: de bzhin du skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir shin tu med pa'i sgyu ma dang / chos thams cad la bslab pa dang / nges par 'byung ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma'i 'gres gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir shin tu med pa'i sgyu ma dang / chos thams cad la bslab pa dang / nges par 'byung ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma'i 'gres gnyis pa'o //
translated: Similarly, since there is no origination, cessation, affliction, or purification, there is no illusion of utter nonexistence, and there is no attainment of the realization of all aspects, of the training, or of the escape in all dharmas. This is the second permutation of illusion.

original: gal te phung po la sogs pa ma 'dres pa'i chos rnams la thug pa'i bar dag la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i ming du mi brjod na /
analyzed: gal te phung po la sogs pa ma 'dres pa'i chos rnams la thug pa'i bar dag la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i ming du mi brjod na /
translated: If the name bodhisattva is not predicated of the aggregates, etc., up to the unmixed dharmas,

original: de lta na ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang med do //
analyzed: de lta na ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang med do //
translated: then, like the illusory man, the bodhisattva does not exist.

original: phung po la sogs pa ma 'dres pa'i mtha' la thug pa'i bar gyi chos de dag kyang skye ba dang / 'gag pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir sgyu ma bzhin du med pa nyid do //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa ma 'dres pa'i mtha' la thug pa'i bar gyi chos de dag kyang skye ba dang / 'gag pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir sgyu ma bzhin du med pa nyid do //
translated: Those phenomena, from the aggregates up to the unmixed limits, are also like illusions, because they do not arise or cease, and so on.

original: de lta na ni 'du shes dang brda la sogs pa med pa dang / shin tu med pa'i byang chub sems dpa' shin tu med pa'i chos rnams la ji ltar slob /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'du shes dang brda la sogs pa med pa dang / shin tu med pa'i byang chub sems dpa' shin tu med pa'i chos rnams la ji ltar slob /
translated: In that case, how can a Bodhisattva who is utterly nonexistent train in utterly nonexistent phenomena, without conceptualization, conventional expressions, and so on?

original: ji ltar nges par 'byung /
analyzed: ji ltar nges par 'byung /
translated: How can he attain emancipation?

original: ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa @109a * //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa @109a * //
translated: How can he attain omniscience?

original: nyid thob par 'gyur zhes bstan nas de ltar mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob pa de ni nges par 'byung zhing thob par 'gyur ro zhes mjug bsdus so //
analyzed: nyid thob par 'gyur zhes bstan nas de ltar mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob pa de ni nges par 'byung zhing thob par 'gyur ro zhes mjug bsdus so //
translated: Having taught this, the text concludes: “In that way, training without apprehending anything, he attains emancipation and attains omniscience.”

original: de ltar phung po lnga po de dag dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar phung po lnga po de dag dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because those five aggregates are essentially unreal,

original: rmi lam dang / brag ca dang / mig yor dang / gzugs brnyan dang / sprul pa dang / smig rgyu lta bu yin la /
analyzed: rmi lam dang / brag ca dang / mig yor dang / gzugs brnyan dang / sprul pa dang / smig rgyu lta bu yin la /
translated: they are like a dream, an echo, an apparition, a reflection, a magical creation, and a mirage.

original: skye mched drug kyang de dag nyid yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni gang yang med de /
analyzed: skye mched drug kyang de dag nyid yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni gang yang med de /
translated: Because the six sense spheres are also just those, there is no one called a bodhisattva.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities and so on.

original: de ltar sgyu ma lta bu la sogs par bslab pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar sgyu ma lta bu la sogs par bslab pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the training in illusion-like and so on,

original: yang thabs mkhas pa la sgrub pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang thabs mkhas pa la sgrub pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to open the opportunity for accomplishing skillful means,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la gsar du zhugs pas bstan pa 'di thos nas skrag ste dngang bar mi 'gyur lags grang zhes bya ba bstan nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la gsar du zhugs pas bstan pa 'di thos nas skrag ste dngang bar mi 'gyur lags grang zhes bya ba bstan nas /
translated: the Lord, having taught, If a bodhisattva newly entered into the vehicle hears this teaching, will they not be frightened and terrified?

original: thabs mi mkhas la dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi lag tu yang ma song ba gang yin pa de ni de ltar skrag ste dngang bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: thabs mi mkhas la dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi lag tu yang ma song ba gang yin pa de ni de ltar skrag ste dngang bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Those who are not skilled in means and have not fallen into the hands of a spiritual friend will be frightened and terrified in that way.

original: thabs la mkhas pa gang yin pa de ni skrag cing dngang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pa gang gis bstan pa 'di thos na mi skrag mi dngang dngang bar mi 'gyur ba'i thabs mkhas pa gang lags zhes bya ba la sogs pas thabs la mkhas pa bstan to //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa gang yin pa de ni skrag cing dngang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pa gang gis bstan pa 'di thos na mi skrag mi dngang dngang bar mi 'gyur ba'i thabs mkhas pa gang lags zhes bya ba la sogs pas thabs la mkhas pa bstan to //
translated: That skill in means is taught by the passage beginning with “He does not tremble, is not frightened or terrified,” and the skill in means is taught by the passage beginning with “Blessed One, what is the skill in means by which a bodhisattva great being, having heard this teaching, does not tremble, is not frightened or terrified?”

original: skrag pa dang / dngang ba la sogs pa'i don ni sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: skrag pa dang / dngang ba la sogs pa'i don ni sngar bstan zin to //
translated: The meaning of trembling, being frightened, etc. has been explained above.

original: thabs la mkhas pa de yang rnam pa bzhir bstan te /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa de yang rnam pa bzhir bstan te /
translated: That skill in means is taught as fourfold:

original: chos thams cad la so sor rtog pa'i thabs la mkhas pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i thabs la mkhas pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa'i thabs la mkhas pa dang / sdig pa'i grogs po spang ba'i thabs la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad la so sor rtog pa'i thabs la mkhas pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i thabs la mkhas pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa'i thabs la mkhas pa dang / sdig pa'i grogs po spang ba'i thabs la mkhas pa'o //
translated: skill in means in the discernment of all dharmas, skill in means in the fulfillment of the six perfections, skill in means in reliance on a spiritual teacher, and skill in means in avoiding bad friends.

original: de la gzugs mi rtag pa'i rnam par so sor rtog ste de yang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de la gzugs mi rtag pa'i rnam par so sor rtog ste de yang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: Here, he discerns the aspects of impermanence, etc. of form, and does not apprehend them.🔽 This is the skill in means of the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in the perfection of wisdom.🔽 Thus ends the chapter on the skill in means, the fourth chapter in the Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines.🔽 Subhuti: Moreover, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in the perfection of wisdom, should train thus in the morning: 'I will not awaken to full enlightenment before I have known full enlightenment.'🔽 This is the skill in means of the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i thabs la mkhas par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar @109b gyis ni chos thams cad la so sor rtog pa'i thabs la mkhas pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i thabs la mkhas par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar @109b gyis ni chos thams cad la so sor rtog pa'i thabs la mkhas pa bstan to //
translated: Thus ends the chapter on the skill in means, the fourth chapter in the Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines.🔽 Subhuti: Moreover, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in the perfection of wisdom, should train thus in the morning: 'I will not awaken to full enlightenment before I have known full enlightenment.'

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: This is the skill in means of the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in the perfection of wisdom.🔽 Thus ends the chapter on the skill in means, the fourth chapter in the Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines.🔽 Subhuti: Moreover, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in the perfection of wisdom, should train thus in the morning: 'I will not awaken to full enlightenment before I have known full enlightenment.'🔽 This is the skill in means of the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in the perfection of wisdom.🔽 Thus ends the chapter on the skill in means, the fourth chapter in the Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines.🔽 Subhuti: Moreover, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in the perfection of wisdom, should train thus in the morning: 'I will not awaken to full enlightenment before I have known full enlightenment.'🔽 This is the skill in means of the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i thabs mkhas pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i thabs la mkhas pa bstan to
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i thabs mkhas pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i thabs la mkhas pa bstan to
translated: Thus ends the chapter on the skill in means, the fourth chapter in the Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines.🔽 Subhuti: Moreover, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in the perfection of wisdom,

original: // de la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos 'chad pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: // de la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos 'chad pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: In this regard, the perfection of generosity is the teaching of the Dharma by way of nonapprehending.

original: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems yongs su spong ba ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems yongs su spong ba ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of morality is the avoidance of the thought of the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha vehicles by way of nonapprehending.

original: chos zab mo la bzod cing mos pa ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: chos zab mo la bzod cing mos pa ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of patience is the patience and conviction with regard to the profound Dharma.

original: mi dmigs pa'i yid la byed pas so sor rtog pa mi gtong ba ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i yid la byed pas so sor rtog pa mi gtong ba ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of effort is the nonabandonment of discernment by way of the mental attention of nonapprehending.

original: byang chub kyi bar du gcod par byed pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi go skabs mi 'byed pa ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar du gcod par byed pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi go skabs mi 'byed pa ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of concentration is the nonadmittance of opportunities for unwholesome dharmas that obstruct enlightenment.

original: stong pa nyid la so sor rtog pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la so sor rtog pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the discernment of emptiness.

original: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid kyis gzugs stong pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi gzugs kun brtags pa'i gzugs kyi stong pa nyid kyi rgyus glo bur du stong par gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid kyis gzugs stong pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi gzugs kun brtags pa'i gzugs kyi stong pa nyid kyi rgyus glo bur du stong par gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: The statement “form is not empty because of the emptiness of form” means that the form of reality is not empty by the emptiness of the imagined form that is adventitious.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is empty by its very essence.

original: de bas na gzugs nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, form itself is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Emptiness itself is form.

original: stong pa nyid dang chos nyid kyi gzugs dag ngo bo nyid gcig go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang chos nyid kyi gzugs dag ngo bo nyid gcig go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that the emptiness of form and the form of reality have the same essence.

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: Subhūti, here a bodhisattva mahāsattva’s spiritual teacher is someone who teaches, explains, and clarifies the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams te /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams te /
translated: Subhūti, these are the bodhisattva mahāsattva’s spiritual teachers.

original: de dag gis yongs su zin pa ni bstan pa 'di thos nas mi skrag mi dngang dngang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsten pa'i thabs la mkhas pa bstan to //🔽de'i 'og tu dmigs @110a * //🔽pa'i rlom sems kyi 'gres kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen med pa las gyur pas 'di nyid du bsdu'o //
analyzed: de dag gis yongs su zin pa ni bstan pa 'di thos nas mi skrag mi dngang dngang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsten pa'i thabs la mkhas pa bstan to // de'i 'og tu dmigs @110a * // pa'i rlom sems kyi 'gres kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen med pa las gyur pas 'di nyid du bsdu'o //
translated: The passage from Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being should know that a spiritual friend is one who teaches thus: 'Here, son of good family, you should not abandon the perfection of giving' up to Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being should know that a spiritual friend is one who teaches thus: 'Here, son of good family, you should not abandon the perfection of wisdom' shows the skill in means of attending on a spiritual friend.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams kyis yongs su zin par rig par bgyi zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /🔽rab 'byor 'di yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sdig pa'i grogs por rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams kyis yongs su zin par rig par bgyi zhes bya ba nas bzung ste / rab 'byor 'di yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sdig pa'i grogs por rig par bya ste /
