original: de ltar brtson pa rnam pa du mchis zhes zhus pa'i tshig rnam par phye ste bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar brtson pa rnam pa du mchis zhes zhus pa'i tshig rnam par phye ste bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the words of the question, “What are the many kinds of striving?”

original: da ni bshad pa 'di'i gtan la dbab pa gang lags zhes zhus pa'i tshig rnams bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni bshad pa 'di'i gtan la dbab pa gang lags zhes zhus pa'i tshig rnams bstan par bya ste /
translated: now, the words of the question, “What is the conclusion of this explanation?” will be explained.

original: de la 'di la sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'dod pas /
analyzed: de la 'di la sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'dod pas /
translated: In this regard, the first section of the explanation, “Śāriputra, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to fully and completely awaken to all dharmas in all aspects

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya'o zhes mdor bshad pa dang por skabs phye ba gang yin pa de da 'dir skabs dbye'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya'o zhes mdor bshad pa dang por skabs phye ba gang yin pa de da 'dir skabs dbye'o //
translated: should strive in the perfection of wisdom,” will now be explained.

original: gtan la dbab pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gtan la dbab pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: That conclusion is also of two kinds:

original: tshig gi don dang / mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: tshig gi don dang / mtshan nyid do //
translated: the meaning of the words and the characteristics.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don gang yin pa dang / sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba'i tshig gang yin pa dang / ji ltar na go cha chen po bgos pa dang / ji ltar na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa dang /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don gang yin pa dang / sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba'i tshig gang yin pa dang / ji ltar na go cha chen po bgos pa dang / ji ltar na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa dang /
translated: What is the meaning of the words “bodhisattva”? What are the words “great being”? How is the great armor donned? How does one set out in the Great Vehicle?

original: ji ltar na theg pa chen po la gnas pa dang / ji ltar na theg pa chen po yin pa dang / theg pa de gang la nges par 'byung ba dang / theg pa de gang du gnas par 'gyur ba dang / theg pa 'dis su zhig nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: ji ltar na theg pa chen po la gnas pa dang / ji ltar na theg pa chen po yin pa dang / theg pa de gang la nges par 'byung ba dang / theg pa de gang du gnas par 'gyur ba dang / theg pa 'dis su zhig nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba dang /
translated: How does one abide in the Great Vehicle? What is the Great Vehicle? What is it that will emerge from that vehicle? Where will that vehicle come to rest? Who will emerge from this vehicle?

original: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan nas theg pa de nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / theg pa de nam mkha' dang mtshungs so zhes bya ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang mthun pa'i theg pa chen po yin no zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan nas theg pa de nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / theg pa de nam mkha' dang mtshungs so zhes bya ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang mthun pa'i theg pa chen po yin no zhes bya ba dang /
translated: This is the Great Vehicle that accords with the perfection of wisdom.🔽Bodhisattvas are not observed in the past, future, or present.

original: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus nas byang chub sems @110b dpa' mi dmigs so zhes bya ba dang / gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa kun tu mtha' yas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus nas byang chub sems @110b dpa' mi dmigs so zhes bya ba dang / gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa kun tu mtha' yas pa'i phyir /
translated: Form, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are infinite.

original: byang chub sems dpa' kun tu mtha' yas par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba dang / gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa byang chub sems dpa' yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu yang med cing mi dmigs zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kun tu mtha' yas par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba dang / gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa byang chub sems dpa' yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu yang med cing mi dmigs zhes bya ba dang /
translated: and “bodhisattvas should be known as infinite,” and “form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are bodhisattvas,” and “that is not so, and is not apprehended,”

original: de ltar bdag gis thams cad kyi thams cad rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs shing yang dag par rjes su ma mthong na byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang la gdams shing rjes
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis thams cad kyi thams cad rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs shing yang dag par rjes su ma mthong na byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang la gdams shing rjes
translated: and “if, in that way, I do not apprehend a bodhisattva at all, in any way, and do not see a bodhisattva, then what bodhisattva should I advise and instruct in what perfection of wisdom?”

original: su bstan par bgyi zhes bya ba dang / 'di lta ste byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba 'di ni ming tsam mo zhes bya ba dang / bdag bdag ces bgyi ba bdag ni shin tu mngon par ma grub pa'o zhes bya ba dang / de ltar chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid lags na /
analyzed: su bstan par bgyi zhes bya ba dang / 'di lta ste byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba 'di ni ming tsam mo zhes bya ba dang / bdag bdag ces bgyi ba bdag ni shin tu mngon par ma grub pa'o zhes bya ba dang / de ltar chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid lags na /
translated: “If all phenomena are indeed the nature of non-entityness,

original: gzugs de gang lags zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzugs de gang lags zhes bya ba nas /
translated: what is this form?”🔽“What is this consciousness?”🔽“Form is unestablished.”

original: rnam par shes pa de gang lags zhes bya ba'i bar dang / gzugs mngon par ma grub ces bya ba dang / mngon par ma grub pa gang lags pa de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de gang lags zhes bya ba'i bar dang / gzugs mngon par ma grub ces bya ba dang / mngon par ma grub pa gang lags pa de /
translated: “What is unestablished?”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par ma grub pa la ji ltar gdams shing rjes su bstan par bgyi zhes bya ba dang / mngon par ma grub pa las gud na byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs zhes bya ba dang / gal te de ltar bstan pa na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems zhum par mi 'gyur dngang bar mi 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par ma grub pa la ji ltar gdams shing rjes su bstan par bgyi zhes bya ba dang / mngon par ma grub pa las gud na byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs zhes bya ba dang / gal te de ltar bstan pa na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems zhum par mi 'gyur dngang bar mi 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o zhes bya ba dang /
translated: If, when taught in this way, the mind of a bodhisattva great being does not become cowed, does not become surpressed, does not become regretful, that bodhisattva great being is practicing the perfection of wisdom.🔽What is a bodhisattva?🔽What is the perfection of wisdom?🔽What is an imputation?

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang lags zhes bya ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang lags zhes bya ba dang / yongs su brtags pa gang lags zhes bya ba dang / ci'i slad du gzugs la sogs pa skye ba ma mchis pa gang lags pa de gzugs la sogs pa ma lags zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang lags zhes bya ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang lags zhes bya ba dang / yongs su brtags pa gang lags zhes bya ba dang / ci'i slad du gzugs la sogs pa skye ba ma mchis pa gang lags pa de gzugs la sogs pa ma lags zhes bya ba dang /
translated: Why is the non-production of form, etc. not form, etc.?

original: ci'i slad du gzugs la sogs pa 'grib pa gang lags pa de @111a * //
analyzed: ci'i slad du gzugs la sogs pa 'grib pa gang lags pa de @111a * //
translated: Why is it that the decrease of form, etc.🔽is not form, etc.?

original: gzugs la sogs pa ma lags zhes bya ba dang / ci'i slad du gzugs la sogs pa de dag gnyis su ma mchis pa'i grangs su mi 'grang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ma lags zhes bya ba dang / ci'i slad du gzugs la sogs pa de dag gnyis su ma mchis pa'i grangs su mi 'grang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Why is it that those forms, etc. are not counted as non-dual?

original: zhu ba nyi shu rtsa brgyad po de rnams dang / 'og nas gnas brtan gnyis kyis dum bur dris pa dang / lan btab pa zhib mo 'byung ba'i don de dag nye bar bzung nas koo shi ka la dris pa'i le'u la thug gi bar du ni gtan la dbab pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhu ba nyi shu rtsa brgyad po de rnams dang / 'og nas gnas brtan gnyis kyis dum bur dris pa dang / lan btab pa zhib mo 'byung ba'i don de dag nye bar bzung nas koo shi ka la dris pa'i le'u la thug gi bar du ni gtan la dbab pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: From the twenty-eight questions up to the chapter on Kauśika's questions, the meaning of the detailed questions and answers in the two elders' sections should be understood as the determination, taking up the meaning of those.

original: de la rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa'i tshig gi don ni gzhi med pa'i don te zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa' rnams la don rnam pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: de la rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa'i tshig gi don ni gzhi med pa'i don te zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa' rnams la don rnam pa bzhi yod de /
translated: There, Subhūti, the meaning of the word bodhisattva is the meaning of the groundless. There are four kinds of meanings for bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub dang / sems dpa' dang / phung po'i bdag nyid du kun rdzob kyi byang chub sems dpa' dang / don dam pa'i byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: byang chub dang / sems dpa' dang / phung po'i bdag nyid du kun rdzob kyi byang chub sems dpa' dang / don dam pa'i byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: enlightenment, the being, and the conventional and ultimate bodhisattvas who are the identity of the aggregates.

original: de bzhi char yang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don ni gzhi'i don med pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhi char yang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don ni gzhi'i don med pa yin no //
translated: Since all four of those are the nature of non-entityness, the meaning of the term “bodhisattva” is the nonexistence of the meaning of a basis.

original: gzhi'i don med pa ni gnas med pa la bya'o //
analyzed: gzhi'i don med pa ni gnas med pa la bya'o //
translated: The nonexistence of the meaning of a basis is called “the absence of a basis.”

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dngos po'i bdag nyid 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na de'i tshig gi don gzhi dang bcas shing gnas dang bcas par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dngos po'i bdag nyid 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na de'i tshig gi don gzhi dang bcas shing gnas dang bcas par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If the so-called bodhisattva were to exist as some kind of entity, then the meaning of the term would have a basis and would have a location.

original: 'di ltar byang chub dang / sems dpa' dang / byang chub sems dpa' gnyis kyang med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub dang / sems dpa' dang / byang chub sems dpa' gnyis kyang med de /
translated: However, since neither enlightenment, nor the being, nor the bodhisattva exist,

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i tshig gi don gyi gzhi med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i tshig gi don gyi gzhi med de /
translated: the meaning of the term “bodhisattva” is without a basis.

original: gnas med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnas med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term “without a basis” means “without a location.”

original: don de nyid rnam par dbye ba'i phyir byang chub kyang ma skyes la /
analyzed: don de nyid rnam par dbye ba'i phyir byang chub kyang ma skyes la /
translated: In order to analyze that very meaning, it says:🔽Enlightenment is not produced.

original: sems dpa' yang ma skyes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sems dpa' yang ma skyes pa'i phyir te /
translated: In order to analyze that very meaning, it is said, “Enlightenment is also non-arisen, and the being is also non-arisen.”🔽Subhūti, in enlightenment and in the being, arising and existence are non-apprehensible.

original: rab 'byor byang chub dang / sems dpa' la skye ba dang / yod pa nyid med cing mi dmigs so zhes pa la byang chub ni 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir skye ba med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub dang / sems dpa' la skye ba dang / yod pa nyid med cing mi dmigs so zhes pa la byang chub ni 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir skye ba med do //
translated: Enlightenment is non-arisen because it is unconditioned.

original: sems dpa' yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir skye ba med do //
analyzed: sems dpa' yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir skye ba med do //
translated: The being is also non-arisen because it does not exist.

original: de bas na rab 'byor byang chub la skye ba med do zhes bya ba dang / sems dpa' la yang yod pa nyid mi dmigs so zhes bya ba so sor sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na rab 'byor byang chub la skye ba med do zhes bya ba dang / sems dpa' la yang yod pa nyid mi dmigs so zhes bya ba so sor sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, in enlightenment there is no arising, and in the being, existence is non-apprehensible.

original: de'i 'og tu tshig gi don gyi sgra rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir /🔽rab 'byor byang chub la yang gzhi med /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu tshig gi don gyi sgra rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir / rab 'byor byang chub la yang gzhi med /
translated: After that, in order to analyze the meaning of the words,🔽it is said, “Subhūti, in enlightenment there is no basis,

original: sems dpa' la yang gzhi med de zhes bya ba gsungs @111b so //
analyzed: sems dpa' la yang gzhi med de zhes bya ba gsungs @111b so //
translated: and in the being there is no basis.”

original: yang de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa'i tshig gi don ni gzhi dang don zhes bya ba bshad de /
analyzed: yang de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa'i tshig gi don ni gzhi dang don zhes bya ba bshad de /
translated: Moreover, since that is so, the meaning of the words of the bodhisattva is explained as the basis and the meaning.

original: des na de bas na gzhi'i don med pa ni gzhi'i don to zhes bya bas mjug bsdus so //
analyzed: des na de bas na gzhi'i don med pa ni gzhi'i don to zhes bya bas mjug bsdus so //
translated: Therefore, since that is so, the non-existence of the meaning of the basis is the meaning of the basis.

original: de'i 'og tu rnam pa bcu gcig gis byang chub sems dpa'i tshig gi don la gzhi'i don med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rnam pa bcu gcig gis byang chub sems dpa'i tshig gi don la gzhi'i don med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the meaning of the words of the bodhisattva is devoid of the meaning of the basis through eleven aspects,

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na nam mkha' la bya'i rjes med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na nam mkha' la bya'i rjes med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Subhūti, it is thus. For example, the tracks of a bird in the sky do not exist and are not apprehended.

original: de la byang chub la rnam par brtags pa'i gzhi med pa dang / kun brtags pa'i sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i gzhi gang yang med pa dang / byang chub las gzhan gud na gzhi med pa dang / kun rdzob kyi byang chub sems dpa' las gud na gzhi med pa dang /
analyzed: de la byang chub la rnam par brtags pa'i gzhi med pa dang / kun brtags pa'i sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i gzhi gang yang med pa dang / byang chub las gzhan gud na gzhi med pa dang / kun rdzob kyi byang chub sems dpa' las gud na gzhi med pa dang /
translated: In this regard, the non-existence of the basis imagined in enlightenment, the non-existence of any basis whatsoever called the imagined bodhisattva, the non-existence of a basis other than enlightenment, the non-existence of a basis other than the conventional bodhisattva,

original: chos nyid kyi byang chub sems dpa'i gzhi med pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i gzhi med pa dang / sems dpa' la byang chub kyi gzhi med pa dang / byang chub ces bya ba'i gzhi'i don med pa dang / kun brtags pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la chos nyid kyi byang chub sems dpa'i tshig gi don med pa dang /🔽don med pa'i byang chub sems dpal pa kun brtags pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshig gi don med pa dang / don dam pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la gzhi med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi byang chub sems dpa'i gzhi med pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i gzhi med pa dang / sems dpa' la byang chub kyi gzhi med pa dang / byang chub ces bya ba'i gzhi'i don med pa dang / kun brtags pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la chos nyid kyi byang chub sems dpa'i tshig gi don med pa dang / don med pa'i byang chub sems dpal pa kun brtags pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshig gi don med pa dang / don dam pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la gzhi med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The ultimate reality of the bodhisattva is without ground, the bodhisattva is without ground, the bodhisattva is without a ground in enlightenment, the meaning of the ground of what is called “enlightenment” is nonexistent, the ultimate reality of the bodhisattva is not the meaning of the words of the imagined bodhisattva,🔽and the imagined bodhisattva is not the meaning of the words of the ultimate reality bodhisattva.

original: de la byang chub la rnam par rtog pa'i gzhi med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la byang chub la rnam par rtog pa'i gzhi med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that there is no ground for conceptualizing enlightenment,

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na nam mkha' la bya'i rjes med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na nam mkha' la bya'i rjes med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “Subhūti, it is thus: for example, the tracks of a bird in the sky are nonexistent and non-apprehensible.”

original: ji ltar na nam mkha' la bya rnams rgyu yang de dag gi rjes yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid byang chub la rnam par rtog pa dag rgyu yang de la gnas par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha
analyzed: ji ltar na nam mkha' la bya rnams rgyu yang de dag gi rjes yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid byang chub la rnam par rtog pa dag rgyu yang de la gnas par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha
translated: Just as birds fly in the sky without a trace of their path, so also, although thoughts of enlightenment move in suchness, they do not abide in it.

original: tshig go // de'i 'og tu kun brtags pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i gzhi'i don med pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshig go // de'i 'og tu kun brtags pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i gzhi'i don med pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: After that, in order to teach the non-existence of the basis of the imagined bodhisattva,

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: it is said, “Subhūti, it is thus.

original: rmi lam la gzhi med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rmi lam la gzhi med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: For example, a dream has no basis and is not apprehended.”

original: dper na rmi lam dang / sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / brag ca dang / mig yor dang / gzugs brnyan dang / sprul pa rnams la gzhi med de /
analyzed: dper na rmi lam dang / sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / brag ca dang / mig yor dang / gzugs brnyan dang / sprul pa rnams la gzhi med de /
translated: For example, dreams, illusions, mirages, echoes, optical illusions, reflections, and magical incarnations have no basis,

original: de dag ni shin tu med pa'i phyir ro //🔽de bzhin du byang @112a * //
analyzed: de dag ni shin tu med pa'i phyir ro // de bzhin du byang @112a * //
translated: because they are utterly non-existent.

original: chub sems dpa' la yang gzhi med de /
analyzed: chub sems dpa' la yang gzhi med de /
translated: In the same way, a bodhisattva has no basis,🔽because he also does not exist.

original: de yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de'i 'og tu byang chub las gud na gang na yang mi gnas par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu byang chub las gud na gang na yang mi gnas par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: After that, in order to teach that there is no basis anywhere other than enlightenment,

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na de bzhin nyid la gzhi med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na de bzhin nyid la gzhi med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “Subhūti, it is like this: there is no basis in suchness, no basis in unmistaken suchness, and so on.

original: ji ltar de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid la sogs pa las gud na gzhi med pa de bzhin du byang chub las gud na yang gzhi med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid la sogs pa las gud na gzhi med pa de bzhin du byang chub las gud na yang gzhi med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Just as there is no basis anywhere other than suchness, unmistaken suchness, and so on, there is no basis anywhere other than enlightenment.”

original: de'i 'og tu kun rdzob kyi byang chub sems dpa'i gzhi med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu kun rdzob kyi byang chub sems dpa'i gzhi med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: After that, in order to teach that there is no basis for the conventional bodhisattva,

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la gzhi med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la gzhi med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “Subhūti, it is like this: the form, feeling, discrimination, compositional factors, and consciousness of an illusory person have no basis.”

original: ji ltar sgyu ma'i bdag nyid kyi skyes bu la phung po lnga la sogs pa med de /
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma'i bdag nyid kyi skyes bu la phung po lnga la sogs pa med de /
translated: Just as the five aggregates and so on do not exist in the nature of an illusory person,

original: de nyid shin tu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid shin tu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that itself is utterly nonexistent.

original: de bzhin du kun rdzob kyi byang chub sems dpa' la yang phung po lnga'i gzhi med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun rdzob kyi byang chub sems dpa' la yang phung po lnga'i gzhi med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In the same way, the conventional bodhisattva also has no basis in the five aggregates, and so on.

original: de'i 'og tu chos nyid kyi byang chub sems dpa' la phung po lnga la sogs pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu chos nyid kyi byang chub sems dpa' la phung po lnga la sogs pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate that the ultimate bodhisattva also has no five aggregates, and so on,

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i gzhi med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i gzhi med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it says, “Subhūti, it is thus. For example, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfect and Complete Buddha has no basis in form, feeling, discrimination, compositional factors, or consciousness,” and so on.

original: ji ltar chos kyi sku'i de bzhin gshegs pa la phung po lnga la sogs pa med pa de bzhin du don dam pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la yang phung po lnga la sogs pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar chos kyi sku'i de bzhin gshegs pa la phung po lnga la sogs pa med pa de bzhin du don dam pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la yang phung po lnga la sogs pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Just as the Tathāgata of the dharmakāya has no five aggregates, and so on, the ultimate bodhisattva also has no five aggregates, and so on.

original: de'i 'og tu byang chub la byang chub sems dpa'i gzhi med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu byang chub la byang chub sems dpa'i gzhi med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate that the bodhisattva is not the basis of enlightenment,

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na 'dus ma byas kyi khams la 'dus byas kyi khams kyi gzhi med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na 'dus ma byas kyi khams la 'dus byas kyi khams kyi gzhi med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “Subhūti, it is like this: in the unconditioned element, the conditioned element is not a basis and is not apprehended.”

original: ji ltar mya ngan las 'das pa la 'khor ba med pa de bzhin du byang chub la yang sems dpa'i gzhi med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar mya ngan las 'das pa la 'khor ba med pa de bzhin du byang chub la yang sems dpa'i gzhi med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Just as there is no samsara in nirvana, so also there is no basis of the bodhisattva in enlightenment.

original: de'i 'og tu sems dpa' la yang byang chub kyi gzhi med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sems dpa' la yang byang chub kyi gzhi med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate that the bodhisattva is also not the basis of enlightenment,

original: 'dus byas kyi khams la 'dus ma @112b byas kyi khams kyi gzhi med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi khams la 'dus ma @112b byas kyi khams kyi gzhi med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “In the conditioned element, the unconditioned element is not a basis.”

original: ji ltar 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i gzhi med pa de bzhin du sems dpa' la yang byang chub kyi gzhi med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i gzhi med pa de bzhin du sems dpa' la yang byang chub kyi gzhi med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Just as there is no basis of samsara and nirvana, so also there is no basis of enlightenment in the bodhisattva.

original: de'i 'og tu byang chub ces bya ba'i tshig gi don med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu byang chub ces bya ba'i tshig gi don med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate that the word “enlightenment” is meaningless,

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / dmigs su med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / dmigs su med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this: in non-production, non-cessation, non-conditioning, non-arising, non-apprehension, non-affliction,

original: rnam par byang ba med pa la gzhi'i don med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba med pa la gzhi'i don med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and non-purification, there is no meaning of basis.

original: ji ltar skye ba med pa la sogs pa la gzhi'i don med pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' la yang gzhi'i don med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar skye ba med pa la sogs pa la gzhi'i don med pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' la yang gzhi'i don med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Just as in non-production and so forth there is no meaning of basis, so it is said that in the bodhisattva there is also no meaning of basis.

original: de'i 'og tu kun brtags pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la chos nyid kyi byang chub sems dpa'i tshig gi don med pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu kun brtags pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la chos nyid kyi byang chub sems dpa'i tshig gi don med pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate that in the imagined bodhisattva the meaning of the word “bodhisattva” in the ultimate sense does not exist,

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na gzugs la skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / dmigs su med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na gzugs la skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / dmigs su med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this: in form, there is no origination, no cessation, no fabrication, no occurrence, no object, no defilement,🔽no purification, and no basis for the meaning of a basis.

original: rnam par byang ba med pa la gzhi'i don med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs ji ltar phung po la sogs pa'i tshig gi don rnams la skye ba med pa la sogs pa 'dus ma byas kyi tshig gi don rnams med pa de bzhin du kun
analyzed: rnam par byang ba med pa la gzhi'i don med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs ji ltar phung po la sogs pa'i tshig gi don rnams la skye ba med pa la sogs pa 'dus ma byas kyi tshig gi don rnams med pa de bzhin du kun
translated: Just as the meanings of the words of the aggregates and so on are not the meanings of the words of the unconditioned such as nonorigination and so on,

original: brtags pa'i phung po lnga'i bdag nyid kyi byang chub sems dpa' la chos nyid kyi byang chub sems dpa' med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: brtags pa'i phung po lnga'i bdag nyid kyi byang chub sems dpa' la chos nyid kyi byang chub sems dpa' med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: in the same way, in the five aggregates that are the nature of the imaginary, there is no bodhisattva who is the nature of the perfect.🔽This is the meaning.

original: de'i 'og tu don dam pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la kun brtags pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshig gi don med pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu don dam pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la kun brtags pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshig gi don med pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: After that, in order to teach that in the ultimate bodhisattva, the meanings of the words of the imaginary bodhisattva do not exist,

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na gzugs shin tu rnam par dag pa la mtshan ma'i gzhi med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na gzugs shin tu rnam par dag pa la mtshan ma'i gzhi med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Subhuti, it is like this: in the very pure form, there is no basis for signs.

original: ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga la sogs pa'i chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa la 'dus byas kyi mtshan ma rnams kyi gzhi med pa dang / rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na bdag la sogs pa rnam par dag pa la mtshan ma'i gzhi med pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga la sogs pa'i chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa la 'dus byas kyi mtshan ma rnams kyi gzhi med pa dang / rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na bdag la sogs pa rnam par dag pa la mtshan ma'i gzhi med pa dang /
translated: Just as in the very pure dharmadhatu of the five aggregates of form and so forth, there is no basis for the signs of the conditioned, Subhuti, it is like this: in the very pure self and so forth, there is no basis for signs.

original: nyi ma la mun pa'i gzhi med pa dang / @113a * //
analyzed: nyi ma la mun pa'i gzhi med pa dang / @113a * //
translated: In the sun, there is no basis for darkness.

original: sreg pa'i bskal pa la 'du byed kyi gzhi med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes gzigs pa la /
analyzed: sreg pa'i bskal pa la 'du byed kyi gzhi med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes gzigs pa la /
translated: In the burning kalpa, there is no basis for formations. In the Tathagata's morality, concentration, wisdom, liberation, and the vision of the wisdom of liberation,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gzhi med pa de bzhin du don dam pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid la kun brtags pa'i phung po lnga'i bdag nyid kyi byang chub sems dpa' med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gzhi med pa de bzhin du don dam pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid la kun brtags pa'i phung po lnga'i bdag nyid kyi byang chub sems dpa' med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Just as there is no basis for the adverse side, in the same way, in the ultimate reality of the Bodhisattva, the expanse of reality, there is no Bodhisattva with the identity of the five aggregates that are imagined.🔽This is the meaning.

original: de'i 'og tu don dam pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chos nyid kyi bdag nyid gang la yang gnas pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu don dam pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chos nyid kyi bdag nyid gang la yang gnas pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: After that, in order to show that the ultimate Bodhisattva, who is the reality of the expanse of reality, has no basis at all,

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: it says, “Subhūti, it is like this.

original: nyi ma dang / zla ba'i 'od la gzhi med do zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhi med pa ston te /
analyzed: nyi ma dang / zla ba'i 'od la gzhi med do zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhi med pa ston te /
translated: The light of the sun and moon has no basis,” and so on.

original: dper na nyi ma dang / zla ba dang / gza' dang / skar ma dang / nor bu rin po che dang / glog gi 'od rnams dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha thams cad dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi tshangs pa rnams dang /
analyzed: dper na nyi ma dang / zla ba dang / gza' dang / skar ma dang / nor bu rin po che dang / glog gi 'od rnams dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha thams cad dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi tshangs pa rnams dang /
translated: For example, the light of the sun, moon, planets, stars, precious jewels, lightning, and all the gods in the desire realm, as well as the Brahmās in the form realm,

original: gnas gtsang ma rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi 'od thams cad ni 'od tsam du zad pas gnas pa med do //
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi 'od thams cad ni 'od tsam du zad pas gnas pa med do //
translated: The pure abodes and the light of the Tathagatas do not exist as mere light.

original: de bzhin du don dam pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang gnas pa med par 'gro ba dag tu rgyu'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang gnas pa med par 'gro ba dag tu rgyu'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In the same way, the ultimate Bodhisattva moves through the worlds without abiding anywhere.

original: de ltar rnam pa bcu gcig gis byang chub sems dpa'i tshig gi don gzhi med par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa bcu gcig gis byang chub sems dpa'i tshig gi don gzhi med par bstan nas /
translated: Thus, the meaning of the word Bodhisattva is shown to be groundless in eleven ways.

original: de'i 'og tu gzhi med pa'i gtan tshigs su /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gzhi med pa'i gtan tshigs su /
translated: After that, the reason for groundlessness is stated:

original: rab 'byor 'di ltar byang chub gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / byang chub sems dpa'i gzhi'i don gang yin pa'i chos de dag thams cad ni ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ltar byang chub gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / byang chub sems dpa'i gzhi'i don gang yin pa'i chos de dag thams cad ni ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Subhuti, it is because all these dharmas, whatever they may be, that is, enlightenment, the Bodhisattva, and the meaning of the word Bodhisattva, are neither joined nor disjoined.

original: byang chub kyi don du rtsol ba'i byang chub sems dpa' byang chub gang gis brtson par byed pa'i byang chub de'am /
analyzed: byang chub kyi don du rtsol ba'i byang chub sems dpa' byang chub gang gis brtson par byed pa'i byang chub de'am /
translated: The bodhisattva who strives for enlightenment, what is the enlightenment by which he strives?

original: yang na byang chub gang gis byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i ming thob par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: yang na byang chub gang gis byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i ming thob par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Or, what is the enlightenment by which he obtains the name “bodhisattva”?

original: byang chub ces bya ba gang yin pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub ces bya ba gang yin pa'am /
translated: What is called “enlightenment”?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshig gi don gang yin pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshig gi don gang yin pa'am /
translated: What is the meaning of the word “bodhisattva”?

original: kun brtags pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / @113b rnam par shes pa la sogs pa gang yin pa dang / chos nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi dbyings gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / @113b rnam par shes pa la sogs pa gang yin pa dang / chos nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi dbyings gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: What is the form, feeling, perception, formation, consciousness, etc. of the imagined bodhisattva, and what is the reality of the bodhisattva, i.e., the element of the Dharma?

original: chos de dag thams cad ces bya ba ni byang chub ces bya ba 'dus ma byas kyi chos dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi chos rnams dang /
analyzed: chos de dag thams cad ces bya ba ni byang chub ces bya ba 'dus ma byas kyi chos dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi chos rnams dang /
translated: All those phenomena are the unconditioned phenomena called “awakening,” the conditioned phenomena called “bodhisattvas,” such as the aggregates, elements, sense spheres, and dependent origination,

original: chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid rnams te /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid rnams te /
translated: and the essences of reality.

original: chos nyid kyi gnas skabs na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ldan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi gnas skabs na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ldan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: They are not associated because in the state of reality they are not by nature afflicted.

original: rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir mi ldan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir mi ldan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: They are not non-associated because they are not by nature purified.

original: dpyod pa med ces bya ba ni 'di ltar rnam par mi rtog pas dpyod pa med pa ste /
analyzed: dpyod pa med ces bya ba ni 'di ltar rnam par mi rtog pas dpyod pa med pa ste /
translated: They are not analyzed means that they are not analyzed because they are non-conceptual.

original: 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid med pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid med pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches that they are not characterized by grasping.

original: bstan du med pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar brjod du med pa'i phyir gzhan dag la tshig gis bstan cing go bar byar mi rung ste /
analyzed: bstan du med pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar brjod du med pa'i phyir gzhan dag la tshig gis bstan cing go bar byar mi rung ste /
translated: The phrase cannot be demonstrated means that it cannot be demonstrated or made known to others by means of speech, because it is inexpressible.

original: de gnyis kyis 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid med pa dang / gzung ba'i mtshan nyid med pa bstan to //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid med pa dang / gzung ba'i mtshan nyid med pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase cannot be grasped means that it cannot be grasped by the two kinds of grasping, i.e., the grasping of signs and the grasping of substantiality.

original: thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i yul bzhin du thogs pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i yul bzhin du thogs pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase cannot be obstructed means that it cannot be obstructed like the objects of the senses.

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid thams cad dang bral ba ni mtshan nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽chags pa med pa dang / yod pa ma yin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub la chags pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid thams cad dang bral ba ni mtshan nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // chags pa med pa dang / yod pa ma yin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub la chags pa'i phyir ram /
translated: The phrase has only one mark, which is no mark means that it is free from all marks, and that its mark is the absence of marks.

original: byang chub la yod pa'i dngos por 'dzin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub la yod pa'i dngos por 'dzin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
translated: One should train in the absence of attachment and the absence of existence means that the bodhisattva is so called because he is attached to enlightenment or because he grasps enlightenment as a real thing.

original: rnam par rtog pa de gnyis bzlog pa'i phyir chos thams cad la chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid du bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de gnyis bzlog pa'i phyir chos thams cad la chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid du bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that one should train in the characteristic of non-attachment to all dharmas and in the characteristic of non-existence in order to avert those two conceptualizations.

original: rtog pa med pa dang / dpyod pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni brtags na rtog pa'i rgyus yod pa'i blo skye'o //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa dang / dpyod pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni brtags na rtog pa'i rgyus yod pa'i blo skye'o //
translated: Because of the absence of conceptual differentiation and the absence of investigation, means: when one investigates, the idea of existence arises on account of conceptual differentiation.

original: dpyad na dad pa'i rgyus chags pa skye ste /
analyzed: dpyad na dad pa'i rgyus chags pa skye ste /
translated: When one examines, attachment arises on account of investigation.

original: de bas na rtog pa med pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin par 'gyur ba dang / dpyod pa med pa'i phyir chags pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na rtog pa med pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin par 'gyur ba dang / dpyod pa med pa'i phyir chags pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because of the absence of conceptual differentiation, there is no existence; and because of the absence of investigation, there is no attachment. This is how one should construe the sentence.

original: gnyis su med pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba ni @114a * //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba ni @114a * //
translated: One should penetrate all dharmas by way of non-duality. This means:

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang / rjod pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang / chos dang chos ma yin pa dang / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dang /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang / rjod pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang / chos dang chos ma yin pa dang / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dang /
translated: Dharma and non-Dharma, compounded and uncompounded,🔽mundane and supramundane, and so on.

original: 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gnyis kyi don dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gnyis kyi don dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the meaning of freedom from duality.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i tshig gi don bstan nas sems dpa' chen po'i tshig gi don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i tshig gi don bstan nas sems dpa' chen po'i tshig gi don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having thus taught the meaning of the words of a bodhisattva, in order to teach the meaning of the words of a great being,🔽he said, “Blessed One, why is it called a bodhisattva mahāsattva?

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi ba ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi zhes gsol te //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi ba ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi zhes gsol te //
translated: Why is it called a bodhisattva mahāsattva?”

original: byang chub sems dpa' la ci'i slad du sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir sems dpa' chen po'i ming du brjod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la ci'i slad du sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir sems dpa' chen po'i ming du brjod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means: for what reason is the name great being used?

original: 'di la bcom ldan 'das dang // gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu dang / rab 'byor dang / gang po dang bzhi'i dgongs pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'di la bcom ldan 'das dang // gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu dang / rab 'byor dang / gang po dang bzhi'i dgongs pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Here, there are four intentions of the Blessed One, the elder Śāriputra, Subhūti, and Pūrṇa.

original: de la re zhig bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pa ni sems can thams cad kyi nang na 'di sems dpa' chen po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pa ni sems can thams cad kyi nang na 'di sems dpa' chen po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Among them, the intention of the Blessed One is that among all sentient beings, this one is a great being,

original: sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ste de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ste de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: so he is called a great being. For that very reason,

original: sems can gyi tshogs chen po dang / sems can gyi ris mang po'i phul byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: sems can gyi tshogs chen po dang / sems can gyi ris mang po'i phul byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba bstan to //
translated: it is taught that he will become the foremost of the great assembly of sentient beings and the class of sentient beings.

original: gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu'i dgongs pa ni chos thams cad dngos po med de yod pa ma yin pa don rtogs pa'i phyir sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu'i dgongs pa ni chos thams cad dngos po med de yod pa ma yin pa don rtogs pa'i phyir sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: The intention of the elder Śāriputra is that all phenomena are unreal and do not exist, yet he is called a great being because he realizes the meaning.

original: chos thams cad kyi ming med par mthong bas bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa dang / med par lta ba'i mtha' rnams dang / phung por lta ba la sogs pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das par lta ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi ming med par mthong bas bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa dang / med par lta ba'i mtha' rnams dang / phung por lta ba la sogs pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das par lta ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi /
translated: Since he sees all phenomena as nameless, he teaches the Dharma to others in order to eliminate all views, such as the view of self, etc.,

original: rnam par rtog pa lta ba rnams med par bya ba'i phyir gzhan dag la yang chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa lta ba rnams med par bya ba'i phyir gzhan dag la yang chos ston pa'o //
translated: the extremes of existence and non-existence, the views of the aggregates, etc., and the views that culminate in the extreme of complete nirvāṇa.

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi dgongs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba 'di la chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa che ba'i phyir sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ste de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi dgongs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba 'di la chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa che ba'i phyir sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ste de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: The intention of the elder Subhūti is this: “A bodhisattva-mahāsattva” is called a “great being” because of his great non-attachment and non-obstruction.

original: sems de la yang chags pa med ces bya ba la sogs pas de la chags pa med par @114b gnas pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: sems de la yang chags pa med ces bya ba la sogs pas de la chags pa med par @114b gnas pa yin par bstan to //
translated: Therefore, “that mind is also without attachment,” etc. shows that he abides without attachment to that.

original: gnas brtan gang po'i dgongs pa ni go cha chen po bgos pa dang / sgrub pa chen po dang / 'bras bu chen po la zhugs pa'i phyir sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gnas brtan gang po'i dgongs pa ni go cha chen po bgos pa dang / sgrub pa chen po dang / 'bras bu chen po la zhugs pa'i phyir sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The intention of the elder Purna is that they are called “great beings” because they are armed with the great armor, they have undertaken the great practice, and they have entered the great result.

original: de nyid kyi phyir go cha chen po bgos pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir go cha chen po bgos pa /
translated: Therefore, they are taught to be armed with the great armor,

original: theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa /
translated: to have set out in the Great Vehicle,

original: theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas par bstan to //🔽de la dang por bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa la sems can gyi tshogs chen po zhes bya ba ni rigs kyi sa'i gang zag nas bzung ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas par bstan to // de la dang por bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa la sems can gyi tshogs chen po zhes bya ba ni rigs kyi sa'i gang zag nas bzung ste /
translated: and to abide in the Great Vehicle.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar gyi yon tan gyi dbang du byas nas sems can gyi tshogs zhes smos so //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar gyi yon tan gyi dbang du byas nas sems can gyi tshogs zhes smos so //
translated: In this regard, the Bhagavat first explained that the great multitude of beings refers to the multitude of beings who are the objects of the bodhisattvas, from the persons of the stage of potential up to the stage of the pratyekabuddha, and it is called a multitude of beings in terms of their qualities.

original: sems can gyi ris mang po zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i ris smos pa ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi ris mang po zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i ris smos pa ste /
translated: The multitude of beings’ categories refers to the categories of bodhisattvas,

original: de dag gi yul du gyur pa de yang bsam pa che ba dang / sgrub pa che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi yul du gyur pa de yang bsam pa che ba dang / sgrub pa che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and their objects are great in terms of their intention and great in terms of their practice.

original: de la bsam pa che ba ni rdo rje lta bu'i sems bskyed pa yon tan lngas brgyan pa ste /
analyzed: de la bsam pa che ba ni rdo rje lta bu'i sems bskyed pa yon tan lngas brgyan pa ste /
translated: The greatness of its attitude is the spirit of enlightenment like a diamond, adorned with five qualities:

original: nges par 'joms pa dang / rin che ba dang / skyon med pa dang / mi phyed pa dang / don sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'joms pa dang / rin che ba dang / skyon med pa dang / mi phyed pa dang / don sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: it is a diamond because it is invincible, valuable, flawless, indivisible, and effective.

original: de la nges par 'joms pa ni shes rab kyi dbang gis yon tan brgyad kyis nges par 'joms pa ste /
analyzed: de la nges par 'joms pa ni shes rab kyi dbang gis yon tan brgyad kyis nges par 'joms pa ste /
translated: It is invincible because of its eight kinds of invincibility, which are due to its wisdom.

original: ser sna la sogs pa nges par 'joms pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ser sna la sogs pa nges par 'joms pa'i phyir /
translated: It is invincible because it is not overcome by stinginess, etc.

original: bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba dang / rjes su chags pa dang / khrong khro ba la sogs pa nges par 'joms pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba dang / rjes su chags pa dang / khrong khro ba la sogs pa nges par 'joms pa'i phyir /
translated: It is invincible because it is not overcome by attachment, hostility, etc.

original: sems mnyam pa nyid dang / lta ba'i nyes pa thams cad nges par 'joms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems mnyam pa nyid dang / lta ba'i nyes pa thams cad nges par 'joms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is invincible because it is not overcome by any faults of views.

original: theg pa gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba dang / sems can yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba'i 'du shes med pa dang / chos thams cad nges par gzhom pa'i phyir /
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba dang / sems can yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba'i 'du shes med pa dang / chos thams cad nges par gzhom pa'i phyir /
translated: It is invincible because it is not overcome by the idea of attaining nirvana through the three vehicles, or by the idea of attaining nirvana for only some beings, or by the idea of overcoming only some phenomena.

original: chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa bdag gis rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba dang / theg pa dman pa nges par gzhom pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa bdag gis rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba dang / theg pa dman pa nges par gzhom pa'i phyir /
translated: The thought I will realize that all phenomena are unborn and unceasing and In order to conquer the Lesser Vehicle,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems ma 'dres pa dang / ngan 'gro thams cad nges par gzhom pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems ma 'dres pa dang / ngan 'gro thams cad nges par gzhom pa'i phyir /
translated: I will realize the unshared mind of omniscience and In order to conquer all lower realms,

original: thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'i chos su rtogs pa yongs su grub pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'i chos su rtogs pa yongs su grub pa ste /
translated: I will realize the perfection of the realization that is all-pervading.

original: sa dang por de bzhin nyid la kun tu 'gro ba'i don du rtogs pa dang / 'khor ba'i rnam par @115a * //
analyzed: sa dang por de bzhin nyid la kun tu 'gro ba'i don du rtogs pa dang / 'khor ba'i rnam par @115a * //
translated: The thought On the first ground, I will realize the suchness that is all-pervading and In order to conquer all the concepts of samsara,

original: rtog pa thams cad nges par gzhom pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad nges par gzhom pa'i phyir /
translated: I will realize the perfection of the realization that is all-pervading.

original: bdag gi phung po nas bzung ste pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar gyi chos rnams la tshul gcig tu bsgrub pa rtogs par bya'o snyam pa ste /
analyzed: bdag gi phung po nas bzung ste pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar gyi chos rnams la tshul gcig tu bsgrub pa rtogs par bya'o snyam pa ste /
translated: The thought I will realize the accomplishment of the practice of the single method in the phenomena from my aggregates up to the perfections.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos rnams stong pa nyid kyi tshul du rtogs pa dang / rnam par byang ba pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad nges par gzhom pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos rnams stong pa nyid kyi tshul du rtogs pa dang / rnam par byang ba pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad nges par gzhom pa'i phyir /
translated: The realization of the aggregates, elements, sense-spheres, dependent origination, and the perfections as the mode of emptiness, and the realization of the practice of the factors of enlightenment and the immeasurables up to the end of the Buddha's teachings in order to definitely conquer all conceptual thoughts of purification.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / tshad med pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi mtha' la thug pa'i bar du sgrub pa rtogs pa ni de dag bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / tshad med pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi mtha' la thug pa'i bar du sgrub pa rtogs pa ni de dag bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba rtogs pa ste /
translated: This is the realization of perfecting the cultivation of those.

original: de ltar shes rab kyi yon tan rnam pa brgyad bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi yon tan rnam pa brgyad bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the eight qualities of wisdom,

original: sems de'i snying rje'i stobs rin che ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems de'i snying rje'i stobs rin che ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the precious power of compassion of that mind,

original: bdag gis sems can gcig gi don du yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can gcig gi don du yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said for the sake of even a single being.

original: sems rin po che skyon med pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems rin po che skyon med pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the faultless precious mind,🔽it is said I will not attain complete enlightenment.

original: rlabs po che'i sems dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang / nyon thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems skyon med pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rlabs po che'i sems dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang / nyon thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems skyon med pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: the great mind, the mind of desire, the mind of hatred, the mind of confusion, the mind of violence, the mind of the śrāvakas, and the mind of the pratyekabuddhas.🔽The unbreakable vajra-like mind

original: sems rdo rje lta bu de mi byed pa nyid ni /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yod la byed pas kyang rlom sems su mi byed ces gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: sems rdo rje lta bu de mi byed pa nyid ni / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yod la byed pas kyang rlom sems su mi byed ces gsungs pa ste /
translated: is not made by the mind of omniscience, nor is it made by the mind of omniscience.🔽It is not made by the mind of omniscience, nor is it made by the mind of omniscience.🔽It is not made by the mind of omniscience, nor is it made by the mind of omniscience.🔽It is not made by the mind of omniscience, nor is it made by the mind of omniscience.🔽It is not made by the mind of omniscience, nor is it made by the mind of omniscience.

original: bdud la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams kyis mi byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽don sgrub par byed pas rin po che dang 'dra ba ni phan pa dang / bde ba'i sems su bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bdud la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams kyis mi byed pa'i phyir ro // don sgrub par byed pas rin po che dang 'dra ba ni phan pa dang / bde ba'i sems su bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is not made by the mind of omniscience, nor is it made by the mind of omniscience.🔽It is not made by the mind of omniscience, nor is it made by the mind of omniscience.🔽It is not made by the mind of omniscience, nor is it made by the mind of omniscience.🔽It is not made by the mind of omniscience, nor is it made by the mind of omniscience.🔽It is not made by the mind of omniscience, nor is it made by the mind of omniscience.🔽It is not made by the mind of omniscience, nor is it made by the mind of omniscience.🔽It is not made by the mind of omniscience, nor is it made by the mind of omniscience.🔽It is not made by the mind of omniscience, nor is it made by the mind of omniscience.🔽It is not made by the mind of omniscience, nor is it made by the mind of omniscience.🔽It is not made by the mind of omniscience, nor is it made by the mind of omniscience.🔽It is not made by the mind of omniscience, nor is it made by the mind of omniscience.🔽It is not made by the mind of omniscience, nor is it made by the mind of omniscience.🔽It is not made by the mind of omniscience, nor is it made by the mind of omniscience.🔽It is not made by the mind of omniscience, nor is it made by the mind of omniscience.

original: de ltar bsam pa che ba bstan nas sgrub pa che ba bstan pa'i phyir /🔽chos la kun tu dga' ba gnas pa dang / stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar bsam pa che ba bstan nas sgrub pa che ba bstan pa'i phyir /🔽chos la kun tu dga' ba gnas pa dang / stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is not made by the mind of omniscience, nor is it made by the mind of omniscience

original: rnam pa gsum gyis bstan to //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum gyis bstan to //
translated: It is shown by three things.

original: chos thams cad dbyer med pa ste zhes bya ba ni dkar po'i chos thams cad de na tha dad pa med pa'i phyir chos kyi sku la bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad dbyer med pa ste zhes bya ba ni dkar po'i chos thams cad de na tha dad pa med pa'i phyir chos kyi sku la bya'o //
translated: All dharmas are undifferentiated in it means that all good dharmas are in it without being differentiated, and so it is the Dharma Body.

original: de ni gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu'i dgongs pa ston te /
analyzed: de ni gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu'i dgongs pa ston te /
translated: This shows the intention of the Elder Śāriputra.

original: sems can du lta ba la sogs pa spangs pas gang zag la bdag med pa bstan to //
analyzed: sems can du lta ba la sogs pa spangs pas gang zag la bdag med pa bstan to //
translated: By abandoning the view of sentient beings, etc., he shows the selflessness of persons.

original: phung por lta ba la @115b sogs pa spangs pas chos la bdag med pa bstan to //
analyzed: phung por lta ba la @115b sogs pa spangs pas chos la bdag med pa bstan to //
translated: By abandoning the view of aggregates, etc., he shows the selflessness of dharmas.

original: gzugs la mi dmigs shing dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lta ba bskyed do zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i rgyus rnam par rtog pa skyed pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la mi dmigs shing dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lta ba bskyed do zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i rgyus rnam par rtog pa skyed pa'o //
translated: He generates the view of form, etc., by not observing them, in the manner of not observing them means that by the cause of observing the aggregate of form, etc., he generates discrimination.

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi spobs pa ston te /🔽'di ltar sems de ni sems med pa ste /
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi spobs pa ston te / 'di ltar sems de ni sems med pa ste /
translated: This shows the eloquence of the Elder Subhūti.🔽Thus that mind is not a mind.

original: sems med pa'i phyir de la chags pa med do zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems med pa'i phyir de la chags pa med do zhes bya ste /
translated: Because it is not a mind, there is no attachment to it.

original: don dam pa'i chos nyid kyi sems ni kun brtags pa'i sems kyi mtshan nyid thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir sems med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i chos nyid kyi sems ni kun brtags pa'i sems kyi mtshan nyid thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir sems med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The ultimate mind of reality is called “mindless” because it is free from all the characteristics of the imagined mind.

original: de bas na sems med pa'i phyir byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba ni sems kun brtags pa'i sems de la chags pa med do //
analyzed: de bas na sems med pa'i phyir byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba ni sems kun brtags pa'i sems de la chags pa med do //
translated: Therefore, because it is mindless, the so-called mind of enlightenment is not attached to that imagined mind.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor sems mi mnyam pa dang / mnyam pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i sems de gang yin zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems kyi mtshan nyid 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor sems mi mnyam pa dang / mnyam pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i sems de gang yin zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems kyi mtshan nyid 'dri ba'o //
translated: Venerable Subhūti, what is that mind which is not equal, and is equal to the mind which is not shared in common with all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas?” This is asking about the characteristics of the mind of enlightenment.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed phyin chad ces bya ba la sogs pas don dam pa'i sems kyi mtshan nyid ston to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed phyin chad ces bya ba la sogs pas don dam pa'i sems kyi mtshan nyid ston to //
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, here, from the first production of the thought of enlightenment onward, the bodhisattva mahāsattva should practice the perfection of wisdom in this way.” This teaches the characteristics of the ultimate mind.

original: sa rab tu dga' ba yan cad kyi rnam par mi rtog pa'i sems la byang chub kyi sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa rab tu dga' ba yan cad kyi rnam par mi rtog pa'i sems la byang chub kyi sems zhes bya'o //
translated: The nonconceptual mind of the bodhisattva from the first ground of Joy onward is called the mind of enlightenment.

original: chos gang la yang skye ba'am 'gag par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la kun tu 'gro ba la sogs pa'i don du rtogs pa'i phyir sems gnas gyur pa /
analyzed: chos gang la yang skye ba'am 'gag par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la kun tu 'gro ba la sogs pa'i don du rtogs pa'i phyir sems gnas gyur pa /
translated: “ One does not see any phenomena as truly arising or ceasing” means that the mind has been transformed into the realization of the meaning of the all-pervasiveness of suchness and so forth.

original: nam mkha' dang mtshungs pas chos thams cad nam mkha' dang mtshungs bar mthong ngo //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mtshungs pas chos thams cad nam mkha' dang mtshungs bar mthong ngo //
translated: Since it is similar to space, one sees all phenomena as similar to space.

original: dper na nam mkha' de bdag dang lhan cig tu gnas pa rtsig pa la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi chos rnams la skye ba dang 'gag pa dag snang yang /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' de bdag dang lhan cig tu gnas pa rtsig pa la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi chos rnams la skye ba dang 'gag pa dag snang yang /
translated: For example, space is present together with itself, and in the conditioned phenomena of walls and so forth, arising and ceasing appear.

original: nam mkha' la ni skye ba dang / 'gag pa med la /
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni skye ba dang / 'gag pa med la /
translated: However, space does not arise or cease.

original: sprin la sogs pas khebs sam ma bral ba'i dus na yang 'phel ba dang / 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sprin la sogs pas khebs sam ma bral ba'i dus na yang 'phel ba dang / 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even when it is covered by clouds and so forth or not, it does not increase or decrease.

original: bdag dang lhan cig tu gnas pa rdo dang shing la sogs pa la 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba yod kyang nam mkha' la ni 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba med do //🔽na bun dang / khug rna dang / du ba la sogs pa yod pa dang / med par gyur na yang kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: bdag dang lhan cig tu gnas pa rdo dang shing la sogs pa la 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba yod kyang nam mkha' la ni 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba med do // na bun dang / khug rna dang / du ba la sogs pa yod pa dang / med par gyur na yang kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: Although there is coming and going in relation to things that coexist with the self, such as stones and trees, there is no coming and going in space.

original: rnam @116a * //
analyzed: rnam @116a * //
translated: Although there is the occurrence and non-occurrence of fog, mist, smoke, and so on, there is no affliction and no purification.

original: par byang bar yang mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang don dam par yongs su grub pa ste /🔽skye ba med /
analyzed: par byang bar yang mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang don dam par yongs su grub pa ste / skye ba med /
translated: Similarly, all phenomena are ultimately unarisen,🔽 unceasing,

original: 'gag pa med /🔽'phel ba med /
analyzed: 'gag pa med / 'phel ba med /
translated: unincreasing,

original: 'grib pa med /
analyzed: 'grib pa med /
translated: undiminishing,

original: 'ong ba med 'gro ba med /
analyzed: 'ong ba med 'gro ba med /
translated: non-coming, non-going,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med /🔽rnam par byang ba med la /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med /🔽rnam par byang ba med la /
translated: unafflicted,🔽and unpurified.

original: kun brtags pa'i gnas skabs na sgyu ma lta bu'i chos de dag skye ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa 'dra bar snang ngo zhes sems gang gis rtogs pa de mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sems dang thun mong ma yin pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i gnas skabs na sgyu ma lta bu'i chos de dag skye ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa 'dra bar snang ngo zhes sems gang gis rtogs pa de mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sems dang thun mong ma yin pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
translated: In the phase of the imagined, those illusion-like phenomena appear as if they were endowed with arising, etc. The mind that realizes that is called the mind that is equal to the unequalled and the mind that is not shared in common.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gang khyod kyis 'di skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pas gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu de nyid la chags pa med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gang khyod kyis 'di skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pas gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu de nyid la chags pa med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Venerable Subhūti, with the passage beginning “Venerable Subhūti, when you say,” etc., it is not only the Elder Śāriputra who is free from attachment.

original: chos thams cad la yang chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid khyab par ston te /
analyzed: chos thams cad la yang chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid khyab par ston te /
translated: It is taught that the characteristic of being free from attachment pervades all phenomena.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gzugs kyang chags pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad do //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gzugs kyang chags pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad do //
translated: Venerable Subhūti, form is also free from attachment, etc.

original: sems ni zag pa med pa /
analyzed: sems ni zag pa med pa /
translated: The mind is uncontaminated

original: khong du chud pa med pa zhes bya ba 'dis kyang chos thams cad la khyab pa'i mtshan nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: khong du chud pa med pa zhes bya ba 'dis kyang chos thams cad la khyab pa'i mtshan nyid du bstan to //
translated: and not fully understood. By this it is taught that the characteristic of being free from attachment pervades all phenomena.🔽Formless phenomena

original: gzugs med pa yang /
analyzed: gzugs med pa yang /
translated: are also free from attachment.

original: gzugs la chags pa med do zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i sems kyi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs la chags pa med do zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i sems kyi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir te /
translated: “He is not attached to form” means that he is free from the imagined nature of mind.

original: 'di ltar yongs su grub pa'i sems la /
analyzed: 'di ltar yongs su grub pa'i sems la /
translated: Thus, in the perfected nature of mind,

original: sems ma yin zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: sems ma yin zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
translated: “mind is not mind.”

original: kun brtags pa'i gzugs kyi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i gzugs kyi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: Similarly, because he is free from the imagined nature of form,

original: chos nyid kyi gzugs la gzugs med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi gzugs la gzugs med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: “form is not form” in the reality nature of form.

original: gzugs med par gyur pa chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: gzugs med par gyur pa chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The reality nature of form is not form.🔽“He is not attached to form” means that he is not attached to the imagined nature of form.

original: kun brtags pa'i gzugs la chags pa med do zhes bya ba dang / tshor ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i chos nyid de yang kun brtags pa'i tshor ba la chags pa med do zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i gzugs la chags pa med do zhes bya ba dang / tshor ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i chos nyid de yang kun brtags pa'i tshor ba la chags pa med do zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: “He is not attached to feeling” means that the reality nature of feeling, which is not the nature of feeling, is not attached to the imagined nature of feeling.

original: gnas brtan gang po'i bshad pa ni /
analyzed: gnas brtan gang po'i bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the elder Pūrṇa is as follows.

original: go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “He is clad in great armor” and so on.

original: dang po'i sems nas bzung nas /
analyzed: dang po'i sems nas bzung nas /
translated: From the first generation of the thought of awakening,

original: bsam pa rgya che ba bstan to //
analyzed: bsam pa rgya che ba bstan to //
translated: he is taught to have a vast intention.

analyzed: theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas bzung ste sa bdun pa'i bar du rtsol ba dang bcas / rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa'i gnas skabs yin par bstan to //
translated: The phrase who have set out in the Great Vehicle indicates the stage of action out of faith up to the seventh stage, which is the period of practice that is both accompanied by effort and accompanied by conceptuality.🔽The phrase who are established in the Great Vehicle indicates the eighth stage and above, which is the period of practice that is free of conceptuality.
