original: de la spyod pa ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la byed pa dang mi ldan pa ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la spyod pa ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la byed pa dang mi ldan pa ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha zhes bya ste /
translated: The practice of the perfection of morality is the armor of the perfection of morality.

original: @117a * // 'di ltar yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed la /
analyzed: @117a * // 'di ltar yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed la /
translated: It is the generation of the mind of complete enlightenment.

original: de nas yi dam blangs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas yi dam blangs pa ste /
translated: Then, it is the taking of the vow.

original: yongs su gtong ba ni tshul khrims dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su gtong ba ni tshul khrims dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not giving up, because that would contradict morality.

original: de bzhin du zang zing gi sbyin pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du zang zing gi sbyin pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin la /
translated: Similarly, the perfection of giving is the giving of material things.🔽The practice of that is the patience of not observing the object given, the giver, and the receiver.

original: de la brtson pa ni sbyin par bya ba dang / sbyin pa po dang / len pa po mi dmigs pa'i yid la byed pa rnams la bzod pa'i don ni chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa ste /
analyzed: de la brtson pa ni sbyin par bya ba dang / sbyin pa po dang / len pa po mi dmigs pa'i yid la byed pa rnams la bzod pa'i don ni chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa ste /
translated: The meaning of patience is the patience of certainty in the Dharma.

original: bzod pa'i go cha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bzod pa'i go cha zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the armor of patience.

original: de bzhin du sbyin pa gtong ba na sems can thams cad kyi don du yongs su bsngos pa'i sbyin pa la brtson 'grus mngon par 'phel ba ni brtson 'grus kyi go cha'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyin pa gtong ba na sems can thams cad kyi don du yongs su bsngos pa'i sbyin pa la brtson 'grus mngon par 'phel ba ni brtson 'grus kyi go cha'o //
translated: Similarly, when one is practicing generosity, the increase of effort in the generosity that is dedicated to the benefit of all beings is the armor of effort.

original: de bzhin du sbyin pa gtong ba ni sbyin pa'i gnas skabs dang / yongs su bsngo ba'i gnas skabs na yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyin pa gtong ba ni sbyin pa'i gnas skabs dang / yongs su bsngo ba'i gnas skabs na yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa /
translated: Similarly, when one is practicing generosity, the one-pointed mind in the state of generosity and in the state of dedication, which is the attention to the knowledge of all aspects,

original: sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa ni bsam gtan gyi go cha'o //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa ni bsam gtan gyi go cha'o //
translated: is the armor of meditation.

original: de gcig pu la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa gcig pu kho na la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de gcig pu la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa gcig pu kho na la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it has only that as its object. It has only the knowledge of all aspects as its object.

original: de bzhin du sbyin pa gtong ba na sgyu ma lta bu la sogs par yid la byed pa rnams dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i yid la byed pa rnams mi spong ba dang / kun rdzob yongs su ma btang bas byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyin pa gtong ba na sgyu ma lta bu la sogs par yid la byed pa rnams dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i yid la byed pa rnams mi spong ba dang / kun rdzob yongs su ma btang bas byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba dang /
translated: Likewise, when practicing generosity, they do not abandon the mental attentions to things being like illusions and so on, and they do not abandon nonconceptual mental attention. They dedicate their generosity to enlightenment without relinquishing the conventional and they apply themselves to the unobservable without relinquishing the ultimate.

original: don dam pa yongs su ma btang bas dmigs su med pa'i sbyor ba'i yid la byed pa ni shes rab kyi go cha'o //
analyzed: don dam pa yongs su ma btang bas dmigs su med pa'i sbyor ba'i yid la byed pa ni shes rab kyi go cha'o //
translated: These mental attentions are the armor of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba na mi dmigs par sbyor ba'i yid la byed pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par 'dod kyang sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba na mi dmigs par sbyor ba'i yid la byed pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par 'dod kyang sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang /
translated: Likewise, when practicing generosity, they wish to perfect the six pāramitās through mental attention that is applied without observation. They practice generosity, discipline, patience, diligence, concentration and wisdom without observation.

original: shes rab kyi mtshan ma rnams mi dmigs pa dang / sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byed pa la zhugs kyang mtshan ma de mi dmigs pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo yang byang chub kyi mtshan ma mi dmigs pa ste /🔽de ltar chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i yid la byed pa 'di ni don dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis @117b yongs su zin pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi go cha zhes bya'o //🔽don dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams bstan pa nyid kyi phyir de dag so sor bstan to //

translated: The non-apprehension of the signs of wisdom, the non-apprehension of the signs of the dedication to the common weal of all beings, and the non-apprehension of the signs of enlightenment, even when one is dedicated to the supreme enlightenment.🔽Thus, this mental attention to the non-apprehension of all things is called the armor of the six perfections, because it is embraced by the six perfections of the ultimate.🔽The six perfections of the ultimate are taught individually, because they are taught as the perfections of the ultimate.🔽🔽

original: sbyin pa gtong ba dang / tshul khrims dang rjes su mthun pa'i bsam pas sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed pa de ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni sbyin pa'i go cha zhes bya'o zhes bya ba
analyzed: sbyin pa gtong ba dang / tshul khrims dang rjes su mthun pa'i bsam pas sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed pa de ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni sbyin pa'i go cha zhes bya'o zhes bya ba
translated: The armor of generosity is when one dedicates to enlightenment, sharing with all sentient beings, with a thought that is in accord with morality.

original: dang / de bzhin du bzod pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i bsam pas sbyin pa la sogs pa byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang rjes su mthun par bya ba nyid dang / bsam gtan gyi rjes su mthun par bya ba nyid kyi phyir zhes bya bar thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dang / de bzhin du bzod pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i bsam pas sbyin pa la sogs pa byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang rjes su mthun par bya ba nyid dang / bsam gtan gyi rjes su mthun par bya ba nyid kyi phyir zhes bya bar thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: And similarly, one should apply the rest: generosity, etc. are done with a thought that is in accord with patience; they are done with a thought that is in accord with effort; they are done with a thought that is in accord with meditation.

original: ser sna dang 'chal ba'i tshul khrims dang / gnod sems la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams tshar bcad pa dang / rjes su mthun pa nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ser sna dang 'chal ba'i tshul khrims dang / gnod sems la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams tshar bcad pa dang / rjes su mthun pa nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The destruction of the afflictions that are adverse, such as stinginess, immorality, malice, etc., and the conformity to the perfections, such as generosity, etc., are the battle of the perfections.

original: de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to all the perfections.

original: dri ba gnyis pa brtsam pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dri ba gnyis pa brtsam pa'i phyir /
translated: The second question is begun:

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa, to what extent is a bodhisattva-mahāsattva established in the Great Vehicle?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po gang yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po gang yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: What is the Great Vehicle of a bodhisattva-mahāsattva?

original: de skad gsungs pa dang / gnas brtan gang pos theg pa chen po rnam pa bcu dang / de la yang dag par zhugs pa rnam pa bcu bstan nas /
analyzed: de skad gsungs pa dang / gnas brtan gang pos theg pa chen po rnam pa bcu dang / de la yang dag par zhugs pa rnam pa bcu bstan nas /
translated: When this was said, the elder Pūrṇa taught the ten aspects of the Great Vehicle and the ten ways of being established in it,

original: de bas na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba bstan to //
translated: and then taught: Therefore, he is established in the Great Vehicle.

original: de la sngar gzugs kyi bsam gtan bzhi dang tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / chos bcu gnyis po de dag dang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bsgoms na theg pa chen po yin pa dang /
analyzed: de la sngar gzugs kyi bsam gtan bzhi dang tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / chos bcu gnyis po de dag dang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bsgoms na theg pa chen po yin pa dang /
translated: Previously, it was taught that if one meditates on the four concentrations of form, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, and those twelve dharmas, and the six perfections, it is the Great Vehicle.

original: de dag gi rnam pa dang / rtags dang mtshan ma yid la byed pa dang / sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te /🔽byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba ni theg pa chen po de la yang @118a * //
analyzed: de dag gi rnam pa dang / rtags dang mtshan ma yid la byed pa dang / sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te / byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba ni theg pa chen po de la yang @118a * //
translated: And it was taught that if one attends to the aspects, signs, and characteristics of those, and makes them common to all sentient beings,

original: dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bstan nas /
translated: and if one dedicates them to enlightenment, one has correctly entered that Great Vehicle.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po yin te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po yin te /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, this is the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba bas 'jug bsdus so //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba bas 'jug bsdus so //
translated: Thus it is said that the bodhisattva mahāsattva is said to have correctly entered the Great Vehicle.

original: de nas yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / chos bcu gnyis po de dag nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas na theg pa chen po yin pa dang / mdo las 'byung ba bzhin du de la brtson pa yang dag par zhugs pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nas yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / chos bcu gnyis po de dag nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas na theg pa chen po yin pa dang / mdo las 'byung ba bzhin du de la brtson pa yang dag par zhugs pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Then, in order to demonstrate that the six perfections and those very twelve dharmas are the Great Vehicle when they are perfected, and that one who is engaged in striving in them is one who has correctly embarked on the Great Vehicle, as it occurs in the sutra,🔽the Lord said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi theg pa chen po yin te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi theg pa chen po yin te /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, this is the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva mahāsattva, the six perfections.🔽Thus, Venerable Śāriputra, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who is endowed with these six perfections is said to be one who has correctly embarked on the Great Vehicle.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa de dag bstan pa'o //🔽sbyin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa de dag bstan pa'o // sbyin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the second teaching.🔽Here, giving refers to

original: 'dir chos kyi sbyin pa la bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir chos kyi sbyin pa la bya ste /
translated: the giving of the Dharma.

original: de yang rnam pa thams cad du bsgoms na /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa thams cad du bsgoms na /
translated: Moreover, when it is cultivated in all aspects,

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi chos rnams theg pa chen po yin pa dang / de dag la yang rnam pa thams cad du bsgom par brtson pa dag yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gsum pa ste /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi chos rnams theg pa chen po yin pa dang / de dag la yang rnam pa thams cad du bsgom par brtson pa dag yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gsum pa ste /
translated: The Dharma from the applications of mindfulness up to the ultimate attributes of a Buddha are the Great Vehicle, and those who are intent on cultivating them in every way are those who have set out correctly.🔽This is the third.

original: de yang tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: de yang tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po'o //
translated: Moreover, Venerable Śāriputra, this is the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba gsungs pa'o //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva great beings have set out in the Great Vehicle.

original: de nas yang tshad med pa bzhi la bsgoms pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag theg pa chen po yin pa dang / mdo las 'byung ba bzhin du de la brtson pa dag yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de nas yang tshad med pa bzhi la bsgoms pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag theg pa chen po yin pa dang / mdo las 'byung ba bzhin du de la brtson pa dag yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: Then, the four immeasurables are the Great Vehicle, and those who strive in them are rightly engaged, as stated in the sutras. This is the fourth.

original: de nas yang stong pa nyid bcu drug ni theg pa chen po yin pa dang / de yang mi dmigs par yid la byed pa dag yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: de nas yang stong pa nyid bcu drug ni theg pa chen po yin pa dang / de yang mi dmigs par yid la byed pa dag yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lnga pa'o //
translated: Then, the sixteen kinds of emptiness are the Great Vehicle, and those who attend to them without objectifying them are rightly engaged. This is the fifth.

original: de nas mi g-yeng zhing mnyam par gzhag pa dag theg pa chen po'i yin pa dang / de shes pa yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba @118b ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: de nas mi g-yeng zhing mnyam par gzhag pa dag theg pa chen po'i yin pa dang / de shes pa yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba @118b ni drug pa'o //
translated: Then, nondistraction and meditative equipoise are the Great Vehicle, and those who understand them are rightly engaged. This is the sixth.

original: g-yeng ba dang ting nge 'dzin dang mtshan ma dang bcas par dmigs par gnas pa la yod kyi mtshan ma med pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: g-yeng ba dang ting nge 'dzin dang mtshan ma dang bcas par dmigs par gnas pa la yod kyi mtshan ma med pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: Distraction, meditative concentration, and the apprehension of attributes exist in the context of attributes, but not in the absence of attributes.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa la gnas pa ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de nas yang gnyis su med pa'i chos nyid theg pa chen po yin pa dang / de la shes pa dang mi shes pa med par gyur pa yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bdun pa'o //🔽de nas yang dus gsum mnyam pa nyid theg pa chen po yin pa dang / de la mi shes pa med pa dang / mi dmigs pa'i shes pa yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa la gnas pa ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de nas yang gnyis su med pa'i chos nyid theg pa chen po yin pa dang / de la shes pa dang mi shes pa med par gyur pa yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bdun pa'o // de nas yang dus gsum mnyam pa nyid theg pa chen po yin pa dang / de la mi shes pa med pa dang / mi dmigs pa'i shes pa yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: And the one who abides in non-conceptuality is always in meditative equipoise.🔽Then, the non-dual reality is the Great Vehicle, and the one who has entered into the absence of knowledge and ignorance with regard to that is the ninth.🔽Then, the equality of the three times is the Great Vehicle, and the one who has entered into the absence of ignorance and the non-apprehension of knowledge with regard to that is the tenth.

original: de nas yang khams gsum mnyam pa nyid theg pa chen po yin pa dang / de la mi shes pa med pa dang / shes pa mi dmigs pa yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dgu pa'o //
analyzed: de nas yang khams gsum mnyam pa nyid theg pa chen po yin pa dang / de la mi shes pa med pa dang / shes pa mi dmigs pa yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dgu pa'o //
translated: Then, the equality of the three realms is the Great Vehicle, and the one who has entered into the absence of ignorance and the non-apprehension of knowledge with regard to that is the eleventh.

original: de nas yang chos thams cad theg pa chen po yin pa dang / de la shes pa mi dmigs pa yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bcu pa'o //
analyzed: de nas yang chos thams cad theg pa chen po yin pa dang / de la shes pa mi dmigs pa yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bcu pa'o //
translated: Then, “All phenomena are the Great Vehicle, and the non-apprehension of consciousness therein is the correct engagement” is the tenth.

original: de dag yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: de dag yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: Having completed those,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po'o //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, this is the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya bas mjug bsdus so /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya bas mjug bsdus so /
translated: Thus, Venerable Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva is correctly engaged in the Great Vehicle.”

original: // / bam po bcu gcig pa /
analyzed: // / bam po bcu gcig pa /
translated: Thus it concludes.

original: da ni dri ba gsum pa brtsam par bya ba'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa gang bo ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la gnas zhes bya zhes bya bshad do //
analyzed: da ni dri ba gsum pa brtsam par bya ba'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa gang bo ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la gnas zhes bya zhes bya bshad do //
translated: Now, in order to begin the third question, “Venerable Pūrṇa, from what point is a bodhisattva mahāsattva said to be established in the Great Vehicle?” is explained.

original: de nas gnas brtan gang pos sa brgyad pa yan chad rnam par mi rtog pa la spyod pa drug bstan la /
analyzed: de nas gnas brtan gang pos sa brgyad pa yan chad rnam par mi rtog pa la spyod pa drug bstan la /
translated: Then the elder Pūrṇa teaches the six stages of the practice of the nonconceptual from the eighth stage on.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: The Venerable Śāriputra, here bodhisattva mahāsattvas, when practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas skabs dang po bstan to //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas skabs dang po bstan to //
translated: correctly abide in the perfection of generosity, and so on. This teaches the first stage of the nonconceptual perfections.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i stong pa nyid bsgom pa ni gnyis pa'o //🔽rnam par mi rtog par dkar po'i @119a * //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i stong pa nyid bsgom pa ni gnyis pa'o // rnam par mi rtog par dkar po'i @119a * //
translated: The cultivation of nonconceptual emptiness is the second.

original: chos thams cad bsgoms pa ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad bsgoms pa ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The cultivation of all virtuous dharmas nonconceptually is the third.

original: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The nonapprehension of all dharmas is the fourth.

original: dbang gi gnas skabs ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: dbang gi gnas skabs ni lnga pa'o //
translated: The stage of mastery is the fifth.

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ni drug pa'o //
translated: Complete and perfect enlightenment is the sixth.

original: de la dang por sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas par spyod pa'i sa nas rnam par mi rtog pa rnam par smin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas la gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go
analyzed: de la dang por sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas par spyod pa'i sa nas rnam par mi rtog pa rnam par smin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas la gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go
translated: The first is the stage of the perfection of generosity. The stage of the perfection of generosity is the stage of the perfection of generosity that is the result of the stage of the perfection of generosity that is associated with conceptual thought.

original: // sa brgyad pa la ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs sngon du yongs su rdzogs par byas pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa rnam par smin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams rtsol ba med par yang nye bar gnas te /
analyzed: // sa brgyad pa la ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs sngon du yongs su rdzogs par byas pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa rnam par smin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams rtsol ba med par yang nye bar gnas te /
translated: On the eighth stage, the perfections that are the results of the perfection of generosity that is associated with conceptual thought and that is previously completed as the accumulation of merit are present without effort.

original: 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyir rna par mi rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyir rna par mi rtog pa yin no //
translated: They are nonconceptual because they are the nature of the result.

original: de dag dang thabs mkhas pa'i mthu dang / smon lam gyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can gyi don sgrub po //🔽gnyis pa pa la ni /
analyzed: de dag dang thabs mkhas pa'i mthu dang / smon lam gyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can gyi don sgrub po //🔽gnyis pa pa la ni /
translated: By means of those and the power of skillful means and the power of prayer, the bodhisattvas accomplish the aims of sentient beings.

original: bsgom pa rnam par gzhig pa'i phyir na stong pa nyid bsgom mo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsgom pa rnam par gzhig pa'i phyir na stong pa nyid bsgom mo zhes bya ba la /
translated: In order to destroy meditation, one meditates on emptiness.

original: rnam par 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir stong par byed pa la bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir stong par byed pa la bya ste /
translated: Here, destroy means to make empty.

original: rnam par 'jig pa bsgom pas mi dmigs par bsgom zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par 'jig pa bsgom pas mi dmigs par bsgom zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meditation on destruction is the meditation on non-apprehension, that is the meaning.

original: dngos po med par byed pa nyid la 'dir bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po med par byed pa nyid la 'dir bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The making of things non-existent is called meditation here.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: de ltar gnas brtan gang pos rang gi spobs pa bstan pa dang / gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pa shes par 'dod nas /
analyzed: de ltar gnas brtan gang pos rang gi spobs pa bstan pa dang / gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pa shes par 'dod nas /
translated: Thus, the Elder Pūrṇa taught his own eloquence, and the Elder Subhūti, wanting to know the thought of the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos zhes bgyi ba lags zhes bcom ldan 'das la zhus so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos zhes bgyi ba lags zhes bcom ldan 'das la zhus so //
translated: asked the Blessed One, saying, Blessed One, by how much is a bodhisattva mahāsattva said to be wearing the great armor?

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis go cha chen po rnam pa dgu bstan to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis go cha chen po rnam pa dgu bstan to //
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One taught the nine kinds of great armor.

original: de'i 'og tu de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis bdag gi spobs pa gnyis pa bstan pa dang 'gres bcu gcig gis bstan te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis bdag gi spobs pa gnyis pa bstan pa dang 'gres bcu gcig gis bstan te /
translated: Then, after that, the Elder Subhūti taught with eleven repetitions, beginning with “Then, the Elder Subhūti taught my second confidence.

original: go cha thams cad bgos pa rnams kyi nang nas rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i rdzu 'phrul gyi ngan 'gro rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i 'gres sgyu ma lta bu dang bcas pa'i 'gres ni dang po'o //
analyzed: go cha thams cad bgos pa rnams kyi nang nas rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i rdzu 'phrul gyi ngan 'gro rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i 'gres sgyu ma lta bu dang bcas pa'i 'gres ni dang po'o //
translated: The first repetition is the magical illusion-like pacification of bad transmigrations from among the fruitional superknowledges of those who have donned all the armor.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug @119b gi 'gres sgyu ma lta bu drug go //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug @119b gi 'gres sgyu ma lta bu drug go //
translated: The six repetitions are the six magical illusion-like perfections.

original: phyogs bcu'i sems can rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bkod pa sgyu ma lta bu ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sems can rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bkod pa sgyu ma lta bu ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: The eighth repetition is the magical illusion-like establishment of sentient beings in the ten directions in the six perfections.

original: bsam pa rgya chen po ni dgu pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa rgya chen po ni dgu pa'o //
translated: The ninth repetition is the vast intention.

original: de la gnas brtan gyis sgyu ma lta bu'i rgyus bdag gi spobs pa bskyed par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la gnas brtan gyis sgyu ma lta bu'i rgyus bdag gi spobs pa bskyed par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In that, in order to teach that the Elder generated my confidence through the cause of magical illusion,

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don tshal ba ltar na zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don tshal ba ltar na zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: the Bhagavān said, “Bhagavān, according to my understanding of the meaning of what the Bhagavān has said . . .”

original: kye ma byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni go cha ma mchis pa'i go cha bgos par rig par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i go cha thams cad kun brtags pa yin pa'i phyir go ca de dag kyang med pa'i rang bzhin de bzhin
analyzed: kye ma byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni go cha ma mchis pa'i go cha bgos par rig par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i go cha thams cad kun brtags pa yin pa'i phyir go ca de dag kyang med pa'i rang bzhin de bzhin
translated: This means that since all the previously explained armors are imagined, those armors are also the essence of suchness, which is the nature of non-existence.

original: nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi go cha bgos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi go cha bgos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that the bodhisattva wears the armor of the essence of suchness.

original: de bas na chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi slad du sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung nas zhes bya ba gsol to //
analyzed: de bas na chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi slad du sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung nas zhes bya ba gsol to //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “Because all phenomena are empty of their own characteristics, one should take up the illusory nature of phenomena.”

original: sgyu ma'i chos de dag bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i chos de dag bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to establish those illusory phenomena,

original: gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad de /
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad de /
translated: it is explained that “form is empty of form,” and so on.

original: 'di ltar yongs su grub pa'i gzugs kun brtags pa'i gzugs kyis stong zhing /
analyzed: 'di ltar yongs su grub pa'i gzugs kun brtags pa'i gzugs kyis stong zhing /
translated: Thus, the fully present form is empty of the imagined form,

original: yongs su grub pa'i tshor ba kun brtags pa'i tshor bas stong ste /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i tshor ba kun brtags pa'i tshor bas stong ste /
translated: and the fully present feeling is empty of the imagined feeling.

original: de'i phyir don dam pa'i go cha yang kun brtags pa'i go chas stong ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam pa'i go cha yang kun brtags pa'i go chas stong ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, the armor of the ultimate is also to be supplied with the emptiness of the imaginary armor.

original: de bas na tha mar /
analyzed: de bas na tha mar /
translated: Thus, finally,

original: go cha chen po yang go cha chen pos stong ste /
analyzed: go cha chen po yang go cha chen pos stong ste /
translated: the great armor is empty of the great armor.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' chen po go cha ma mchis pa'i go cha bgos par rig par bgyi'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' chen po go cha ma mchis pa'i go cha bgos par rig par bgyi'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Blessed One, by this approach one should know that the great bodhisattva dons the armor of non-armor.

original: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni ma byas ma bshig mngon par 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba ci las dgongs she na /
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni ma byas ma bshig mngon par 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba ci las dgongs she na /
translated: Subhūti, the knowledge of all aspects is not made, is not destroyed, and is not conditioned.

original: 'jig rten 'di na go cha ni rnam pa gsum du 'jug ste ci zhig bya'o snyam nas go cha gyon par byed de /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di na go cha ni rnam pa gsum du 'jug ste ci zhig bya'o snyam nas go cha gyon par byed de /
translated: In this world, armor is worn in three ways: one dons armor thinking, “I will do this.”

original: dper na bdag gi grong khyer brtsig go snyam mam /🔽gtsug lag khang brtsig go zhes bya ba lta bu dang / ci zhig med par bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: dper na bdag gi grong khyer brtsig go snyam mam / gtsug lag khang brtsig go zhes bya ba lta bu dang / ci zhig med par bya'o snyam nas /
translated: For example, one thinks, “I will build a city,”

original: go cha gyon par byed de /
analyzed: go cha gyon par byed de /
translated: or “I will build a temple,” and one dons armor thinking, “I will destroy this.”

original: dper na bdag gis grong khyer gzhig par bya'o zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: dper na bdag gis grong khyer gzhig par bya'o zhes bya ba'am /
translated: For example, it is like saying, “I will destroy the city.”

original: grong khyer gzhig par bya'o zhes bya ba lta bu dang / dang ci zhig mngon par @120a * //
analyzed: grong khyer gzhig par bya'o zhes bya ba lta bu dang / dang ci zhig mngon par @120a * //
translated: For example, it is like saying, “I will destroy the city,” or “The city will be destroyed,”

original: 'du bya'o snyam nas go cha gyon par byed de /🔽dper na bdag gis grong nyams dga' bar bya'o snyam mam /
analyzed: 'du bya'o snyam nas go cha gyon par byed de / dper na bdag gis grong nyams dga' bar bya'o snyam mam /
translated: or “What should I create?” and then putting on armor.

original: grong khyer legs par bya'o snyam du sems pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: grong khyer legs par bya'o snyam du sems pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like thinking, “I will make a pleasant town,” or “I will make a good city.”

original: de bzhin du rna pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang gal te 'ga' zhig gis byas pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang gal te 'ga' zhig gis byas pa'am /
translated: In the same way, if omniscience were created by someone,

original: gzhig pa'am / mngon par 'du bya ba zhig yin na ni de lta na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi don du go cha chen po bgos par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gzhig pa'am / mngon par 'du bya ba zhig yin na ni de lta na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi don du go cha chen po bgos par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: or destroyed, or something to be created, then it would be the case that one would put on the great armor for the sake of omniscience.

original: 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma byas /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma byas /
translated: However, omniscience is not created,

original: ma bshig mngon par 'dus ma byas pa yin te /
analyzed: ma bshig mngon par 'dus ma byas pa yin te /
translated: not destroyed, and not something to be created.

original: de bas na de'i don du go cha chen po bgos par mi rigs so //
analyzed: de bas na de'i don du go cha chen po bgos par mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to put on the great armor for its sake.

original: de bas na go cha med pa'i go cha bgos so zhes bya bar rigs so snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na go cha med pa'i go cha bgos so zhes bya bar rigs so snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to think that one dons the armor without armor.

original: de nyid kyi phyir byed pa po mi dmigs pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma byas /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir byed pa po mi dmigs pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma byas /
translated: For that very reason, since the agent is not observed, the knowledge of all aspects is not made.

original: ma bshig mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: ma bshig mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ste /
translated: It is not destroyed, not accumulated.

original: 'di ltar de dag shin tu med cing /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag shin tu med cing /
translated: Because they do not exist at all,

original: mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: and are not observed.

original: de bzhin nyid kyang gang gi tshe gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang sgra'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa kun brtags pa'i rnam par mi 'dzin pa de'i tshe yang de'i rnam par yod pa ma yin pas de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyang gang gi tshe gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang sgra'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa kun brtags pa'i rnam par mi 'dzin pa de'i tshe yang de'i rnam par yod pa ma yin pas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: When suchness is also not grasped as the suchness of form, the suchness of sound, and so on, which are imagined, then at that time it is said to exist in that way, because it does not exist in that way.

original: de nas yang gnas brtan gyis bdag gi bsam pa brtan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nas yang gnas brtan gyis bdag gi bsam pa brtan pa'i phyir /
translated: Then, in order to stabilize his own thought, the elder

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don 'tshal ba ltar na zhes bya ba gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don 'tshal ba ltar na zhes bya ba gsol to //
translated: said, As I understand the meaning of what the Blessed One has said, the Blessed One has not made anything.

original: gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o zhes bya ba ci las dgongs she na 'ga' zhig 'di snyam du 'di ltar zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga po dag ni kun tu sbyor ba la sogs pas bcings te /
analyzed: gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o zhes bya ba ci las dgongs she na 'ga' zhig 'di snyam du 'di ltar zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga po dag ni kun tu sbyor ba la sogs pas bcings te /
translated: Some think, “The five contaminated aggregates are bound by fetters and so on.

original: de dag kyang bcings par gyur nas /
analyzed: de dag kyang bcings par gyur nas /
translated: Since they are bound,

original: las dang nyon mongs pa dag gis yang dang yang 'khor bar byed la /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa dag gis yang dang yang 'khor bar byed la /
translated: karma and affliction repeatedly cause one to circle in samsara.

original: zag pa med pa dag ni phyis grol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa dag ni phyis grol bar 'gyur te /
translated: The uncontaminated aggregates are liberated later.🔽When they are destroyed at that time, they are said to be uncreated and undestroyed.”

original: de'i tshe bshig par gyur na ma byas ma bshig ces bya ba snyam du sems pa de'i phyir gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i tshe bshig par gyur na ma byas ma bshig ces bya ba snyam du sems pa de'i phyir gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To respond to that, the root text states, “Form is neither bound nor liberated,” and so on.

original: bcings pa dang grol ba gnyis ni yod pa las 'gyur na /
analyzed: bcings pa dang grol ba gnyis ni yod pa las 'gyur na /
translated: If being bound and being liberated exist,

original: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa ni shin tu med pa yin pas yod pa ma yin pa de dag la bcings pa @120b dang grol ba ga la yod de mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa ni shin tu med pa yin pas yod pa ma yin pa de dag la bcings pa @120b dang grol ba ga la yod de mi 'grub bo //
translated: then form and so on would exist. But since they do not exist at all, how could they be bound or liberated? They are not established as such.

original: kun brtags pa'i dbang gis ni bcings pa dang grol ba gnyis bstan gyi /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i dbang gis ni bcings pa dang grol ba gnyis bstan gyi /
translated: By the power of the imagined, both bondage and liberation are taught.

original: don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: But not ultimately, is what is meant.

original: de bas na tshe dang ldan pa gang po gzugs nyid med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na tshe dang ldan pa gang po gzugs nyid med pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the Venerable Pūrṇa explained, “Because form itself does not exist,

original: gzugs de ma bcings ma grol ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad do //
analyzed: gzugs de ma bcings ma grol ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad do //
translated: that form is neither bound nor liberated.”

original: rmi lam lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yongs su grub pa'i gzugs kyang ma bcings ma grol ba nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: rmi lam lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yongs su grub pa'i gzugs kyang ma bcings ma grol ba nyid du bstan to //
translated: By the statement, “like a dream,” etc., even the perfected form is shown to be neither bound nor liberated.

original: dben pa dang / zhi ba dang / stong pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' bzhin du gnas pa la bcings ba dang / grol ba nyid mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dben pa dang / zhi ba dang / stong pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' bzhin du gnas pa la bcings ba dang / grol ba nyid mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because of being void, peaceful, and empty, it is not logical that there is bondage or liberation, as in the case of space.

original: lhag ma rnams ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: de ltar go cha chen po brtan pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar go cha chen po brtan pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: Thus, having completed the great armor of firmness,

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig bzung ste /
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig bzung ste /
translated: The elder Subhūti took up the term “one who has set out in the Great Vehicle”

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po gang lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhu ba rnam pa lnga brtsams so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po gang lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhu ba rnam pa lnga brtsams so //
translated: and asked five questions beginning with “Bhagavan, what is the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas?”

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis theg pa chen po zhes bya ba rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gcig tu phye ste /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis theg pa chen po zhes bya ba rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gcig tu phye ste /
translated: In response to that, the Bhagavān distinguished twenty-one types of the Great Vehicle.

original: bshad pa 'di lta ste pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen po dang / stong pa nyid thams cad kyi thag pa chen po dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi theg pa chen po dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i theg pa chen po dang /
analyzed: bshad pa 'di lta ste pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen po dang / stong pa nyid thams cad kyi thag pa chen po dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi theg pa chen po dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i theg pa chen po dang /
translated: They are as follows: the Great Vehicle of the perfections, the Great Vehicle of all emptinesses, the Great Vehicle of all samādhis, the Great Vehicle of the applications of mindfulness,

original: yang dag par spong ba'i theg pa chen po dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i theg pa chen po dang / dbang po'i theg pa chen po dang / stobs kyi theg pa chen po dang / byang chub kyi yan lag gi theg pa chen po dang /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba'i theg pa chen po dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i theg pa chen po dang / dbang po'i theg pa chen po dang / stobs kyi theg pa chen po dang / byang chub kyi yan lag gi theg pa chen po dang /
translated: the Great Vehicle of the correct exertions, the Great Vehicle of the bases of supernatural powers, the Great Vehicle of the faculties, the Great Vehicle of the powers, the Great Vehicle of the branches of enlightenment,

original: lam gyi theg pa chen po dang / rnam par thar pa'i theg pa chen po dang / shes pa'i theg pa chen po dang / dbang po'i theg pa chen po dang / ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi theg pa chen po dang / rjes su dran pa'i theg pa chen po dang /
analyzed: lam gyi theg pa chen po dang / rnam par thar pa'i theg pa chen po dang / shes pa'i theg pa chen po dang / dbang po'i theg pa chen po dang / ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi theg pa chen po dang / rjes su dran pa'i theg pa chen po dang /
translated: the Great Vehicle of the path, the Great Vehicle of liberation, the Great Vehicle of knowledge, the Great Vehicle of the faculties, the Great Vehicle of the three meditative stabilizations, the Great Vehicle of recollection,

original: snyoms par 'jug pa lnga'i theg pa chen po dang / stobs bcu'i theg pa chen po dang / mi 'jigs pa'i theg pa chen po dang / so so yang dag par rig pa'i thag pa chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i theg pa chen po dang /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa lnga'i theg pa chen po dang / stobs bcu'i theg pa chen po dang / mi 'jigs pa'i theg pa chen po dang / so so yang dag par rig pa'i thag pa chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i theg pa chen po dang /
translated: the Great Vehicle of the five meditative concentrations, the Great Vehicle of the ten powers, the Great Vehicle of the fearlessnesses, the Great Vehicle of the correct understandings, the Great Vehicle of the distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: gzungs kyi sgo'i theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo'i theg pa chen po'o //
translated: and the Great Vehicle of the dhāraṇī gateway.

original: @121a * // de la gnyis pa stong pa nyid kyi theg pa chen po'i 'gres la mig ni mig gis stong ste /
analyzed: @121a * // de la gnyis pa stong pa nyid kyi theg pa chen po'i 'gres la mig ni mig gis stong ste /
translated: The second, the Mahāyāna of emptiness, is as follows: The eye is empty of the eye,🔽because it does not endure permanently and it does not disintegrate.

original: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i mig ni kun brtags pa'i mig gis stong ste /
analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i mig ni kun brtags pa'i mig gis stong ste /
translated: The imaginary eye is empty of the imaginary eye.

original: stong pa ni med pa'i don yin pas mig la mig gi dngos po med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽gal te yod pa zhig yin na rtag pa ther zug tu gnas pa zhig gam /
analyzed: stong pa ni med pa'i don yin pas mig la mig gi dngos po med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // gal te yod pa zhig yin na rtag pa ther zug tu gnas pa zhig gam /
translated: Since emptiness means nonexistence, it means that the eye does not have the entity of the eye.

original: mi rtag pa 'jig pa zhig yin grang na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa 'jig pa zhig yin grang na /
translated: If it existed, it would be either permanent and enduring or impermanent and disintegrating.

original: 'di ltar ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin zhing 'jig pa med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin zhing 'jig pa med de /
translated: It is neither permanent and enduring nor impermanent and disintegrating.

original: de'i phyir ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin la 'jig pa med pas med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i phyir ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin la 'jig pa med pas med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, it means that because it is neither permanent and enduring nor impermanent and disintegrating, it does not exist.

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mig la mig gi dngos po med pa nyid de'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mig la mig gi dngos po med pa nyid de'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Because that is its nature. The eye does not have the entity of the eye. That is its nature.

original: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the term “own-being.”

original: nang dang phyi'i chos rnams so sor med pa nyid de stong pa nyid gnyis so //
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i chos rnams so sor med pa nyid de stong pa nyid gnyis so //
translated: The emptiness of the non-existence of the internal and external is the emptiness of the two.

original: nang gi chos rnams phyi'i chos rnams la 'dzin pa dang / phyi'i chos rnams nang gi chos rnams kyi yul du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: nang gi chos rnams phyi'i chos rnams la 'dzin pa dang / phyi'i chos rnams nang gi chos rnams kyi yul du gyur pa ste /
translated: The internal dharmas are not apprehended in the external dharmas, and the external dharmas are not apprehended as the objects of the internal dharmas.

original: yul can dang yul gyi dngos po stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni phyi nang stong pa nyid de gsum pa'o //
analyzed: yul can dang yul gyi dngos po stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni phyi nang stong pa nyid de gsum pa'o //
translated: The emptiness of the state of subject and object is the emptiness of the internal and the external.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid gang yin pa'i stong pa nyid des stong pa nyid du gyur pa 'di ni stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid gang yin pa'i stong pa nyid des stong pa nyid du gyur pa 'di ni stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ste /
translated: The emptiness of the emptiness of all dharmas is the emptiness of emptiness.

original: stong pa yang de yin la stong pa nyid kyang de yin pa'i phyir stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa yang de yin la stong pa nyid kyang de yin pa'i phyir stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: It is emptiness and it is also emptiness, thus it is called the emptiness of emptiness.

original: gang gis stong zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis stong zhe na /
translated: By what is it empty?

original: chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is empty of the emptiness of all dharmas.

original: stong pa nyid des stong ngo zhes bshad do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid des stong ngo zhes bshad do //
translated: It is explained that it is empty of that emptiness.

original: ji skad bstan par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad bstan par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it taught?

original: stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid gnyis pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin gyi ngo bo nyid kho nas stong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid gnyis pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin gyi ngo bo nyid kho nas stong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Emptiness is not empty of another emptiness, but rather it is empty of itself.

original: shar phyogs ni shar phyogs kyis stong zhes bya ba'i chos chen po rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni che ba nyid yin pas chen po stong pa nyid ces bya ste /🔽phyogs thams cad du khyab pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shar phyogs ni shar phyogs kyis stong zhes bya ba'i chos chen po rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni che ba nyid yin pas chen po stong pa nyid ces bya ste / phyogs thams cad du khyab pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The emptiness of the great is as follows: The eastern direction is empty of the eastern direction. The emptiness of the great is the emptiness of the great elements.🔽It is called the emptiness of the great because it is the emptiness of the great elements, which pervade all directions.

original: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa de 'ang mya ngan las 'das pas stong ngo zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa de 'ang mya ngan las 'das pas stong ngo zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: That nirvana is empty of nirvana means that nirvana is empty of the nature of ultimate nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ther zug tu gnas pa zhes mi @121b bya'am zhe na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ther zug tu gnas pa zhes mi @121b bya'am zhe na /
translated: Is nirvana not said to be an eternal state?

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rtogs pa dang bcas pa kha cig gi tshul ni de lta ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rtogs pa dang bcas pa kha cig gi tshul ni de lta ma yin gyi /
translated: The way of some of the Sravakas who have understanding is not like that.

original: don dam par ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i chos gang yang med do //
analyzed: don dam par ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i chos gang yang med do //
translated: In the ultimate sense, there is no dharma whatsoever called nirvana.

original: 'dus byas zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'o zhes bya ba la 'dus byas thams cad khams gsum du gtogs pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'o zhes bya ba la 'dus byas thams cad khams gsum du gtogs pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The compounded is the three realms means that all compounded things are included in the three realms.

original: gang la skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa dang / gnas pa med pa dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa zhes bya ba la chos rnams 'byung ba ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: gang la skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa dang / gnas pa med pa dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa zhes bya ba la chos rnams 'byung ba ni skye ba'o //
translated: Where there is no arising, no ceasing, no destruction, no abiding, and no transformation, means that the occurrence of dharmas is arising.

original: rgyun chad pa ni 'gag pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun chad pa ni 'gag pa'o //
translated: The interruption of the continuum is ceasing.

original: skad cig gcig la 'jig pa ni zhig pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig gcig la 'jig pa ni zhig pa'o //
translated: The destruction in one moment is destruction.

original: rgyun gyi rgyud ma chad pa ni gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun gyi rgyud ma chad pa ni gnas pa'o //
translated: The uninterrupted continuum is abiding.

original: rgyun rnams kyi snga phyi'i bye brag ni gzhan du gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun rnams kyi snga phyi'i bye brag ni gzhan du gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The distinction of the earlier and later moments of the continuum is called transformation.

original: gang la chos de dag med pa'i chos de dag la 'dus ma byas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang la chos de dag med pa'i chos de dag la 'dus ma byas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The dharmas that do not have those dharmas are called unconditioned.

original: nam mkha' dang / de bzhin nyid dang / 'gog pa gnyis dang / chos de dag 'dus ma byas pa'i dngos por yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang / de bzhin nyid dang / 'gog pa gnyis dang / chos de dag 'dus ma byas pa'i dngos por yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Space, suchness, the two cessations, and those dharmas do not exist as unconditioned things.

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the emptiness of the unconditioned.

original: chad pa'i mtha' dang / rtag pa'i mtha'o zhes bstan pa tsam du zad pas dngos po dang / dngos po med pa dang / chos dang chos ma yin pa dang / yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i mtha' rnams kyang 'di nyid du 'dus so //🔽gang la thog ma dang tha ma mi dmigs pa de la dbus med ces bya ba ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa thog ma zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi mtha' la bya'o //
analyzed: chad pa'i mtha' dang / rtag pa'i mtha'o zhes bstan pa tsam du zad pas dngos po dang / dngos po med pa dang / chos dang chos ma yin pa dang / yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i mtha' rnams kyang 'di nyid du 'dus so // gang la thog ma dang tha ma mi dmigs pa de la dbus med ces bya ba ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa thog ma zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi mtha' la bya'o //
translated: The extremes of annihilation and permanence are taught, but the extremes of things and non-things, of dharma and nondharma, of existence and nonexistence, and so on, are included in just this.

original: tha ma zhes bya ba ni phyir ma'i mtha' la bya'o //
analyzed: tha ma zhes bya ba ni phyir ma'i mtha' la bya'o //
translated: That which is not observed in the beginning and end is without middle means that in the so-called absence of beginning and end, the so-called beginning refers to the prior limit, and the so-called end refers to the posterior limit.

original: yang na tha ma zhes bya ba ni dang po'i mtha' la bya'o //
analyzed: yang na tha ma zhes bya ba ni dang po'i mtha' la bya'o //
translated: Or else, the end is the end of the beginning.

original: thog ma zhes bya ba ni phyi ma'i mtha' la bya ste /
analyzed: thog ma zhes bya ba ni phyi ma'i mtha' la bya ste /
translated: The beginning is the beginning of the end.

original: mtha' de gnyis med pa'i phyir dbus kyang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mtha' de gnyis med pa'i phyir dbus kyang med par 'gyur te /
translated: Since these two ends do not exist, the middle also does not exist.

original: de bas na thog ma med pa dang / tha ma med pa dang / dbus med pa'i stong pa nyid la /
analyzed: de bas na thog ma med pa dang / tha ma med pa dang / dbus med pa'i stong pa nyid la /
translated: Therefore, the emptiness of that which is beginningless and endless and of the middle is called

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: the emptiness of that which has neither been observed nor not observed.

original: yang na thog ma dang tha ma dang / dbus med pa de dag nyid thog ma dang tha ma dang dbus med pas stong pa'i phyir thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid ces pa'o //
analyzed: yang na thog ma dang tha ma dang / dbus med pa de dag nyid thog ma dang tha ma dang dbus med pas stong pa'i phyir thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid ces pa'o //
translated: Or else, since that which has neither beginning nor end and the middle are empty of that which has neither beginning nor end and the middle, it is called the emptiness of that which has neither been observed nor not observed.

original: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni ji ltar sngar blangs pa'i chu bo zhing med par byas na bum @122a * //
analyzed: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni ji ltar sngar blangs pa'i chu bo zhing med par byas na bum @122a * //
translated: The emptiness of non-rejection is as follows: Just as a pot becomes empty when the water that was previously taken into it is poured out,

original: pa stong par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: pa stong par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: in the same way,

original: don dam pa'i rdzas sngon byung ba rnams phyis bor zhing btang ba 'di la stong pa nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni yin gyi /
analyzed: don dam pa'i rdzas sngon byung ba rnams phyis bor zhing btang ba 'di la stong pa nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni yin gyi /
translated: The establishment of emptiness in this regard is the relinquishment and abandonment of previously existing substantial entities.

original: chos rnams ngo bo nyid kyis med pa de stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos rnams ngo bo nyid kyis med pa de stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The nonexistence of entities by way of their intrinsic nature is what is meant by the term “emptiness.”

original: de la dor ba med pa ni dor ba med pas stong ngo zhes bya ba ni dor ba med pa'i chos ni gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la dor ba med pa ni dor ba med pas stong ngo zhes bya ba ni dor ba med pa'i chos ni gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: With regard to that, the absence of something to be relinquished is empty of the absence of something to be relinquished.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas rnams kyi rang bzhin chos nyid stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni nyan thos sam /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas rnams kyi rang bzhin chos nyid stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni nyan thos sam /
translated: The emptiness of the intrinsic nature refers to the emptiness that is the reality, i.e., the intrinsic nature, of conditioned and unconditioned phenomena.🔽That is not created by any śrāvaka,

original: rang sangs rgyas sam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas sam /
translated: pratyekabuddha,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'am /🔽gang gis kyang ma byas ma mdzad de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'am / gang gis kyang ma byas ma mdzad de /
translated: or tathāgata.

original: de bas na rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the “intrinsic nature.”

original: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin de yang rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin de yang rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: Moreover, the intrinsic nature of all phenomena is empty of the intrinsic nature.

original: chos can yod na ni de'i rang bzhin yang 'grub par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: chos can yod na ni de'i rang bzhin yang 'grub par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If there were a phenomenon, then its intrinsic reality would also be established.

original: 'di ltar chos can nyid med na de gang gi rang bzhin du brjod par 'os zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos can nyid med na de gang gi rang bzhin du brjod par 'os zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: But since there is no phenomenon, what is suitable to be called its intrinsic reality? This is the meaning.

original: de bas na rang bzhin ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na rang bzhin ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that intrinsic reality is empty of intrinsic reality.

original: chos thams cad ni chos thams cad kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba ni don dam par na chos thams cad la chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni chos thams cad kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba ni don dam par na chos thams cad la chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: All phenomena are empty of all phenomena means that ultimately all phenomena do not have the intrinsic reality of all phenomena.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos rnams med na 'di dag gang gis rang gi mtshan nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos rnams med na 'di dag gang gis rang gi mtshan nyid du 'gyur /
translated: The emptiness of defining characteristics means that if phenomena do not exist, by what would these be the defining characteristics of?

original: de bas na chos rnams kun brtags pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir mtshan nyid 'di dag kyang kun pa rtags pa yin pas med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na chos rnams kun brtags pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir mtshan nyid 'di dag kyang kun pa rtags pa yin pas med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, since phenomena are mere imputations, these defining characteristics are also imputed and do not exist. This is the meaning.

original: mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni dus gsum du rtogs pa'i chos rnams dus gsum gyi bdag nyid du med pa gang yin pa de mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni dus gsum du rtogs pa'i chos rnams dus gsum gyi bdag nyid du med pa gang yin pa de mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: The emptiness of nonapprehension is that the phenomena that are realized in the three times do not exist in the nature of the three times.

original: mi dmigs pa de yang mi dmigs pa'i bdag nyid kyis stong gi /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa de yang mi dmigs pa'i bdag nyid kyis stong gi /
translated: That nonapprehension is empty of the nature of nonapprehension.

original: mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan du gyur pa ni gang la yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan du gyur pa ni gang la yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: There is no other phenomenon called “nonapprehension” that exists anywhere.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis su bshad de /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis su bshad de /
translated: The emptiness of the entities of nonthings is explained in two ways.

original: de la bshad pa snga ma ni /
analyzed: de la bshad pa snga ma ni /
translated: The first explanation is as follows.

original: rab 'byor 'dus pa las byung ba'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid med ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'dus pa las byung ba'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid med ces bya ba ste /
translated: Subhūti, the entities of phenomena that arise from a collection do not exist.

original: ji skad bstan par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad bstan par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is this taught?

original: 'di la chos thams cad skye ba na /
analyzed: 'di la chos thams cad skye ba na /
translated: Here, when all phenomena arise,

original: rang gi stobs 'ba' zhig gis @122b skye ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rang gi stobs 'ba' zhig gis @122b skye ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: they do not arise by their own power alone.

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyi stobs kyis skye ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyi stobs kyis skye ste /
translated: They arise by the power of causes and conditions.

original: dper na sa bon gyis myu gu skyed pa na rang gi mthu 'ba' zhig gis skyed pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dper na sa bon gyis myu gu skyed pa na rang gi mthu 'ba' zhig gis skyed pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: For example, when a seed produces a sprout, it does not produce it by its own power alone.🔽It is produced by the power of the collection of earth, water, etc.

original: sa dang chu la sogs pa 'dus pa'i mthus bskyed pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang rgyu dang / rkyen tshogs pa'i mthus skye'o //
analyzed: sa dang chu la sogs pa 'dus pa'i mthus bskyed pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang rgyu dang / rkyen tshogs pa'i mthus skye'o //
translated: In the same way, all dharmas are produced by the power of the collection of causes and conditions.

original: rang gi mthu 'ba' zhig gis skye ba ma yin pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba kho na'o //
analyzed: rang gi mthu 'ba' zhig gis skye ba ma yin pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba kho na'o //
translated: Because they are not produced by their own power alone, they are only dependent origination.

original: chos gzhan la brten te skye ba'i chos gang yin pa de dag ni gzugs su rung ba dang / myong ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: chos gzhan la brten te skye ba'i chos gang yin pa de dag ni gzugs su rung ba dang / myong ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin du zin kyang /
translated: Those dharmas that are produced in dependence on other dharmas, even though they have the nature of being capable of material form, experience, etc.,

original: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa nyid las skye bar 'gyur bas na 'dus pa las byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa nyid las skye bar 'gyur bas na 'dus pa las byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: are produced from the mere collection of causes and conditions. Therefore, they are called “produced from a collection.”

original: 'dus pa las byung ba gang yin pa de rang gi ngo bo nyid ces brjod par ji ltar nus /
analyzed: 'dus pa las byung ba gang yin pa de rang gi ngo bo nyid ces brjod par ji ltar nus /
translated: How can that which is produced from a collection be said to have its own nature?

original: de bas na chos thams cad gzhan gyi dngos pos skye ba'i phyir rang gi dngos po med pas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na chos thams cad gzhan gyi dngos pos skye ba'i phyir rang gi dngos po med pas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, all phenomena are devoid of intrinsic reality because they arise from the intrinsic reality of something else.

original: rang gi dngos po med pa nyid kyi phyir dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi dngos po med pa nyid kyi phyir dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Because they are devoid of intrinsic reality, they are said to be devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: de bas na rab 'byor 'dus pa las byung ba'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: de bas na rab 'byor 'dus pa las byung ba'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, the intrinsic reality of a phenomenon that arises from a collection does not exist.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so //🔽'di nyid chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so // 'di nyid chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Because it is dependently arisen.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This very absence of intrinsic reality of all phenomena is called the emptiness of the absence of intrinsic reality.

original: bshad pa cig shos ni /
analyzed: bshad pa cig shos ni /
translated: The other explanation is:

original: dngos po ni dngos pos stong ngo //
analyzed: dngos po ni dngos pos stong ngo //
translated: A thing is empty of a thing.

original: dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pas stong ngo zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pas stong ngo zhes bya ba ste /
translated: A non-thing is empty of a non-thing.

original: dngos po dang ngo bo nyid ni dngos po dang ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po dang ngo bo nyid ni dngos po dang ngo bo nyid do //
translated: A thing and intrinsic reality are a thing and intrinsic reality.

original: dngos po dang / ngo bo nyid med pa ni dngos po dang / ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po dang / ngo bo nyid med pa ni dngos po dang / ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
translated: The non-existence of an existent thing and the non-existence of an intrinsic nature are called the emptiness of non-existence and the emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: rnam par rtog pa 'di la dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dngos po yod pa ma yin par rtogs pas dngos po dang / dngos po med pa yang bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa 'di la dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dngos po yod pa ma yin par rtogs pas dngos po dang / dngos po med pa yang bzung ba yin no //
translated: In this regard, the word “non-existence” refers to the non-existence of an existent thing and the existence of a non-existent thing.

original: ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rang gi dngos po ma yin par rtogs pas gzhan gyi dngos po dang / rang gi dngos po yang bzung ba yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rang gi dngos po ma yin par rtogs pas gzhan gyi dngos po dang / rang gi dngos po yang bzung ba yin te /
translated: The word “intrinsic nature” refers to the non-existence of an intrinsic nature and the existence of an extrinsic nature and an intrinsic nature.

original: stong pa bzhi po de dag la dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa bzhi po de dag la dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: These four kinds of emptiness are called the emptiness of non-existence and the existence of an intrinsic nature.

original: de las byung bas na /
analyzed: de las byung bas na /
translated: Because they arise from that,

original: dngos po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po zhes bya ste /
translated: they are called “things.”

original: dngos po zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dus byas kyi chos rnams la bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dus byas kyi chos rnams la bya'o //
translated: The word “thing” refers to conditioned things.

original: de'i phyir dngos po ni dngos pos stong ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po ni dngos pos stong ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that “a thing is empty of a thing.”

original: dngos po med pa'i sgras ni @123a * //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i sgras ni @123a * //
translated: The word “non-existence” refers to

original: 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams la bya ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams la bya ste /
translated: and unconditioned phenomena.

original: de'i phyir dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pas stong ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pas stong ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that “non-entityness is empty of non-entityness.”🔽In this regard, the meaning of “the entityness of entities is absent” is that the entityness of entities is devoid of itself.

original: de la dngos po'i chos ni dngos po'i bdag nyid dang bral ba dang / dngos po med pa'i chos kyang dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la dngos po'i chos ni dngos po'i bdag nyid dang bral ba dang / dngos po med pa'i chos kyang dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of “the non-entityness of non-entities is absent” is that the non-entityness of non-entities is devoid of itself.

original: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni shes pa dang mthong ba ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni shes pa dang mthong ba ste /
translated: “ Nature” means knowledge and seeing.

original: chos rnams kyi kun brtags pa'i gnas skabs yongs su spangs pa'i lhag ma yongs su grub pa'i gnas skabs ni shes pa dang mthong ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi kun brtags pa'i gnas skabs yongs su spangs pa'i lhag ma yongs su grub pa'i gnas skabs ni shes pa dang mthong ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The remainder of the perfected nature, which is the relinquishment of the imagined nature of phenomena, is said to be the nature of knowledge and seeing.

original: de la shes pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni shes pas ma byas la /
analyzed: de la shes pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni shes pas ma byas la /
translated: The emptiness of that knowledge is not made by knowledge.

original: mthong ba'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de yang mthong bsam byas te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de yang mthong bsam byas te /
translated: The emptiness of that seeing is not made by seeing.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: ngo bo nyid de gnyis kyi stong pa nyid ni rang bzhin yin pas ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid de gnyis kyi stong pa nyid ni rang bzhin yin pas ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The emptiness of those two natures is their intrinsic reality, and so it is called the emptiness of intrinsic reality.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /🔽ma byung rung ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung / ma byung rung ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Whether the Tathagatas arise or not,🔽the reality nature of things,

original: gnas pa'i mtshan nyid de bzhin nyid chos nyid gang yin pa de /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa pha rol gzhan gyis byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas pa'i mtshan nyid de bzhin nyid chos nyid gang yin pa de / de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa pha rol gzhan gyis byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: the suchness that is the characteristic of abiding,🔽is not made by the Tathagatas or anyone else.

original: byed pa po gzhan med la /
analyzed: byed pa po gzhan med la /
translated: Therefore, there is no other creator, and

original: gzhan gyi dngos po stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: this is called the emptiness of other.

original: de nas yang ting nge 'dzin gyi theg pa chen po'i gnas skabs dbye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nas yang ting nge 'dzin gyi theg pa chen po'i gnas skabs dbye ba'i phyir /
translated: Then, in order to classify the stages of the Great Vehicle of meditative stabilization,

original: dpa' bar 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: dpa' bar 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he spoke of the meditative stabilization called “heroic stride,” and so on.

original: dpa' bo bzhin du ting nge 'dzin gyi bya ba byed pa dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi spyod yul nyams su myong bar byed pa dang / thams cad du khyab par byed pa gang yin pa de la dpa' bar 'gro ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dpa' bo bzhin du ting nge 'dzin gyi bya ba byed pa dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi spyod yul nyams su myong bar byed pa dang / thams cad du khyab par byed pa gang yin pa de la dpa' bar 'gro ba zhes bya ste /
