translated: It is called the hero's progress because it performs the functions of concentration like a hero and it experiences the domain of all concentrations and it pervades all.🔽In this regard, the nonconceptual, uncontaminated, supramundane mind of the buddhas and bodhisattvas is called concentration because it does not perform the functions of conceptual thought and it is primarily undistracted.🔽Moreover, that concentration is not the essence of the meditative development of the transcendent perfect prajñā, because it is not the antidote for the obscurations of the mental afflictions.🔽Nor is that concentration the essence of the meditative development of the transcendent perfect prajñā, because it is not the antidote for the obscurations of the knowable.🔽Nor is that concentration the essence of the meditative development of the transcendent perfect prajñā, because it is not the antidote for the obscurations of the mental afflictions.

original: 'di la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par mi rtog pa zag pa med pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'i bya ba mi byed pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba med pa gtso bor byed pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par mi rtog pa zag pa med pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'i bya ba mi byed pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba med pa gtso bor byed pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: Nor is that concentration the essence of the meditative development of the transcendent perfect prajñā, because it is not the antidote for the obscurations of the knowable.

original: ting nge 'dzin de yang bsam gtan gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin te /🔽bsam gtan ni gzugs yod pa na spyod par gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de yang bsam gtan gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin te / bsam gtan ni gzugs yod pa na spyod par gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is that concentration the essence of the meditative development of the transcendent perfect prajñā, because it is not the antidote for the obscurations of the mental afflictions.🔽Nor is that concentration the essence of the meditative development of the transcendent perfect prajñā, because it is not the antidote for the obscurations of the knowable.

original: sems kyi bdag nyid du gcig tu zin kyang sngon gyi brtsal ba'i mthus so sor byed pa phan @123b pas na /
analyzed: sems kyi bdag nyid du gcig tu zin kyang sngon gyi brtsal ba'i mthus so sor byed pa phan @123b pas na /
translated: Nor is that concentration the essence of the meditative development of the transcendent perfect prajñā, because it is not the antidote for the obscurations of the mental afflictions.🔽Nor is that concentration the essence of the meditative development of the transcendent perfect prajñā, because it is not the antidote for the obscurations of the knowable.🔽Nor is that concentration the essence of the meditative development of the transcendent perfect prajñā, because it is not the antidote for the obscurations of the mental afflictions.🔽Nor is that concentration the essence of the meditative development of the transcendent perfect prajñā, because it is not the antidote for the obscurations of the knowable.🔽Nor is that concentration the essence of the meditative development of the transcendent perfect prajñā, because it is not the antidote for the obscurations of the mental afflictions.🔽Nor is that concentration the essence of the meditative development of the transcendent perfect prajñā, because it is not the antidote for the obscurations of the knowable.🔽Nor is that

original: bya ba byed pa'i dbang gis tha dad du brjod do //
analyzed: bya ba byed pa'i dbang gis tha dad du brjod do //
translated: They are distinguished by the power of their activity.

original: de yang gzhan dag gis rtog pa'i spyod yul du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang gzhan dag gis rtog pa'i spyod yul du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, they are not the domain of speculation by others,

original: so sor rang gis rig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor rang gis rig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the self-experience of each one.

original: de dag kyang mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du gzung bar bya ste /
translated: They should be accepted just as they are stated in the scriptures.

original: de la rigs pas dpyad par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la rigs pas dpyad par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not to be examined by reasoning.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di lta ste /🔽dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba ni 'di la dran pa nye bar gnas pas na /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di lta ste / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba ni 'di la dran pa nye bar gnas pas na /
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, the Mahayana of the bodhisattva, the great being, is as follows:🔽The four applications of mindfulness.🔽Here, because of the presence of mindfulness,

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: the four applications of mindfulness are explained.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang chos zhes bya ba dang bzhi la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i sgrar brjod do //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang chos zhes bya ba dang bzhi la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i sgrar brjod do //
translated: The four applications of mindfulness are called the applications of mindfulness to the body, feelings, mind, and dharmas.🔽They are mindfulness

original: de ni dran pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de ni dran pa yang yin la /
translated: and

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o zhes bshad pa'i phyir chos bzhi'i yul ma brjed pa dang / bsrung ba'i don du dran pa'i bzhi ste /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o zhes bshad pa'i phyir chos bzhi'i yul ma brjed pa dang / bsrung ba'i don du dran pa'i bzhi ste /
translated: Since they are foundations of mindfulness, they are mindfulness foundations.

original: dmigs pa bzhir gyur pa'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa bzhir gyur pa'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called the four foundations of mindfulness because they are the four objects of mindfulness.

original: 'di la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa 'di bzhi char theg pa chen po'i tshul du ni sngar bstan to //
analyzed: 'di la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa 'di bzhi char theg pa chen po'i tshul du ni sngar bstan to //
translated: The four foundations of mindfulness have already been taught as the method of the Great Vehicle.

original: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gcig pu ni phyis nyan thos kyi tshul dang mthun par rnam pa drug tu bstan te /
analyzed: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gcig pu ni phyis nyan thos kyi tshul dang mthun par rnam pa drug tu bstan te /
translated: The foundation of mindfulness of the body alone is later taught in six aspects in accordance with the method of the Sravakas.

original: nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe nang gi sems can du bgrangs pa'i lus kyi rjes su lta ba de'i tshe na /
analyzed: nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe nang gi sems can du bgrangs pa'i lus kyi rjes su lta ba de'i tshe na /
translated: The statement, “One observes the internal body and abides in that observation” means that when one observes the internal body, which is counted as a sentient being, then it is called “observing the internal body.”🔽When one observes the external body, which is not counted as a sentient being, then it is called “observing the external body.”

original: nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba zhes bya'o //🔽gang gi tshe phyi rol sems can du mi bgrang ba /
analyzed: nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba zhes bya'o //🔽gang gi tshe phyi rol sems can du mi bgrang ba /
translated: When one observes the internal and external body, then it is called “observing the internal and external body.”

original: gzugs kyi lus kyi rjes su lta ba de'i tshe ni phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi lus kyi rjes su lta ba de'i tshe ni phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When he observes the body of form, then it is called “observing the external body.”

original: gang gi tshe phyi'i sems can du bgrang ba /
analyzed: gang gi tshe phyi'i sems can du bgrang ba /
translated: When he observes the body of another sentient being,

original: gzhan gyi lus kyi rjes su lta ba de'i tshe na nang dang phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lus kyi rjes su lta ba de'i tshe na nang dang phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: then it is called “observing the internal and external body.”

original: gang gi tshe nang gi sems can du bgrang ba'i gzugs la dmigs nas tshor ba dang sems dang / chos rnams 'byung ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nang gi sems can du bgrang ba'i gzugs la dmigs nas tshor ba dang sems dang / chos rnams 'byung ba de'i tshe /
translated: When he observes the form of a sentient being, and feelings, mind, and dharmas arise,

original: nang gi tshor ba dang / nang gi sems dang / nang gi chos rnams la bya'o //
analyzed: nang gi tshor ba dang / nang gi sems dang / nang gi chos rnams la bya'o //
translated: then it is called “observing internal feelings, mind, and dharmas.”🔽When he observes the form of a non-sentient being, and feelings, mind, and dharmas arise,

original: gang gi tshe phyi rol sems can du mi bgrang ba'i gzugs la dmigs pa las 'byung ba de'i tshe na phyi'i tshor ba dang / phyi'i sems dang / phyi'i chos rnams la zhes bya'o //🔽gang gi tshe @124a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe phyi rol sems can du mi bgrang ba'i gzugs la dmigs pa las 'byung ba de'i tshe na phyi'i tshor ba dang / phyi'i sems dang / phyi'i chos rnams la zhes bya'o //🔽gang gi tshe @124a * //
translated: then it is called “observing external feelings, mind, and dharmas.”🔽When he observes the form of a sentient being and a non-sentient being, and feelings, mind, and dharmas arise,🔽then it is called “observing internal and external feelings, mind, and dharmas.”

original: sems can du bgrang ba gzhan gyi gzugs la dmigs pa las byung ba de'i tshe na phyi nang gi tshor ba dang / phyi nang gi sems dang / phyi nang gi chos rnams la zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can du bgrang ba gzhan gyi gzugs la dmigs pa las byung ba de'i tshe na phyi nang gi tshor ba dang / phyi nang gi sems dang / phyi nang gi chos rnams la zhes bya'o //
translated: When it arises from the observation of another’s form, which is not counted as a sentient being, then it is called the observation of internal and external feelings, the observation of internal and external mind, and the observation of internal and external dharmas.

original: yang na skye mched drug la dmigs par byed pa la ni nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na skye mched drug la dmigs par byed pa la ni nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or, when it is directed to the six sense bases, the observation of the internal body is called the observation of the internal body.

original: dbang por ma gtogs shing ma zin pa phyi'i gzugs la dmigs par byed pa de la ni phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang por ma gtogs shing ma zin pa phyi'i gzugs la dmigs par byed pa de la ni phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When it is directed to external form, which is not included in the sense bases and is not grasped, it is called the observation of the external body.

original: skye mched drug ma gtogs par nang gi zin pa'i gzugs la dmigs par byed pa la ni phyi dang nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched drug ma gtogs par nang gi zin pa'i gzugs la dmigs par byed pa la ni phyi dang nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When it is directed to internal grasped form, which is not included in the six sense bases, it is called the observation of the internal and external body.

original: gzugs de gsum la dmigs pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos rnams kyang rnam pa gsum du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs de gsum la dmigs pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos rnams kyang rnam pa gsum du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The feelings, mind, and dharmas that arise from the observation of those three kinds of form should be understood in three ways.

original: yang na nang gi 'byung ba'i gzugs rang gi lus su gtogs pa la dmigs par byed pa la ni nang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na nang gi 'byung ba'i gzugs rang gi lus su gtogs pa la dmigs par byed pa la ni nang zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, when one observes the form of the internal elements that is included in one’s own body, it is called “internal.”

original: phyi'i gzhan gyi 'byung ba la dmigs par byed pa la ni phyi'i zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyi'i gzhan gyi 'byung ba la dmigs par byed pa la ni phyi'i zhes bya'o //
translated: When one observes the form of the external elements that is not included in one’s own body, it is called “external.”

original: 'byung ba'i gzugs de yang rgyur byas nas 'byung ba'i dbang po dang / yul gyi gzugs gang yin pa de la dmigs par byed pa de la ni phyi nang gi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i gzugs de yang rgyur byas nas 'byung ba'i dbang po dang / yul gyi gzugs gang yin pa de la dmigs par byed pa de la ni phyi nang gi zhes bya'o //
translated: When one observes the form of the elements that is derived from the primary elements and is the object of the internal sense faculties, it is called “both internal and external.”

original: 'di gsum la dmigs pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos rnams la yang rnam pa gsum du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di gsum la dmigs pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos rnams la yang rnam pa gsum du rig par bya'o //
translated: The feelings, mind, and mental qualities that arise from observing these three are also to be understood as being of three kinds.

original: yang na gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba de'i tshe na nang gi lus dang / tshor ba dang sems dang chos kyi rjes su lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba de'i tshe na nang gi lus dang / tshor ba dang sems dang chos kyi rjes su lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, when one observes the internal body that is associated with consciousness, it is called “observing the body in the body.”

original: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa med pa rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa la rjes su lta ba de'i tshe na phyi'i lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos kyi rjes su lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa med pa rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa la rjes su lta ba de'i tshe na phyi'i lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos kyi rjes su lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When one observes the blue-black putridity of the body without consciousness, this is called “observing the external body.”

original: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa med pa'i rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa'i gzugs 'das pa'i dus na rnam par shes pa dang / bcas pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa med pa'i rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa'i gzugs 'das pa'i dus na rnam par shes pa dang / bcas pa ste /
translated: When one observes the blue-black putridity of the body without consciousness in the past, and the present body with consciousness, and the future body without consciousness,🔽this is called “observing the internal and external body.”

original: rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus 'di yang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na rnam par shes pa med par mtshungs pa'i chos nyid dang mthun pa'i chos nyid du rjes su lta ba de'i tshe na phyi nang gi lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus 'di yang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na rnam par shes pa med par mtshungs pa'i chos nyid dang mthun pa'i chos nyid du rjes su lta ba de'i tshe na phyi nang gi lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang /
translated: When one observes the blue-black putridity of the body without consciousness, and the present body with consciousness, and the future body without consciousness,

original: chos kyi rjes su lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: this is called “observing the internal and external body.”

original: nang @124b gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba zhes bya ba ni nang gi lus la lus zhes brtags pa yin par rjes su brtags nas lta zhing gnas pa ste /
analyzed: nang @124b gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba zhes bya ba ni nang gi lus la lus zhes brtags pa yin par rjes su brtags nas lta zhing gnas pa ste /
translated: The phrase observing the internal body as a body means that one observes and abides in the thought that the internal body is a body.

original: gang zag yod pa nyid dam /
analyzed: gang zag yod pa nyid dam /
translated: One does not see the existence of a person or🔽the existence of a dharma.

original: chos yod pa nyid du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas mi dmigs par gnas pas gnas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos yod pa nyid du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas mi dmigs par gnas pas gnas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the phrase one abides in the absence of perception is that one abides in the absence of perception.

original: mi dmigs par gnas pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /🔽lus dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams la rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: mi dmigs par gnas pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir / lus dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams la rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that very absence of perception,🔽it is said, One does not conceive of the conceptions that are associated with the body.

original: lus su 'du shes pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa 'di ni lus so zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: lus su 'du shes pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa 'di ni lus so zhes bya ba'am /
translated: The conceptions that are associated with the notion of a body are the conceptions that think, This is a body.

original: rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba dang / sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / bdag dang / bdag med pa dang / stong pa dang / mi stong pa dang / mtshan ma dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /🔽smon pa dang / smon pa med pa la sogs pa de dag tu rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba dang / sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / bdag dang / bdag med pa dang / stong pa dang / mi stong pa dang / mtshan ma dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa dang / smon pa med pa la sogs pa de dag tu rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He does not conceptualize them as permanent or impermanent, as happy or not happy, as a self or not a self, as empty or not empty, as with signs or signless, as having wishes or as wishless.🔽This is what is meant by “he does not conceptualize them.”

original: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni de yang de la rjes su lta ba dang / rnam par mi rtog pa ni mi dmigs par yod la byed pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni de yang de la rjes su lta ba dang / rnam par mi rtog pa ni mi dmigs par yod la byed pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “He does not conceptualize them by way of not apprehending them” means that he does not apprehend them as being there in the way that they are seen, and that he does not conceptualize them by way of the power of his actions.

original: brtun pa can shes bzhin dang / dran pa dang ldan zhing 'jig rten gyi brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brtun pa can shes bzhin dang / dran pa dang ldan zhing 'jig rten gyi brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas zhes bya ba la /
translated: “He is energetic, mindful, and has a clear perception of his body and mind. He has eliminated worldly covetousness and unhappiness.”

original: rgyun du sbyor ba dang / gus par sbyor bas yang dag par mngon par brtson pa'i phyir brtun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun du sbyor ba dang / gus par sbyor bas yang dag par mngon par brtson pa'i phyir brtun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “diligence” because it is applied continuously and with respect, and because it is applied with perfect effort.

original: rjes su lta ba'i shes rab dang / shes bzhin gyis yang dag par yid la byed pa'i phyir shes bzhin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su lta ba'i shes rab dang / shes bzhin gyis yang dag par yid la byed pa'i phyir shes bzhin zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “awareness” because it is the perfect mental attention of the wisdom of subsequent insight and of introspection.

original: mi brjed pa'i bdag nyid dang / srung bar byed pa dang / g-yeng ba med par byed pa'i dran pa dang bcas pa la dran pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi brjed pa'i bdag nyid dang / srung bar byed pa dang / g-yeng ba med par byed pa'i dran pa dang bcas pa la dran pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “mindfulness” because it is associated with mindfulness that has the nature of non-forgetting, that protects the mind, and that prevents distraction.

original: de'i 'og tu brtson 'grus dang / shes rab dang / dran pa de dag gi phan yon bstan pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu brtson 'grus dang / shes rab dang / dran pa de dag gi phan yon bstan pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate the benefits of that diligence, wisdom, and mindfulness, he says, “having eliminated worldly covetousness and depression.”

original: 'jig rten gyi chos zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi chos rnams la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi chos rnams la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: “Worldly dharmas” means the dharmas of the world.

original: rnyed pa dang grags pa dang / bde ba dang / bstod pa zhes bya ba 'jig rten gyi chos bzhi la ni chags sems 'byung ngo //🔽ma rnyed pa @125a * //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang grags pa dang / bde ba dang / bstod pa zhes bya ba 'jig rten gyi chos bzhi la ni chags sems 'byung ngo // ma rnyed pa @125a * //
translated: The four worldly distresses are called loss,

original: dang / ma grags pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / smad pa rnams la ni yid mi bde ba zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: dang / ma grags pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / smad pa rnams la ni yid mi bde ba zhes 'byung ste /
translated: disrepute, pain, and blame.

original: de ltar mi dmigs par bsgom pa la brtson pa ni 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad kyis mi gos par bstan pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar mi dmigs par bsgom pa la brtson pa ni 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad kyis mi gos par bstan pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The phrase “having eliminated worldly covetousness and depression” is stated to show that one who strives to cultivate nonapprehension is unstained by any worldly concerns.

original: yang na gang zag dang / chos rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir sems can rnams dang / 'du byed rnams la rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba spangs par bstan pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: yang na gang zag dang / chos rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir sems can rnams dang / 'du byed rnams la rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba spangs par bstan pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Alternatively, the phrase “having eliminated worldly covetousness and depression” is stated to show that one abandons attachment and hostility toward sentient beings and conditioned things, respectively, because one does not apprehend either persons or things.

original: yang na sgrib pa thams cad kyi nang na gtso bor gyur pa 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems gnyis spangs par bstan pa'i sgrib pa thams cad kyang spangs par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na sgrib pa thams cad kyi nang na gtso bor gyur pa 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems gnyis spangs par bstan pa'i sgrib pa thams cad kyang spangs par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Or else, it shows that all obscurations are abandoned by abandoning the two principal ones among all obscurations, namely, sensual desire and malice.

original: de bzhin du nang gi tshor ba rnams la tshor ba'i rjes su lta zhing zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang gis tshor ba rnam pa gsum du gyur pa las lus kyi tshor ba dang / sems kyi tshor ba'i dbang gis drug tu gyur pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du nang gi tshor ba rnams la tshor ba'i rjes su lta zhing zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang gis tshor ba rnam pa gsum du gyur pa las lus kyi tshor ba dang / sems kyi tshor ba'i dbang gis drug tu gyur pa dang /
translated: Similarly, “he watches feelings among inner feelings” means that, from among the three kinds of feelings that arise from the experience of pleasure, pain, and indifference, he distinguishes the six kinds of feelings that arise from bodily and mental feelings.🔽He distinguishes feelings that are worldly and unworldly, those that are based on attachment and those that are based on renunciation, and so on.

original: zang zing dang bcas pa dang / zang zing med pa dang / zhen pa la brten pa dang / mngon par 'byung ba la brten pa rnams zhes bya bar tha dad du phye ba'i tshor ba rnams la tshor bar brtags pa bzung nas /
analyzed: zang zing dang bcas pa dang / zang zing med pa dang / zhen pa la brten pa dang / mngon par 'byung ba la brten pa rnams zhes bya bar tha dad du phye ba'i tshor ba rnams la tshor bar brtags pa bzung nas /
translated: He watches feelings by apprehending the concept of feeling.

original: tshor ba po bdag gam /
analyzed: tshor ba po bdag gam /
translated: Is the self the feeler?

original: chos yin par brten pa la bltas nas mi dmigs par gnas pas gnas so//🔽de bzhin du sems la yang 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags med pa dang / zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / bsdus pa dang /🔽rnam par 'phros pa zhes bya ba la sogs par dbye bas phye ba'i sems la brten nas bdag gam chos mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rjes su lta zhing gnas so //
analyzed: chos yin par brten pa la bltas nas mi dmigs par gnas pas gnas so// de bzhin du sems la yang 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags med pa dang / zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / bsdus pa dang / rnam par 'phros pa zhes bya ba la sogs par dbye bas phye ba'i sems la brten nas bdag gam chos mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rjes su lta zhing gnas so //
translated: He abides in the observation of the non-apprehension of a self or a being in dependence on the mind, and likewise, in dependence on the mind that is associated with passion, without passion, associated with hatred, without hatred, associated with delusion, without delusion, contracted, or excited, he abides in the observation of the non-apprehension of a self or a being in the differentiation of the mind by way of the differentiation of the mind as “associated with passion” and so on.

original: chos rnams la yang phung po dang khams dang / skye mched dang / sgrib pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams la @125b brten nas kun brtags pa'i chos thams cad mi dmigs par snyoms par 'jug pa la bsgom zhing gnas so zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos rnams la yang phung po dang khams dang / skye mched dang / sgrib pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams la @125b brten nas kun brtags pa'i chos thams cad mi dmigs par snyoms par 'jug pa la bsgom zhing gnas so zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: He abides in the observation of the non-apprehension of a self or a being in dependence on the aggregates, elements, sense bases, obscurations, limbs of enlightenment, noble truths, and so on. He abides in the cultivation of the meditative absorption of the non-apprehension of all imagined phenomena.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa'i tshul du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa'i tshul du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the four establishments of mindfulness in the manner of the Bodhisattva Vehicle,

original: nyan thos kyi tshul du bstan pa'i tshul gyis lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nyid rnam pa drug tu bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi tshul du bstan pa'i tshul gyis lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nyid rnam pa drug tu bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: in order to teach the establishment of mindfulness of the body alone in six aspects in the manner of teaching in the Śrāvaka Vehicle,

original: de'i nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na /
analyzed: de'i nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na /
translated: he said, “When he is internally observing the body as body,

original: spyod na spyod do zhes bya bar rab tu shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: spyod na spyod do zhes bya bar rab tu shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he is fully aware that he is walking when he is walking.”

original: spyod lam gyi sgo dang / shes bzhin gyi sgo dang / dbugs rdub pa dang 'byung ba'i sgo dang / khams rnams rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo dang / rnam pa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi sgo dang / mi sdug pa'i sgo dang / sgo drug po dag gis bstan to //
analyzed: spyod lam gyi sgo dang / shes bzhin gyi sgo dang / dbugs rdub pa dang 'byung ba'i sgo dang / khams rnams rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo dang / rnam pa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi sgo dang / mi sdug pa'i sgo dang / sgo drug po dag gis bstan to //
translated: This is taught by means of six doors: the door of the modes of conduct, the door of introspection, the door of inhalation and exhalation, the door of the arrangement of the elements, the door of the thirty-two aspects, the door of foulness, and the door of the four truths.

original: de la dang por spyod lam gyi sgo nas bstan pa ni spyod pa dang / 'greng ba dang 'dug pa dang nyal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la dang por spyod lam gyi sgo nas bstan pa ni spyod pa dang / 'greng ba dang 'dug pa dang nyal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, the teaching by means of the door of the modes of conduct is called “the modes of conduct, standing, sitting, and lying down.”

original: spyod lam 'di dag la rnam pa gsum bstan te /
analyzed: spyod lam 'di dag la rnam pa gsum bstan te /
translated: These modes of conduct are taught to be of three types:

original: chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu'o //
analyzed: chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu'o //
translated: great, medium, and small.

original: gang gi tshe lam ring por 'gro ba de'i tshe spyod lam bzhi ni che ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe lam ring por 'gro ba de'i tshe spyod lam bzhi ni che ba zhes bya ste /
translated: When one travels a long distance, the four modes of conduct are great,

original: de'i dbang gis 'gres dang po bstan to //🔽gang gi tshe bsod snyoms kyi phyir grong du 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis 'gres dang po bstan to // gang gi tshe bsod snyoms kyi phyir grong du 'jug pa'am /
translated: because of which the first verse is stated.

original: gtsug lag khang nas gtsug lag khang gzhan dag tu don gnyer du 'gro ba de'i tshe spyod pa'i spyod lam bzhi ni 'bring po ste /🔽de'i dbang gis de'i dbang du 'gro'am /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang nas gtsug lag khang gzhan dag tu don gnyer du 'gro ba de'i tshe spyod pa'i spyod lam bzhi ni 'bring po ste / de'i dbang gis de'i dbang du 'gro'am /
translated: When one enters a village for alms or goes to another temple for a specific purpose, the four modes of conduct are medium,

original: 'ong yang shes bzhin du spyod pa yin zhes bya bas ni gnyis pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'ong yang shes bzhin du spyod pa yin zhes bya bas ni gnyis pa bstan to //
translated: because of which the second verse is stated.

original: lus kyi nyam nga ba bsal ba'i phyir bshang gci la sogs pa'i gnas su 'gro ba la sogs par spyod pa'i spyod lam bzhi ni chung ngu ste /
analyzed: lus kyi nyam nga ba bsal ba'i phyir bshang gci la sogs pa'i gnas su 'gro ba la sogs par spyod pa'i spyod lam bzhi ni chung ngu ste /
translated: When one goes to a place for defecating, urinating, and so on in order to relieve physical distress, the four modes of conduct are small,🔽because of which the third verse is stated.

original: de'i dbang gis 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: By its power, going, standing, sitting, and lying down are taught.

original: lhag ma kun tu lta'am /
analyzed: lhag ma kun tu lta'am /
translated: The rest, looking all around,

original: rnam par lta yang shes bzhin spyod pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas chung du nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par lta yang shes bzhin spyod pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas chung du nyid do //
translated: looking in all directions, and so on, are the lesser.

original: de la bya ba byed pa thams cad la yang so sor rtog pa rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de la bya ba byed pa thams cad la yang so sor rtog pa rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Among them, there are five aspects of discernment in all activities:

original: 'di dang 'di bya'o zhes bya ba dang / 'di ni bya'o 'di ni mi bya'o zhes bya ba dang / 'di ni dus yin no 'di ni dus ma yin no zhes bya ba dang / 'di ltar ni bya'o @126a * //
analyzed: 'di dang 'di bya'o zhes bya ba dang / 'di ni bya'o 'di ni mi bya'o zhes bya ba dang / 'di ni dus yin no 'di ni dus ma yin no zhes bya ba dang / 'di ltar ni bya'o @126a * //
translated: This and this should be done, This should be done, this should not be done, This is the time, this is not the time, In this way it should be done,

original: 'di ltar mi bya'o zhes bya ba de'i don du bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi bya'o zhes bya ba de'i don du bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In this way it should not be done, and For this purpose it should be done.

original: de yang spyod na spyod do zhes bya bar rab tu shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad do //
analyzed: de yang spyod na spyod do zhes bya bar rab tu shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad do //
translated: And that is explained by If he engages in that, he fully knows 'I am engaging in that.'

original: de'i 'og tu spyod lam chung ngu'i 'gres la 'gro zhes bya ba ni phar la 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu spyod lam chung ngu'i 'gres la 'gro zhes bya ba ni phar la 'gro ba'o //
translated: After that, in the lesser conduct, going means going forward.

original: 'ong zhes bya ba ni slar log pa'o //
analyzed: 'ong zhes bya ba ni slar log pa'o //
translated: “To come” means to return.

original: blo sngon du ma btang bas ma brtags par gzugs la lta ba ni kun tu lta ba'o //
analyzed: blo sngon du ma btang bas ma brtags par gzugs la lta ba ni kun tu lta ba'o //
translated: “To look around” means to look at forms without mental attention, without examination.

original: blo sngon du btang bas bsgrims te gzugs la lta ba ni rnam par lta ba'o //
analyzed: blo sngon du btang bas bsgrims te gzugs la lta ba ni rnam par lta ba'o //
translated: “To look around” means to look at forms with mental attention, with examination.

original: yang na mdun du lta ba ni kun tu lta ba'o //
analyzed: yang na mdun du lta ba ni kun tu lta ba'o //
translated: Or else, “to look around” means to look in front of oneself.

original: phyogs gzhan du lta ba ni rnam par lta ba'o //🔽dpung pa dang / lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / yan lag dang / nying lag rnams bya ba de dang de dag la bsdus pa ni bskum pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs gzhan du lta ba ni rnam par lta ba'o // dpung pa dang / lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / yan lag dang / nying lag rnams bya ba de dang de dag la bsdus pa ni bskum pa'o //
translated: “To look around” means to look in other directions.🔽“To contract” means to draw in the arms, legs, and other limbs and minor appendages in order to perform some action.

original: bsrang ba ni brkyang ba'o //
analyzed: bsrang ba ni brkyang ba'o //
translated: “To extend” means to stretch out the arms, legs, and other limbs and minor appendages.

original: chos gos chen po ni snam sbyar ro //🔽de las gzhan pa'i gos ni chos gos so //
analyzed: chos gos chen po ni snam sbyar ro // de las gzhan pa'i gos ni chos gos so //
translated: “Outer robe” means a large piece of cloth.🔽“Lower robe” means a piece of cloth worn below.

original: bslang ba'i snod ni lhung bzed do //🔽zos pa ni 'bras chan la sogs pa'o //🔽'thungs pa ni btung ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bslang ba'i snod ni lhung bzed do // zos pa ni 'bras chan la sogs pa'o // 'thungs pa ni btung ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Alms bowl” means a begging bowl.🔽“Food” means boiled rice, etc.🔽“Drink” means water, etc.

original: 'chos pa ni khur ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'chos pa ni khur ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Chewable” means hard food, etc.

original: myangs pa ni 'o ma dang / zho dang bu ram la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: myangs pa ni 'o ma dang / zho dang bu ram la sogs pa'o //
translated: Tasting is milk, curd, molasses, and so on.

original: lam du 'gro ba la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: lam du 'gro ba la sogs pa'am /
translated: Walking is walking on a path, and so on.

original: tsha bas gdungs pa la sogs pas dus ma yin pa'i gnyid kyis non pa la phyogs su lta ba dang chus gdab pa dang / gdong phyi ba la sogs pa ni gtsang ba'o //
analyzed: tsha bas gdungs pa la sogs pas dus ma yin pa'i gnyid kyis non pa la phyogs su lta ba dang chus gdab pa dang / gdong phyi ba la sogs pa ni gtsang ba'o //
translated: Looking at the directions, sprinkling with water, wiping the face, and so on, when overcome by untimely sleep due to walking on a path, and so on, or being tormented by heat, and so on, is pure.

original: bcag pa la sogs pa ni 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: bcag pa la sogs pa ni 'gro ba'o //
translated: Breaking and so on is going.

original: bla ma la bsnyen bkur bya ba la sogs pa ni 'greng ba'o //
analyzed: bla ma la bsnyen bkur bya ba la sogs pa ni 'greng ba'o //
translated: Serving the guru, and so on, is standing.

original: skyil mo krung la sogs pa ni 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: skyil mo krung la sogs pa ni 'dug pa'o //
translated: Sitting cross-legged, and so on, is sitting.

original: dus su seng ge'i nyal thabs su nyal ba ni nyal ba'o //
analyzed: dus su seng ge'i nyal thabs su nyal ba ni nyal ba'o //
translated: Sleeping at the proper time in the lion's posture is lying down.

original: mel tse thun lnga ni gnyid kyis ma log pa'o //🔽chos 'chad pa'i yang dag pa'i gtam la sogs pa ni smra ba'o //
analyzed: mel tse thun lnga ni gnyid kyis ma log pa'o // chos 'chad pa'i yang dag pa'i gtam la sogs pa ni smra ba'o //
translated: Not falling asleep in the five periods of the night is not sleeping.🔽Explaining the Dharma, and so on, is speaking.

original: ji ltar thos shing bzung ba'i chos rnams kyi don sems shing 'jal ba la sogs pa ni mi smra ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar thos shing bzung ba'i chos rnams kyi don sems shing 'jal ba la sogs pa ni mi smra ba'o //
translated: Contemplating, measuring, and so on, the meaning of the Dharmas one has heard and retained is not speaking.

original: lhag mthong dang zhi gnas la mngon par brtson pa ni nang du yang dag par 'jog ces bya'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong dang zhi gnas la mngon par brtson pa ni nang du yang dag par 'jog ces bya'o //
translated: The one who is intent on insight and serenity is said to settle inwardly in correct samādhi.

original: dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba'i sgo gsum la dran bzhin du dbugs rngubs na dran bzhin du dbugs rngubs na dran bzhin du dbugs rubs so snyam du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni dran @126b pa dang /
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba'i sgo gsum la dran bzhin du dbugs rngubs na dran bzhin du dbugs rngubs na dran bzhin du dbugs rubs so snyam du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni dran @126b pa dang /
translated: When he breathes in a long breath, he knows as it really is: I am breathing in a long breath. When he breathes out a long breath, he knows as it really is: I am breathing out a long breath. When he breathes in a short breath, he knows as it really is: I am breathing in a short breath. When he breathes out a short breath, he knows as it really is: I am breathing out a short breath.

original: shes bzhin gtso bor byas te /
analyzed: shes bzhin gtso bor byas te /
translated: This is the mindfulness and the awareness that are primary.

original: legs par nan tan du dbugs rngubs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: legs par nan tan du dbugs rngubs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means he is intent on breathing in and out.🔽 When he breathes in a long breath, he knows: I am breathing in a long breath. When he breathes out a long breath, he knows: I am breathing out a long breath. When he breathes in a short breath, he knows: I am breathing in a short breath. When he breathes out a short breath, he knows: I am breathing out a short breath.

original: dbugs ring du rngubs na dbugs ring du rngubs so snyam du zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe las dang po pa 'di dran pa dang / shes bzhin du dran pa la brtson par byed pa na de'i lus dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa na dbugs rngub pa dang /
analyzed: dbugs ring du rngubs na dbugs ring du rngubs so snyam du zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe las dang po pa 'di dran pa dang / shes bzhin du dran pa la brtson par byed pa na de'i lus dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa na dbugs rngub pa dang /
translated: When he is a beginner, he is intent on the mindfulness and awareness of this sort. When his body and mind are very relaxed, his in-breaths and out-breaths are long.

original: 'byung ba dag rim gyis phra bar gyur cing rtogs par dka' bar gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'byung ba dag rim gyis phra bar gyur cing rtogs par dka' bar gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the elements become subtle and difficult to discern,

original: rnal 'byor pa dag gis dbugs ring du byas nas rtogs par byed do //🔽kha cig na re ngal gso ba'i phyir bar bar thung du byas /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa dag gis dbugs ring du byas nas rtogs par byed do // kha cig na re ngal gso ba'i phyir bar bar thung du byas /
translated: the yogis and yoginis realize them by means of long breaths.

original: bar bar ring du byas te bsgom par bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bar bar ring du byas te bsgom par bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that for the sake of rest, one should meditate on long and short breaths from time to time.

original: gzhan dag na re dbugs ma thal bar rngub pa dang / 'byung ba la ni ring po zhes bya /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re dbugs ma thal bar rngub pa dang / 'byung ba la ni ring po zhes bya /
translated: Others say that inhaling and exhaling without interruption is called long,

original: skabs skabs su dbugs rngub pa dang / 'byung ba la ni thung ngu zhes bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: skabs skabs su dbugs rngub pa dang / 'byung ba la ni thung ngu zhes bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: and inhaling and exhaling from time to time is called short.

original: rdza mkhan nam rdza mkhan gyi slob ma zhes bya ba la rdza mkhan zhes bya ba ni legs par lobs pa'o //
analyzed: rdza mkhan nam rdza mkhan gyi slob ma zhes bya ba la rdza mkhan zhes bya ba ni legs par lobs pa'o //
translated: A potter or a potter's apprentice. A potter is one who is skilled.

original: rdza mkhan gyi slob ma zhes bya ba ni slob pa ste /
analyzed: rdza mkhan gyi slob ma zhes bya ba ni slob pa ste /
translated: A potter's apprentice is one who is learning.

original: gnyis ka smos pa ni rnal 'byor spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / las dang po pa gnyis dang mthun par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka smos pa ni rnal 'byor spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / las dang po pa gnyis dang mthun par bstan pa'o //
translated: Both are mentioned to show that this is suitable for both those who are fully accomplished in yoga and beginners.

original: khams kyi sgo dang / lus kyi rjes su lta ba'i sgo ni go sla'o //
analyzed: khams kyi sgo dang / lus kyi rjes su lta ba'i sgo ni go sla'o //
translated: The gate of the elements and the gate of observing the body are easy to understand.

original: mi sdug pa'i sgo la ni 'gres dgu ste /
analyzed: mi sdug pa'i sgo la ni 'gres dgu ste /
translated: The gate of foulness is ninefold.

original: shi nas zhag gcig lon pa ni rnam par bam pa'o //
analyzed: shi nas zhag gcig lon pa ni rnam par bam pa'o //
translated: A corpse one day dead is called “swollen.

original: shi nas zhag gnyis lon pa ni rnam par bsngos pa'o //
analyzed: shi nas zhag gnyis lon pa ni rnam par bsngos pa'o //
translated: ” A corpse two days dead is called “bloated.

original: shi nas zhag gsum lon pa'am /
analyzed: shi nas zhag gsum lon pa'am /
translated: ” A corpse three days dead,

original: shi nas zhag bzhi lon pa ni rnam par rnags pa'o //
analyzed: shi nas zhag bzhi lon pa ni rnam par rnags pa'o //
translated: or a corpse four days dead, is called “bleeding.🔽” A corpse five days dead is called “eaten.

original: shi nas zhag lnga lon pa ni rnam par 'bus gzhig pa ste 'bu zhugs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shi nas zhag lnga lon pa ni rnam par 'bus gzhig pa ste 'bu zhugs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ” This means “infested with worms.

original: 'das pa'i dus thams cad kyang de lta bu'i chos can no //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus thams cad kyang de lta bu'i chos can no //
translated: ” All of the past was like this,

original: ma 'ongs pa yang de lta bu'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yang de lta bu'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: and the future will be like this,

original: da ltar byung ba yang chos nyid de las ma 'das pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba yang chos nyid de las ma 'das pa'o //
translated: and the present is not beyond this reality.

original: za ba zhes bya ba'i 'gres dang / rnam par zos pa zhes bya ba'i 'gres gnyis ni rnam par zos pa'i mi sdug pa ste /
analyzed: za ba zhes bya ba'i 'gres dang / rnam par zos pa zhes bya ba'i 'gres gnyis ni rnam par zos pa'i mi sdug pa ste /
translated: The two formulas “being eaten” and “eaten” are the foulness of being eaten.

original: da ltar dang 'das pa'i bye brag gis phye ba'o //
analyzed: da ltar dang 'das pa'i bye brag gis phye ba'o //
translated: They are distinguished by the present and the past.

original: sha dang khrag ra ri chags pa rgyus pas brang breng du 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i 'gres dang / gsum char yang med pa'i 'gres dang / 'gres de @127a * //
analyzed: sha dang khrag ra ri chags pa rgyus pas brang breng du 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i 'gres dang / gsum char yang med pa'i 'gres dang / 'gres de @127a * //
translated: The fourth is the unpleasantness of the livid.🔽The fifth is the unpleasantness of the festering.

original: gnyis ni rnam par dmar ba'i mi sdug pa'o //🔽rus pa keng rus zungs med pa /
analyzed: gnyis ni rnam par dmar ba'i mi sdug pa'o // rus pa keng rus zungs med pa /
translated: The sixth is the unpleasantness of the discolored.🔽The seventh is the unpleasantness of the cut up.🔽The eighth is the unpleasantness of the gnawed.🔽The ninth is the unpleasantness of the scattered.🔽The tenth is the unpleasantness of the burned.

original: gyes pa dung gi mdog ltar gyur pa /🔽sa la rnam par 'thor ba zhes bya ba'i 'gres dang / rkang pa'i rus pa rnams kyang gzhan du 'thor /
analyzed: gyes pa dung gi mdog ltar gyur pa / sa la rnam par 'thor ba zhes bya ba'i 'gres dang / rkang pa'i rus pa rnams kyang gzhan du 'thor /
translated: The eleventh is the unpleasantness of the skeleton.🔽The twelfth is the unpleasantness of the worm-infested.🔽The first two are the unpleasantness of the bloated.🔽The third is the unpleasantness of the livid.

original: byin pa'i rus pa rnams kyang gzhan du 'thor zhes bya ba'i 'gres dang / 'gres de gnyis ni rnam par 'thor ba'i mi sdug pa ste /
analyzed: byin pa'i rus pa rnams kyang gzhan du 'thor zhes bya ba'i 'gres dang / 'gres de gnyis ni rnam par 'thor ba'i mi sdug pa ste /
translated: The fourth is the unpleasantness of the festering.🔽The fifth is the unpleasantness of the discolored.🔽The sixth is the unpleasantness of the cut up.🔽The seventh is the unpleasantness of the gnawed.🔽The eighth is the unpleasantness of the scattered.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'thor ba dang / phyogs thams cad du 'thor ba zhes bya ba de tsam gyis dbye'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'thor ba dang / phyogs thams cad du 'thor ba zhes bya ba de tsam gyis dbye'o //
translated: The ninth is the unpleasantness of the burned.🔽The tenth is the unpleasantness of the skeleton.🔽The eleventh is the unpleasantness of the worm-infested.

original: 'gres 'og ma gnyis kyis rus gong gis mi sdug pa ste /
analyzed: 'gres 'og ma gnyis kyis rus gong gis mi sdug pa ste /
translated: The first two are the unpleasantness of the bloated.🔽The third is the unpleasantness of the livid.🔽The fourth is the unpleasantness of the festering.

original: kha dog ma gyur cing /
analyzed: kha dog ma gyur cing /
translated: The fifth is the unpleasantness of the discolored.🔽The sixth is the unpleasantness of the cut up.🔽The seventh is the unpleasantness of the gnawed.🔽The eighth is the unpleasantness of the scattered.🔽The ninth is the unpleasantness of the burned.🔽The tenth is the unpleasantness of the skeleton.🔽The eleventh is the unpleasantness of the worm-infested.🔽The first two are the unpleasantness of the bloated.🔽The third is the unpleasantness of the livid.🔽The fourth is the unpleasantness of the festering.🔽The fifth is the unpleasantness of the dis

original: rus pa ma grugs pa dang / kha dog gyur la rus pa grugs pa zhes bya ba de tsam gyis dbye'o //
analyzed: rus pa ma grugs pa dang / kha dog gyur la rus pa grugs pa zhes bya ba de tsam gyis dbye'o //
translated: The difference between the two is that in the latter the bones are broken.

original: de ltar rnam par bam pa dang / rnam par bsngos pa dang / rnam par rnags pa dang / rnam par 'bus gzhig pa dang / rnam par zos pa dang / rnam par dmar ba dang / rnam par 'thor ba dang / rus gong zhes bya ba mi sdug pa rnam pa brgyad yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par bam pa dang / rnam par bsngos pa dang / rnam par rnags pa dang / rnam par 'bus gzhig pa dang / rnam par zos pa dang / rnam par dmar ba dang / rnam par 'thor ba dang / rus gong zhes bya ba mi sdug pa rnam pa brgyad yin no //
translated: Thus, there are eight types of impurity: bloated, livid, festering, cut up, gnawed, scattered, hacked and bleeding, and a skeleton.

original: rnam par 'bus gzhig pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'tshig pa zhes bya ba yang de nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par 'bus gzhig pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'tshig pa zhes bya ba yang de nyid do //
translated: The “gnawed” and “burned” are the same as the “cut up.”

original: de la thams cad kyi dang po ni mi dmigs par yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la thams cad kyi dang po ni mi dmigs par yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The first of these eight is the mental attention to the non-apprehension of impurity.

original: rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus kyi rjes su lta ba lnga dang / rnam par shes pa med pa'i mi sdug pa brgyad dang / rnam pa bcu gsum gyis lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bshad de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus kyi rjes su lta ba lnga dang / rnam par shes pa med pa'i mi sdug pa brgyad dang / rnam pa bcu gsum gyis lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bshad de /
translated: The mindfulness of the body is explained as being of thirteen types: five that are mental attentions to the body with consciousness, and eight types of impurity without consciousness.

original: 'gres bco lnga pa'o /
analyzed: 'gres bco lnga pa'o /
translated: This is the fifteenth permutation.

original: // / bam po bcu gnyis pa /
analyzed: // / bam po bcu gnyis pa /
translated: The four right efforts.🔽Since this establishes the mind correctly, it is called right establishment.

original: gnyis pa la yang dag par spong ba bzhi zhes bya ba ni 'dis sems yang dag par 'jog pas na yang dag par 'jog pa zhes bya ste brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: gnyis pa la yang dag par spong ba bzhi zhes bya ba ni 'dis sems yang dag par 'jog pas na yang dag par 'jog pa zhes bya ste brtson 'grus so //
translated: It is called right effort because it is the effort to establish the mind correctly.

original: brtson 'grus de yang sbyor ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhir gyur pas na bzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus de yang sbyor ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhir gyur pas na bzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: That effort is called fourfold because it is fourfold in its application.

original: 'dun pa bskyed do rtsol lo brtson 'grus rtsom mo sems rab tu 'dzin to yang dag par rab tu 'jog go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dun pa bskyed do rtsol lo brtson 'grus rtsom mo sems rab tu 'dzin to yang dag par rab tu 'jog go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One generates zeal, strives, arouses energy, and exerts the mind.

original: brtson 'grus de yang rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus de yang rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /
translated: That effort is fourfold.

original: go cha'i brtson 'grus dang / sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus dang / mi skye ba'i brtson 'grus dang / thabs kyi brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: go cha'i brtson 'grus dang / sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus dang / mi skye ba'i brtson 'grus dang / thabs kyi brtson 'grus so //
translated: It is the armor-effort, the effort of application, the effort of non-decline, and the effort of means.

original: dang por 'di ltar bya'o zhes go cha bgo bar byed do //
analyzed: dang por 'di ltar bya'o zhes go cha bgo bar byed do //
translated: First, one puts on the armor, thinking, “I will do this.”

original: de ni 'dun @127b pa bskyed do zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'dun @127b pa bskyed do zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is what is said about generating zeal.

original: de'i 'og tu go cha bgos pa dang rjes su mthun par sbyor ba rtsom ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu go cha bgos pa dang rjes su mthun par sbyor ba rtsom ste /
translated: Then, in accordance with the armoring, he undertakes the application.

original: de ni rtsol lo zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rtsol lo zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is called “endeavoring.”

original: de'i 'og tu tshigs che bar gyur kyang skyo ba ma skyes par brtson 'grus nyid 'phel bar byed de /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu tshigs che bar gyur kyang skyo ba ma skyes par brtson 'grus nyid 'phel bar byed de /
translated: Then, even if he becomes tired, he increases his effort without becoming discouraged.

original: de ni brtson 'grus rtsom mo zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni brtson 'grus rtsom mo zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is called “making effort.”

original: de'i 'og tu thabs ma yin par bsgrub pa yongs su spangs nas yang dag pa'i thabs la gnas par byed de /🔽de ni sems rab tu 'dzin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu thabs ma yin par bsgrub pa yongs su spangs nas yang dag pa'i thabs la gnas par byed de / de ni sems rab tu 'dzin no //
translated: Then, having abandoned the practice of what is not the method, he abides in the correct method.

original: yang dag par rab tu 'jog go zhes bya ba 'di gnyis kyis bstan to //🔽de la sems bying bar gyur na rab tu 'dzin pa yid la byed pas rab tu 'dzin pas na sems rab tu 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu 'jog go zhes bya ba 'di gnyis kyis bstan to // de la sems bying bar gyur na rab tu 'dzin pa yid la byed pas rab tu 'dzin pas na sems rab tu 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is taught by the two lines “he fully engages his mind” and “he fully stabilizes his mind.”🔽When his mind becomes slack, he fully engages his mind by means of the attention of full engagement.

original: sems rgod par gyur na mngon par sdud pa yid la byed pas yang dag par 'jog pa la yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems rgod par gyur na mngon par sdud pa yid la byed pas yang dag par 'jog pa la yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When his mind becomes excited, he fully stabilizes his mind by means of the attention of full absorption.

original: gsum pa la /
analyzed: gsum pa la /
translated: The third has two parts:

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos zhes bya ba rdzu 'phrul gyi gzhi dang / gnas su gyur pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos zhes bya ba rdzu 'phrul gyi gzhi dang / gnas su gyur pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The four bases of supernatural powers are called supernatural powers because they are the basis and the cause of supramundane dharmas.

original: de dag kyang 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / dpyod pa dang bzhi'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / dpyod pa dang bzhi'o //
translated: They are will, vigor, mind, and investigation.

original: 'di ltar la la ni dge ba'i chos sgom pa la 'dod pa cher skyed par gyur pa na de 'dun pa'i stobs 'ba' zhig gis sbyor bar gyur pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar la la ni dge ba'i chos sgom pa la 'dod pa cher skyed par gyur pa na de 'dun pa'i stobs 'ba' zhig gis sbyor bar gyur pa /
translated: Some, when they generate great will for the cultivation of virtuous dharmas, apply themselves by the power of will alone.

original: legs par nges par sems shing yid la byed pa gzhan med pas sems rtse gcig tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: legs par nges par sems shing yid la byed pa gzhan med pas sems rtse gcig tu 'gyur te /
translated: Since they do not have other mental attentions that are well ascertained, their minds become one pointed.

original: de'i 'dun pa'i dbang gis byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin la 'dun pa'i ting 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'dun pa'i dbang gis byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin la 'dun pa'i ting 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: Concentration that arises from the power of will is called concentration of will.

original: la la ni yang dag par spong ba bzhi'i brtson 'grus kyis rab tu sbyor ba na dge ba la 'jog pa'i brtson 'grus kyis rab tu sbyor zhing /
analyzed: la la ni yang dag par spong ba bzhi'i brtson 'grus kyis rab tu sbyor ba na dge ba la 'jog pa'i brtson 'grus kyis rab tu sbyor zhing /
translated: Some, when they apply themselves by the vigor of the four right efforts, apply themselves by the vigor of establishing virtue.

original: mi dge ba spong ba dang / dge ba skyed pa la rab tu zhugs pa na sems rtse gcig tu gyur te /
analyzed: mi dge ba spong ba dang / dge ba skyed pa la rab tu zhugs pa na sems rtse gcig tu gyur te /
translated: When one is engaged in abandoning nonvirtue and generating virtue, the mind becomes one-pointed.

original: de'i brtson 'grus kyi dbang gis byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin la brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i brtson 'grus kyi dbang gis byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin la brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: The concentration that arises from that effort is called the concentration of effort.

original: la la ni sems sbyong ba la zhugs pa na zhi gnas dang rab tu 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan rnams kyis sems yang dag par 'jog pa la sems sbyong ba'i stobs kyis sems rtse gcig tu gnas par gyur te /
analyzed: la la ni sems sbyong ba la zhugs pa na zhi gnas dang rab tu 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan rnams kyis sems yang dag par 'jog pa la sems sbyong ba'i stobs kyis sems rtse gcig tu gnas par gyur te /
translated: When one is engaged in training the mind, the mind is correctly placed by means of the signs of serenity, complete acceptance, and equanimity. The mind abides one-pointedly by the power of training the mind.

original: de'i sems kyi dbang gis byung @128a * //
analyzed: de'i sems kyi dbang gis byung @128a * //
translated: The concentration that arises from that mind

original: ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sems kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sems kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: is called the concentration of mind.

original: la la ni gang gi tshe yang dag par sbyor ba na tshul bzhin ma yin pa spang ba dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / kun nas dkris pa rnams mi skye ba dang / kun nas dkris pa'i gnyen po'i chos rnams goms par byas pas sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams kun tu mi spyod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: la la ni gang gi tshe yang dag par sbyor ba na tshul bzhin ma yin pa spang ba dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / kun nas dkris pa rnams mi skye ba dang / kun nas dkris pa'i gnyen po'i chos rnams goms par byas pas sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams kun tu mi spyod par 'gyur te /
translated: Some, when they are correctly engaged, do not engage in sinful, nonvirtuous dharmas by abandoning what is improper, by attending properly, by not producing the entanglements, and by cultivating the dharmas that are the antidotes to the entanglements.

original: de'i tshe de 'di snyam du sems so //
analyzed: de'i tshe de 'di snyam du sems so //
translated: At that time, they think this:

original: ci bdag sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams la kun tu mi spyod dam snyam du sems pa de'i tshe na yang de 'di snyam du sems te /🔽ci sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams yod pa la /
analyzed: ci bdag sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams la kun tu mi spyod dam snyam du sems pa de'i tshe na yang de 'di snyam du sems te / ci sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams yod pa la /
translated: “Do I not engage in sinful, nonvirtuous dharmas?” At that time, they think this:🔽“Do I not engage in sinful, nonvirtuous dharmas that exist?

original: bdag kun tu mi spyod par gyur tam /
analyzed: bdag kun tu mi spyod par gyur tam /
translated: Or do I not engage in sinful, nonvirtuous dharmas that do not exist?”

original: 'on te med pa nyid la kun tu mi spyod par gyur snyam pa de bdag gis yongs su dpyad par bya'o snyam nas dpyod pa yid la byed pa bskyed de /
analyzed: 'on te med pa nyid la kun tu mi spyod par gyur snyam pa de bdag gis yongs su dpyad par bya'o snyam nas dpyod pa yid la byed pa bskyed de /
translated: Having thought, “I will thoroughly investigate that,” they generate the attention of investigation.

original: yang dag par sems par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dag par sems par 'gyur te /
translated: They think correctly.

original: de dpyod pa yid la byed pa de'i dbang du byas nas rtsol ba na ting nge 'dzin skyes pa de dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dpyod pa yid la byed pa de'i dbang du byas nas rtsol ba na ting nge 'dzin skyes pa de dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: When one makes an effort in that analysis, the concentration that arises is called the concentration of analysis.

original: de ltar ting nge 'dzin rnam pa bzhi byung zhing kun nas dkris pa thag ring du gyur nas bag la nyal ba rnams spang ba'i phyir gong du yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi po dag gis brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
analyzed: de ltar ting nge 'dzin rnam pa bzhi byung zhing kun nas dkris pa thag ring du gyur nas bag la nyal ba rnams spang ba'i phyir gong du yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi po dag gis brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
translated: When the four kinds of concentration have arisen in that way and the fetters have been removed, one makes an effort with the four right efforts in order to eliminate the latent dispositions.

original: de brtson 'grus rtsom pa na spong ba'i 'du byed kyi chos brgyad mngon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de brtson 'grus rtsom pa na spong ba'i 'du byed kyi chos brgyad mngon du 'gyur te /
translated: When one makes that effort, the eight qualities of elimination manifest.

original: nam zhig na 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed par bya snyam du sems pa'i 'dun pa dang / mi dge ba'i chos thams cad nges par 'joms pa'i brtson 'grus dang / gong du thob pa'i chos la dad pa dang /
analyzed: nam zhig na 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed par bya snyam du sems pa'i 'dun pa dang / mi dge ba'i chos thams cad nges par 'joms pa'i brtson 'grus dang / gong du thob pa'i chos la dad pa dang /
translated: The eight qualities of elimination are: the aspiration to generate mundane and supramundane meditative concentration; the effort to definitely destroy all nonvirtuous qualities; faith in the qualities that are attained higher up; the effort to attain the qualities that have not yet been attained; the effort to increase the qualities that have been attained; the effort to eliminate the afflictions; the effort to eliminate the secondary afflictions; and the effort to eliminate the latent dispositions.

original: de sngon du btang ba'i shin tu sbyangs pa dang / de la dran pa dang shes bzhin gyi phyogs dang / lhag mthong gi phyogs kyi shes bzhin dang / de la sems mngon par 'du byed pa'i sems dang / sems kun nas nyams pa med pa'i bdag nyid kyi btang snyoms rnams te sngar smos pa'i 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: de sngon du btang ba'i shin tu sbyangs pa dang / de la dran pa dang shes bzhin gyi phyogs dang / lhag mthong gi phyogs kyi shes bzhin dang / de la sems mngon par 'du byed pa'i sems dang / sems kun nas nyams pa med pa'i bdag nyid kyi btang snyoms rnams te sngar smos pa'i 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: The previously mentioned intention, concentration,🔽effort, faith, pliancy, mindfulness, vigilance, thought, and equanimity are the eight formative forces of abandonment.

original: 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dad pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / sems pa dang / btang snyoms zhes bya ba spong ba'i 'du byed @128b brgyad po 'di dag dang ldan par 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang par 'gyur ba'i ting nge 'dzin sgom mo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dad pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / sems pa dang / btang snyoms zhes bya ba spong ba'i 'du byed @128b brgyad po 'di dag dang ldan par 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang par 'gyur ba'i ting nge 'dzin sgom mo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Endowed with these, one cultivates concentration that becomes a supramundane basis of magical power.

original: dpen pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dag las dben pa'o //
analyzed: dpen pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dag las dben pa'o //
translated: Dwelling in solitude means being secluded from afflictions.

original: srid pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: srid pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is freedom from attachment to existence.

original: sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
translated: It is the cessation of suffering.

original: phung po thams cad rnam par spong ba'o //
analyzed: phung po thams cad rnam par spong ba'o //
translated: It is the complete abandonment of all the aggregates.

original: yang na sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir dben pa la gnas pa'o //🔽kun 'byung ba'i bden pa spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir dben pa la gnas pa'o // kun 'byung ba'i bden pa spang ba'i phyir /
translated: Or else, it is the state of solitude because of the complete understanding of the truth of suffering.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa'o //🔽'gog pa'i bden pa mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa'o // 'gog pa'i bden pa mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir /
translated: It is the state of freedom from attachment because of the abandonment of the truth of the arising of suffering.

original: 'gog pa la gnas pa'o //🔽lam gyi bden pa bsgom pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gog pa la gnas pa'o // lam gyi bden pa bsgom pa'i phyir /
translated: It is the state of cessation because of the realization of the truth of cessation.

original: rnam par spong bas yongs su bsgyur ba zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par spong bas yongs su bsgyur ba zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: It is the state of complete abandonment because of the cultivation of the truth of the path.

original: yang na tshul khrims kyi phung pos ni dben pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: yang na tshul khrims kyi phung pos ni dben pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: Or else, the aggregate of morality is the state of solitude.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi phung pos ni 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi phung pos ni 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa'o //
translated: The aggregate of meditative absorption is the state of freedom from attachment.

original: shes rab kyi phung pos 'gog pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi phung pos 'gog pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: The aggregate of wisdom is the state of cessation.

original: rnam par grol ba'i phung pos ni rnam par spong bas yongs su bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i phung pos ni rnam par spong bas yongs su bsgyur ba'o //
translated: The aggregate of complete liberation is the state of complete abandonment.

original: bzhi pa la ni de ltar bdag po bzhi po dag gis yang dag par sbyor ba khyad par gyi chos 'byung ba'i rtags mthong bas gong du khyad par gyi chos 'byung ba la nges pa skye ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni de ltar bdag po bzhi po dag gis yang dag par sbyor ba khyad par gyi chos 'byung ba'i rtags mthong bas gong du khyad par gyi chos 'byung ba la nges pa skye ste /
translated: On the fourth, one sees the signs of the arising of the special qualities due to the correct application of those four masters, and one generates certainty in the arising of the special qualities.

original: de'i tshe rnal 'byor pa de ston pa dang / nyan thos rnams kyi thob pa la yid ches pa skye'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe rnal 'byor pa de ston pa dang / nyan thos rnams kyi thob pa la yid ches pa skye'o //
translated: At that time, the yogi generates confidence in the attainments of the teacher and the śrāvakas.

original: de de ltar yid ches pa na gong du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos 'byung ba la dbang byed pas dad pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de de ltar yid ches pa na gong du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos 'byung ba la dbang byed pas dad pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: When one has such confidence, since one controls the arising of supramundane qualities, it is called the faculty of faith.

original: dad pa'i stobs kyis kyang brtson 'grus shin tu lhag par skye ste /
analyzed: dad pa'i stobs kyis kyang brtson 'grus shin tu lhag par skye ste /
translated: Also, through the power of faith, effort arises in abundance.

original: de yang de bzhin du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos 'byung ba la dbang byed pas brtson 'grus kyi dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos 'byung ba la dbang byed pas brtson 'grus kyi dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: Since that also controls the arising of supramundane qualities, it is called the faculty of effort.

original: dran pa la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to mindfulness and so on.

original: lnga pa la ni de ltar dad pa de nyid mngon par 'phel bas lha'am bdud dam /
analyzed: lnga pa la ni de ltar dad pa de nyid mngon par 'phel bas lha'am bdud dam /
translated: On the fifth, one's faith increases and one cannot be turned away from enlightenment by gods, demons, etc.

original: tshangs pa yang rung /
analyzed: tshangs pa yang rung /
translated: In the fifth, since that faith increases, one cannot be overcome by any god, demon, or Brahma in accordance with the Dharma.🔽And one is not overcome by the afflictions.

original: gang gis kyang chos dang mthun pas thub par ma nus shing nyon mongs pa kun nas dkris pas kyang mi tshugs par gyur pa de'i tshe de nyid la dad pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //🔽gong du smos pa de dag nyid kyis mi brdzi ba'i phyir de bzhin du brtson 'grus @129a * //
analyzed: gang gis kyang chos dang mthun pas thub par ma nus shing nyon mongs pa kun nas dkris pas kyang mi tshugs par gyur pa de'i tshe de nyid la dad pa'i stobs zhes bya'o // gong du smos pa de dag nyid kyis mi brdzi ba'i phyir de bzhin du brtson 'grus @129a * //
translated: At that time, it is called the power of faith.

original: la sogs pa yang thub dka' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la sogs pa yang thub dka' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, effort, etc. become difficult to overcome because they cannot be suppressed by those previously mentioned.

original: stobs de dag gis rnal 'byor pa de stobs dang ldan pas bdud kyi stobs thams cad las rgyal nas rab tu sbyor te /
analyzed: stobs de dag gis rnal 'byor pa de stobs dang ldan pas bdud kyi stobs thams cad las rgyal nas rab tu sbyor te /
translated: Since the yogi/nī is powerful through those powers, having conquered all the powers of Māra, they are applied.

original: de bas na stobs rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na stobs rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called powers.

original: dad pa'i dbang po la sogs pa lnga po de dag nyid bsgoms na nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: dad pa'i dbang po la sogs pa lnga po de dag nyid bsgoms na nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bzhir 'gyur te /
translated: Those five, faith, etc., when cultivated, become the four roots of virtue that are conducive to penetration.

original: dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo dang / bzod pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog go //
analyzed: dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo dang / bzod pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog go //
translated: heat, peak, patience, and the supreme mundane state.

original: de la dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo'i gnas skabs na ni dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo'i gnas skabs na ni dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: In the states of heat and peak, they are called faculties.

original: bzod pa dang 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs na ni stobs rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bzod pa dang 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs na ni stobs rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: In the states of patience and the supreme mundane state, they are called powers.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog ces bya ba'i lnga po rnams shin tu yongs su 'phel na de ma thag tu mthong ba'i lam la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog ces bya ba'i lnga po rnams shin tu yongs su 'phel na de ma thag tu mthong ba'i lam la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur bas /
translated: In the state of the supreme mundane state, the five faculties are greatly increased, and immediately after that, in the path of vision, they become the members of enlightenment, which are seven in number.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya ba'i chos bdun 'byung ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya ba'i chos bdun 'byung ste /
translated: The seven members of enlightenment are:🔽1) mindfulness, 2) the investigation of the teachings, 3) effort, 4) joy, 5) pliancy, 6) concentration, and 7) equanimity.

original: chos rnam par 'byed pa dang brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba zhes bya ba 'di gsum ni lhag mthong gi phyogs so //
analyzed: chos rnam par 'byed pa dang brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba zhes bya ba 'di gsum ni lhag mthong gi phyogs so //
translated: The three of investigation of the teachings, effort, and joy are on the side of insight.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs so //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs so //
translated: The three of pliancy, concentration, and equanimity are on the side of calm abiding.

original: dran pa ni gnyi ga'i phyogs so //
analyzed: dran pa ni gnyi ga'i phyogs so //
translated: Mindfulness is the factor of both.

original: des kyang de dag thob pas bdag gi nyon mongs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams ni spangs par mthong zhing /
analyzed: des kyang de dag thob pas bdag gi nyon mongs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams ni spangs par mthong zhing /
translated: By means of that, he sees that the afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing are abandoned and

original: bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba rnams ni ma spangs par mthong nas de dag spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba rnams ni ma spangs par mthong nas de dag spang ba'i phyir /
translated: he sees that the afflictions to be abandoned by the path of meditation are not abandoned.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa phung po gsum bsgom mo //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa phung po gsum bsgom mo //
translated: In order to abandon them, he cultivates the three aggregates of the eightfold noble path.

original: de la yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba rnams ni shes rab kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba rnams ni shes rab kyi phung po'o //
translated: Among them, right view, right thought, and right effort are the aggregate of wisdom.

original: yang dag pa'i dag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba ni tshul ba ni tshul khrims kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba ni tshul ba ni tshul khrims kyi phung po'o //
translated: Right speech, right action, and right livelihood are the aggregate of morality.

original: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gnyis ni ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gnyis ni ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po'o //
translated: Right mindfulness and right concentration are the aggregate of meditative stabilization.

original: yan lag brgyad kyis bsdus pa'i lam de yang 'phags pa slob pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa dang / rnam par grol ba mngon sum du bya ba'i lam yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yan lag brgyad kyis bsdus pa'i lam de yang 'phags pa slob pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa dang / rnam par grol ba mngon sum du bya ba'i lam yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This path, which is comprised of the eightfold noble path, is the path for the elimination of all the defilements of the noble beings in training and for the realization of perfect liberation.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa @129b zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa @129b zhes bya ste /
translated: Moreover, that path consisting of eight members is called the noble eightfold path because it is the path by which all the defilements of the noble learners are abandoned and their liberation is actualized.

original: de dag ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos kyi theg pa chen po bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos kyi theg pa chen po bstan pa yin no //
translated: These are the teachings on the Great Vehicle of the factors of enlightenment.
