original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di ltar rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi ting nge 'dzin gsum ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di ltar rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi ting nge 'dzin gsum ste /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva great beings is as follows: the three concentrations of the three doors of liberation.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes bya ba ni de la byis pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'i mtshan nyid de dang bral ba yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid brjod du med cing /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes bya ba ni de la byis pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'i mtshan nyid de dang bral ba yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid brjod du med cing /
translated: The concentration of emptiness, the concentration of signlessness, and the concentration of wishlessness.

original: stong pa'i rnam par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'i sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa gang yin pa de ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: stong pa'i rnam par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'i sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa gang yin pa de ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The concentration of emptiness is the one-pointed mind that sees the inexpressible and empty nature of the perfect, which is free from the imagined nature that is the domain of the childish.

original: yongs su grub pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de nyid yongs su rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad kyi mtshan ma'i rnam pa dang bral ba nam mkha' bzhin du mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par zhi ba nyid du yid la byed pa'i sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa gang yin pa de ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge🔽'dzin to // yang gzhan gyi dbang gis yongs su grub pa'i dngos po de nyid bzung nas /🔽de ltar shin tu yongs su dag pa'i dngos po la gzhan gyi dbang gis yongs su rtog pa'i spros pa las byung ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis nye bar nyon mongs pa ni smad pa yin no snyam nas de la mi mthun par 'du shes te /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de nyid yongs su rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad kyi mtshan ma'i rnam pa dang bral ba nam mkha' bzhin du mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par zhi ba nyid du yid la byed pa'i sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa gang yin pa de ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to // yang gzhan gyi dbang gis yongs su grub pa'i dngos po de nyid bzung nas / de ltar shin tu yongs su dag pa'i dngos po la gzhan gyi dbang gis yongs su rtog pa'i spros pa las byung ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis nye bar nyon mongs pa ni smad pa yin no snyam nas de la mi mthun par 'du shes te /
translated: The concentration of emptiness is the one-pointed mind that takes as its object the fact that the fully present reality is empty of the dependent reality.🔽The concentration of absence of expectancy is the one-pointed mind that takes as its object the fact that the fully present reality is free of the expectancy of the dependent reality.🔽The concentration of absence of attributes is the one-pointed mind that takes as its object the fact that the fully present reality is free of the attributes of the dependent reality.🔽The concentration of wishlessness is the one-pointed mind that takes as its object the fact that the fully present reality is free of all the conceptual and discursive elaborations that are the aspects of signs, and is thus peace, the absence of signs, like space.🔽The concentration of emptiness is the one-pointed mind that takes as its object the fact that the fully present reality is empty of the dependent reality.🔽The concentration of absence of expectancy is the one-pointed mind that takes as its object the fact that the fully present reality is free of the expectancy of the dependent reality.🔽The concentration of absence of attributes is the one-pointed mind that takes as its object the fact that the fully present reality is free of the attributes of the dependent reality.

original: phyin chad khams gsum pa de la mi smon cing gnas par mi bya'o snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: phyin chad khams gsum pa de la mi smon cing gnas par mi bya'o snyam du bsams nas /
translated: The concentration of wishlessness is the one-pointed mind that takes as its object the fact that the fully present reality is free of all the conceptual and discursive elaborations that are the aspects of signs, and is thus peace, the absence of signs, like space.

original: de ltar yid la byed pa'i sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa gang yin pa de ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de ltar yid la byed pa'i sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa gang yin pa de ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The one-pointed mind that attends to it in this way is the concentration of wishlessness.

original: de la kun brtags pa rnams mtshan nyid med par mthong ba ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin to //🔽yongs su grub pa la zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du mthong ba ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de la kun brtags pa rnams mtshan nyid med par mthong ba ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin to // yongs su grub pa la zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du mthong ba ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The concentration of emptiness is the seeing of the imagined nature as having no characteristics.🔽The concentration of signlessness is the seeing of the perfected nature as having the characteristic of peace.

original: gzhan gyi dbang la mi mthun par mthong ba ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang la mi mthun par mthong ba ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The concentration of wishlessness is the seeing of the relative nature as disagreeable.

original: de la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid rnams shin tu med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid rnams shin tu med pa'i phyir /
translated: The imagined nature is completely nonexistent.

original: chos thams cad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid du so sor rtog pa'i tshe /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid du so sor rtog pa'i tshe /
translated: When one discriminates the emptiness of the intrinsic identity of all things,

original: sems gnas pa gang yin pa de ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam par thar pa'i sgo ste /
analyzed: sems gnas pa gang yin pa de ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam par thar pa'i sgo ste /
translated: the mind rests in that discrimination.

original: @130a * // 'di ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: @130a * // 'di ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is called the concentration of emptiness.

original: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid kyis chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid kyis chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas /
translated: Since all phenomena are characterized by the absence of characteristics due to the characteristic of the consummate,

original: chos thams cad mtshan ma med par so sor rtog pa'i tshe /
analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan ma med par so sor rtog pa'i tshe /
translated: when one discerns that all phenomena are without characteristics,

original: sems gnas pa gang yin pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo ste /
analyzed: sems gnas pa gang yin pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo ste /
translated: the state of mental stability is the door of liberation that is the absence of characteristics.

original: 'di ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is called the meditative absorption of the absence of characteristics.

original: chos nyid rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa la glo bur gyi nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i rgyus yod pa ma yin pa la mngon par 'du byed pa /
analyzed: chos nyid rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa la glo bur gyi nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i rgyus yod pa ma yin pa la mngon par 'du byed pa /
translated: The nature of phenomena is naturally pure. It is not due to the causes of adventitious afflictions and so forth that it exists.

original: bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de don dam par med pa'i phyir /🔽chos thams cad mngon par 'du byed pa med pas /
analyzed: bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de don dam par med pa'i phyir / chos thams cad mngon par 'du byed pa med pas /
translated: Since the characteristics of merit, demerit, and the imperturbable do not exist ultimately,🔽all phenomena are unconditioned.

original: chos thams cad mngon par 'du byed pa med do zhes so sor rtog pa'i tshe /
analyzed: chos thams cad mngon par 'du byed pa med do zhes so sor rtog pa'i tshe /
translated: When one discerns that all phenomena are unconditioned,🔽the state of mental stability is the door of liberation that is the absence of expectancy.

original: sems gnas pa gang yin pa ni smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo ste 'di ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems gnas pa gang yin pa ni smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo ste 'di ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The gateway to liberation that is the absence of expectancy is the stability of mind. This is called the meditative absorption of the absence of expectancy.

original: shes pa'i theg pa chen po la shes pa bcu gcig po rnams ni theg pa chen po ste /
analyzed: shes pa'i theg pa chen po la shes pa bcu gcig po rnams ni theg pa chen po ste /
translated: The Great Vehicle is the eleven knowledges.🔽This is suffering.🔽This is the origin of suffering.

original: de la 'di ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: de la 'di ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: This is the cessation of suffering.🔽This is the path.🔽This is the knowledge of suffering.🔽This is the origin of suffering.

original: 'di ltar sdug bsngal kun 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar sdug bsngal kun 'byung ngo //
translated: This is the cessation of suffering.🔽This is the path.🔽This is the knowledge of the path.🔽This is the knowledge of the origin of suffering.

original: 'di ltar sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
translated: This is the cessation of suffering.🔽This is the path.🔽This is the knowledge of the cessation of suffering.🔽This is the path.🔽This is the knowledge of the path.🔽This is the knowledge of the origin of suffering.

original: 'di ltar sdug bsngal phyis mi skye'o zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal shes pa'o //🔽rnam pa bzhir gyur du zin kyang tha ma bzung nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar sdug bsngal phyis mi skye'o zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal shes pa'o // rnam pa bzhir gyur du zin kyang tha ma bzung nas /
translated: This is the cessation of suffering.🔽This is the path.🔽This is the knowledge of the origin of suffering.

original: phyi ma la sdug bsngal mi skye zhing rgyun chad do zhes de ltar zhugs pa'i shes pa la /
analyzed: phyi ma la sdug bsngal mi skye zhing rgyun chad do zhes de ltar zhugs pa'i shes pa la /
translated: This is the cessation of suffering.🔽This is the path.🔽This is the knowledge of the path.🔽This is the knowledge of the origin of suffering.🔽This is the cessation of suffering.🔽This is the path.🔽This is the knowledge of the path.🔽This is the knowledge of the origin of suffering.🔽This is the cessation of suffering.🔽This is the path.🔽This is the knowledge of the path.🔽This is the knowledge of the origin of suffering.🔽This is the cessation of suffering.🔽This is the path.🔽This is the knowledge of the path.🔽This is the knowledge of the origin of suffering.🔽This is the cessation of suffering.🔽This is the path.🔽This is the knowledge of the path.🔽This is the knowledge of the origin of suffering.

original: 'dir sdug bsngal shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir sdug bsngal shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is the cessation of suffering.🔽This is the path.🔽This is the knowledge of the path.🔽This is the knowledge of the origin of suffering.

original: de bas na gang sdug bsngal mi skye bar shes pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na gang sdug bsngal mi skye bar shes pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is the cessation of suffering.🔽This is the path.🔽This is the knowledge of the path.🔽This is the knowledge of the origin of suffering.

original: kun 'byung ba spangs par shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung ba'i bdag nyid nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad dang las rnams spangs par shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba spangs par shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung ba'i bdag nyid nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad dang las rnams spangs par shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The knowledge of the abandonment of the origin is the knowledge of the abandonment of all the defilements and secondary defilements which are the nature of the origin, and of the actions.

original: gang sdug bsngal 'gog par shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag zad par shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang sdug bsngal 'gog par shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag zad par shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the cessation of suffering is the knowledge of the exhaustion of the five aggregates of attachment.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni lam 'di dang rtogs pa 'dis sdug bsngal 'gags pas sdug bsngal 'gog pa'i rgyu shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni lam 'di dang rtogs pa 'dis sdug bsngal 'gags pas sdug bsngal 'gog pa'i rgyu shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the noble eightfold path is the knowledge of the cause of the cessation of suffering, because suffering ceases through this path and through the realization of this path.

original: gang 'dod chags dang / zhe @130b sdang dang gti mug zad par shes pa zhes bya ba ni byas pa srung ba can gyi sa la ste /
analyzed: gang 'dod chags dang / zhe @130b sdang dang gti mug zad par shes pa zhes bya ba ni byas pa srung ba can gyi sa la ste /
translated: The knowledge of the exhaustion of craving, hatred and delusion is the knowledge of the stage of the protector of what has been done.

original: de la shes pa ni mngon sum gyi shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la shes pa ni mngon sum gyi shes pa'o //
translated: Here, knowledge is direct knowledge.🔽 The knowledge of non-arising is the knowledge of the stage of the one who has nothing more to train in.

original: srid pa'i 'gro ba mi skye bar shes pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i 'gro bar skye ba med par rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i 'gro ba mi skye bar shes pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i 'gro bar skye ba med par rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The knowledge that the transmigrator does not arise in any of the destinies of existence is the knowledge of nonarising.🔽The knowledge of nonarising is subsequent knowledge.🔽The knowledge that the transmigrator does not arise in any of the destinies of existence is the knowledge of nonarising.🔽The knowledge that the transmigrator does not arise in any of the destinies of existence is the knowledge of nonarising.

original: mi skye ba shes pa ni rjes su dag pa'i shes pa'o //🔽rnam par grol ba mngon sum du byed pas /🔽de la dmigs pa ni chos shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba shes pa ni rjes su dag pa'i shes pa'o // rnam par grol ba mngon sum du byed pas / de la dmigs pa ni chos shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge that the transmigrator does not arise in any of the destinies of existence is the knowledge of nonarising.🔽The knowledge that the transmigrator does not arise in any of the destinies of existence is the knowledge of nonarising.🔽The knowledge that the transmigrator does not arise in any of the destinies of existence is the knowledge of nonarising.🔽The knowledge that the transmigrator does not arise in any of the destinies of existence is the knowledge of nonarising.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa ni rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir de la dmigs pa'i shes pa ni rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o //🔽kha cig kho nar kun brtags pa la dmigs pa'i phyir pha rol gyi sems shes pa la kun rdzob shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa ni rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir de la dmigs pa'i shes pa ni rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o // kha cig kho nar kun brtags pa la dmigs pa'i phyir pha rol gyi sems shes pa la kun rdzob shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge that the transmigrator does not arise in any of the destinies of existence is the knowledge of nonarising.🔽The knowledge that the transmigrator does not arise in any of the destinies of existence is the knowledge of nonarising.🔽The knowledge that the transmigrator does not arise in any of the destinies of existence is the knowledge of nonarising.

original: yongs su 'dris pa shes pa zhes bya ba la yongs su 'dris pa ni goms par byed pa ste /🔽sgom pa zhes bya ba dang don gcig go //
analyzed: yongs su 'dris pa shes pa zhes bya ba la yongs su 'dris pa ni goms par byed pa ste /🔽sgom pa zhes bya ba dang don gcig go //
translated: The knowledge that the transmigrator does not arise in any of the destinies of existence is the knowledge of nonarising.🔽The knowledge that the transmigrator does not arise in any of the destinies of existence is the knowledge of nonarising.🔽The knowledge that the transmigrator does not arise in any of the destinies of existence is the knowledge of nonarising.🔽The knowledge that the transmigrator does not arise in any of the destinies of existence is the knowledge of nonarising.🔽The knowledge that the transmigrator does not arise in any of the destinies of existence is the knowledge of nonarising.🔽The knowledge that the transmigrator does not arise in any of the destinies of existence is the knowledge of nonarising.🔽The knowledge that the transmigrator does not arise in any of the destinies of existence is the knowledge of nonarising.🔽The knowledge that the transmigrator does not arise in any of the destinies of existence is the knowledge of nonarising.🔽The knowledge that the transmigrator does not arise in any of the destinies of existence is the knowledge of nonarising.🔽The knowledge that the transmigrator

original: yongs su 'dris pa yang sdug pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams thams cad du zil gyis gnon zhes bya ba dang don gcig go //
analyzed: yongs su 'dris pa yang sdug pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams thams cad du zil gyis gnon zhes bya ba dang don gcig go //
translated: And the knowledge of thorough familiarity is the same as the knowledge of the complete conquest of all unwholesome states.

original: de la don snga ma'i rnam par rtog pa la yang dag par sgrub pa shes pa ni yongs su 'dris pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la don snga ma'i rnam par rtog pa la yang dag par sgrub pa shes pa ni yongs su 'dris pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, the knowledge of the complete conquest of the former object is called thorough familiarity.

original: don gnyis pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sdig pa thams cad zil gyis mnan cing zad par byas par shes pa ni yongs su 'dris pa shes pa ste /
analyzed: don gnyis pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sdig pa thams cad zil gyis mnan cing zad par byas par shes pa ni yongs su 'dris pa shes pa ste /
translated: And the knowledge of the complete conquest of all evil and the destruction of it in the case of the latter object is the knowledge of thorough familiarity.

original: de'i phyir lam shes pa dang / yongs su zad pa shes pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir lam shes pa dang / yongs su zad pa shes pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the knowledge of the path and the knowledge of complete conquest are one.

original: de la rnam pa snga ma yongs su 'dris pa shes pa 'og ma'i bshad pa mdor bsdu ste 'di nyid du bstan pas yang ma bshad do //
analyzed: de la rnam pa snga ma yongs su 'dris pa shes pa 'og ma'i bshad pa mdor bsdu ste 'di nyid du bstan pas yang ma bshad do //
translated: Here, the knowledge of thorough familiarity with the former aspect is explained in brief in the explanation of the lower one and is not explained again here.

original: sgra ji bzhin shes pa gang zhe na de bzhin gshegs pas sgra thams cad mkhyen pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin shes pa gang zhe na de bzhin gshegs pas sgra thams cad mkhyen pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: What is knowledge according to the letter? It is the knowledge of all sounds by the Tathagata.

original: sgra ni brjod pa ste /
analyzed: sgra ni brjod pa ste /
translated: Here, sound means expression.

original: 'du shes dang brtags pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs te /
analyzed: 'du shes dang brtags pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs te /
translated: The terms “notion” and “investigation” are synonyms.

original: sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang mi dang lha la sogs pa'i skad gang yin pa dang / brjod pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad rtog pa la sgra ji bzhin shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang mi dang lha la sogs pa'i skad gang yin pa dang / brjod pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad rtog pa la sgra ji bzhin shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the sound just as it is in regard to the language of all sentient beings, such as hell beings, animals, humans, gods, etc., and the language of all verbal expressions, is called “the knowledge of the sound just as it is.

original: dbang po gsum zhes bya ba ni dbang po gsum po dag theg pa chen po ste /
analyzed: dbang po gsum zhes bya ba ni dbang po gsum po dag theg pa chen po ste /
translated: The three faculties are the three faculties of the Great Vehicle.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ba rnams rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la dbang byed pa rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro //🔽kun shes par @131a * //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ba rnams rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la dbang byed pa rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro // kun shes par @131a * //
translated: Because the faculties of the Listeners and the Rhinoceroses are fixed in regard to the purification dharmas.

original: byed pa'i dbang po ni mthong ba'i lam la'o //
analyzed: byed pa'i dbang po ni mthong ba'i lam la'o //
translated: The faculty of understanding what has not been understood is on the path of seeing.

original: kun shes pa'i dbang po ni gnyis ka la'o //
analyzed: kun shes pa'i dbang po ni gnyis ka la'o //
translated: The faculty of understanding is on both.

original: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po ni mi slob pa'i lam la'o //
analyzed: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po ni mi slob pa'i lam la'o //
translated: The faculty of the possession of understanding is on the path of no-more-learning.

original: snang ba med pa dregs pa 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam la de bzhin nyid ma gtogs par byang chub sems dpa' rnams la chos thams cad snang bar mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir snang ba med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: snang ba med pa dregs pa 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam la de bzhin nyid ma gtogs par byang chub sems dpa' rnams la chos thams cad snang bar mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir snang ba med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The path of insight is called “the absence of appearances” because, except for reality, all things do not appear to the bodhisattvas.

original: nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir dregs pa 'dul ba zhes bya'o //🔽rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir dregs pa 'dul ba zhes bya'o // rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa la /
translated: It is called “the subduing of pride” because it eliminates the afflictions.🔽The three meditative concentrations are called “with investigation and sustained thought,” etc.

original: ting nge 'dzin gsum ni sems kyi rgyu ba rags pa nyid dang / 'bring dang / phra mo rnams rtogs par bya ba'i phyir te /🔽rtog pa dang bcas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsum ni sems kyi rgyu ba rags pa nyid dang / 'bring dang / phra mo rnams rtogs par bya ba'i phyir te / rtog pa dang bcas shing /
translated: They are to be understood as the gross, medium, and subtle states of mental activity.

original: dpyod pa dang bcas pa ni chen po'o //🔽rtog pa med la dpyod pa dang bcas pa ni 'bring ngo //
analyzed: dpyod pa dang bcas pa ni chen po'o // rtog pa med la dpyod pa dang bcas pa ni 'bring ngo //
translated: The first is called “with investigation and sustained thought” because it has gross mental activity.🔽The second is called “without investigation, with only sustained thought” because it has medium mental activity.

original: rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa ni phra mo'o //
analyzed: rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa ni phra mo'o //
translated: The third is called “without investigation or sustained thought” because it has subtle mental activity.

original: rjes su dran pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa la sogs pa ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / bsdu ba dang / dbang thob par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba la sogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dran pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa la sogs pa ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / bsdu ba dang / dbang thob par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba la sogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The recollections, the meditative concentrations, the liberations, the dhyanas, the unlimiteds, etc., are for the sake of the purification of the Buddha-dharmas, etc.

original: de la tshad med pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la tshad med pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The four unlimiteds are

original: sems can tshad med pa la dmigs pa dang / tshogs tshad med pa'i rgyur gyur pa dang / chos tshad med pa thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa dang / ye shes tshad med pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa'i phyir tshad med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can tshad med pa la dmigs pa dang / tshogs tshad med pa'i rgyur gyur pa dang / chos tshad med pa thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa dang / ye shes tshad med pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa'i phyir tshad med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: unlimiteds because of the unlimited beings they take as objects, because they are the cause of the unlimited accumulations, because they are the cause of the attainment of the unlimited dharmas, and because they are the domain of the unlimited knowledge.

original: de la byams pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /🔽mos pas spyod pa'i sa la ni la byams pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la byams pa ni rnam pa gsum ste / mos pas spyod pa'i sa la ni la byams pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of love:🔽The love of the stage of action in faith takes as its object the beings of the desire realm.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The love of the stage of action in faith takes as its object the beings of the desire realm.

original: sa dang po nas sa bdun pa'i bar du ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sa dang po nas sa bdun pa'i bar du ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The love of the first stage up to the seventh stage takes suchness as its object.

original: sa brgyad pa yan chad ni dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa yan chad ni dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: On the eighth ground and above, it is non-apprehending.

original: snying rje la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: snying rje la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Compassion also has three types:

original: sems can sdug bsngal ba la dmigs pa dang / nyes par spyod pa mang ba'i sems can la dmigs pa dang / rkyen dang mi ldan pas rnam par ma grol ba'i sems can la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can sdug bsngal ba la dmigs pa dang / nyes par spyod pa mang ba'i sems can la dmigs pa dang / rkyen dang mi ldan pas rnam par ma grol ba'i sems can la dmigs pa'o //
translated: that which focuses on sentient beings who are suffering, that which focuses on sentient beings who engage in non-virtuous actions, and that which focuses on sentient beings who are not liberated due to not having the conditions.

original: dga' ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dga' ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Joy also has three types:

original: bde ba'i sems can la dmigs pa dang / bdag gi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa la dmigs pa dang / dam pa'i chos kyi ro myang ba la @131b dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i sems can la dmigs pa dang / bdag gi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa la dmigs pa dang / dam pa'i chos kyi ro myang ba la @131b dmigs pa'o //
translated: that which focuses on sentient beings who are happy, that which focuses on the completion of one’s own accumulations, and that which focuses on the experience of the taste of the sublime Dharma.

original: btang snyoms la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Equanimity also has three types:

original: sems can gyi don spyad pa dag la skal ba yod pa dang / skal ba med pa la dmigs pa dang / rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi chos rnams la mnyam pa nyid du dmigs pa dang / tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la dus dang dus ma yin pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don spyad pa dag la skal ba yod pa dang / skal ba med pa la dmigs pa dang / rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi chos rnams la mnyam pa nyid du dmigs pa dang / tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la dus dang dus ma yin pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The scope of the benefit of sentient beings, the scope of the mundane and supermundane dharmas, the scope of the equality of gain and loss, etc., the scope of the timely and untimely completion of the stores.

original: de la byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems zhes bya bas ni yon tan can bstan to //
analyzed: de la byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems zhes bya bas ni yon tan can bstan to //
translated: Here, the phrase “with a mind endowed with love” indicates the one who has the virtues.

original: yangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yon tan nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yon tan nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase “vast, exalted, and so on” indicates the virtues themselves.

original: yon tan can yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yon tan can yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The one who has the virtues is threefold:

original: che ba nyid dang / gcig pa'i bdag nyid dang / gnod pa spong ba'o //
analyzed: che ba nyid dang / gcig pa'i bdag nyid dang / gnod pa spong ba'o //
translated: great, of one nature, and free from harm.

original: che ba yang rnam pa gsum gyis bstan te /
analyzed: che ba yang rnam pa gsum gyis bstan te /
translated: The greatness is shown in three ways:

original: bsam pa dang / 'phel ba dang / dmigs pas so //
analyzed: bsam pa dang / 'phel ba dang / dmigs pas so //
translated: by intention, by increase, and by objective support.

original: de la bsam pas che ba ni yangs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de la bsam pas che ba ni yangs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Here, the greatness of intention is indicated by the word “vast.”

original: 'phel bas che ba ni rgya chen por gyur pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phel bas che ba ni rgya chen por gyur pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The greatness of increase is indicated by the word “exalted.”

original: dmigs pas che ba ni sems can tshad med pa la dmigs pa'i phyir tshad med pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pas che ba ni sems can tshad med pa la dmigs pa'i phyir tshad med pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The greatness of the object is that it is said to be immeasurable because it has immeasurable sentient beings as its object.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa dang / byams pa'i rnam par gcig pa'i phyir bdag nyid gcig pa ni mi gnyis pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa dang / byams pa'i rnam par gcig pa'i phyir bdag nyid gcig pa ni mi gnyis pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The sameness of self is said to be non-differentiation because it is the same in its aspect of love.

original: rnam par 'tshe ba'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir nang gi chos las gyur pa'i gnod pa med pa ni khon med pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir nang gi chos las gyur pa'i gnod pa med pa ni khon med pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The absence of internal harm that is a property of the inner self is said to be non-enmity because it is the antidote to harm.

original: phyi rol gyi sems can gyis byas pa'i gnod pa med pa ni 'gran zla med pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi sems can gyis byas pa'i gnod pa med pa ni 'gran zla med pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The absence of external harm that is done by sentient beings is said to be non-rivalry.

original: phyi rol dang 'du byed las gyur pa'i gnod pa med pa ni gnod pa med pa zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: phyi rol dang 'du byed las gyur pa'i gnod pa med pa ni gnod pa med pa zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: The absence of harm that is done by external conditions is said to be non-violence,

original: 'dod chags dang / dug dang / me la sogs pa'i gnod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / dug dang / me la sogs pa'i gnod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is free from the harm of attachment, poison, fire, and so on.

original: bsam gtan bzhi zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi zhes bya ba de la /
translated: The four concentrations are as follows.

original: 'dod pa dag las dben zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa dang / dngos po la 'dod pa dag las dben pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa dag las dben zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa dang / dngos po la 'dod pa dag las dben pa ste /
translated: The phrase detached from desires means detached from the desires of the passions and from the desires of things.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa las dben pa dang / dmigs pa las dben pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa las dben pa dang / dmigs pa las dben pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are detached from the passions and from the objective supports of the passions.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyod par gtogs pa /🔽chad pas gcod pa dang / mtshon gyis 'debs pa @132a * //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyod par gtogs pa / chad pas gcod pa dang / mtshon gyis 'debs pa @132a * //
translated: The phrase detached from evil and unwholesome states means detached from evil and unwholesome states of body, speech, and mind that arise from the causes of the desires of the passions.

original: dang / 'thab pa dang / rtsod pa dang / 'gyed pa dang / g-yo'i tshig dang / gnod pa dang / brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa de dag las dben pa'o //🔽rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa dag skyon du ma mthong bas /
analyzed: dang / 'thab pa dang / rtsod pa dang / 'gyed pa dang / g-yo'i tshig dang / gnod pa dang / brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa de dag las dben pa'o // rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa dag skyon du ma mthong bas /
translated: This is because they are detached from the evil and unwholesome states of killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, lying, slander, harsh speech, frivolous speech, covetousness, harmful intent, and wrong views.

original: 'dod pa'i gnyen po de gnyis dang mtshungs par ldan pa 'dod pa las dben pa'am /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i gnyen po de gnyis dang mtshungs par ldan pa 'dod pa las dben pa'am /
translated: The phrase detached from the passions means detached from the passions of the three realms.🔽The phrase detached from bad destinies means detached from the evil destinies of the hells, hungry ghosts, and animals.🔽 The phrase detached from the inferior attitude means detached from the inferior attitude of the disciples and solitary sages.🔽The phrase detached from conceptualization and analysis means detached from the two kinds of conceptualization.

original: sgrib pa las dben pa skyes pa'i phyir dben pa las skyes pa'o //🔽'dod pa'i don rnyed nas gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral bas lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs te /
analyzed: sgrib pa las dben pa skyes pa'i phyir dben pa las skyes pa'o // 'dod pa'i don rnyed nas gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral bas lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs te /
translated: It is born of seclusion because it is born from seclusion from the obscurations.

original: las su rung ba'i phyir dga' ba dang bde ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: las su rung ba'i phyir dga' ba dang bde ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Having attained the desired goal, it is endowed with joy and ease because the body and mind are well-developed, being free from all depravity.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas rnam par dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma dag la skyon du mthong nas de las sems bzlog te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas rnam par dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma dag la skyon du mthong nas de las sems bzlog te /
translated: In the second meditation, one sees the signs of concentration with initial and sustained thought as faults, and turns the mind away from them.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa dang rnam par dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma la sems nye bar 'dogs shing g-yeng bar spyod pa'i dmigs pa dang bral bar byas nas sems rtse gcig tu spyod pa'i dmigs pa la tshul gcig pas zhi ba dang
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa dang rnam par dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma la sems nye bar 'dogs shing g-yeng bar spyod pa'i dmigs pa dang bral bar byas nas sems rtse gcig tu spyod pa'i dmigs pa la tshul gcig pas zhi ba dang
translated: One fixes the mind on the signs of concentration without initial and sustained thought, and, free from the distraction of the objective mental orientation, one fixes the mind in a single area, with the mental orientation of the single area of the mind operating in a state of tranquility.

original: rab tu dang ba'i sems su 'jog go //
analyzed: rab tu dang ba'i sems su 'jog go //
translated: One fixes the mind in a state of faith.

original: de bas na de rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang bral zhing nang yongs su dang ste zhes bya ba gsungs so //🔽de de ltar sems nye bar 'jog pas rnam par rtog pa dang bcas /
analyzed: de bas na de rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang bral zhing nang yongs su dang ste zhes bya ba gsungs so // de de ltar sems nye bar 'jog pas rnam par rtog pa dang bcas /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “free from conception and investigation, internally clear.”

original: rnam par dpyod pa dang bcas pas glags dang bcas shing /
analyzed: rnam par dpyod pa dang bcas pas glags dang bcas shing /
translated: Thus, by settling the mind in this way, one transcends the stage that is accompanied by conceptualization and investigation, accompanied by an occasion, and accompanied by obstacles.

original: bar chad dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs las 'das nas bsgom pa goms pas glags med cing bar chad med pa'i gnas skabs thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bar chad dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs las 'das nas bsgom pa goms pas glags med cing bar chad med pa'i gnas skabs thob par 'gyur te /
translated: By cultivating meditation, one attains the stage that is free from an occasion and free from obstacles.

original: de bas na sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pa sa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pa sa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “the mindstream becomes one-pointed.”

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas shing rnam par dpyod pa dang bcas pa thams cad kyis thams cad du spangs pas rtog pa med pa dpyod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas shing rnam par dpyod pa dang bcas pa thams cad kyis thams cad du spangs pas rtog pa med pa dpyod pa med pa'o //
translated: Since all conceptualization and investigation are completely abandoned, there is no conception and no investigation.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa la /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa la /
translated: In the third meditative concentration,

original: de dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas btang snyoms la gnas shing dran pa dang / shes bzhin can yin te bde ba lus kyis myong la zhes bya ba la btang snyoms su gnas pa dang / bde ba myong ba dag 'gal lo snyam du sems pa la /🔽de gnyis mi 'gal bar sgrub @132b ba ston te /🔽bsam gtan pa de rnam par rtog pa dang bcas /
analyzed: de dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas btang snyoms la gnas shing dran pa dang / shes bzhin can yin te bde ba lus kyis myong la zhes bya ba la btang snyoms su gnas pa dang / bde ba myong ba dag 'gal lo snyam du sems pa la / de gnyis mi 'gal bar sgrub @132b ba ston te / bsam gtan pa de rnam par rtog pa dang bcas /
translated: He is equanimous, mindful, and alert, and he experiences bodily pleasure.🔽He is equanimous, mindful, and alert, and he experiences bodily pleasure.🔽He is equanimous, mindful, and alert, and he experiences bodily pleasure.🔽He is equanimous, mindful, and alert, and he experiences bodily pleasure.🔽He is equanimous, mindful, and alert, and he experiences bodily pleasure.

original: rnam par dpyod pa dang bcas pa de dag dang / dga' ba yang spangs pas /
analyzed: rnam par dpyod pa dang bcas pa de dag dang / dga' ba yang spangs pas /
translated: He is equanimous, mindful, and alert, and he experiences bodily pleasure.🔽He is equanimous, mindful, and alert, and he experiences bodily pleasure.🔽He is equanimous, mindful, and alert, and he experiences bodily pleasure.🔽He is equanimous, mindful, and alert, and he experiences bodily pleasure.🔽He is equanimous, mindful, and alert, and he experiences bodily pleasure.🔽He is equanimous, mindful, and alert, and he experiences bodily pleasure.🔽He is equanimous, mindful, and alert, and he experiences bodily pleasure.🔽He is equanimous, mindful, and alert, and he experiences bodily pleasure.🔽He is equanimous, mindful, and alert, and he experiences bodily pleasure.🔽He is equanimous, mindful, and alert, and he experiences bodily pleasure.🔽He is equanimous, mindful, and alert, and he experiences bodily pleasure.🔽He is equanimous, mindful, and alert, and he experiences bodily pleasure.🔽He is equanimous, mindful, and alert, and he experiences bodily pleasure.🔽He is equanimous, mindful, and alert, and he experiences bodily pleasure.

original: bar chad med par btang snyoms dang ldan par gnas so //
analyzed: bar chad med par btang snyoms dang ldan par gnas so //
translated: He is equanimous, mindful, and alert, and he experiences bodily pleasure.🔽He is equanimous, mindful, and alert, and he experiences bodily pleasure.🔽He is equanimous, mindful, and alert, and he experiences bodily pleasure.🔽He is equanimous, mindful, and alert, and he experiences bodily pleasure.🔽He is equanimous, mindful, and alert, and he experiences bodily pleasure.🔽He is equanimous, mindful, and alert, and he experiences bodily pleasure.

original: de yang dga' ba dang ldan pa'i 'du shes yid la byed pa rnams kyi go skabs mi dbye ba'i phyir dran pa nye bar gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang dga' ba dang ldan pa'i 'du shes yid la byed pa rnams kyi go skabs mi dbye ba'i phyir dran pa nye bar gnas pa yin no //
translated: He is equanimous, mindful, and alert, and he experiences bodily pleasure.

original: skyes pa rnams kyang nam yang ji ltar yang dang yang du mi blang ba'i phyir shes rab kyis mang du gnas so //
analyzed: skyes pa rnams kyang nam yang ji ltar yang dang yang du mi blang ba'i phyir shes rab kyis mang du gnas so //
translated: He is

original: de bas na dran pa dang ldan zhing shes bzhin can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na dran pa dang ldan zhing shes bzhin can zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “endowed with mindfulness and introspection.”

original: de ltar btang snyoms la mang du gnas pa de sems g-yeng bar byed pa'i dga' ba dang ldan pa'i tshor ba spangs nas /
analyzed: de ltar btang snyoms la mang du gnas pa de sems g-yeng bar byed pa'i dga' ba dang ldan pa'i tshor ba spangs nas /
translated: Thus, when one who has often practiced equanimity abandons the feeling that is associated with the delight that causes distraction,

original: dga' ba med pa zhi ba rab tu zhi ba'i tshor ba skye ste /
analyzed: dga' ba med pa zhi ba rab tu zhi ba'i tshor ba skye ste /
translated: the feeling that is free from delight, peaceful, and very peaceful arises.

original: de yang de'i tshe gzugs kyi lus dang / yid kyi lus kyi tshor ba'i bde ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde ba myong bar byed do //
analyzed: de yang de'i tshe gzugs kyi lus dang / yid kyi lus kyi tshor ba'i bde ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde ba myong bar byed do //
translated: At that time, one experiences the pleasure of the physical body and the pleasure of the mental body, as well as the pleasure of pliancy.

original: de bas na bde ba lus kyis myong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na bde ba lus kyis myong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “the experience of pleasure with the body.”🔽The noble ones call it “the equanimity of one who is mindful and who abides in pleasure.”

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis gang de dran pa dang ldan pa bde ba la gnas pa btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod pa ste zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan 'og ma gnyis la de lta bu'i bde ba dang / btang snyoms med do //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis gang de dran pa dang ldan pa bde ba la gnas pa btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod pa ste zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan 'og ma gnyis la de lta bu'i bde ba dang / btang snyoms med do //
translated: In the first two meditative concentrations, there is no such pleasure and equanimity.

original: gong ma la ni btang snyoms yod la bde ba med do //
analyzed: gong ma la ni btang snyoms yod la bde ba med do //
translated: In the higher ones, there is equanimity but not pleasure.

original: de bas na bsam gtan gsum pa 'di nyid bde ba dang btang snyoms kyi gnas yin pas 'phags pa sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams kyis bsam gtan pa 'di nyid la btang snyoms pa /
analyzed: de bas na bsam gtan gsum pa 'di nyid bde ba dang btang snyoms kyi gnas yin pas 'phags pa sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams kyis bsam gtan pa 'di nyid la btang snyoms pa /
translated: The noble buddhas and the śrāvakas of the buddhas, who are meditators, are said to be primarily those who abide in equanimity

original: bde ba la gnas pa /
analyzed: bde ba la gnas pa /
translated: and pleasure

original: dran pa dang ldan pa'o zhes gtso bor gsungs so //
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan pa'o zhes gtso bor gsungs so //
translated: and are endowed with mindfulness.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa la bde ba yang spangs zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa dang ldan pa'i bde ba bsam gtan bzhi pa 'dis spangs par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa la bde ba yang spangs zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa dang ldan pa'i bde ba bsam gtan bzhi pa 'dis spangs par bstan pa'o //
translated: In the fourth concentration, pleasure is also abandoned means that the pleasure associated with the third concentration is abandoned by this fourth concentration.

original: snga nas sdug bsngal yang spangs zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pas spangs pa yang bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: snga nas sdug bsngal yang spangs zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pas spangs pa yang bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: Previously, suffering is also abandoned means that what is abandoned by the second concentration is also included and taught.

original: snga nas zhes bya ba dang / yid bde ba nub pas zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa la dga' ba spangs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: snga nas zhes bya ba dang / yid bde ba nub pas zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa la dga' ba spangs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: Previously and the subsiding of mental pleasure means that joy is abandoned in the third concentration.

original: yid mi bde ba nub pas zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pas spangs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba nub pas zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pas spangs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase “because mental dissatisfaction has been eliminated” indicates the elimination of the second meditative absorption.

original: btang snyoms dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin rnams 'dir shin tu rnam par dag pa thob pa'i phyir @133a * //🔽sngar spangs pa rnams kyang 'dir bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin rnams 'dir shin tu rnam par dag pa thob pa'i phyir @133a * // sngar spangs pa rnams kyang 'dir bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase “equanimity, mindfulness, and introspection” indicates that the third meditative absorption is attained by the purification of these three mental factors.🔽The phrase “the elimination of the four types of mental activity” indicates that the fourth meditative absorption is attained by the elimination of the four types of mental activity.🔽The phrase “the attainment of the fourth meditative absorption” indicates the elimination of the four types of mental activity.
