original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bstan pa la /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bstan pa la /
translated: The phrase “the attainment

original: de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' lta bur mos pa spel bas sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i kha dog gi 'du shes kyis skyo zhing 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dbang gis med par gyur pa bstan to //
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' lta bur mos pa spel bas sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i kha dog gi 'du shes kyis skyo zhing 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dbang gis med par gyur pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase he has completely transcended the perceptions of form indicates that, by expanding his conviction that [the deity's form] is like space, he has become disenchanted with and freed from attachment to the perceptions of color such as blue, yellow, red, white, and so forth.

original: de bas na nam mkha' lta bur mos pa bsgom pa goms pas /🔽gzugs kyi 'du shes de dag las yang dag par 'das pas kha dog rnam pa du ma brtsegs pa'i rgyu las byung ba /🔽ka ba dang / rtsig pa dang / shing leb la sogs pa sgrib pa'i 'du shes gang yin pa de dag thams cad snang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na nam mkha' lta bur mos pa bsgom pa goms pas / gzugs kyi 'du shes de dag las yang dag par 'das pas kha dog rnam pa du ma brtsegs pa'i rgyu las byung ba / ka ba dang / rtsig pa dang / shing leb la sogs pa sgrib pa'i 'du shes gang yin pa de dag thams cad snang bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, by cultivating the conviction that [the deity's form] is like space, he has completely transcended the perceptions of form.🔽 The phrase the perceptions of obstruction refers to the perceptions that arise from the causes of the various colors that are stacked up, such as pillars, walls, planks of wood, and so forth.

original: de bas na thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: All of these do not appear to him, and therefore it is said that the perceptions of obstruction have disappeared.

original: de dag med par gyur pas gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs mang po la zhugs pa bza' ba dang btung ba dang / bzhon pa dang / gos dang / rgyan dang / khyim dang / skyed mos tshal dang ri la sogs pa'i 'du shes sna tshogs gang yin pa de dag la rtsol ba mi 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag med par gyur pas gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs mang po la zhugs pa bza' ba dang btung ba dang / bzhon pa dang / gos dang / rgyan dang / khyim dang / skyed mos tshal dang ri la sogs pa'i 'du shes sna tshogs gang yin pa de dag la rtsol ba mi 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: Since those do not exist, one does not engage in the effort of various kinds of perceptions of many kinds of forms, such as food and drink, vehicles, clothes, ornaments, houses, gardens, mountains, and so on.

original: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore it is said, “one does not pay attention to various kinds of perceptions.”

original: gzugs la dmigs pa'i 'du shes de dag thams cad rnam par bshig pas nam mkha' mtha' yas pa'i rnam par mos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs la dmigs pa'i 'du shes de dag thams cad rnam par bshig pas nam mkha' mtha' yas pa'i rnam par mos par 'gyur te /
translated: Since all those perceptions that focus on form are destroyed, one becomes absorbed in the sphere of infinite space.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore it is said,

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: “thinking ‘space is infinite,’ one achieves and remains in the sphere of infinite space.”

original: de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par te rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so snyam nas zhes bya ba ni de rnam par shes pa gang gis nam mkha' mtha' yas par mos pa'i rnam par shes pa nam mkha' @133b
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par te rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so snyam nas zhes bya ba ni de rnam par shes pa gang gis nam mkha' mtha' yas par mos pa'i rnam par shes pa nam mkha' @133b
translated: In every way, they are completely free from the sphere of infinite space, thinking, Consciousness is infinite.

original: mtha' yas pa'i rnam par mos pa de nyid mtha' yas pa nyid du bzung ste /
analyzed: mtha' yas pa'i rnam par mos pa de nyid mtha' yas pa nyid du bzung ste /
translated: They apprehend the very same infinite space that they are devoted to through consciousness as infinite.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la snyoms par 'jug par 'dod nas /
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la snyoms par 'jug par 'dod nas /
translated: They wish to enter the meditative absorption of the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi 'du shes rnam par bzlog ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi 'du shes rnam par bzlog ste /
translated: They reverse the ideation of the sphere of infinite space.

original: rnam par shes pa nyid mtha' yas pa'i rnam par mos par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid mtha' yas pa'i rnam par mos par byed do //
translated: They are devoted to the very same infinite consciousness.

original: de bas na rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so snyam nas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so snyam nas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, they think, Consciousness is infinite.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te zhes bya ba ni des rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las bskyod de rnam par shes pa las gud na dmigs pa gzhan btsal na gzugs can nam /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te zhes bya ba ni des rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las bskyod de rnam par shes pa las gud na dmigs pa gzhan btsal na gzugs can nam /
translated: That is completely transcending the sphere of infinite consciousness is that it moves beyond the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: gzugs med pa ci yang ma rnyed do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa ci yang ma rnyed do //
translated: If one searches for an object that is different from consciousness, one does not find anything at all, whether it is material or not.

original: des dmigs pa de ma rnyed pas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: des dmigs pa de ma rnyed pas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: Since one does not find that object, one completely transcends the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched nyid la dmigs nas mos shing bsgoms te snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched nyid la dmigs nas mos shing bsgoms te snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: One focuses on the sphere of nothingness itself, is intent on it, cultivates it, and enters into it.

original: de bas na ci yang med do snyam nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na ci yang med do snyam nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, thinking “there is nothing at all,” one completes the sphere of nothingness and abides in it.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du ci yang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das zhes bya ba ni des ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'du shes de la rags pa'i nyes dmigs su mthong nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'du shes las rnam🔽par bzlog go //
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du ci yang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das zhes bya ba ni des ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'du shes de la rags pa'i nyes dmigs su mthong nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'du shes las rnam par bzlog go //
translated: The phrase they completely transcend the sense field of nothing whatsoever means that they see the notion of the sense field of nothing whatsoever as a coarse and disadvantageous state and they turn away from the notion of the sense field of nothing whatsoever.

original: des sngar ci yang med pa'i skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus na ci zhig yod pa'i 'du shes rnam par bzlog go //
analyzed: des sngar ci yang med pa'i skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus na ci zhig yod pa'i 'du shes rnam par bzlog go //
translated: Previously, when they entered meditative absorption in the sense field of nothing whatsoever, they turned away from the notion of something existing.

original: da ni ci yang med pa'i 'du shes las rnam par bzlog pas des na 'du shes med ces bya ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: da ni ci yang med pa'i 'du shes las rnam par bzlog pas des na 'du shes med ces bya ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: Now, they turn away from the notion of nothing whatsoever. Therefore, it is called the absence of notion.

original: sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ltar 'du shes thams cad kyi thams cad du 'gags pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ltar 'du shes thams cad kyi thams cad du 'gags pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that all notions have ceased, as in the meditative absorption of non-notion.

original: shin tu phra ba'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes gang yin pa de 'byung ste /
analyzed: shin tu phra ba'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes gang yin pa de 'byung ste /
translated: However, because it is extremely subtle, the notion of signlessness occurs.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: 'du shes med min zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'du shes med min zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: it is called neither notion nor non-notion.

original: rnam par thar pa bstan pa la /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa bstan pa la /
translated: The teaching of the liberations

original: gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba zhes bya ba ni nang gi gzugs la dmigs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa'i phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la dmigs nas snyoms par 'jug ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba zhes bya ba ni nang gi gzugs la dmigs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa'i phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la dmigs nas snyoms par 'jug ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The first liberation is called “having form, one sees forms.” This means that one who has attained meditative concentration that focuses on internal form focuses on external forms and enters meditative concentration.

original: 'di la yang rnam par thar pa snga ma gnyis @134a * //
analyzed: 'di la yang rnam par thar pa snga ma gnyis @134a * //
translated: Here, the first two liberations

original: ni mi sdug pa nyid de /
analyzed: ni mi sdug pa nyid de /
translated: are simply the meditation on foulness.

original: de dag kyang bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: They are also the natures of the first and second absorptions.

original: rnam par thar pa gsum pa ni bsam gtan bzhi ba'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa gsum pa ni bsam gtan bzhi ba'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The third liberation is the nature of the fourth absorption.

original: de yang chags pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: de yang chags pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes 'chad do //
translated: It is also explained as being the nature of nonattachment.

original: 'di la yang bsam gtan dang po 'dod pa na spyod pa'i kha dog la 'dod chags pa'i gnyen por nang gi skra la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs nas de'i 'og tu phyi rol gyi rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa
analyzed: 'di la yang bsam gtan dang po 'dod pa na spyod pa'i kha dog la 'dod chags pa'i gnyen por nang gi skra la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs nas de'i 'og tu phyi rol gyi rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa
translated: Here, the first absorption is the antidote to attachment to the colors of the desire realm. Having entered meditative concentration that focuses on internal hair and so on, one then focuses on external forms that are blue and so on.

original: la dmigs te /
analyzed: la dmigs te /
translated: and focuses on the color of the first absorption.

original: bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa na gzugs can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa na gzugs can zhes bya'o //
translated: When one enters meditative attainment of the first absorption, it is called form.

original: de bzhin bstan gtan dang po'i sa pa'i kha dog la 'dod chags pa'i gnyen por bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par 'jug pa na yang gzugs can gzugs rnam la lta ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin bstan gtan dang po'i sa pa'i kha dog la 'dod chags pa'i gnyen por bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par 'jug pa na yang gzugs can gzugs rnam la lta ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Similarly, when one enters meditative attainment of the second absorption in order to remedy attachment to the color of the first absorption level, it is called one who views forms externally.

original: nang gi gzugs la dmigs pa'i dbang gis ni gzugs can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nang gi gzugs la dmigs pa'i dbang gis ni gzugs can zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called form because it focuses on internal form.

original: phyi rol gyi gzugs la dmigs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i dbang gis ni gzugs rnams la lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi gzugs la dmigs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i dbang gis ni gzugs rnams la lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called one who views forms externally because it is meditative attainment that focuses on external form.

original: 'dir yang snyoms par 'jug pa'i dbang gis gzugs la lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang snyoms par 'jug pa'i dbang gis gzugs la lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, it is called one who views forms because it is meditative attainment.🔽The second is called one who has the internal ideation of formlessness and views external forms.

original: gnyis pa la nang gzugs med par 'du shes pa phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor spyod pa la la nang gi skra la sogs pa dmigs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa la nang gzugs med par 'du shes pa phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor spyod pa la la nang gi skra la sogs pa dmigs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par mi 'jug ste /
translated: Some yogis do not enter meditative attainment that focuses on internal hair and so on.

original: phyi rol gyi rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa dmigs pa na 'dod pa na spyod pa'i kha dog la 'dod chags pa la sogs pa'i gnyen por bsam gtan dang po'am /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa dmigs pa na 'dod pa na spyod pa'i kha dog la 'dod chags pa la sogs pa'i gnyen por bsam gtan dang po'am /
translated: When one focuses on external forms such as blue, one enters the second meditative absorption in order to counteract attachment to the colors of the desire realm.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i kha dog la 'dod chags pa la sogs pa'i gnyen por bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i kha dog la 'dod chags pa la sogs pa'i gnyen por bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Or, when one focuses on the colors of the first meditative absorption, one enters the second meditative absorption in order to counteract attachment to those colors.

original: sdug par mos pa zhes bya ba 'di ni sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa'o //
analyzed: sdug par mos pa zhes bya ba 'di ni sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa'o //
translated: The phrase “one who is devoted to beauty” refers to the liberation of beauty.

original: mi sdug pa'i rnam par bsgoms pas sems kyi rgyud zhum pa dga' bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: mi sdug pa'i rnam par bsgoms pas sems kyi rgyud zhum pa dga' bar bya ba'am /
translated: One cultivates this meditative absorption in order to delight the mind that has become weary through cultivating the meditation on foulness.

original: ci bdag yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs rnams sdug pa nyid du yid la byed na kha dog la 'dod chags pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis sems kyi rgyud gzhan du 'gyur ram /🔽'on te mi 'gyur zhes sad pa'i phyir de bsgom ste /
analyzed: ci bdag yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs rnams sdug pa nyid du yid la byed na kha dog la 'dod chags pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis sems kyi rgyud gzhan du 'gyur ram / 'on te mi 'gyur zhes sad pa'i phyir de bsgom ste /
translated: Or, one cultivates this meditative absorption in order to determine whether the mind will be diverted to other objects by the power of attachment to color, etc., when one turns one’s attention to beautiful forms.

original: yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs nas /
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs nas /
translated: One cultivates this meditative absorption in order to determine whether the mind will be diverted to other objects by the power of attachment to color, etc., when one turns one’s attention to beautiful forms.🔽One cultivates this meditative absorption in order to determine whether the mind will be diverted to other objects by the power of attachment to color, etc., when one turns one’s attention to beautiful forms.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par 'jug pa na sdug par mos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par 'jug pa na sdug par mos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one enters the fourth meditation, it is called the “beautiful” meditation.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad @134b cig la sdug pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa med du zin kyang sngon du 'jug pa'i dbang gis de skad bya'o zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad @134b cig la sdug pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa med du zin kyang sngon du 'jug pa'i dbang gis de skad bya'o zhes 'chad do //
translated: Even though there is no longer any discursive thought of beauty, etc., in the moment of entry into meditation, nevertheless, one can say that the meditation is beautiful because of the force of its prior cultivation.

original: gzugs med pa'i rnam par thar pa rnams ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i rnam par thar pa rnams ni bshad zin to //
translated: The liberations of the formless realm have already been explained.

original: bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa brgyad dang / 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'o /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa brgyad dang / 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'o /
translated: The eight liberations of the formless realm and the cessation of ideation and sensation are the nine serial absorptions.

original: // / bam po bcu gsum pa /
analyzed: // / bam po bcu gsum pa /
translated: The Ten Powers of the Tathāgatas

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu ste zhes bya ba la gnas la yang gnas su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu ste zhes bya ba la gnas la yang gnas su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: The ten powers of the Tathāgatas.

original: gnas ma yin pa la yang gnas ma yin par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba de la gnas ni gang /
analyzed: gnas ma yin pa la yang gnas ma yin par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba de la gnas ni gang /
translated: Here, what is a real fact? What is not a real fact?

original: gnas ma yin pa ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas ma yin pa ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is a real fact?

original: nyes par spyod pa rnams kyi rnam par smin pa yid du mi 'ong ba ni gnas so //
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa rnams kyi rnam par smin pa yid du mi 'ong ba ni gnas so //
translated: The unpleasant ripening of evil actions is possible.

original: rnam par smin pa yid du mi 'ong ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa yid du mi 'ong ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: The unpleasant ripening of good actions is impossible.

original: legs par spyod pa rnams kyi rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba ni gnas so //
analyzed: legs par spyod pa rnams kyi rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba ni gnas so //
translated: The pleasant ripening of good actions is possible.

original: rnam par smin pa yid du mi 'ong ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa yid du mi 'ong ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: The pleasant ripening of evil actions is impossible.

original: ser snas dbul por 'gyur ba ni gnas so //
analyzed: ser snas dbul por 'gyur ba ni gnas so //
translated: The poverty of the miser is possible.

original: longs spyod chen por 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod chen por 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: The great wealth of the miser is impossible.

original: sbyin pas longs spyod chen por 'gyur ba ni gnas so //
analyzed: sbyin pas longs spyod chen por 'gyur ba ni gnas so //
translated: The great wealth of the generous person is possible.

original: dbul por 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //🔽'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyis ngan 'gror skye ba ni gnas so //
analyzed: dbul por 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o // 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyis ngan 'gror skye ba ni gnas so //
translated: The poverty of the generous person is impossible.🔽The bad destiny of the immoral person is possible.

original: bde 'gror skye ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde 'gror skye ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: The good destiny of the immoral person is impossible.

original: tshul khrims kyis bde 'gror skye ba ni gnas so //🔽ngan 'gror skye ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis bde 'gror skye ba ni gnas so // ngan 'gror skye ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: The good destiny of the moral person is possible.🔽The bad destiny of the moral person is impossible.

original: gnod sems kyis gzugs mi sdug bar 'gyur ba ni gnas so //
analyzed: gnod sems kyis gzugs mi sdug bar 'gyur ba ni gnas so //
translated: The ugly form of the malicious person is possible.

original: gzugs bzang por 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs bzang por 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is impossible that a person of good appearance should be reborn in an unfortunate realm.

original: bzod pas gzugs mdzes par 'gyur ba ni gnas so //
analyzed: bzod pas gzugs mdzes par 'gyur ba ni gnas so //
translated: It is possible that a patient person should be ugly.

original: gzugs mi sdug par 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //🔽le los mngon par rtogs par mi 'gyur ba ni gnas so //
analyzed: gzugs mi sdug par 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o // le los mngon par rtogs par mi 'gyur ba ni gnas so //
translated: It is impossible that an ugly person should be reborn in an unfortunate realm.🔽It is possible that a lazy person should not attain comprehension.

original: mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is impossible that a lazy person should attain comprehension.

original: brtson 'grus kyis bden pa mngon par rtogs pa ni gnas so //🔽mngon par rtogs par mi 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //🔽rnam par g-yeng bas skyon med pa la mi 'jug pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis bden pa mngon par rtogs pa ni gnas so // mngon par rtogs par mi 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o // rnam par g-yeng bas skyon med pa la mi 'jug pa ni gnas so //
translated: It is possible that a person of energy should attain comprehension of the truth.🔽It is impossible that a person of energy should not attain comprehension of the truth.🔽It is possible that a distracted person should not enter the certainty of perfection.

original: skyon med pa la 'jug pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: skyon med pa la 'jug pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is impossible that a distracted person should enter the certainty of perfection.

original: bsam gtan gyis yang dag pa nyid la 'jug pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis yang dag pa nyid la 'jug pa ni gnas so //
translated: It is possible that a person of meditation should enter the truth.

original: mi 'jug pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //🔽'chal @135a * //🔽ba'i shes rab kyis byang chub 'thob pa med pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: mi 'jug pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o // 'chal @135a * // ba'i shes rab kyis byang chub 'thob pa med pa ni gnas so //
translated: It is impossible that a person of meditation should not enter the truth.🔽It is possible that a person of bad understanding should not attain enlightenment.

original: byang chub 'thob pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub 'thob pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is impossible that a person of bad understanding should attain enlightenment.

original: shes rab kyis byang chub thob pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: shes rab kyis byang chub thob pa ni gnas so //
translated: It is possible to attain enlightenment through wisdom.

original: mi 'thob pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'thob pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is impossible not to attain it.

original: srog gcod pas tshe thung bar 'gyur ba ni gnas so //
analyzed: srog gcod pas tshe thung bar 'gyur ba ni gnas so //
translated: It is possible that one who kills will have a short life.

original: tshe ring por 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: tshe ring por 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is impossible that one will have a long life.

original: de spangs pas tshe ring por 'gyur ba ni gnas so //
analyzed: de spangs pas tshe ring por 'gyur ba ni gnas so //
translated: It is possible that one who abstains from killing will have a long life.

original: tshe thung bar 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: tshe thung bar 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is impossible that one will have a short life.

original: ma byin par len pas longs spyod chen po 'thob pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma byin par len pas longs spyod chen po 'thob pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is impossible that one who steals will obtain great wealth.

original: dbul por 'gyur ba ni gnas so //
analyzed: dbul por 'gyur ba ni gnas so //
translated: It is possible that one will be poor.

original: de spangs pas longs spyod 'thob pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: de spangs pas longs spyod 'thob pa ni gnas so //
translated: It is possible that one who abstains from stealing will obtain wealth.

original: dbul por 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dbul por 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is impossible that one will be poor.

original: 'dod pa la log par g-yem pas 'gran zla dang bcas pa'i chung ma rnyed pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: 'dod pa la log par g-yem pas 'gran zla dang bcas pa'i chung ma rnyed pa ni gnas so //
translated: It is possible that one who engages in sexual misconduct will obtain a spouse who is shared with others.

original: 'gran zla med pa'i chung ma rnyed pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'gran zla med pa'i chung ma rnyed pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is impossible that one will obtain a spouse who is not shared with others.

original: de spangs pas 'gran zla med pa'i chung ma rnyed pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: de spangs pas 'gran zla med pa'i chung ma rnyed pa ni gnas so //
translated: It is possible that one who abstains from sexual misconduct will obtain a spouse who is not shared with others.

original: 'gran zla dang bcas pa'i chung ma rnyed pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'gran zla dang bcas pa'i chung ma rnyed pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: To find a wife who is a rival is impossible.

original: brdzun du smra bas skur pa 'debs pa thob pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: brdzun du smra bas skur pa 'debs pa thob pa ni gnas so //
translated: To obtain slander by lying is possible.

original: de mi 'thob pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de mi 'thob pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: Not to obtain it is impossible.

original: de spangs pas de mi 'thob pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: de spangs pas de mi 'thob pa ni gnas so //
translated: To not obtain it by abandoning it is possible.

original: de 'thob pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de 'thob pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: To obtain it is impossible.

original: phra mas 'khor mi phyed pa mi rnyed pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: phra mas 'khor mi phyed pa mi rnyed pa ni gnas so //
translated: To not find an undivided retinue by divisive speech is possible.

original: rnyed pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: To find it is impossible.

original: de spangs pas 'khor mi phyed pa rnyed pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: de spangs pas 'khor mi phyed pa rnyed pa ni gnas so //
translated: To find an undivided retinue by abandoning it is possible.

original: mi rnyed pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi rnyed pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: Not to find it is impossible.

original: tshig rtsub pos rtag par mi snyan pa thos pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: tshig rtsub pos rtag par mi snyan pa thos pa ni gnas so //
translated: To always hear unpleasant words by harsh speech is possible.

original: mi thos pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi thos pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: Not to hear it is impossible.

original: de spangs pas rtag tu snyan pa thos pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: de spangs pas rtag tu snyan pa thos pa ni gnas so //
translated: To always hear pleasant words by abandoning it is possible.

original: mi thos pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //🔽tshig 'khyal pas tshig btsun par mi 'gyur ba ni gnas so //
analyzed: mi thos pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o // tshig 'khyal pas tshig btsun par mi 'gyur ba ni gnas so //
translated: Not to hear it is impossible.🔽To not become one whose words are respected by idle speech is possible.

original: tshig btsun par 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: tshig btsun par 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: To become one whose words are respected is impossible.

original: de spangs pas tshig btsun par 'gyur ba ni gnas so //
analyzed: de spangs pas tshig btsun par 'gyur ba ni gnas so //
translated: It is possible that by abandoning it, one will have pure speech.

original: tshig btsun par mi 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: tshig btsun par mi 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is impossible that one will not have pure speech.

original: brnab sems kyis longs spyod rnam par 'jig pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: brnab sems kyis longs spyod rnam par 'jig pa ni gnas so //
translated: It is possible that covetousness will destroy one’s wealth.

original: rnam par mi 'jig pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi 'jig pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is impossible that it will not destroy one’s wealth.

original: gnod sems kyis sems can dmyal bar 'gro ba ni gnas so //
analyzed: gnod sems kyis sems can dmyal bar 'gro ba ni gnas so //
translated: It is possible that ill will will lead to rebirth in the hells.

original: bde 'gror 'gro ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde 'gror 'gro ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is impossible that it will lead to happy rebirths.

original: de spangs pas bde 'gror 'gro ba ni gnas so //
analyzed: de spangs pas bde 'gror 'gro ba ni gnas so //
translated: It is possible that by abandoning it, one will go to happy rebirths.

original: log par lta bas 'phags pa'i lam thob par mi 'gyur ba ni @135b gnas so //
analyzed: log par lta bas 'phags pa'i lam thob par mi 'gyur ba ni @135b gnas so //
translated: It is possible that wrong views will prevent one from attaining the noble path.

original: 'thob pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'thob pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is impossible that they will lead to its attainment.

original: yang dag pa'i lta bas 'phags pa'i lam 'thob pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta bas 'phags pa'i lam 'thob pa ni gnas so //
translated: It is possible that right views will lead to the attainment of the noble path.

original: mi 'thob pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'thob pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is impossible that they will not lead to its attainment.

original: mtshams med pa byed pas ting nge 'dzin rnams mi 'thob pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: mtshams med pa byed pas ting nge 'dzin rnams mi 'thob pa ni gnas so //
translated: It is possible that one who commits the actions of immediate retribution will not attain the meditative absorptions.

original: 'thob pa ni gnas ma yin pa'i //
analyzed: 'thob pa ni gnas ma yin pa'i //
translated: It is impossible that one who possesses moral discipline will not attain them.

original: tshul khrims dang / ldan pas 'thob pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / ldan pas 'thob pa ni gnas so //
translated: It is possible that one who possesses moral discipline will attain them.

original: mi 'thob pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'thob pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is impossible not to obtain it.

original: dmigs pa'i lta bas rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa mi 'thob pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i lta bas rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa mi 'thob pa ni gnas so //
translated: It is impossible for one who has a view of an object to obtain the acquiescence of nonproduction.

original: 'thob pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'thob pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is possible to obtain it.

original: stong pa nyid la gnas pas rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa 'thob pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la gnas pas rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa 'thob pa ni gnas so //
translated: It is possible for one who abides in emptiness to obtain the acquiescence of nonproduction.

original: mi 'thob pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'thob pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is impossible not to obtain it.

original: 'gyod pa dang ldan pas sems g-yeng ba ni gnas so //
analyzed: 'gyod pa dang ldan pas sems g-yeng ba ni gnas so //
translated: It is possible for one who has regret to have a distracted mind.

original: sems shin tu sbyangs par 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems shin tu sbyangs par 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is impossible for one to have a pliant mind.

original: 'gyod pa med pas sems shin tu sbyangs par 'gyur ba ni gnas so //
analyzed: 'gyod pa med pas sems shin tu sbyangs par 'gyur ba ni gnas so //
translated: It is possible for one who is without regret to have a pliant mind.

original: g-yeng bar 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //🔽gang bud med 'khor los sgyur ba'am /🔽brgya byin nam /
analyzed: g-yeng bar 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o // gang bud med 'khor los sgyur ba'am / brgya byin nam /
translated: It is impossible to have a distracted mind.🔽It is impossible for a woman to become a universal monarch,

original: tshangs pa 'am /🔽dbang sgyur ram /
analyzed: tshangs pa 'am / dbang sgyur ram /
translated: Śakra,🔽Brahmā,🔽a powerful lord,

original: sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: or a buddha.

original: gang skyes pas de dag tu 'gyur ba ni gnas so //
analyzed: gang skyes pas de dag tu 'gyur ba ni gnas so //
translated: It is possible for a man to become these.

original: gang brgyad pa'i gang zag rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ma thob par stan las ldang ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang brgyad pa'i gang zag rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ma thob par stan las ldang ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is impossible for a person in the eighth stage to rise from his seat without having attained the fruit of stream-entry.

original: gang rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob nas ldang ba ni gnas so //
analyzed: gang rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob nas ldang ba ni gnas so //
translated: It is possible for one who has attained the fruit of stream-entry to rise from his seat.

original: gang rgyun tu zhugs pa'i srid pa brgyad pa len pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang rgyun tu zhugs pa'i srid pa brgyad pa len pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is impossible for a stream-enterer to take up an eighth existence.

original: gang mi len pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: gang mi len pa ni gnas so //
translated: It is possible not to take it up.

original: gang lan cig phyir 'ong ba srid pa gsum pa len pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang lan cig phyir 'ong ba srid pa gsum pa len pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is impossible for a once-returner to take up a third existence.

original: gang mi len pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: gang mi len pa ni gnas so //
translated: It is possible not to take it up.

original: gang phyir mi 'ong ba 'jig rten 'dir 'ong ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang phyir mi 'ong ba 'jig rten 'dir 'ong ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is impossible for a non-returner to come back to this world.

original: gang phyir mi 'ong ba ni gnas so //
analyzed: gang phyir mi 'ong ba ni gnas so //
translated: It is possible for a non-returner.

original: gang dgra bcom pa las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis nying mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang dgra bcom pa las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis nying mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is impossible for an arhat to take rebirth through the power of karma and afflictions.

original: gang mi 'gyur ba ni gnas so //
analyzed: gang mi 'gyur ba ni gnas so //
translated: It is possible not to take rebirth.

original: gang 'phags pa'i gang zag ston pa gzhan tshol ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'phags pa'i gang zag ston pa gzhan tshol ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is impossible for an arhat to seek another teacher.

original: gang mi tshol ba ni gnas so //
analyzed: gang mi tshol ba ni gnas so //
translated: The non-investigation of anything is a bodhisattva’s resting place.

original: gang mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' phyir mi ldog pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: gang mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' phyir mi ldog pa ni gnas so //
translated: The acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas by a bodhisattva who is irreversible is a bodhisattva’s resting place.

original: phyir ldog pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //🔽gang byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi @136a * //
analyzed: phyir ldog pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o // gang byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi @136a * //
translated: The reversal of that is not a bodhisattva’s resting place.🔽The bodhisattva who, having sat on the seat of awakening, does not rise up from that seat until he has fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is a bodhisattva’s resting place.🔽The bodhisattva who rises up from that seat after having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is a bodhisattva’s resting place.🔽The bodhisattvas who have not fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening are not a bodhisattva’s resting place.

original: snying po la 'dug nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas par stan las ldang ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: snying po la 'dug nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas par stan las ldang ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas who have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening are a bodhisattva’s resting place.🔽The bodhisattvas who have not fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening are not a bodhisattva’s resting place.

original: gang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ldang ba ni gnas so //🔽gang sangs rgyas rnams la bag chags kyi gnas yod pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ldang ba ni gnas so // gang sangs rgyas rnams la bag chags kyi gnas yod pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas who have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening are a bodhisattva’s resting place.🔽The bodhisattvas who have not fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening are not a bodhisattva’s resting place.🔽The bodhisattvas who have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening are a bodhisattva’s resting place.

original: gang ma lus par spangs pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: gang ma lus par spangs pa ni gnas so //
translated: The bodhisattvas who have not fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening are not a bodhisattva’s resting place.🔽The bodhisattvas who have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening are a bodhisattva’s resting place.🔽The bodhisattvas who have not fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening are not a bodhisattva’s resting place.🔽The bodhisattvas who have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening are a bodhisattva’s resting place.🔽The bodhisattvas who have not fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening are not a bodhisattva’s resting place.🔽The bodhisattvas who have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening are a bodhisattva’s resting place.

original: gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i mkhyen pa gang la yang thogs par 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i mkhyen pa gang la yang thogs par 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas who have not fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening are not a bodhisattva’s resting place.

original: gang thams cad du thogs pa med pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: gang thams cad du thogs pa med pa ni gnas so //
translated: The bodhisattvas who have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening are a bodhisattva’s resting place.🔽The bod

original: gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyi gtsug sus kyang mthong bar 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyi gtsug sus kyang mthong bar 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is impossible that anyone should see the crown of the head of the Tathagata.

original: gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyi gtsug sus kyang mi mthong ba ni gnas so //
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyi gtsug sus kyang mi mthong ba ni gnas so //
translated: It is possible that no one should see the crown of the head of the Tathagata.

original: gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs 'gyur bar snang ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs 'gyur bar snang ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is impossible that the mind of the Tathagata should be seen to change.

original: gang mi snang ba ni gnas so //
analyzed: gang mi snang ba ni gnas so //
translated: It is possible that it should not be seen.

original: gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rnam par g-yeng ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rnam par g-yeng ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is impossible that the mind of the Tathagata should be distracted.

original: gang rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: gang rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa ni gnas so //
translated: It is possible that it should always be concentrated.

original: gang de bzhin gshegs pa log par gsung ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pa log par gsung ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is impossible that the Tathagata should speak falsely.

original: gang log par mi gsung ba ni gnas so //
analyzed: gang log par mi gsung ba ni gnas so //
translated: It is possible that he should not speak falsely.

original: gang sangs rgyas rnams kyi gsung la 'khrul pa yod pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang sangs rgyas rnams kyi gsung la 'khrul pa yod pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is impossible that there should be any faltering in the speech of the Buddhas.

original: gang med pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: gang med pa ni gnas so //
translated: It is possible that there should be none.

original: gang de bzhin gshegs pa gang du yang bag tsha ba dang / bsnyengs par 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pa gang du yang bag tsha ba dang / bsnyengs par 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is impossible that the Tathagata should be afraid.

original: gang thams cad du bag tsha ba dang / bsnyengs pa mi mnga' ba ni gnas so //🔽de dag la sogs pa ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang thams cad du bag tsha ba dang / bsnyengs pa mi mnga' ba ni gnas so // de dag la sogs pa ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The knowledge of the Buddha that is not timid or fearful in any situation is the power of knowledge regarding proper and improper conditions.

original: de shes pa ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de shes pa ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: These and other such [powers] are called the power of knowledge regarding proper and improper conditions.🔽The knowledge of the Buddha that is not timid or fearful in any situation is the power of knowledge regarding proper and improper conditions.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi mkhyen pa gang gis las rnams dang / las len pa rnams kyi rnam par smin pa rgyu dang gnas las mkhyen pa ste /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi mkhyen pa gang gis las rnams dang / las len pa rnams kyi rnam par smin pa rgyu dang gnas las mkhyen pa ste /
translated: The power of knowledge regarding the ripening of karma is the knowledge of the Buddha that knows the ripening of karma and the taking up of karma in terms of their causes and locations.

original: gang 'das pa'i las len pa /
analyzed: gang 'das pa'i las len pa /
translated: There is the taking up of past karma

original: dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba /
analyzed: dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba /
translated: that arises from the cause of virtue

original: mi dge ba dang bral ba /
analyzed: mi dge ba dang bral ba /
translated: and is free from nonvirtue.

original: ma 'ongs pa na dge ba'i rgyu 'byin pa de lta bu yang yod /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na dge ba'i rgyu 'byin pa de lta bu yang yod /
translated: In the future, it will produce the cause of virtue.

original: da ltar byung ba na khyad par la brten la /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba na khyad par la brten la /
translated: In the present, it is based on a specific [cause].

original: las len pa gang mi dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba /
analyzed: las len pa gang mi dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba /
translated: There is the taking up of karma that arises from the cause of nonvirtue

original: dge ba dang bral ba /
analyzed: dge ba dang bral ba /
translated: and is free from virtue.

original: ma 'ongs pa na mi dge ba'i rgyu 'byin pa yang yod /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na mi dge ba'i rgyu 'byin pa yang yod /
translated: In the future, it will produce the cause of nonvirtue.

original: 'das @136b pa na dman pa la brten la ma 'ongs pa na khyad par la brten par 'gyur ba yang yod /
analyzed: 'das @136b pa na dman pa la brten la ma 'ongs pa na khyad par la brten par 'gyur ba yang yod /
translated: There are those who rely on the lesser in the past but will rely on the special in the future.

original: da ltar byung ba na dman pa la brten la /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba na dman pa la brten la /
translated: There are those who rely on the lesser in the present

original: ma 'ongs pa na khyad par la brten par 'gyur ba yang yod /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na khyad par la brten par 'gyur ba yang yod /
translated: but will rely on the special in the future.

original: da ltar byung ba na khyad par la brten la /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba na khyad par la brten la /
translated: There are those who rely on the special in the present

original: ma 'ongs pa na dman pa la brten par 'gyur ba yang yod /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na dman pa la brten par 'gyur ba yang yod /
translated: but will rely on the lesser in the future.

original: da ltar byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa na yang dman pa la brten par 'gyur ba yang yod /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa na yang dman pa la brten par 'gyur ba yang yod /
translated: There are those who rely on the lesser in the present and future.

original: da ltar byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa na yang khyad par la brten par 'gyur ba yod /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa na yang khyad par la brten par 'gyur ba yod /
translated: There are those who rely on the special in the present and future.

original: 'das pa na sbyor ba chung la ma 'ongs pa na sbyor ba rgya chen por 'gyur ba dang / 'das pa na sbyor ba rgya che la /
analyzed: 'das pa na sbyor ba chung la ma 'ongs pa na sbyor ba rgya chen por 'gyur ba dang / 'das pa na sbyor ba rgya che la /
translated: There are those who have little application in the past but will have vast application in the future.

original: ma 'ongs pa na sbyor ba chung ba dang / rtsom pa chung la khyad par chen por 'gyur ba dang / rtsom pa che la khyad par du chung ba dang / nyan thos su 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang / rang sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na sbyor ba chung ba dang / rtsom pa chung la khyad par chen por 'gyur ba dang / rtsom pa che la khyad par du chung ba dang / nyan thos su 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang / rang sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang /
translated: In the future, there are those who have little application and little effort but great distinction, those who have great application and little distinction, and those who are causes of becoming a śrāvaka, a pratyekabuddha,🔽a buddha, and those who are causes of becoming a bodhisattva.

original: sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang / da ltar byung ba na sdug bsngal la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang / da ltar byung ba na sdug bsngal la /
translated: In the present, there are those who are suffering

original: ma 'ongs pa na rnam par smin pa bde ba dang / da ltar byung ba na bde la /🔽ma 'ongs pa na rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba dang / da ltar byung ba na sdug bsngal la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na rnam par smin pa bde ba dang / da ltar byung ba na bde la / ma 'ongs pa na rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba dang / da ltar byung ba na sdug bsngal la /
translated: and in the future have pleasant karmic maturation, those who are happy in the present🔽and in the future have unpleasant karmic maturation, those who are suffering in the present

original: ma 'ongs pa na yang rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba dang / da ltar byung ba na yang bde la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na yang rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba dang / da ltar byung ba na yang bde la /
translated: and in the future have unpleasant karmic maturation, and those who are happy in the present

original: ma 'ongs pa na yang rnam par smin pa bde ba yang yod do //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na yang rnam par smin pa bde ba yang yod do //
translated: and in the future have pleasant karmic maturation.

original: da ltar 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus rnams na sems can thams cad kyi las gang yin pa dang / rgyu gang yin pa dang / rnam par smin pa gang yin pa rnams de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: da ltar 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus rnams na sems can thams cad kyi las gang yin pa dang / rgyu gang yin pa dang / rnam par smin pa gang yin pa rnams de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the karma of all sentient beings in the past, future, and present, as well as their causes and their results.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs dang / 'jig rten gyi khams du ma zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i bsam pa'i khams gang dang gang gis 'jig rten bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa sogs pa dang / mi g-yo ba mngon par 'du byed pa stsogs pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs dang / 'jig rten gyi khams du ma zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i bsam pa'i khams gang dang gang gis 'jig rten bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa sogs pa dang / mi g-yo ba mngon par 'du byed pa stsogs pa dang /
translated: “Various world systems” and “many world systems” refer to the different kinds of world systems that are created by the different kinds of superior intention.

translated: He knows those who have the faculty of effort and apply it to wisdom, those who have the faculty of wisdom and apply it to concentration, and those who have the faculty of concentration and apply it to wisdom.

translated: those who have the faculties of the pratyekabuddhas and connects them with the śrāvakas, those who have the faculties of the pratyekabuddhas and connects them with the buddhas, those who have the faculties of the buddhas and connects them with the pratyekabuddhas,

translated: those who have the faculties of saṃsāra and connects them with nirvāṇa, and those who have the faculties of nirvāṇa and connects them with saṃsāra. Having known all of them, he teaches the Dharma in accordance with them.

original: 'di ni dbang po mchog dang / mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so//
analyzed: 'di ni dbang po mchog dang / mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so//
translated: This is the power of knowing the degree of acumen and the degree of acumen of faculties.

translated: The Tathāgata knows as they really are the realms of sentient beings that are definite in the nature of being destined for perfection, those that are definite in the nature of being destined for the miserable realms, and those that are indefinite.🔽He knows the path that is suitable for those who are definite in the nature of being destined for perfection and those who are indefinite.

original: log pa nyid du nges pa rnams ni btang snyoms su bya ba dang mthun par mkhyen to //🔽byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi don du go cha gyon to //
analyzed: log pa nyid du nges pa rnams ni btang snyoms su bya ba dang mthun par mkhyen to // byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi don du go cha gyon to //
translated: He knows the path that is suitable for those who are definite in the nature of being destined for the miserable realms to be indifferent.🔽He knows the path that is suitable for those who are definite in the nature of being destined for perfection to be the armor.

original: 'dod chags kyi lam rnam pa gsum yang mkhyen te //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi lam rnam pa gsum yang mkhyen te //
translated: He knows the three types of paths of desire:

original: 'dod chags kyi lam sdug pa'i rnam pa las byung ba yang yod /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi lam sdug pa'i rnam pa las byung ba yang yod /
translated: The path of desire that arises from the aspect of beauty,

analyzed: 'dod chags kyi lam rjes su chags pa'i rnam pa las byung ba yang yod /

analyzed: 'dod chags kyi lam sngon gyi tshe rabs la goms pa'i stobs las byung ba yang yod /

analyzed: zhe sdang gi lam kun nas mnar sems kyi gzhi las byung ba yang yod /
translated: There is a path of anger that arises from the basis of malice.

analyzed: mtshan ma las byung ba'i khong khro ba de lta bu yang yod //

original: sngon gyi rgyu las byung ba yang yod /
analyzed: sngon gyi rgyu las byung ba yang yod /

original: gti mug gi lam la rig pa'i rgyu las byung ba yang yod /
analyzed: gti mug gi lam la rig pa'i rgyu las byung ba yang yod /

analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu las byung ba yang yod /
translated: There is a path of ignorance that arises from the cause of the view of the transitory collection.

analyzed: the tshom gyi rgyu las byung ba yang yod par rab tu mkhyen to // de la mngon par shes pa sla la bum ba'i lam yang yod /

original: mngon par shes pa dka' la myur ba'i lam yang yod /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa dka' la myur ba'i lam yang yod /
translated: There is a path of direct knowledge that is difficult and fast.

original: mngon par shes pa sla la myur ba'i lam yang yod /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa sla la myur ba'i lam yang yod /
translated: There is a path of direct knowledge that is easy and fast.

original: mngon par shes pa dka' la bul ba'i lam yang yod //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa dka' la bul ba'i lam yang yod //
translated: There is a path of direct knowledge that is difficult and slow.

analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i stobs rdzogs par byed la / bsgom pa'i stobs ma yin pa'i lam yang yod /

analyzed: bsgom pa'i stobs rdzogs par byed la so sor brtags pa'i stobs ma yin pa'i lam yang yod /

original: gnyi ga rdzogs par byed pa'i lam yang yod /
analyzed: gnyi ga rdzogs par byed pa'i lam yang yod /

analyzed: bsam pa phun sum tshogs la sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa'i lam yang yod /

analyzed: sbyor ba phun sum tshogs la bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa'i lam yang yod /

original: gnyi ga phun sum tshogs pa yang yod /
analyzed: gnyi ga phun sum tshogs pa yang yod /
translated: There is a path that is excellent in both.

original: gnyi ga @140b phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa'i lam yang yod /🔽lus dag par byed la ngag dang sems dag par mi byed pa'i lam yang yod /
analyzed: gnyi ga @140b phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa'i lam yang yod / lus dag par byed la ngag dang sems dag par mi byed pa'i lam yang yod /
translated: There is a path that is not excellent in either.🔽There is a path that purifies the body but does not purify speech and mind.

original: ngag dag par byed la lus dang sems dag par mi byed pa yang yod /
analyzed: ngag dag par byed la lus dang sems dag par mi byed pa yang yod /
translated: There is a path that purifies speech but does not purify the body and mind.

original: yid dag par byed la lus dang ngag dag par mi byed pa yang yod /
analyzed: yid dag par byed la lus dang ngag dag par mi byed pa yang yod /
translated: There are those who purify their mind but not their body and speech.

original: lus dang ngag dag par byed la sems dag par mi byed pa yang yod /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dag par byed la sems dag par mi byed pa yang yod /
translated: There are those who purify their body and speech but not their mind.

original: gang dag sems dag par byed la lus dag par mi byed pa yang yod /🔽lus dang sems dag par byed la ngag dag par mi byed pa yang yod /
analyzed: gang dag sems dag par byed la lus dag par mi byed pa yang yod / lus dang sems dag par byed la ngag dag par mi byed pa yang yod /
translated: There are those who purify their mind but not their body.🔽There are those who purify their body and mind but not their speech.

original: lus dang ngag dag par byed la yid dag par mi byed pa yang yod /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dag par byed la yid dag par mi byed pa yang yod /
translated: There are those who purify their body and speech but not their mind.

original: thams cad dag par mi byed pa yang yod /
analyzed: thams cad dag par mi byed pa yang yod /
translated: There are those who do not purify any of them.

original: 'dir sdug bsngal la pha rol du bde bar 'gyur ba'i lam yang yod /
analyzed: 'dir sdug bsngal la pha rol du bde bar 'gyur ba'i lam yang yod /
translated: Here there is a path that leads to happiness in the next life after suffering in this life.

original: 'dir bde ba la pha rol du sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba yang yod /
analyzed: 'dir bde ba la pha rol du sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba yang yod /
translated: Here there is a path that leads to suffering in the next life after happiness in this life.

original: gnyi gar sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba yang yod /
analyzed: gnyi gar sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba yang yod /
translated: Here there is a path that leads to suffering in both this life and the next.

original: gnyi gar bde bar 'gyur ba yang yod /🔽bdag la phan la gzhan la phan par mi 'gyur ba'i lam yang yod /
analyzed: gnyi gar bde bar 'gyur ba yang yod / bdag la phan la gzhan la phan par mi 'gyur ba'i lam yang yod /
translated: Here there is a path that leads to happiness in both this life and the next.🔽Here there is a path that benefits oneself but not others.

original: gzhan la phan la bdag la phan par mi 'gyur ba yang yod /
analyzed: gzhan la phan la bdag la phan par mi 'gyur ba yang yod /
translated: Here there is a path that benefits others but not oneself.

original: gnyi ga la phan par 'gyur ba yang yod /
analyzed: gnyi ga la phan par 'gyur ba yang yod /
translated: There are also those that are beneficial for both.

original: gnyi ga la phan par mi 'byung ba yang yod /
analyzed: gnyi ga la phan par mi 'byung ba yang yod /
translated: There are also those that are not beneficial for both.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'bras bu'i lam yang yod /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'bras bu'i lam yang yod /
translated: There are also paths that are the results of the desire realm.

original: 'dod pa la 'dod chags kyi gnyen po yang yod /
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dod chags kyi gnyen po yang yod /
translated: There are also antidotes to the attachment of the desire realm.

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi 'bras bu'i lam yang yod /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi 'bras bu'i lam yang yod /
translated: There are also paths that are the results of the form realm.

original: gzugs kyi 'dod chags kyi gnyen po yang yod /
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dod chags kyi gnyen po yang yod /
translated: There are also antidotes to the attachment of the form realm.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi 'bras bu'i lam yang yod /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi 'bras bu'i lam yang yod /
translated: There are also paths that are the results of the formless realm.

original: gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags kyi gnyen po yang yod /🔽srid pa'i 'bras bu yang yod /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags kyi gnyen po yang yod / srid pa'i 'bras bu yang yod /
translated: There are also antidotes to the attachment of the formless realm.🔽There are also results of existence.

original: 'byung ba'i 'bras bu yang yod /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i 'bras bu yang yod /
translated: There are also results of arising.

original: nyan thos kyi 'bras bur 'gyur ba yang yod /🔽rang byang chub kyi 'bras bur 'gyur ba yang yod /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi 'bras bur 'gyur ba yang yod / rang byang chub kyi 'bras bur 'gyur ba yang yod /
translated: There are also those that become the results of śrāvakas.🔽There are also those that become the results of pratyekabuddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bur 'gyur ba yang yod /🔽nges pa yang yod /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bur 'gyur ba yang yod / nges pa yang yod /
translated: There are also those that become the results of buddhas.🔽There are also those that are definite.

original: ma nges pa yang yod /🔽nyes par spyod pa'i gnyen por 'gyur ba yang yod /
analyzed: ma nges pa yang yod / nyes par spyod pa'i gnyen por 'gyur ba yang yod /
translated: There are also those that are indefinite.🔽There are also those that become antidotes to misdeeds.

original: kun nas ldang ba'i gnyen por gyur pa yang yod /
analyzed: kun nas ldang ba'i gnyen por gyur pa yang yod /
translated: There are also those that become antidotes to motivations.

original: bag la nyal gyi gnyen por gyur pa yang yod /
analyzed: bag la nyal gyi gnyen por gyur pa yang yod /
translated: There are also those that serve as antidotes to latent tendencies.

original: 'dod chags kyi gnyen por gyur pa yang yod /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi gnyen por gyur pa yang yod /
translated: There are also those that serve as antidotes to desire.

original: zhe sdang gi gnyen por gyur pa yang yod /🔽gti mug gi gnye @141a * //🔽por gyur pa yang yod /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi gnyen por gyur pa yang yod / gti mug gi gnye @141a * // por gyur pa yang yod /
translated: There are also those that serve as antidotes to anger.🔽There are also those that serve as antidotes to ignorance.

original: nga rgyal gyi gnyen por gyur pa yang yod /
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi gnyen por gyur pa yang yod /
translated: There are also those that serve as antidotes to pride.

original: lta ba'i gnyen por gyur pa yang yod /
analyzed: lta ba'i gnyen por gyur pa yang yod /
translated: There are also those that serve as antidotes to views.

original: zhi gnas sgrub pa yang yod /🔽lhag mthong sgrub pa yang yod /🔽pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub pa yang yod /
analyzed: zhi gnas sgrub pa yang yod / lhag mthong sgrub pa yang yod / pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub pa yang yod /
translated: There are also those that accomplish śamatha.🔽There are also those that accomplish vipaśyanā.🔽There are also those that accomplish the perfections.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa sgrub pa yang yod /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa sgrub pa yang yod /
translated: There are also those that accomplish the cultivation of the factors of awakening.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa sgrub pa yang yod /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa sgrub pa yang yod /
translated: There are also those that accomplish the ripening of sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byed pa sgrub pa yang yod /🔽sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa sgrub par byed pa yang yod /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byed pa sgrub pa yang yod / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa sgrub par byed pa yang yod /
translated: There are also those that accomplish the ripening of the qualities of buddhahood.🔽There are also those that accomplish the purification of a buddha realm.

original: sa yongs su sbyong ba sgrub pa yang yod /
analyzed: sa yongs su sbyong ba sgrub pa yang yod /
translated: There are also those that accomplish the purification of the bhūmis.

original: mngon par shes pa sgrub pa yang yod /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa sgrub pa yang yod /
translated: There are also those that accomplish the higher perceptions.

original: dbang sgrub pa yang yod /
analyzed: dbang sgrub pa yang yod /
translated: There are also those that accomplish power.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su sgrub pa yang yod /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su sgrub pa yang yod /
translated: They also have the accumulation of merit.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs sgrub pa yang yod par rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs sgrub pa yang yod par rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: They also have the accumulation of wisdom.

original: 'di ni thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs so //🔽bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang ldan pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni de la bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa bsam gtan bzhi po dag dang /
analyzed: 'di ni thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs so // bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang ldan pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni de la bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa bsam gtan bzhi po dag dang /
translated: This is the power of knowledge of the paths that lead everywhere.🔽“They know the afflictions and purification of the concentrations, liberations, absorptions, and attainments exactly as they are.”🔽The first concentration and so on are the four concentrations.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad po dag dang / rtog pa dang bcas /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad po dag dang / rtog pa dang bcas /
translated: The eight liberations are the liberation of form looking at form and so on, the liberation of the formless realm, the liberation of the sphere of infinite space, and so on.

original: dpyod pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum po dag dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi po dag dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu po dag dang / de dag gi kun nas nyon mongs pa gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: dpyod pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum po dag dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi po dag dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu po dag dang / de dag gi kun nas nyon mongs pa gang yin pa dang /
translated: The three concentrations, such as that associated with investigation, the four formless states of composure, the nine meditative absorptions of progressive abiding, their defilements,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu gang yin pa dang / rnam par byang ba gang yin pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i rgyu gang yin pa dang / de dag las ldang ba'i rgyu gang yin pa de dag thams cad rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu gang yin pa dang / rnam par byang ba gang yin pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i rgyu gang yin pa dang / de dag las ldang ba'i rgyu gang yin pa de dag thams cad rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: their causes of defilement, their purifications, their causes of purification, and the causes of rising from them.

original: de la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / srid pa'i don du yongs su bsngo ba dang / lta ba sna tshogs dang ldan pa dang / ro myong bar byed pa dang ldan pa dang / dmigs pa yid la byed pa'i dbang gis bsam gtan la sogs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / srid pa'i don du yongs su bsngo ba dang / lta ba sna tshogs dang ldan pa dang / ro myong bar byed pa dang ldan pa dang / dmigs pa yid la byed pa'i dbang gis bsam gtan la sogs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this regard, there are five causes of the defilement of the meditative concentrations, etc.: incorrect mental activity, dedication to the aims of existence, possession of various views, possession of the experience of enjoyment, and mental activity that is focused on an objective mental image.

original: bsam gtan gyi yan lag la snyoms par zhugs @141b nas mthong ngam /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi yan lag la snyoms par zhugs @141b nas mthong ngam /
translated: He enters into the meditative concentrations and meditative attainments and sees.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Or else, in order to ripen beings,

original: mngon par shes pa sgrub pa'am /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa sgrub pa'am /
translated: he accomplishes the superknowledges.

original: mi dmigs pa yid la byed pa bsam gtan la sogs pa rnam par byang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa yid la byed pa bsam gtan la sogs pa rnam par byang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, in order to purify the meditative states, etc., he practices the mental attentions related to the nondiscernment.

original: ldang ba ni seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa'am /
analyzed: ldang ba ni seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa'am /
translated: He rises from the meditative states by the lion’s sport meditative attainment,

original: thod rgal du snyoms par 'jug pas lugs dang mthun pa'am /
analyzed: thod rgal du snyoms par 'jug pas lugs dang mthun pa'am /
translated: or by the alternating meditative attainment, either in the forward order or in the reverse order.

original: lugs las bzlog pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis 'gyur te /
analyzed: lugs las bzlog pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis 'gyur te /
translated: He rises by the power of the superknowledges, or by the power of aspirational prayers.

original: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa ting nge 'dzin la yang snyoms par 'jug pa la rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa yang yin no //
analyzed: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa ting nge 'dzin la yang snyoms par 'jug pa la rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa yang yin no //
translated: The Tathāgata, in this regard, is always in equipoise, even though he is entering into meditative concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin gcig tu yang ting nge 'dzin thams cad la snyoms par 'jug cing bzhengs so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gcig tu yang ting nge 'dzin thams cad la snyoms par 'jug cing bzhengs so //
translated: He enters into and rises from all meditative states within a single meditative state.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi nang du ting nge 'dzin gcig ston cing bzhengs te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi nang du ting nge 'dzin gcig ston cing bzhengs te /
translated: He enters into and rises from a single meditative state within all meditative states.

original: mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: This is as it is described in the sutra.

original: ting nge 'dzin gcig gis kyang ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi bya ba rnams mdzad do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gcig gis kyang ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi bya ba rnams mdzad do //
translated: And with a single concentration, he performs the functions of all concentrations.

original: ting nge 'dzin mang pos ting nge 'dzin gcig gi bya ba mdzad do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin mang pos ting nge 'dzin gcig gi bya ba mdzad do //
translated: And with many concentrations, he performs the function of a single concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad la bzhengs pa gcig ston to //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad la bzhengs pa gcig ston to //
translated: He manifests a single rising from concentration in all concentrations.

original: ting nge 'dzin sna tshogs las bzhengs pa sna tshogs ston to //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin sna tshogs las bzhengs pa sna tshogs ston to //
translated: He manifests various risings from various concentrations.🔽He manifests a single concentration from various risings.

original: bzhengs pa sna tshogs las ting nge 'dzin gcig ston to zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang mdo las ji skad du 'byung ba bzhin du gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: bzhengs pa sna tshogs las ting nge 'dzin gcig ston to zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang mdo las ji skad du 'byung ba bzhin du gzung bar bya ste /
translated: And so on, as stated in the sutra.

original: 'di ni bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: 'di ni bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
translated: This is the power of knowledge of concentrations, liberations, meditative stabilizations, and absorptions.

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / lha'i mig gis mngon par shes pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyang gzhung nyid las 'byung ba bzhin du gzung bar bya'o /
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / lha'i mig gis mngon par shes pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyang gzhung nyid las 'byung ba bzhin du gzung bar bya'o /
translated: The power of knowledge of recollecting former lives, the power of knowledge of the divine eye of superknowledge, and the power of knowledge of the exhaustion of contaminants should be understood as they appear in the texts.🔽🔽

original: // / bam po bcu bzhi pa /
analyzed: // / bam po bcu bzhi pa /
translated: The power of knowledge of recollecting former abodes, the power of knowledge of clairvoyance through the divine eye, and the power of knowledge of the extinction of defilements should be understood as they appear in the text.

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The four fearlessnesses.

original: dang po dang gnyis pa ni rang gi don las brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: dang po dang gnyis pa ni rang gi don las brtsams pa'o //
translated: The first and second are from the point of view of one’s own aim.

original: gsum pa dang bzhi pa ni gzhan gyi don las brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa dang bzhi pa ni gzhan gyi don las brtsams pa'o //
translated: The third and fourth are from the point of view of others’ aims.

original: dge sbyong dang bram ze zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dge sbyong dang bram ze zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for “śramaṇa, brahmin, etc.,”

original: shes rab kyis mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes rab kyis mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are arrogant about their wisdom,

original: dge sbyong dang bram ze smos so //
analyzed: dge sbyong dang bram ze smos so //
translated: śramaṇas and brahmins are mentioned.

original: lha'i mig dang pha rol gyi sems shes pa la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir lha dang / bdud smos so //🔽rdzu 'phrul dang mthu che @142a * //
analyzed: lha'i mig dang pha rol gyi sems shes pa la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir lha dang / bdud smos so // rdzu 'phrul dang mthu che @142a * //
translated: Because they are endowed with clairvoyance, the divine eye, knowledge of others’ minds, and so on, gods and māras are mentioned.

original: ba'i phyir tshangs pa rnams smos so //
analyzed: ba'i phyir tshangs pa rnams smos so //
translated: Because they have great miraculous powers, Brahmā is mentioned.

original: rgyu de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste zhes bya ba ni de dag gis brgal ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba 'gal ba de cung zad kyang mi mthong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyu de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste zhes bya ba ni de dag gis brgal ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba 'gal ba de cung zad kyang mi mthong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He does not see that cause as real. This means that he does not see even the slightest contradiction in the cause of their dispute.

original: bde ba thob ces bya ba ni lus kyi spu zing zhes byed pa dang / bag 'khums pa la sogs pa med par bstan to //
analyzed: bde ba thob ces bya ba ni lus kyi spu zing zhes byed pa dang / bag 'khums pa la sogs pa med par bstan to //
translated: He has attained happiness. This shows that he is without horripilation, trembling, and so on.

original: de'i dbang gis cang shes khyu mchog gi gnas su zhal gyis 'ches te /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis cang shes khyu mchog gi gnas su zhal gyis 'ches te /
translated: By the power of that, he has the confidence to be the chief of the herd.

original: sku'i phrin las rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sku'i phrin las rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because his physical activity is pure.

original: bag tsha ba med par thob ces bya ba ni gsung la zhum pa dang / dman par gyur pa la sogs pa med par bstan to //
analyzed: bag tsha ba med par thob ces bya ba ni gsung la zhum pa dang / dman par gyur pa la sogs pa med par bstan to //
translated: He has attained fearlessness. This shows that he is without timidity, inferiority, and so on in his speech.

original: de'i dbang gis seng ge bzhin du sgrog ste /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis seng ge bzhin du sgrog ste /
translated: By the power of that, he roars like a lion.

original: gsung gi phrin las rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsung gi phrin las rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because his verbal activity is pure.

original: mi 'jigs pa thob ces bya ba ni thugs la dogs pa dang / zhum pa la sogs pa med par bstan to //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa thob ces bya ba ni thugs la dogs pa dang / zhum pa la sogs pa med par bstan to //
translated: He has attained fearlessness. This shows that he is without doubt, timidity, and so on in his mind.

original: de'i dbang gis tshangs pa bzhin du 'khor lo bskor te /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis tshangs pa bzhin du 'khor lo bskor te /
translated: By its power, he turns the wheel like Brahma,

original: thugs kyi phrin las rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thugs kyi phrin las rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because his mental action is pure.

original: de bzhin du thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to all the other knowledges.

original: chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab tu rtogs pa tshig gi tshogs dang / ming gi tshogs dang / tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs kyi bdag nyid kyi gzhung mang po ste /🔽'dis chos so so yang dag par rig par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab tu rtogs pa tshig gi tshogs dang / ming gi tshogs dang / tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs kyi bdag nyid kyi gzhung mang po ste / 'dis chos so so yang dag par rig par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: The knowledge of the teaching and the knowledge of the meaning are the many scriptures in the teachings of the Tathagata, which have the nature of collections of words, collections of names, collections of consonants, and collections of syllables.🔽By this, there is the knowledge of the teaching.
