original: chos so so yang dag par rig pa'i phyir so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: chos so so yang dag par rig pa'i phyir so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: Or, it is the knowledge because of the knowledge of the teaching.

original: don ces bya ba ni brjod par bya ba'i tshogs te /
analyzed: don ces bya ba ni brjod par bya ba'i tshogs te /
translated: The meaning is the collection of things to be expressed.

original: de shes pa ni don so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: de shes pa ni don so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of that is the knowledge of the meaning.

original: yang na rgyu dang rkyen gyi chos thams cad ni chos te /
analyzed: yang na rgyu dang rkyen gyi chos thams cad ni chos te /
translated: Alternatively, all phenomena that are causes and conditions are the teaching.

original: de dag shes pa ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: de dag shes pa ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of these is the correct knowledge of the teaching.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'bras bu'i chos rnams shes pa ni /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'bras bu'i chos rnams shes pa ni /
translated: Knowledge of the resultant factors of dependent origination is

original: don so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: don so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: the correct knowledge of the meaning.

original: yang na rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa'i chos dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos thams cad ni chos te /
analyzed: yang na rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa'i chos dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos thams cad ni chos te /
translated: Alternatively, the teaching is all virtuous and nonvirtuous factors that have karmic maturation.

original: de dag shes pa ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: de dag shes pa ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of these is the correct knowledge of the teaching.

original: sgrib pa dang mi sgrib pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams ni don te /
analyzed: sgrib pa dang mi sgrib pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams ni don te /
translated: The meaning is the factors that are obscured and unobscured, and those that are neutral.

original: don de dag shes pa ni don so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: don de dag shes pa ni don so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of these meanings is the correct knowledge of the meaning.

original: yang na kun 'byung ba dang / lam gyi @142b bden par rtogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos phyogs kyi chos thams cad ni chos te /
analyzed: yang na kun 'byung ba dang / lam gyi @142b bden par rtogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos phyogs kyi chos thams cad ni chos te /
translated: Alternatively, the teaching is all the factors of the side of purification, which are the realization of the truths of origin and path.

original: de dag shes pa ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: de dag shes pa ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of these is the correct knowledge of the teaching.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / 'gog pa'i bden par gtogs pa'i chos thams cad ni don te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / 'gog pa'i bden par gtogs pa'i chos thams cad ni don te /
translated: The object is all things included in the truth of suffering and the truth of cessation.

original: de dag shes pa ni don so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: de dag shes pa ni don so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of that is the perfect knowledge of the object.

original: yang na gdul ba rnams kyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / spyod pa dang / mos pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa thams cad ni chos te /
analyzed: yang na gdul ba rnams kyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / spyod pa dang / mos pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa thams cad ni chos te /
translated: Alternatively, the object is all the inclinations, propensities, conduct, interests, faculties, etc. of those to be trained.

original: de dag shes pa ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa'o //🔽mgo smos pa dang / rnam par spros pa go ba dang / drang dgos pa dang / tshig lhur len pa dang / nyon mongs pa che ba dang / chung ba dang / dbang po rno ba dang / rtul ba dang / skal ba yod pa dang /
analyzed: de dag shes pa ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa'o // mgo smos pa dang / rnam par spros pa go ba dang / drang dgos pa dang / tshig lhur len pa dang / nyon mongs pa che ba dang / chung ba dang / dbang po rno ba dang / rtul ba dang / skal ba yod pa dang /
translated: The knowledge of that is the perfect knowledge of the object.

original: skal ba med pa la sogs pa'i gdul ba rnams ni don te //
analyzed: skal ba med pa la sogs pa'i gdul ba rnams ni don te //
translated: The object is those to be trained who understand through a mere indication, who understand through an extensive explanation, who require guidance, who are intent on the letter, who have great or small defilements, who have sharp or dull faculties, who have good fortune, who do not have good fortune, etc.

original: de dag shes pa ni don so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: de dag shes pa ni don so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of that is the perfect knowledge of the object.🔽The object is the Dharma and its meaning.

original: nges pa'i tshig ces bya ba ni 'jig rten na grags pa ming gi tshogs la sogs pa rnam pa mang po de dag nyid kyi tshig nges pa la nges pa'i tshig ces bya'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig ces bya ba ni 'jig rten na grags pa ming gi tshogs la sogs pa rnam pa mang po de dag nyid kyi tshig nges pa la nges pa'i tshig ces bya'o //
translated: Etymologies are the many kinds of collections of words that are well known in the world. The words for those are called etymologies.

original: yang na gling chen po bco brgyad na gnas pa dang / yul chen po bcu drug dag na gnas pa dang / mtha' 'khob dgu bcu rtsa brgyad na gnas pa dang / yul gyi dbus su gtogs pa'i mi thams cad dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa dang /
analyzed: yang na gling chen po bco brgyad na gnas pa dang / yul chen po bcu drug dag na gnas pa dang / mtha' 'khob dgu bcu rtsa brgyad na gnas pa dang / yul gyi dbus su gtogs pa'i mi thams cad dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa dang /
translated: Or, it is for all the people who live in the eighteen great islands, the sixteen great countries, the ninety-eight border regions, and the central countries; for all those in the animal realm;

original: yi dags dang / sems can dmyal ba thams cad dang / lha ma yin dang / klu dang / dri za dang / mi'am ci thams cad dang / grub pa dang / rig sngags 'chang dang / rol mo byed cing rgyu ba la sogs pa dang rgyal chen bzhi'i ris dang /
analyzed: yi dags dang / sems can dmyal ba thams cad dang / lha ma yin dang / klu dang / dri za dang / mi'am ci thams cad dang / grub pa dang / rig sngags 'chang dang / rol mo byed cing rgyu ba la sogs pa dang rgyal chen bzhi'i ris dang /
translated: for all the pretas, hell beings, asuras, nagas, gandharvas, and kinnaras; for all the accomplished vidyadharas, musicians, and so forth; for the Caturmaharajakayikas,

original: sum cu rtsa gsum la sogs pa 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha rnams dang / bdud kyi ris thams cad dang / tshangs pa dang / gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha thams cad kyi sngags 'chang dang / brjod pa gang yin pa thams cad ni nges pa'i tshig gi chos te /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum la sogs pa 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha rnams dang / bdud kyi ris thams cad dang / tshangs pa dang / gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha thams cad kyi sngags 'chang dang / brjod pa gang yin pa thams cad ni nges pa'i tshig gi chos te /
translated: The Dharma of etymologies is the mantras of all the gods of the desire realm, such as the Thirty-Three Gods, all the classes of demons, Brahma, and all the gods of the pure abodes.

original: de dag shes pa ni nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //🔽shes pa rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid shes pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de dag shes pa ni nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o // shes pa rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid shes pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: To know them is called the correct understanding of etymologies.

original: spobs pa so so @143a * //🔽yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: spobs pa so so @143a * // yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: The correct understanding of eloquence is the knowledge of those three kinds of knowledge.

original: gdul ba de dag nyid kyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang mthun par chos rnams yang dag par ston pa dang / shes par byed pa dang / khong du chud par byed pa ni spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: gdul ba de dag nyid kyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang mthun par chos rnams yang dag par ston pa dang / shes par byed pa dang / khong du chud par byed pa ni spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: The correct understanding of eloquence is the teaching of the Dharma in accordance with the thoughts, dispositions, and inclinations of those to be trained, and the knowledge and understanding that results.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi rgyun ma chad par 'byung ba dag chos so so yang dag par rig pas skad cig gcig kho na las yang dag par 'dzin to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi rgyun ma chad par 'byung ba dag chos so so yang dag par rig pas skad cig gcig kho na las yang dag par 'dzin to //
translated: The bodhisattva, by means of the correct knowledge of the teaching, in a single moment, receives the uninterrupted arising of the teaching of all the buddhas in all the universes.

original: don so so yang dag par rig pas ni skad cig de nyid la chos de dag gi don kyang 'dzin to //
analyzed: don so so yang dag par rig pas ni skad cig de nyid la chos de dag gi don kyang 'dzin to //
translated: By means of the correct knowledge of the meaning, in that same moment, he receives the meaning of those teachings.

original: skad cig de nyid la /
analyzed: skad cig de nyid la /
translated: In that same moment,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs na /
translated: in the various universes,

original: gdul ba sna tshogs kyi nges pa'i tshig rnams sna tshogs kyis nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pas chos ston to //🔽spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pas ni 'dul ba de rnams /
analyzed: gdul ba sna tshogs kyi nges pa'i tshig rnams sna tshogs kyis nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pas chos ston to // spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pas ni 'dul ba de rnams /
translated: by means of the correct knowledge of the etymological definition, he teaches the Dharma with various etymological definitions for the various disciples.

original: chos nyid mngon sum du 'dzin du 'dzud do //
analyzed: chos nyid mngon sum du 'dzin du 'dzud do //
translated: By means of the correct knowledge of eloquence, he causes those disciples to enter into the direct realization of reality.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dras pa bco brgyad ces bya ba la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dras pa bco brgyad ces bya ba la /
translated: The eighteen special qualities of the Buddha are as follows.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul ba mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi mdzad pa rnams la 'khrul pa mi mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul ba mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi mdzad pa rnams la 'khrul pa mi mnga' ba ste /
translated: The Tathagata is without error means that he is without error in his actions of body, speech, and mind.

original: ji ltar 'di ni dgra bcom pa rnams grong la sogs par bsod snyoms kyi phyir rgyu ba na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di ni dgra bcom pa rnams grong la sogs par bsod snyoms kyi phyir rgyu ba na /
translated: For example, when Arhats go to a village for alms,

original: glang po che dang / rta dang / ba glang dang / khyi gtum po dang / tsher ma dang / sdig sbrul la sogs pa'i gdon pa rnams 'byung ba dang / dgon pa na chom rkun dang / stag dang / gzig gi 'jigs pa 'byung ba mi shes pa las gyur pa'i 'khrul pa de lta bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa la thams cad kyi thams cad du mi mnga'o //
analyzed: glang po che dang / rta dang / ba glang dang / khyi gtum po dang / tsher ma dang / sdig sbrul la sogs pa'i gdon pa rnams 'byung ba dang / dgon pa na chom rkun dang / stag dang / gzig gi 'jigs pa 'byung ba mi shes pa las gyur pa'i 'khrul pa de lta bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa la thams cad kyi thams cad du mi mnga'o //
translated: they may encounter elephants, horses, bulls, fierce dogs, thorns, poisonous snakes, and so on, or in the wilderness, they may encounter robbers, tigers, and leopards. Such errors, which arise from ignorance, are never found in the Tathagata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos can te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos can te /
translated: The Tathagata is endowed with the Dharma of nonforgetfulness.

original: brtags na skyon mi mnga' ba nyid du sems can la mdzad pa rtsom mo //
analyzed: brtags na skyon mi mnga' ba nyid du sems can la mdzad pa rtsom mo //
translated: He acts for the sake of sentient beings, having examined whether there is any fault.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi spyod lam ni 'jig rten la mdzes so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi spyod lam ni 'jig rten la mdzes so //
translated: The conduct of the Tathagatas is beautiful in the world.

original: kun tu gzigs pa dang / rnam par gzigs pa dang / bskum pa dang / brkyang ba la sogs pa ni mi dang / lha dang / tshangs pa thams cad dang / dud 'gro thams cad kyang tshim par byed pa ste /
analyzed: kun tu gzigs pa dang / rnam par gzigs pa dang / bskum pa dang / brkyang ba la sogs pa ni mi dang / lha dang / tshangs pa thams cad dang / dud 'gro thams cad kyang tshim par byed pa ste /
translated: Their looking around, their looking straight ahead, their bending, their stretching, and so forth, satisfy all humans, gods, Brahmas, and all animals.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa bzhud pa dang / byon pa la sogs pa @143b thams cad na zhabs gnyis kyi mthil sa la mi reg go //
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa bzhud pa dang / byon pa la sogs pa @143b thams cad na zhabs gnyis kyi mthil sa la mi reg go //
translated: Thus, when the Tathagata walks, stands, and so forth, the soles of his two feet do not touch the ground.

original: 'khor lo rtsibs stong dang ldan pa'i rjes sa la 'byung ngo //🔽gang du de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs bor ba der pad mo yid du 'ong ba /
analyzed: 'khor lo rtsibs stong dang ldan pa'i rjes sa la 'byung ngo // gang du de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs bor ba der pad mo yid du 'ong ba /
translated: The imprint of a wheel with a thousand spokes appears on the ground.

original: bsung dang ldan pa dag 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bsung dang ldan pa dag 'byung ngo //
translated: Wherever the Tathagata places his feet, beautiful lotuses with good fragrance appear.

original: zhabs kyis dud 'gro la reg na yang zhag bdun du bde ba mchog gis tshim par gyur te /
analyzed: zhabs kyis dud 'gro la reg na yang zhag bdun du bde ba mchog gis tshim par gyur te /
translated: When he touches animals with his feet, they are satisfied for seven days with the highest bliss.

original: shi 'phos na yang bde 'gro mtho ris su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shi 'phos na yang bde 'gro mtho ris su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When they die, they are reborn in the happy realms of the higher existences.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la na bza' sor bzhir mi reg cing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la na bza' sor bzhir mi reg cing /
translated: The Tathagata's body is not touched by clothes, etc.

original: rnam par 'thor rlung gis kyang bskyod par mi nus so //
analyzed: rnam par 'thor rlung gis kyang bskyod par mi nus so //
translated: and even a violent wind cannot move it.

original: sku'i 'od kyis kyang mnar med pa la thug pa'i bar gyi sems can rnams bde ba dag thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sku'i 'od kyis kyang mnar med pa la thug pa'i bar gyi sems can rnams bde ba dag thob par 'gyur te /
translated: The light of his body causes all beings, down to the Avici hell, to obtain happiness.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la 'khrul pa mi mnga'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la 'khrul pa mi mnga'o zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the Tathagata's body is without error.

original: gsung la yang 'khrul pa mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: gsung la yang 'khrul pa mi mnga' ste /
translated: His speech is also without error.

original: dus su gsung ba dang / bden par gsung ba dang / snyan par gsung ba dang / ma nor bar gsung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dus su gsung ba dang / bden par gsung ba dang / snyan par gsung ba dang / ma nor bar gsung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because he speaks at the right time, speaks the truth, speaks pleasantly, and speaks without error,

original: gsung skyon thams cad dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: gsung skyon thams cad dang bral ba ste /
translated: his speech is free from all faults.

original: zlos bur mi gsung ba dang / shin tu nges par gsung ba dang / rigs pa dang ldan par gsung ba dang / gsung gcig brjod pas skad cig gcig la sems can thams cad kyis go bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zlos bur mi gsung ba dang / shin tu nges par gsung ba dang / rigs pa dang ldan par gsung ba dang / gsung gcig brjod pas skad cig gcig la sems can thams cad kyis go bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not speak in vain, speaks with great certainty, speaks in a manner that is appropriate, and causes all beings to understand in a single instant by uttering a single statement.

original: thugs la yang 'khrul pa mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: thugs la yang 'khrul pa mi mnga' ste /
translated: His mind is also without error.

original: rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa dang / bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos can dang / chos thams cad la chags pa dang / sgrib pa mi mnga' bar mkhyen cing gzigs pa dang mdzad pa thams cad la rtag tu lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa dang / bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos can dang / chos thams cad la chags pa dang / sgrib pa mi mnga' bar mkhyen cing gzigs pa dang mdzad pa thams cad la rtag tu lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is always in meditative equipoise, because he is not subject to forgetfulness, because he is not attached to any phenomenon, because he knows and sees without any obscurations, and because all his actions are always spontaneous and nonconceptual.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa mi mnga' ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa mi mnga' ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata is said to be without error.

original: 'di ni ma 'dres pa'i chos dang po'o //🔽ca co mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar dgra bcom pa dag dgon pa na lam stor nas ca co'i sgra 'byin pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ni ma 'dres pa'i chos dang po'o // ca co mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar dgra bcom pa dag dgon pa na lam stor nas ca co'i sgra 'byin pa'am /
translated: This is the first of the unshared qualities.🔽He does not speak incoherently.

original: bag chags kyi dbang gis gad mo rta gad 'byin pa dang / tshig la yi ge log par 'byung ba de ltar sangs rgyas rnams la ca co mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: bag chags kyi dbang gis gad mo rta gad 'byin pa dang / tshig la yi ge log par 'byung ba de ltar sangs rgyas rnams la ca co mi mnga' ste /
translated: As when some arhats, in the wilderness, lose their way and cry out incoherently, or when they laugh loudly through the power of latent propensities, or when they mispronounce a syllable, the Buddhas do not speak incoherently.

original: sems can thams cad dang / chos thams cad la rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba mi mnga' ba dang / 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad las shin tu 'das pa dang / rtag tu mnyam par @144a * //
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang / chos thams cad la rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba mi mnga' ba dang / 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad las shin tu 'das pa dang / rtag tu mnyam par @144a * //
translated: It is to be free of attachment and aversion toward all sentient beings and all phenomena. It is to transcend all worldly phenomena. It is to always be in equipoise.🔽

original: gzhag pa dang / nyon mongs pa mi mnga' bar bzhugs pa dang / bag chags thams cad yang dag par bcom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhag pa dang / nyon mongs pa mi mnga' bar bzhugs pa dang / bag chags thams cad yang dag par bcom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because he is not attached to or averse to any sentient being or phenomenon, he has transcended all worldly dharmas, he is always in equipoise, he abides without afflictions, and he has completely destroyed all habitual tendencies.

original: de bas na ca co mi mnga' ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na ca co mi mnga' ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, he is called “one who does not sigh.”

original: 'di ni ma 'dres pa'i chos gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ma 'dres pa'i chos gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second unshared quality.

original: bsnyel ba mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar dgra bcom pa rnams ma bsams nas brjed par bya ba shor ba dang / dus las yol bar 'gyur ba de lta bu de bzhin gshegs pa la mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: bsnyel ba mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar dgra bcom pa rnams ma bsams nas brjed par bya ba shor ba dang / dus las yol bar 'gyur ba de lta bu de bzhin gshegs pa la mi mnga' ste /
translated: “He is not forgetful” means that, unlike arhats who forget and lose their focus when they are not mindful and who sometimes miss the right time, the Tathāgata is never like that.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems can thams cad kyi don thams cad dang / chos thams cad dang mdzad pa thams cad dang / dus thams cad du bsnyel ba mi mnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems can thams cad kyi don thams cad dang / chos thams cad dang mdzad pa thams cad dang / dus thams cad du bsnyel ba mi mnga'o //
translated: The Tathāgata does not forget the aims, the teachings, the activities, and the times of all sentient beings.

original: de bas na bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, he is called the “unforgetful one.”

original: 'di ni ma 'dres pa'i chos gsum pa'o //🔽sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar dgra bcom pa dag gang gi tshe /
analyzed: 'di ni ma 'dres pa'i chos gsum pa'o // sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar dgra bcom pa dag gang gi tshe /
translated: This is the third unique quality.🔽He does not have an uncollected mind.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa de nyid kyi tshe na mnyam par gzhag par 'gyur gyi gzhan gyi tshe ni ma yin no //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa ni snyoms par zhugs kyang rung /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa de nyid kyi tshe na mnyam par gzhag par 'gyur gyi gzhan gyi tshe ni ma yin no // de bzhin gshegs pa ni snyoms par zhugs kyang rung /
translated: Thus, when the arhats enter into meditative concentration, then they have a collected mind, but not at other times.

original: snyoms par ma zhugs kyang rung /
analyzed: snyoms par ma zhugs kyang rung /
translated: The Tathāgata, whether he is in meditative concentration or not,

original: dus thams cad du mnyam par gzhag pa nyid de /
analyzed: dus thams cad du mnyam par gzhag pa nyid de /
translated: at all times has a collected mind.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni ting nge 'dzin zab mo dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni ting nge 'dzin zab mo dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The Tathāgata has perfected the highest profound meditative absorption.

original: 'di ni ma 'dres pa'i chos bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ma 'dres pa'i chos bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth unique quality.

original: tha dad pa'i 'du shes mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar dgra bcom pa dag ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos la sogs pa tha dad pa'i blo 'jug gi /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i 'du shes mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar dgra bcom pa dag ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos la sogs pa tha dad pa'i blo 'jug gi /
translated: They do not have the notion of multiplicity, because arhats have the notion of multiplicity with regard to samsara and nirvana, to phenomena of defilement and purification, and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: But the Tathagatas are not like that.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni rtag tu sems can mnyam pa nyid dang / chos mnyam pa nyid la 'jug ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni rtag tu sems can mnyam pa nyid dang / chos mnyam pa nyid la 'jug ste /
translated: The Tathagatas are always engaged in the sameness of sentient beings and the sameness of phenomena.

original: thugs rje'i dbang dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi dbang gis /
analyzed: thugs rje'i dbang dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi dbang gis /
translated: By the power of their great compassion and the power of their nonconceptual gnosis,

original: 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'am /🔽dkar po dang / nag po'i chos rnams sam /
analyzed: 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'am / dkar po dang / nag po'i chos rnams sam /
translated: they are engaged in samsara and nirvana,🔽in virtuous and nonvirtuous phenomena,

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / tshul khrims 'chal pa'am /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / tshul khrims 'chal pa'am /
translated: in those who observe moral discipline and those who violate it,

original: phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod pa byed pa'am /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod pa byed pa'am /
translated: in those who benefit them and those who harm them,🔽in those who are destined for the ultimate and those who are not,

original: yang dag pa nyid du nges pa dang / log pa nyid du nges pa'am /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du nges pa dang / log pa nyid du nges pa'am /
translated: and in those who are liberated and those who are not.

original: sems can mchog dang tha ma rnams la tha dad pa'i 'du shes @144b mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: sems can mchog dang tha ma rnams la tha dad pa'i 'du shes @144b mi 'jug ste /
translated: He does not entertain any notion of difference with regard to superior and inferior sentient beings.

original: 'di ni ma 'dres pa'i chos lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ma 'dres pa'i chos lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifth unique quality.

original: so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He does not have a non-discursive equanimity.

original: ji ltar dgra bcom pa rnams so so ma brtags par sems can gyi don yal bar 'dor ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar dgra bcom pa rnams so so ma brtags par sems can gyi don yal bar 'dor ba de bzhin du /
translated: As for the arhats, they abandon the welfare of sentient beings without examining each case.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mi mdzad de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mi mdzad de /
translated: The Tathāgata does not act in that way.

original: de ni dus dang dus ma yin pa dang / skal ba yod pa dang skal ba med pa dang / don yod pa dang don med pa so sor brtags nas yal bar 'jog pa yin gyi gzhan du ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni dus dang dus ma yin pa dang / skal ba yod pa dang skal ba med pa dang / don yod pa dang don med pa so sor brtags nas yal bar 'jog pa yin gyi gzhan du ma yin te /
translated: He examines each case, whether the time is right or not, whether there is an opportunity or not, whether there is benefit or not, and then he abandons them.

original: 'di ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni drug pa'o //
translated: This is the sixth.

original: 'dun pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He does not have a loss of aspiration.

original: brtson 'grus yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //🔽dran pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o // dran pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He does not have a loss of effort.🔽He does not have a loss of mindfulness.

original: ting nge 'dzin yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He does not have a loss of concentration.

original: shes rab yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: shes rab yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He does not have a loss of wisdom.

original: rnam par grol ba yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He does not lose his complete liberation.🔽He does not lose his vision of the awareness of complete liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa dag ni spyod yul gyi dbang gis rang bzhin gyis sangs rgyas kyi sa dang / rang bzhin gyis sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa la 'dun pa mi skye'i /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa dag ni spyod yul gyi dbang gis rang bzhin gyis sangs rgyas kyi sa dang / rang bzhin gyis sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa la 'dun pa mi skye'i /
translated: Arhats do not generate the aspiration for the natural stage of a buddha and the natural deeds of a buddha due to the power of their domain.

original: nyan thos kyi bya ba nyid la 'dun par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi bya ba nyid la 'dun par 'gyur ro //
translated: They generate the aspiration for the deeds of a śrāvaka.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi sa'i brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba gang yin pa de dag ni nyan thos rnams la med de /
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi sa'i brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba gang yin pa de dag ni nyan thos rnams la med de /
translated: Similarly, the effort, mindfulness, samādhi, wisdom, complete liberation, and vision of the awareness of complete liberation of the stage of a buddha do not exist for śrāvakas.

original: de bas na 'dun pa la sogs pa chos bdun po de dag ma thob par yongs su nyams pas yongs su nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'dun pa la sogs pa chos bdun po de dag ma thob par yongs su nyams pas yongs su nyams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, they lose those seven qualities, such as aspiration, because they have not attained them.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni khyad par can gyi chos ma brnyes pa mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni khyad par can gyi chos ma brnyes pa mi mnga' ste /
translated: The Buddhas do not lack the acquisition of special qualities.

original: chos thams cad thugs su chud par gyur pas yongs su nyams pa cung zad kyang mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad thugs su chud par gyur pas yongs su nyams pa cung zad kyang mi mnga' ste /
translated: They do not have the slightest imperfection, since they have realized all the qualities.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas rnams ni dus thams cad du sems can gyi don mdzad pa la 'dun pa rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas rnams ni dus thams cad du sems can gyi don mdzad pa la 'dun pa rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, the Buddhas are always intent on working for the benefit of sentient beings, and this intent arises uninterruptedly.

original: byams pa chen po dang / thugs rje chen po la sogs pa'i chos la 'dun pa dang / chos 'chad pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / byang chub kyi sems yang dag par blangs nas dkon mchog gsum gyi rgyun mi bcad pa'i 'dun pa rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: byams pa chen po dang / thugs rje chen po la sogs pa'i chos la 'dun pa dang / chos 'chad pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / byang chub kyi sems yang dag par blangs nas dkon mchog gsum gyi rgyun mi bcad pa'i 'dun pa rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ngo //
translated: The intent to teach the Dharma, to bring sentient beings to maturity, to take up the thought of awakening, and to prevent the lineage of the Three Jewels from being interrupted, all of these arise uninterruptedly.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni brtson @145a * //🔽'grus thams cad la sku bsnyel ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni brtson @145a * // 'grus thams cad la sku bsnyel ba'am /
translated: The Tathāgata does not have any forgetfulness with regard to any of his efforts.

original: thugs bsnyel ba nam yang mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: thugs bsnyel ba nam yang mi 'byung ngo //
translated: He never has any forgetfulness of the body or the mind.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems can gcig gi don du yang bskal par yang bshos mi gsol bar chos ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems can gcig gi don du yang bskal par yang bshos mi gsol bar chos ston to //
translated: The Tathāgata does not teach the Dharma for the sake of even one being who would not be satisfied for eons.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyang 'das par mdzad nas gang na sangs rgyas kyis 'dul bar 'gyur ba sems can gcig yod pa der gshegs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyang 'das par mdzad nas gang na sangs rgyas kyis 'dul bar 'gyur ba sems can gcig yod pa der gshegs so //
translated: The Tathāgata would go to where there is even one being who would be disciplined by a Buddha, even if he had to pass through as many buddhafields as there are sands in the Ganges River.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dran pa la yang yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dran pa la yang yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ste /
translated: The Tathāgata does not have any loss of mindfulness.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: Thus, the Tathāgata, having attained unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa dang / g-ye ba thams cad dang / bsam pa dang / bag la nyal ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa thams cad dang /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa dang / g-ye ba thams cad dang / bsam pa dang / bag la nyal ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa thams cad dang /
translated: knows the mental activity and distraction, intentions, latent tendencies, afflictions, faculties, etc. of all sentient beings of the past, future, and present.

original: sems can gdul ba'i thabs thams cad dang / sems can gyi don thams cad dang / sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa thams cad dang / chos ji ltar dgongs pa dang / gzigs pa thams cad dran pa'i lam du gzhag pas /
analyzed: sems can gdul ba'i thabs thams cad dang / sems can gyi don thams cad dang / sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa thams cad dang / chos ji ltar dgongs pa dang / gzigs pa thams cad dran pa'i lam du gzhag pas /
translated: All the means of training sentient beings, all the aims of sentient beings, all the deeds of the Buddha, all the teachings as intended and as seen are established on the path of mindfulness.

original: de la phyis ye shes gtong ba mi mdzad de /
analyzed: de la phyis ye shes gtong ba mi mdzad de /
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata never loses his knowledge.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dran pa ni dus thams cad du yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ba nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dran pa ni dus thams cad du yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ba nyid do //
translated: The mindfulness of the Tathāgata is never lost at any time.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ste /
translated: The Tathāgata’s samādhi is also never lost.

original: sems can thams cad dang / chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid la mnyam par gzhag pas de bzhin nyid mnyam pa nyid kyis chos thams cad mnyam par 'jog go //
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang / chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid la mnyam par gzhag pas de bzhin nyid mnyam pa nyid kyis chos thams cad mnyam par 'jog go //
translated: He is absorbed in the suchness of all sentient beings and all phenomena, and he is absorbed in the sameness of all phenomena through the sameness of suchness.

original: de bas na de bzhin nyid la ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin nyid la ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, suchness is called samādhi.

original: de bzhin nyid de yang nam mkha' dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid de yang nam mkha' dang mtshungs te /
translated: That suchness is also like space.

original: de la 'phel ba'am /
analyzed: de la 'phel ba'am /
translated: There is no increase or

original: yongs su 'grib pa med cing /
analyzed: yongs su 'grib pa med cing /
translated: There is no decrease.

original: dus thams cad du de bzhin bas na de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: dus thams cad du de bzhin bas na de bzhin nyid de /
translated: Since it is just so at all times, it is thusness.

original: de bas na ting nge 'dzin la nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: de bas na ting nge 'dzin la nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: Therefore, there is no decrease in meditative absorption.

original: shes rab la yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: shes rab la yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ste /
translated: There is no decrease in wisdom.

original: 'di ltar sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa mkhyen pa mi zad pa dang / chos bstan pa mkhyen pa mi zad pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i @145b mkhyen pa mi zad pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa la mkhas pa'i mkhyen pa mi zad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa mkhyen pa mi zad pa dang / chos bstan pa mkhyen pa mi zad pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i @145b mkhyen pa mi zad pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa la mkhas pa'i mkhyen pa mi zad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is explained that there is no decrease in the knowledge of the mental activity of all sentient beings, the knowledge of teaching the Dharma, the knowledge of ripening sentient beings, and the knowledge of skill in discriminating awareness.

original: rnam par grol ba yang yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba yang yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ste /
translated: There is also no decrease in liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba la nyan thos rnams kyi rnam par grol ba ni sgra'i rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba la nyan thos rnams kyi rnam par grol ba ni sgra'i rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: As for what is called “liberation,” the liberation of the hearers follows after sound.

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam par grol ba ni rkyen gyi rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam par grol ba ni rkyen gyi rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: The liberation of the solitary realizers follows after conditions.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam par grol ba ni chos nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba 'di yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam par grol ba ni chos nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba 'di yin te /
translated: This is the liberation of the buddhas, which is in accord with reality.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba dang / 'bras bu'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pas rnam par grol ba dang / mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam par grol ba ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba dang / 'bras bu'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pas rnam par grol ba dang / mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam par grol ba ste /
translated: It is liberation from the afflictive obstructions, liberation from the obstructions to omniscience, liberation through meditative concentration for the sake of the result, and liberation in nonabiding nirvana.

original: de rnam par grol ba thams cad zad mi shes shing /
analyzed: de rnam par grol ba thams cad zad mi shes shing /
translated: That liberation is inexhaustible for all.

original: nam mkha' lta bur gyur pas sems can gyi don mdzad pa la 'khor ba ji srid yod kyi bar du 'jug pas na rnam par grol ba la yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bur gyur pas sems can gyi don mdzad pa la 'khor ba ji srid yod kyi bar du 'jug pas na rnam par grol ba la yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: Since it is like space, it engages in benefiting sentient beings for as long as cyclic existence lasts. Therefore, there is no degeneration in liberation.

original: ji ltar rnam par grol ba la yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ba de bzhin du rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba la yang yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par grol ba la yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ba de bzhin du rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba la yang yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ba ste /
translated: Just as there is no degeneration in liberation, there is also no degeneration in the wisdom that sees liberation.

original: 'di ni chos bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni chos bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the twelfth quality.

original: sku'i phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo zhes bya ba ni ji ltar dgra bcom pa gzhan dag lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rnams bsams bzhin med par byed pa dang / nyes pa yang mthol ba dang /
analyzed: sku'i phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo zhes bya ba ni ji ltar dgra bcom pa gzhan dag lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rnams bsams bzhin med par byed pa dang / nyes pa yang mthol ba dang /
translated: This is not so for other arhats, who perform physical, verbal and mental actions without forethought,🔽and who sometimes reveal their faults and sometimes do not.

original: bag chags kyi ma tshor ba yang byed pa de ltar yang sangs rgyas rnams mi mdzad de /
analyzed: bag chags kyi ma tshor ba yang byed pa de ltar yang sangs rgyas rnams mi mdzad de /
translated: The Buddhas do not act in this way.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni gzigs pas kyang sems can rnams 'dul lo //🔽gsung ba dang / cang mi gsung ba dang / bshos gsol ba dang / mnal ba dang / bzhud pa dang / byon pa dang / bzhugs pa dang / 'phres pa dang / sku las 'od zer 'gyed pa dang / mtshan rnams dang / dpe byad bzang po rnams dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni gzigs pas kyang sems can rnams 'dul lo // gsung ba dang / cang mi gsung ba dang / bshos gsol ba dang / mnal ba dang / bzhud pa dang / byon pa dang / bzhugs pa dang / 'phres pa dang / sku las 'od zer 'gyed pa dang / mtshan rnams dang / dpe byad bzang po rnams dang /
translated: The Buddhas guide sentient beings by their sight.🔽They guide sentient beings by their speech, by their silence, by their eating, by their sleeping, by their coming, by their going, by their sitting, by their lying down, by their radiating light, by their major marks, by their excellent minor marks,

original: zhabs gom pa 'dor ba dang / spyan 'byed pas kyang sems can rnams 'dul lo //
analyzed: zhabs gom pa 'dor ba dang / spyan 'byed pas kyang sems can rnams 'dul lo //
translated: by their walking, by their opening their eyes, and so forth.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi gsung thams cad kyang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi gsung thams cad kyang /
translated: All the speech of the Buddhas

original: sems can / thams kyi don thams sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: sems can / thams kyi don thams sgrub pa ste /
translated: accomplishes all the aims of all sentient beings.

original: don dam par mi @146a * //
analyzed: don dam par mi @146a * //
translated: ultimately, it is

original: 'gyur zhing rnam pa du ma yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'gyur zhing rnam pa du ma yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
translated: unchanging and has many aspects, endowed with sixty nuances, arising in accord with the thoughts, dispositions, and tendencies of all sentient beings.

original: thugs kyi phrin las kyang nyon mongs pa'i bag chags thams cad dang / rtog pa'i bag chags thams cad dang / spros pa'i bag chags thams cad dang mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: thugs kyi phrin las kyang nyon mongs pa'i bag chags thams cad dang / rtog pa'i bag chags thams cad dang / spros pa'i bag chags thams cad dang mi ldan pa ste /
translated: The activity of their minds is not associated with any habitual tendencies of the afflictions, any habitual tendencies of conceptualization, or any habitual tendencies of conceptual elaboration.

original: byams pa chen po dang / thugs rje chen po'i ngang dang ldan zhing yang dag pa'i mtha' yongs su ma btang ba dang / don dam pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa chen po dang / thugs rje chen po'i ngang dang ldan zhing yang dag pa'i mtha' yongs su ma btang ba dang / don dam pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is endowed with the state of great love and great compassion, does not abandon the limit of reality, and is engaged in the ultimate nature.

original: phrin las gsum po de dag thams cad kyang ye shes lngar byung ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ye shes sngon du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: phrin las gsum po de dag thams cad kyang ye shes lngar byung ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ye shes sngon du 'gro ba'o //
translated: Since all these three activities arise from the cause that is the appearance of the five pristine wisdoms, they are preceded by pristine wisdom.

original: ye shes dang lhan cig tu rgyu ba'i dbang gis chos gsum po 'di dag ni ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes dang lhan cig tu rgyu ba'i dbang gis chos gsum po 'di dag ni ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: These three dharmas are called “following wisdom” because they are governed by the movement of wisdom.🔽The Tathāgatas’ wisdom vision penetrates the past without impediment or obstruction.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes mthong ba 'das pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs par 'jug go zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji ltar dgra bcom pa dag / gang dang gang du rtsol ba gtong ba de dang de nyid shes kyi gzhan du ni shes
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes mthong ba 'das pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs par 'jug go zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji ltar dgra bcom pa dag / gang dang gang du rtsol ba gtong ba de dang de nyid shes kyi gzhan du ni shes
translated: As for the rest, the Arhats, when they direct their attention to something, know it, but when they do not direct their attention to it, they do not know it.

original: pa chags shing thogs par gyur pa de lta bu de bzhin gshegs pa dag la mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: pa chags shing thogs par gyur pa de lta bu de bzhin gshegs pa dag la mi mnga' ste /
translated: The Tathāgatas, however, are not like that.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dag ni 'das pa'i dus na sangs rgyas kyi zhing byung ba ji snyed yod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag na sa dang chu dang / me dang rlung gi rdul phra rab ji snyed yod pa rnams dang / rtsa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dag ni 'das pa'i dus na sangs rgyas kyi zhing byung ba ji snyed yod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag na sa dang chu dang / me dang rlung gi rdul phra rab ji snyed yod pa rnams dang / rtsa dang /
translated: The Tathāgatas know the number of atoms in the past in all the buddhafields that have appeared, and in the earth, water, fire, and wind in those buddhafields, and in the grass,

original: shing gel pa dang / sman dang / nags tshal ji snyed yod pa rnams dang / sems can gyi rigs ji snyed yod pa rnams dang / sems can de dag gi rigs dang / kha dog dang / na tshod dang / gzugs dang / byad lag dang /
analyzed: shing gel pa dang / sman dang / nags tshal ji snyed yod pa rnams dang / sems can gyi rigs ji snyed yod pa rnams dang / sems can de dag gi rigs dang / kha dog dang / na tshod dang / gzugs dang / byad lag dang /
translated: the trees, the medicinal herbs, the forests, the various types of sentient beings, the different types of sentient beings, their different colors, ages, forms, limbs,

original: sems kyi spyod pa dang / bsam pa dang / dbang po dang / mos pa tha dad pa ji snyed yod pa rnams dang / de dag tu sangs rgyas ji snyed byung ba rnams dang / de dag gis chos bstan pa ji snyed yod pa rnams dang /
analyzed: sems kyi spyod pa dang / bsam pa dang / dbang po dang / mos pa tha dad pa ji snyed yod pa rnams dang / de dag tu sangs rgyas ji snyed byung ba rnams dang / de dag gis chos bstan pa ji snyed yod pa rnams dang /
translated: their different mental activities, thoughts, faculties, and inclinations, the various buddhas that appear there, the various teachings they give,

original: theg pa gsum la 'dul ba'i sems can ji snyed yod pa rnams dang / de na nyan thos ji snyed yod pa rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas ji snyed yod pa rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' ji snyed yod pa rnams dang / de dag thams cad kyi tshe'i tshad ji tsam thub pa dang /
analyzed: theg pa gsum la 'dul ba'i sems can ji snyed yod pa rnams dang / de na nyan thos ji snyed yod pa rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas ji snyed yod pa rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' ji snyed yod pa rnams dang / de dag thams cad kyi tshe'i tshad ji tsam thub pa dang /
translated: the sentient beings who are trained in the three vehicles, the various śrāvakas, the various pratyekabuddhas, the various bodhisattvas, and the lifespans of all of them,

original: de dag gi @146b zas kyi dus dang / gos dang yongs su spyod pa ji snyed yod pa rnams dang / 'jig rten gyi khams de dag tu sreg pa'i bskal pa ji snyed 'byung ba dang / chu dang med dang rlung gis 'jig pa ji snyed 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: de dag gi @146b zas kyi dus dang / gos dang yongs su spyod pa ji snyed yod pa rnams dang / 'jig rten gyi khams de dag tu sreg pa'i bskal pa ji snyed 'byung ba dang / chu dang med dang rlung gis 'jig pa ji snyed 'byung ba dang /
translated: the times of their meals, the extent of their clothing and possessions, the number of conflagrations, floods, and storms that occur in those world systems,

original: nam mkha'i khams ji tsam pa dang / skar ma'i gzugs rnams ji snyed yod pa dang / ri dang ri sul dang / 'bab chu dang / mtsho dang rgya mtsho ji snyed yod pa dang / grong dang grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / ljongs dang /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams ji tsam pa dang / skar ma'i gzugs rnams ji snyed yod pa dang / ri dang ri sul dang / 'bab chu dang / mtsho dang rgya mtsho ji snyed yod pa dang / grong dang grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / ljongs dang /
translated: the extent of the realm of space, the number of stellar bodies, the mountains and mountain ranges, waterfalls, lakes, and oceans, the towns, cities, villages, countries,

original: yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor ji snyed yod pa dang / tshong dus kyi rnam par dbye ba ji snyed yod pa dang / zhing dang / kun dga' rab dang / skyed mos tshal dang / nags tshal ji snyed yod pa dang /
analyzed: yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor ji snyed yod pa dang / tshong dus kyi rnam par dbye ba ji snyed yod pa dang / zhing dang / kun dga' rab dang / skyed mos tshal dang / nags tshal ji snyed yod pa dang /
translated: kingdoms, and royal palaces, the various marketplaces, the fields, parks, gardens, and forests,

original: de na sems can gyi 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba dang / 'gro ba rab tu dbye ba ji snyed yod pa dang / de dag gi dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba ji snyed yod pa dang / mig 'byed pa dang / 'dzums pa ji snyed yod pa de dag dang /🔽de 'dra ba gzhan thams cad kyang de bzhin gshegs pas skad cig gcig la bgrang ba'i tshul du mngon sum gyis mkhyen pas yongs su bcad de rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de na sems can gyi 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba dang / 'gro ba rab tu dbye ba ji snyed yod pa dang / de dag gi dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba ji snyed yod pa dang / mig 'byed pa dang / 'dzums pa ji snyed yod pa de dag dang / de 'dra ba gzhan thams cad kyang de bzhin gshegs pas skad cig gcig la bgrang ba'i tshul du mngon sum gyis mkhyen pas yongs su bcad de rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata directly perceives and fully knows in a single moment of mind the number of beings who die and are reborn, the number of their comings and goings, the number of their in-breaths and out-breaths, and the number of their opening and closing of eyes.🔽In the same way, the Tathāgata’s wisdom directly perceives and fully knows in a single moment of mind the number of beings who die and are reborn in the future, and the number of their comings and goings, in-breaths and out-breaths, and opening and closing of eyes.

original: de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa dang / de bzhin du da ltar byung ba thams cad la yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ma chags ma thogs par 'jug ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa dang / de bzhin du da ltar byung ba thams cad la yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ma chags ma thogs par 'jug ste /
translated: In the same way, the Tathāgata’s wisdom directly perceives and fully knows in a single moment of mind the number of beings who die and are reborn in the present, and the number of their comings and goings, in-breaths and out-breaths, and opening and closing of eyes.

original: 'di dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad do //
analyzed: 'di dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad do //
translated: These are the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha.

original: gzungs kyi sgo theg pa chen po ni de la gzungs kyi sgo dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo theg pa chen po ni de la gzungs kyi sgo dag gang zhe na /
translated: The Mahāyāna dhāraṇī gateway. What are the dhāraṇī gateways?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: yi ge'i tshul mnyam pa nyid dang / yi ge'i sgo dang / yi ge la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yi ge'i tshul mnyam pa nyid dang / yi ge'i sgo dang / yi ge la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The door of syllables, and the engagement with syllables.

original: gzungs zhes bya ba ni sngar byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan bstan par brjod pa'i rnam pas bzod pa'i gzungs dang / chos kyi gzungs dang / don gyi gzungs dang / sngags kyi gzungs dang bzhi la gzungs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzungs zhes bya ba ni sngar byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan bstan par brjod pa'i rnam pas bzod pa'i gzungs dang / chos kyi gzungs dang / don gyi gzungs dang / sngags kyi gzungs dang bzhi la gzungs zhes bya'o //
translated: The four kinds of retention that were mentioned above in the description of the bodhisattva's virtues are called retention.

original: gzungs de dag gi sgo dag ni gzungs kyi sgo rnams te yi ge rnams so //
analyzed: gzungs de dag gi sgo dag ni gzungs kyi sgo rnams te yi ge rnams so //
translated: The doors of those retentions are the doors of retention, which are the syllables.

original: yi ge nges par bsam pa'i stobs kyis gzungs 'di bzhi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yi ge nges par bsam pa'i stobs kyis gzungs 'di bzhi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the power of reflecting on the syllables, these four retentions occur.

original: yi ge de dag gi tshul gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: yi ge de dag gi tshul gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the method of the syllables?

original: yi ge'i tshul ni yang dag pa'i don rab tu rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge'i tshul ni yang dag pa'i don rab tu rtogs pa'o //
translated: The method of the syllables is the understanding of the true meaning.

original: yi ge'i tshul mnyam pa nyid ni yi ge'i tshul mnyam pa nyid de aa zhes bya ba @147a * //
analyzed: yi ge'i tshul mnyam pa nyid ni yi ge'i tshul mnyam pa nyid de aa zhes bya ba @147a * //
translated: The sameness of the method of the syllables is the sameness of the method of the syllables.

original: la sogs pa yi ge 'bru thams cad ni skye ba med pa la sogs pa de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin rab tu rtogs par byed pas yi ge'i tshul mnyam pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: la sogs pa yi ge 'bru thams cad ni skye ba med pa la sogs pa de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin rab tu rtogs par byed pas yi ge'i tshul mnyam pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: And so on refers to the knowledge of the nature of all syllables as non-arisen and so on, as the nature of thusness.

original: mnyam pa nyid de dag la dmigs na se ye shes byung ba la yang yi ge'i tshul mnyam pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid de dag la dmigs na se ye shes byung ba la yang yi ge'i tshul mnyam pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The equality of the method of syllables is so called because it is the knowledge that arises from the observation of those equalities.

original: yi ge rnams ni 'di'i sgo yin pas yi ge ni ye shes kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: yi ge rnams ni 'di'i sgo yin pas yi ge ni ye shes kyi sgo'o //
translated: Syllables are the door to that knowledge, so the method of syllables is the door to knowledge.

original: yi ge rnams kyi 'jug pas na yi ge 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: yi ge rnams kyi 'jug pas na yi ge 'jug pa ste /
translated: The entry of syllables is so called because it is the entry of syllables.

original: yi ge'i dbang gis ye shes de 'jug go //
analyzed: yi ge'i dbang gis ye shes de 'jug go //
translated: That knowledge enters by the power of syllables.🔽The syllable a is the door of all dharmas because it is originally non-arisen.

original: aa zhes bya ba ni gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba la aa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo ste /
analyzed: aa zhes bya ba ni gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba la aa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo ste /
translated: The syllable a is the door to the correct knowledge of all dharmas as they are.

original: 'jug par byed pa dang rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa dang rgyu yin no //
translated: It is the cause and the entry.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is originally non-arisen.

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni gzod ma nas dri ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs nyid na /🔽ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni gzod ma nas dri ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs nyid na / ma skyes pa ste /
translated: Thus, all phenomena are unborn even in the state of being originally stained.

original: de bas na rnal 'byor spyod pas ma skyes pa'i don 'di aa zhes bya ba la ma skyes pa'i don du sgro btags nas bsgom pa na goms pa'i stobs kyis aa zhes bya ba tsam shin tu bsgoms pas chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i bzod pa 'thob
analyzed: de bas na rnal 'byor spyod pas ma skyes pa'i don 'di aa zhes bya ba la ma skyes pa'i don du sgro btags nas bsgom pa na goms pa'i stobs kyis aa zhes bya ba tsam shin tu bsgoms pas chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i bzod pa 'thob
translated: Therefore, when yogis and yoginis meditate on the meaning of non-arising by superimposing the meaning of non-arising onto the syllable A, through the power of familiarity, they attain the patience of the non-arising of all phenomena by meditating on the mere syllable A.

original: po // de bzhin du ra zhes bya ba la rdul dang / bral ba'i don sgro btags nas shin tu bsgoms pas chos thams cad rdul dang bral ba'i bzod pa thob ste /
analyzed: po // de bzhin du ra zhes bya ba la rdul dang / bral ba'i don sgro btags nas shin tu bsgoms pas chos thams cad rdul dang bral ba'i bzod pa thob ste /
translated: Similarly, by superimposing the meaning of being free from dust onto the syllable Ra and meditating on it, they attain the patience of all phenomena being free from dust.

original: de las bzod pa'i gzungs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las bzod pa'i gzungs su 'gyur ro //
translated: From that, it becomes the dhāraṇī of patience.

original: de ltar sngar gleng gzhi bstan par bshad pa'i tshul gyis phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis chos bshad pa rgya chen po shin tu myur bar 'byung ba'i tshogs 'dzin pa'i rgyur gyur pa ni chos kyi gzungs so //
analyzed: de ltar sngar gleng gzhi bstan par bshad pa'i tshul gyis phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis chos bshad pa rgya chen po shin tu myur bar 'byung ba'i tshogs 'dzin pa'i rgyur gyur pa ni chos kyi gzungs so //
translated: Thus, as explained in the above introduction, the Dharma dhāraṇī is the cause for the rapid and vast arising of the Dharma teachings of the buddhas and bodhisattva-mahāsattvas of the ten directions.

original: chos de rnams kyi don yang dag par 'dzin pa'i rgyur gyur pa ni don gyi gzungs so //
analyzed: chos de rnams kyi don yang dag par 'dzin pa'i rgyur gyur pa ni don gyi gzungs so //
translated: The meaning dhāraṇī is the cause for the correct retention of the meanings of those Dharmas.

original: sems can thams cad kyi yams kyi nad dang / gnod pa zhi bar byed pa'i gsang sngags kyi gzhi rnams ni gsang sngags kyi gzungs so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi yams kyi nad dang / gnod pa zhi bar byed pa'i gsang sngags kyi gzhi rnams ni gsang sngags kyi gzungs so //
translated: The mantra dhāraṇī is the basis of the mantras that pacify all sentient beings’ epidemics and harms.

original: de dag thams cad kyang yi ge'i rgyu las byung ba nyid de /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang yi ge'i rgyu las byung ba nyid de /
translated: All of those arise from the cause of letters.

original: de bas na gzungs kyi sgor gyur pa'i phyir yi ge rnams ni gzungs kyi sgo rnams te /
analyzed: de bas na gzungs kyi sgor gyur pa'i phyir yi ge rnams ni gzungs kyi sgo rnams te /
translated: Therefore, the letters are the dhāraṇī gateways because they are the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: de dag la dmigs pa las byung ba'i ye shes la yang @147b gzungs kyi sgo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la dmigs pa las byung ba'i ye shes la yang @147b gzungs kyi sgo zhes bya'o //
translated: The wisdom that arises from observing them is also called a dhāraṇī gateway.

original: ma skyes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de bzhin nyid kyi chos rnams te /
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de bzhin nyid kyi chos rnams te /
translated: The phrase “because they are unborn” and so on refers to the qualities of suchness.

original: 'di ltar nam mkha' dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar nam mkha' dang mtshungs so //
translated: They are like space.

original: 'di ltar nam mkha' ma skyes pa bzhin du de bzhin nyid kyang ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar nam mkha' ma skyes pa bzhin du de bzhin nyid kyang ma skyes pa'o //
translated: Just as space is unborn, suchness is also unborn.

original: 'di ltar nam mkha' rdul gyis ma gos pa'i phyir rdul dang bral ba de bzhin du de bzhin nyid kyang rdul dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar nam mkha' rdul gyis ma gos pa'i phyir rdul dang bral ba de bzhin du de bzhin nyid kyang rdul dang bral ba'o //
translated: Just as space is free of dust because it is not soiled by particles, suchness is also free of dust.

original: don dam par khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni don dam par tha dad med pa'i phyir gcig go //
analyzed: don dam par khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni don dam par tha dad med pa'i phyir gcig go //
translated: They are one because they are ultimately without distinction.

original: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la 'chi ba'i srid pa dang / skye ba'i srid pa dag mi dmigs pa'i srid pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la 'chi ba'i srid pa dang / skye ba'i srid pa dag mi dmigs pa'i srid pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In the sense that one does not apprehend death and rebirth.

original: ming mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la ming du brjod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la ming du brjod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the sense that one does not apprehend a name.

original: 'jig rten las 'das shing zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das shing zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is supramundane because suchness is supramundane.

original: srid pa'i 'khri shing gi rgyu dang rkyen yang dag par bcom pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid ni srid pa'i 'khri shing gi rgyu dang rkyen gang yin pa de dag yang dag par bcom pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i 'khri shing gi rgyu dang rkyen yang dag par bcom pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid ni srid pa'i 'khri shing gi rgyu dang rkyen gang yin pa de dag yang dag par bcom pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the complete destruction of the causes and conditions of the vine of existence because suchness is the nature of the complete destruction of the causes and conditions of the vine of existence.

original: dul ba dang dul bar gnas pa yongs su nges pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid du dul bar byed pa nyon mongs pa rnams dang / ma dul bar gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi las rnams med pa'i phyir dul ba dang dul bar gnas pa nyid du yongs su nges pa'o //
analyzed: dul ba dang dul bar gnas pa yongs su nges pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid du dul bar byed pa nyon mongs pa rnams dang / ma dul bar gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi las rnams med pa'i phyir dul ba dang dul bar gnas pa nyid du yongs su nges pa'o //
translated: It is the certainty of the disciplined and the disciplined state because suchness is certain as the disciplined and the disciplined state, since there is no disciplining of the passions and no nature of actions that are the basis of the undisciplined state.

original: bcings pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi bcing ba gsum po dag las grol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcings pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi bcing ba gsum po dag las grol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is liberation from bondage because it is liberated from the three bonds of passion, hatred, and folly.

original: khrag 'khrugs pa dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang / las dang rnam par smin pa'i dbang gis khrag 'khrugs dang rnam par g-yeng bar gyur pa gang yin pa de dag dang bral bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khrag 'khrugs pa dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang / las dang rnam par smin pa'i dbang gis khrag 'khrugs dang rnam par g-yeng bar gyur pa gang yin pa de dag dang bral bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of being free from the disturbance of blood, means because of being free from the disturbance and agitation that occur through the power of affliction, karma, and ripening.

original: chags pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i chags pa dang / las kyi sgrib pa'i chags pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa'i chags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i chags pa dang / las kyi sgrib pa'i chags pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa'i chags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of attachment, means because of the absence of the attachment of the affliction-obstruction, the attachment of the karma-obstruction, and the attachment of the ripening-obstruction.

original: ngag gi lam gyi sgra yang dag par chad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ngag gi tha snyad kyi bdag nyid kyi sgra rnams yang dag par chad pa'i phyir ro //🔽de bzhin nyid las ma @148a * //
analyzed: ngag gi lam gyi sgra yang dag par chad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ngag gi tha snyad kyi bdag nyid kyi sgra rnams yang dag par chad pa'i phyir ro // de bzhin nyid las ma @148a * //
translated: Because of the cessation of the sound of the path of speech, means because of the cessation of the sounds that are the nature of verbal conventions.

original: g-yos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid las rnam par ma g-yos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid las rnam par ma g-yos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of not moving from suchness, means because of not moving from the intrinsic reality of suchness.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du ma skyes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rigs par ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //🔽khengs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni khengs pa zhes bya ba nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du ma skyes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rigs par ma skyes pa'i phyir ro // khengs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni khengs pa zhes bya ba nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: Because of non-production in reality, means because of non-production in accordance with the way things are.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa las gyur pa'i khengs pa med pa'i phyir ro //🔽byed pa po mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni byed pa po zhes bya ba gang zag gam dbang phyug la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i rgyu rnams sam /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa las gyur pa'i khengs pa med pa'i phyir ro // byed pa po mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni byed pa po zhes bya ba gang zag gam dbang phyug la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i rgyu rnams sam /
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of haughtiness, means because of the absence of haughtiness which is a secondary defilement or which is a discursive thought of defilement.

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyi chos rnams dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyi chos rnams dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of an agent, means because of the non-apprehension of an agent, such as a person or a god, etc., as a cause that is not in conformity, or of the dharmas that are causes and conditions.

original: mnyam pa nyid las mi 'da' zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la mnyam pa nyid las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid las mi 'da' zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la mnyam pa nyid las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because of non-deviation from sameness, means because of non-deviation from the sameness of all dharmas. This is the meaning.

original: nga yir 'dzin pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sred pas bdag gir 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nga yir 'dzin pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sred pas bdag gir 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of the possession of mine, means because of the absence of craving for the possession of mine.

original: 'gro ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gro'i dbang gis skye ba gzhan du 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //🔽gnas mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gnas pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gro'i dbang gis skye ba gzhan du 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro // gnas mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gnas pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //

original: skye ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni med pa las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //🔽dbugs mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyam chung ba'i phyir stobs med pa'o //🔽chos mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rnam par med pa'i phyir ro //🔽nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad nam mkha' dang mnyam pas dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni med pa las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //🔽dbugs mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyam chung ba'i phyir stobs med pa'o //🔽chos mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rnam par med pa'i phyir ro //🔽nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad nam mkha' dang mnyam pas dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the non-apprehension of the equality of the absence of the intrinsic nature of the past, because of the non-apprehension of the equality of the absence of the

original: zad pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi zad pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zad pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi zad pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of destruction, i.e. because of the non-apprehension of the characteristic of impermanence.

original: ye shes mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shes bya'i dngos po med pas mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shes bya'i dngos po med pas mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of knowledge, i.e. because of the non-existence of the object of knowledge, there is no characteristic.

original: rgyu med pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of the absence of a cause, i.e. because of the absence of the characteristic of a cause.

original: 'jigs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid 'jigs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jigs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid 'jigs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of fear, i.e. because of the non-apprehension of the characteristic of destruction.

original: mdog mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la mdog med cing 'od med pas mi snang @148b ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdog mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la mdog med cing 'od med pas mi snang @148b ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of colour, i.e. because suchness is not visible, being without colour and without light.

original: dran pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid dran par byed pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid dran par byed pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of memory, i.e. because suchness is not the domain of the knowledge which brings about memory.

original: bod pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ming gi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bod pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ming gi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of the Tibetan, i.e., because of the non-existence of the domain of the name.

original: ming ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: ming ni bod pa'o //
translated: The Tibetan is a name.

original: chos rnams la spro ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad g-yo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rnams la spro ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad g-yo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of the activity of dharmas, i.e., because all dharmas are without movement.

original: stug po mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni stug por rnam par rtog pa log pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stug po mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni stug por rnam par rtog pa log pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of the dense, i.e., because of the cessation of the conceptual differentiation of the dense.

original: rnam par bsgrub pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'du byed rnam par dgod pa la rnam par bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par bsgrub pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'du byed rnam par dgod pa la rnam par bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of the establishment, i.e., the establishment of the formative forces is called the arrangement of the formative forces;

original: de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the non-existence of that.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the absence of defilement, i.e., because of the absence of the defilement of moral defilement and the defilement of conceptual differentiation.

original: 'bras bu mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i chos rnams la 'bras bu'i rnam pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i chos rnams la 'bras bu'i rnam pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of the result, i.e., because of the non-apprehension of the result in the dharmas that are the result.

original: phung po mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang / las dang rnam par smin pa'i phung po rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang / las dang rnam par smin pa'i phung po rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the aggregates are not perceived means because the aggregates of affliction, karma, and ripening do not exist.

original: rga ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rga ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rga ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rga ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because aging is not perceived means because aging, which is characterized by a change from the previous state, does not exist.

original: spyod pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba'i spyod pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyod pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba'i spyod pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because activity is not perceived means because the activity of going and coming is not perceived.

original: sdigs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'tshe ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdigs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'tshe ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because fear is not perceived means because there is no harm.

original: ngar 'dzin pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lta ba'i bdag nyid dang / nga rgyal gyi bdag nyid kyi ngar 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lta ba'i bdag nyid dang / nga rgyal gyi bdag nyid kyi ngar 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because grasping at “I” is not perceived means because grasping at “I” that is of the nature of view and pride does not exist.

original: gang gis tha snyad 'dogs pa dang / gang gis brjod pa dang / gang gis bstan pa zhes bya ba ni smra ba'i chos so //
analyzed: gang gis tha snyad 'dogs pa dang / gang gis brjod pa dang / gang gis bstan pa zhes bya ba ni smra ba'i chos so //
translated: That which is designated, that which is expressed, and that which is taught are the phenomena of speech.
