original: gang gis rtog par byed pa dang / gang gis mthong ba zhes bya ba ni nyan pa po'i chos so //🔽gang gis tha snyad 'dogs zhes bya ba ni gang 'phags pa rnams dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams kyis mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i dbang dang / ma mthong ba dang / ma thos pa dang /
analyzed: gang gis rtog par byed pa dang / gang gis mthong ba zhes bya ba ni nyan pa po'i chos so // gang gis tha snyad 'dogs zhes bya ba ni gang 'phags pa rnams dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams kyis mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i dbang dang / ma mthong ba dang / ma thos pa dang /
translated: “By whom is it imagined?” and “By whom is it seen?” refer to the Dharma of the listener.

original: bye brag ma phyed pa dang / rnam par ma shes pa'i dbang ste /
analyzed: bye brag ma phyed pa dang / rnam par ma shes pa'i dbang ste /
translated: “By whom is it designated?” refers to the designation by the power of the noble ones and the non-noble ones, by the power of what is seen, heard, distinguished, and cognized, and by the power of what is not seen, not heard, not distinguished, and not cognized.

original: tha snyad bcu drug gi dbang gis brjod do //
analyzed: tha snyad bcu drug gi dbang gis brjod do //
translated: “By whom is it expressed?” refers to expression by the power of the sixteen designations.

original: @149a * // gang gis brjod ces bya ba ni bum pa dang / snam bu dang ba glang dang / rta la sogs pa'i ming brjod pa'i dbang gis brjod pa'o //
analyzed: @149a * // gang gis brjod ces bya ba ni bum pa dang / snam bu dang ba glang dang / rta la sogs pa'i ming brjod pa'i dbang gis brjod pa'o //
translated: “By whom is it spoken?” refers to expression by the power of speaking the names of pot, cloth, ox, horse, and so on.

original: gang gis ston pa zhes bya ba ni ring po dang thung ngu dang / dkar sham dang / sngo ba sangs dang / sngon po dang / ser po la sogs pa'i yon tan bstan pa'i dbang gis brjod do //
analyzed: gang gis ston pa zhes bya ba ni ring po dang thung ngu dang / dkar sham dang / sngo ba sangs dang / sngon po dang / ser po la sogs pa'i yon tan bstan pa'i dbang gis brjod do //
translated: “By whom is taught” is expressed by the power of teaching such qualities as long and short, dark and light, blue and yellow, etc.

original: nyan pa po yang rjes su dag pa'i dbang gis don rjes su rtogs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: nyan pa po yang rjes su dag pa'i dbang gis don rjes su rtogs par byed pa ste /
translated: “By whom is heard” is expressed by the power of understanding the meaning by means of purification.

original: gang gis rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i dbang gis brjod do //
analyzed: gang gis rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i dbang gis brjod do //
translated: “By whom is realized” is expressed by the power of inference.

original: gang gis mthong ba zhes bya ba de ni mngon sum gyi don mthong ba'i dbang gis brjod do //🔽sgra gang la yang thogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni brjod pa thams cad la don dam pa tshol bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis mthong ba zhes bya ba de ni mngon sum gyi don mthong ba'i dbang gis brjod do // sgra gang la yang thogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni brjod pa thams cad la don dam pa tshol bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “By whom is seen” is expressed by the power of seeing the meaning of direct intuition.🔽“He does not encounter any sound” means that he seeks the ultimate meaning in all expressions.

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyis yang dag par sgrub par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni sgra thams cad de bzhin nyid du sbyor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyis yang dag par sgrub par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni sgra thams cad de bzhin nyid du sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: “He is established in the sameness of all things” means that he applies all sounds to reality.

original: sgra shes pa la mkhas pa yang zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyi skad dang / bsam pa thams cad shes pa'o //
analyzed: sgra shes pa la mkhas pa yang zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyi skad dang / bsam pa thams cad shes pa'o //
translated: Skill in the knowledge of sounds means the knowledge of the speech and thoughts of all sentient beings.

original: dran pa ni mi brjed pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa ni mi brjed pa'o //
translated: Recollection means non-forgetfulness.

original: blo gros zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: blo gros zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i shes rab ste /
translated: Intelligence is the wisdom that follows the ultimate truth.

original: blo gros dang / yid gzhungs pa dang / myur du mang po 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: blo gros dang / yid gzhungs pa dang / myur du mang po 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid de /
translated: It is the nature of intelligence, sharpness, and the quick retention of much.

original: de'i dbang gis shes rab myur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis shes rab myur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: By its power, wisdom is said to be quick.

original: blo ni kun rdzob kyi spyod yul lo //
analyzed: blo ni kun rdzob kyi spyod yul lo //
translated: Mind is the domain of conventional activity.

original: lhag ma ni don gsal lo //
analyzed: lhag ma ni don gsal lo //
translated: The rest is clear in meaning.

original: 'di ni theg pa chen po bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni theg pa chen po bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the teaching of the Mahayana.

original: de ltar theg pa chen po bstan pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar theg pa chen po bstan pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: Having thus completed the teaching of the Mahayana,

original: da ni zhus pa gnyis pa skabs dbye ba ste /
analyzed: da ni zhus pa gnyis pa skabs dbye ba ste /
translated: now the second request is the division of the occasion.

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin zhes zer ba zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i sa bcu po dag la zhugs pa ni theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa🔽zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin zhes zer ba zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i sa bcu po dag la zhugs pa ni theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is said that one who has set out in the ten stages that will be explained below is one who has set out in the Great Vehicle.

original: des na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu dang / sa yongs su sbyang bar bya ba zhus so //
analyzed: des na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu dang / sa yongs su sbyang bar bya ba zhus so //
translated: Therefore, it is taught by the Blessed One that one is a bodhisattva who has set out in the Great Vehicle, and the ten bodhisattva stages and the purification of the stages are requested.

original: chos thams cad 'pho ba med pas zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: chos thams cad 'pho ba med pas zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs te /
translated: Since all phenomena are without transference, suchness is like space,

original: 'pho ba med pas 'pho ba med pa'i ye shes ni sa @149b gzhan du 'phar ba'i rgyu yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'pho ba med pas 'pho ba med pa'i ye shes ni sa @149b gzhan du 'phar ba'i rgyu yin par bstan to //
translated: and since it is without transference, the wisdom without transference is taught to be the cause of leaping to another stage.

original: chos rnams kyi gang yin pa de la yang rlom sems su mi byed la sa yongs su sbyong bar yang byed do zhes bya bas sa gzhan du 'phar ba'i rgyu bstan to //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi gang yin pa de la yang rlom sems su mi byed la sa yongs su sbyong bar yang byed do zhes bya bas sa gzhan du 'phar ba'i rgyu bstan to //
translated: He does not even falsely project the stages of the dharmas, and he purifies the stages. This shows the cause for leaping over the stages.

original: 'pho ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa dang / 'ong ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir chos rnams kyi sa la rlom sems mi byed kyang las rnams mi byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: 'pho ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa dang / 'ong ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir chos rnams kyi sa la rlom sems mi byed kyang las rnams mi byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: He does not falsely project the stages of the dharmas because there is no transference, no going, no coming, etc. But this does not mean that he does not perform actions.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thabs mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thabs mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i bya ba bstan to //
translated: This shows the activity of the perfection of skill in means of the bodhisattvas.

original: thabs mkhas pa ni kun rdzob dang / don dam pa'i tshul gnyis shin tu 'gal ba 'dra ba yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dgos pa thams cad la 'gal ba med par bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa ni kun rdzob dang / don dam pa'i tshul gnyis shin tu 'gal ba 'dra ba yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dgos pa thams cad la 'gal ba med par bsgrub pa'o //
translated: Skill in means is the accomplishment of all goals without contradiction, even though the conventional and ultimate modes are mutually contradictory.

original: sa yongs su sbyong ba de dag kyang sngar glengs te bstan nas /
analyzed: sa yongs su sbyong ba de dag kyang sngar glengs te bstan nas /
translated: These purifications of the stages have been mentioned and taught previously.

original: phyis bshad pa'i 'gres la bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa dang po la gnas pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su sbyang bar bgyi ba gang lags zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad do //
analyzed: phyis bshad pa'i 'gres la bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa dang po la gnas pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su sbyang bar bgyi ba gang lags zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad do //
translated: Later, the repetition is explained by “Bhagavān, what is the thorough preparation of the superior intention of a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who is on the first ground?” and so on.

original: sems can thams cad kyi don gyi phyir theg pa chen po'i ye shes yongs su tshol ba la 'jug pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don gyi phyir theg pa chen po'i ye shes yongs su tshol ba la 'jug pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Engaging in the pursuit of the wisdom of the Great Vehicle for the sake of all sentient beings” is as follows.

original: theg pa chen po'i ye shes zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i ye shes zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: The “wisdom of the Great Vehicle” is the wisdom of omniscience.

original: de la tshol ba ni smon lam gdab pa dang / sems bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: de la tshol ba ni smon lam gdab pa dang / sems bskyed pa ste /
translated: The “pursuit” of that is the aspiration and the generation of the mind.

original: 'di ltar sems can thams cad kyi don du sangs rgyas kyi sa yongs su tshol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can thams cad kyi don du sangs rgyas kyi sa yongs su tshol ba'o //
translated: Thus, it is the pursuit of the buddha ground for the sake of all sentient beings.

original: 'di ni sems can thams cad la phan pa'i dngos po yongs su sbyong ba'o /🔽// / bam po bco lnga pa /
analyzed: 'di ni sems can thams cad la phan pa'i dngos po yongs su sbyong ba'o /🔽// / bam po bco lnga pa /
translated: This is the thorough preparation of the thing that benefits all sentient beings.

original: de las yongs su sbyong bar 'dod pas thog mar bsam pa yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de las yongs su sbyong bar 'dod pas thog mar bsam pa yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one who wishes to purify it should first purify his attitude.

original: de'i 'og tu sgrub pa ni sems can thams cad la phan pa'i rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir phan pa'i sems su bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sgrub pa ni sems can thams cad la phan pa'i rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir phan pa'i sems su bya'o //
translated: After that, he should have a helpful attitude, because practice is the root of help for all beings.

original: de yang sems can thams cad la sems snyoms pa las 'byung ba'i phyir sems mnyam pa nyid du bya'o //
analyzed: de yang sems can thams cad la sems snyoms pa las 'byung ba'i phyir sems mnyam pa nyid du bya'o //
translated: And that should be an attitude of sameness, because it arises from an attitude of sameness toward all beings.

original: dang po ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i sa yin pas na gtong ba yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dang po ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i sa yin pas na gtong ba yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: The first is the stage of the perfection of giving, so one should purify giving.

original: dag pa'i sa thob par bya ba la sngar bya ba yin pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen gdon mi za bar dgos pa'i phyir @150a * //🔽de la brten par bya'o //
analyzed: dag pa'i sa thob par bya ba la sngar bya ba yin pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen gdon mi za bar dgos pa'i phyir @150a * // de la brten par bya'o //
translated: Since it is the first thing to be done in order to attain the stage of purity, one should rely on a spiritual teacher, because he is indispensable.

original: de'i 'og tu dge ba'i bshes gnyen las dam pa'i chos mnyan par bya dgos pas chos yongs su btsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dge ba'i bshes gnyen las dam pa'i chos mnyan par bya dgos pas chos yongs su btsal bar bya'o //
translated: After that, one should seek the Dharma, because it is necessary to listen to the holy Dharma from a spiritual teacher.

original: rgyud yongs su ma smin pa'i phyir mngon par 'byung ba la gnas pa nyid du bya'o //
analyzed: rgyud yongs su ma smin pa'i phyir mngon par 'byung ba la gnas pa nyid du bya'o //
translated: Because the continuum has not matured, one should remain in renunciation.

original: rtag tu rgyun mi chad par sangs rgyas kyi sku dang / sangs rgyas nyid la 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: rtag tu rgyun mi chad par sangs rgyas kyi sku dang / sangs rgyas nyid la 'dod par bya'o //
translated: One should always desire the Buddha's body and Buddhahood without interruption.

original: ci nus su sems can yongs su smin par bya dgos pas brtson 'grus la yongs su skyo ba mi 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir chos bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: ci nus su sems can yongs su smin par bya dgos pas brtson 'grus la yongs su skyo ba mi 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir chos bshad par bya'o //
translated: One should explain the Dharma so that one does not become discouraged by striving to ripen beings as much as possible.

original: dang po smon lam nas bzung nas bden pa'i tshig la gus par bya ste /
analyzed: dang po smon lam nas bzung nas bden pa'i tshig la gus par bya ste /
translated: From the initial aspiration, one should respect the words of truth.

original: 'di dag ni yongs su sbyang ba bcu po dag gis mtshams sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni yongs su sbyang ba bcu po dag gis mtshams sbyar ba'o //
translated: These are the ten thorough preparations.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sa yin pa'i sa gnyis pa la yang tshul khrims yid la byed do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sa yin pa'i sa gnyis pa la yang tshul khrims yid la byed do //
translated: On the second ground, which is the ground of the perfection of morality, one should keep in mind morality.

original: sems can thams cad la byams pa spel ba'i phyir byas pa gzo ba dang / byas pa tshor ba yid la byed do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la byams pa spel ba'i phyir byas pa gzo ba dang / byas pa tshor ba yid la byed do //
translated: In order to increase loving kindness toward all sentient beings, one should keep in mind gratitude and appreciation.

original: sems can rnams kyi nyes pa la mi lta ba'i phyir bzod pa yid la byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi nyes pa la mi lta ba'i phyir bzod pa yid la byed do //
translated: He keeps in mind patience, because he does not look for faults in sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi rgyud snod du rung bar bya ba'i phyir mchog tu dga' ba yid la byed do //
analyzed: sems can gyi rgyud snod du rung bar bya ba'i phyir mchog tu dga' ba yid la byed do //
translated: He keeps in mind supreme joy, because he makes the stream of sentient beings fit for the Great Vehicle.

original: rtsom pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba ni de dag yin pas sems can yongs su mi gtong ba yid la byed do //
analyzed: rtsom pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba ni de dag yin pas sems can yongs su mi gtong ba yid la byed do //
translated: He keeps in mind not abandoning sentient beings, because these are the roots of all undertakings.

original: bdag gi sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir snying rje yid la byed do //
analyzed: bdag gi sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir snying rje yid la byed do //
translated: He keeps in mind compassion, because he turns away from the notion of his own suffering.

original: gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir bla ma rnams la dad pas 'phangs par yid la byed do //
analyzed: gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir bla ma rnams la dad pas 'phangs par yid la byed do //
translated: He keeps in mind the respect for gurus, because he generates devotion.

original: byang chub kyi tshogs kyi phyir pha rol tu phyin pa yid la byed de /
analyzed: byang chub kyi tshogs kyi phyir pha rol tu phyin pa yid la byed de /
translated: He keeps in mind the perfections, because he accumulates the requisites for enlightenment.

original: yid la byed pa brgyad do //
analyzed: yid la byed pa brgyad do //
translated: These are the eight considerations.

original: de bzhin du thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: And so on for all the rest.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed cing yongs su bsngo ba zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bskyed nas dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed cing yongs su bsngo ba zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bskyed nas dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs
translated: The root of merit that is produced and dedicated to the purification of the Buddha-land is the root of merit that leads to the purification of the Buddha-land.

original: su dag par gyur cig ces yongs su bsngo ba'o //
analyzed: su dag par gyur cig ces yongs su bsngo ba'o //
translated: Having produced the roots of merit, one dedicates them to the purification of the Buddha-land with the thought, “By these roots of merit, may the Buddha-land be purified.”

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing zhes bya ba'i dngos po ni gang yang med kyi /🔽bdag dang gzhan dag la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing zhes bya ba'i dngos po ni gang yang med kyi / bdag dang gzhan dag la /
translated: There is no such thing as a Buddha-land.🔽It is only the appearance of self and others

original: de lta de lta bur snang ba tsam du zad pas /
analyzed: de lta de lta bur snang ba tsam du zad pas /
translated: in such and such a way.

original: sems can yongs su sbyang ba nyid la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sems can yongs su sbyang ba nyid la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the purification of the Buddha-land is the purification of beings.🔽“Not abandoning the forest life” means that the word “forest” here does not refer to a forest grove,

original: dgon pa la gnas pa yongs su mi gtang ba zhes bya ba la dgon pa la @150b gnas pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir nags tshal na gnas pa la ni mi bya'i /
analyzed: dgon pa la gnas pa yongs su mi gtang ba zhes bya ba la dgon pa la @150b gnas pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir nags tshal na gnas pa la ni mi bya'i /
translated: but to the four immeasurables.

original: sems 'dre ba med par gnas pa dang / dben par gnas pa la 'dir dgon pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems 'dre ba med par gnas pa dang / dben par gnas pa la 'dir dgon pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The non-intermingling of the mind is the non-intermingling of the mind with the Disciples and Solitary Buddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems 'dre ba zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang / rang byang chub yid la byed pa'i dbang gis 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems 'dre ba zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang / rang byang chub yid la byed pa'i dbang gis 'gyur te /
translated: The non-intermingling of the mind of the Bodhisattvas is due to the influence of the attention given to the Disciples and Solitary Buddhas.

original: ji skad du rab 'byor gang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la byed pa dang mi ldan par dben par gnas pa 'di ni rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dben pa yin par ngas rjes su gnang ste /
analyzed: ji skad du rab 'byor gang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la byed pa dang mi ldan par dben par gnas pa 'di ni rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dben pa yin par ngas rjes su gnang ste /
translated: As it is said: Subhuti, I allow the Bodhisattva, the great being, to dwell in solitude, if he is not accompanied by the attention given to the Disciples and Solitary Buddhas.

original: gal te dben pa 'dis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nyin mtshan du gnas na dben pa nyid du gnas pa'o zhes 'og nas bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gal te dben pa 'dis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nyin mtshan du gnas na dben pa nyid du gnas pa'o zhes 'og nas bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: If the Bodhisattva, the great being, dwells in this solitude day and night, he dwells in true solitude.

original: gzhan yang de dgon pa dang nags tshal gyi phyogs dang / bas mtha'i gnas na gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dgon pa dang nags tshal gyi phyogs dang / bas mtha'i gnas na gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is said that he lives in a monastery or forest, or in a remote place, and so on.

original: de bzhin du sbyangs pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba'i sgra yang rnam par rtog pa sbyong ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i yon tan rnams la bya'i /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyangs pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba'i sgra yang rnam par rtog pa sbyong ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i yon tan rnams la bya'i /
translated: Similarly, the term “virtue of austerity” should be understood to refer to the virtues that are the cause of purifying the conceptual thoughts.

original: phyag dar khrod pa la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyag dar khrod pa la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not refer to the practice of wearing cast-off rags and so on.

original: gang la bslab pa thams cad rgyu ba med pa ste zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la bya'o //
analyzed: gang la bslab pa thams cad rgyu ba med pa ste zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la bya'o //
translated: “Where all training does not operate” refers to the practice of the perfection of wisdom, which is free of conceptual thought.

original: gang chos thams cad la mngon par 'du byed pa med pa zhes bya ba ni gang chos thams cad la g-yo ba yongs su btang ba'o //
analyzed: gang chos thams cad la mngon par 'du byed pa med pa zhes bya ba ni gang chos thams cad la g-yo ba yongs su btang ba'o //
translated: “Where there is no mental activity with regard to any dharma” means that all movement with regard to any dharma is relinquished.

original: gang rnam par shes pa gnas pa la de'i sems mi sbyor ba ste zhes bya ba ni kun tu 'dre bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gang rnam par shes pa gnas pa la de'i sems mi sbyor ba ste zhes bya ba ni kun tu 'dre bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: “Where the mind is not engaged with the stations of consciousness” means that it does not become involved with them.

original: bag la nyal du mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bag la nyal du mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that they do not remain latent.

original: sangs rgyas su lta ba la brten pas sangs rgyas mthong bar mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas mthong ngo snyam nas sangs rgyas su dmigs pa'i lta bas sangs rgyas su lta ba la gnas pa'i phyir sangs rgyas mthong ba med de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas su lta ba la brten pas sangs rgyas mthong bar mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas mthong ngo snyam nas sangs rgyas su dmigs pa'i lta bas sangs rgyas su lta ba la gnas pa'i phyir sangs rgyas mthong ba med de /
translated: “ One does not see the Buddha by taking the view of the Buddha as a basis” means that one does not see the Buddha by taking the view of the Buddha as a basis, thinking “I see the Buddha” and taking the view of the Buddha as a referential object.

original: mi dmigs pa'i ye shes nyid kyis sangs rgyas mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i ye shes nyid kyis sangs rgyas mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that one sees the Buddha by means of the gnosis of nonapprehending.

original: chos dang dge 'dun la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: chos dang dge 'dun la yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to the Dharma and the Saṅgha.

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyis stong pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyis stong pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that all phenomena are empty of emptiness.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di @151a * //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di @151a * //
translated: It is because they are empty of their own characteristics.

original: ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that phenomena such as form exist as the imagined characteristics of form and so on.

original: brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid don dam pa stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid du ni med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid don dam pa stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid du ni med pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the ultimate, which is the inexpressible reality, does not exist.

original: de'i phyir stong pa nyid la thams cad chad par lta ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i 'jigs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa nyid stong pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir stong pa nyid la thams cad chad par lta ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i 'jigs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa nyid stong pas /
translated: Therefore, it is said that one should not fear emptiness, which is the view of the annihilation of everything.🔽Because emptiness is empty of emptiness,🔽emptiness does not contradict emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid dang 'gal bar mi byed pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni gal te stong pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa ma yin na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid dang 'gal bar mi byed pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni gal te stong pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa ma yin na /
translated: If emptiness were not empty of the characteristics of emptiness,

original: de lta na ni mi stong pa'i chos shig yod par gyur pas chos thams cad stong ngo zhes bya ba dang / stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid 'di 'gal ba'i phyir stong pa nyid 'gal bar 'gyur ba zhig na 'di ltar stong pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i chos gzhan du gyur pa gang yang med pas stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis stong par khas len
analyzed: de lta na ni mi stong pa'i chos shig yod par gyur pas chos thams cad stong ngo zhes bya ba dang / stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid 'di 'gal ba'i phyir stong pa nyid 'gal bar 'gyur ba zhig na 'di ltar stong pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i chos gzhan du gyur pa gang yang med pas stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis stong par khas len
translated: If that were so, since there would be a phenomenon that is not empty, then emptiness would be contradictory, since the characteristic of emptiness would be contradictory.🔽But it is not like that, since there is no phenomenon called emptiness that is different from emptiness.

original: te / de bas na chos thams cad stong ngo zhes bya ba 'grub pa'i phyir stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang 'gal bar mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: te / de bas na chos thams cad stong ngo zhes bya ba 'grub pa'i phyir stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang 'gal bar mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, since the statement “All phenomena are empty” is established, emptiness does not make the characteristic of emptiness contradictory.🔽This is the meaning of the text.

original: 'di ltar stong pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid stong gi /
analyzed: 'di ltar stong pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid stong gi /
translated: Thus emptiness is empty of emptiness.🔽Emptiness does not realize emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid rtogs par mi byed ces bya ba ni stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid gnyis pa med de /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid rtogs par mi byed ces bya ba ni stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid gnyis pa med de /
translated: This means that emptiness is not empty of emptiness.

original: de bas na stong pa nyid gnyis pa med pa'i phyir stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid rtogs par mi byed do zhes bya bar shes pa gang yin pa de dag nyid kyis stong pa nyid rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na stong pa nyid gnyis pa med pa'i phyir stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid rtogs par mi byed do zhes bya bar shes pa gang yin pa de dag nyid kyis stong pa nyid rtogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since emptiness is non-dual, one should understand that emptiness is not realized by emptiness.

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The purity of the three spheres refers to the purity of the three spheres of body, speech, and mind.

original: sems can gyi zhing yongs su dag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po nyid yin pa'i phyir sems can gyi zhing yongs su dag pa'o //🔽bsnan pa med pa dang dbri ba med pa zhes bya ba la /🔽yod pa skur pa mi 'debs pa ni dbri ba med pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi zhing yongs su dag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po nyid yin pa'i phyir sems can gyi zhing yongs su dag pa'o // bsnan pa med pa dang dbri ba med pa zhes bya ba la / yod pa skur pa mi 'debs pa ni dbri ba med pa'o //
translated: Because the field of sentient beings is purified means that the field of sentient beings is purified because all sentient beings are the essence of the Tathagata.🔽Without addition and without subtraction means🔽without subtraction, because existence is not denied,

original: med pa sgro mi 'dogs pa ni bsnan pa med pa ste /
analyzed: med pa sgro mi 'dogs pa ni bsnan pa med pa ste /
translated: and without addition, because non-existence is not affirmed.

original: yang dag par yod pa la skur pa mi 'debs pa dang / yang dag par med pa la sgro mi 'dogs pas mnyam pa nyid du mthong zhes bya ba'i @151b tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang dag par yod pa la skur pa mi 'debs pa dang / yang dag par med pa la sgro mi 'dogs pas mnyam pa nyid du mthong zhes bya ba'i @151b tha tshig go //
translated: It is the same in seeing the equality of things, in that it does not deny what is really there and does not superimpose what is not there.

original: gang chos thams cad rab tu rtogs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs par bya ba dang / rtogs par byed pa gnyi ga ma mthong ba'i phyir rtogs pa med pa nyid yang dag pa'i tshul rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang chos thams cad rab tu rtogs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs par bya ba dang / rtogs par byed pa gnyi ga ma mthong ba'i phyir rtogs pa med pa nyid yang dag pa'i tshul rtogs pa'o //
translated: The absence of realization is the realization of the true mode of being, because neither the realization nor the object of realization are seen.

original: chos nyid la kun tu spyod pa med pa nyid de tshul gcig tu bstan pa'o zhes bya ba ni dper na nam mkha' gcig pu'i ngo bo yin pas /
analyzed: chos nyid la kun tu spyod pa med pa nyid de tshul gcig tu bstan pa'o zhes bya ba ni dper na nam mkha' gcig pu'i ngo bo yin pas /
translated: The absence of activity is the teaching of the single principle, because there is no activity in reality.

original: ngo bo nyid la tha dad du dbye ba med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la tha dad du dbye ba med pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as space has a single nature and is not differentiated by nature,

original: de bzhin nyid kyang rnam pa gcig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyang rnam pa gcig pa'i phyir /
translated: so too suchness is the same in all things.

original: yod pa dang med pa dang / chos dang / chos ma yin pa dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos gnyis la kun tu spyod pa med pas tshul gcig tu bstan to //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dang / chos dang / chos ma yin pa dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos gnyis la kun tu spyod pa med pas tshul gcig tu bstan to //
translated: He is said to be “one-sided” because he does not engage in the duality of things such as existence and non-existence, virtue and evil, permanence and impermanence.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi lta ba rnams zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi lta ba ma spangs pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de dag la bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi lta ba rnams zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi lta ba ma spangs pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de dag la bya'o //
translated: The “views of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas” are the conceptual thoughts that have not been abandoned by the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: gang dbang po drug po dag rab tu mi 'phro ba gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba med cing 'du ba'o //
analyzed: gang dbang po drug po dag rab tu mi 'phro ba gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba med cing 'du ba'o //
translated: “The non-scattering of the six senses” means that they do not go out to objects and do not come together with them.

original: shes pa thogs pa med pa'i ye shes kyis rjes su chags pa'i sa ma yin pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni gang rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang bral ba'i ye shes de gang zhe na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes pa thogs pa med pa'i ye shes kyis rjes su chags pa'i sa ma yin pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni gang rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang bral ba'i ye shes de gang zhe na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “The wisdom that is not attached to the unobstructed wisdom” means “What is the wisdom that is free from attachment and aversion?”

original: gang chos la bsnyen bkur ba ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang chos la bsnyen bkur ba ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The one who serves the Dharma” means

original: sus chos mthong ba des sangs rgyas mthong ngo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sus chos mthong ba des sangs rgyas mthong ngo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Whoever sees the Dharma sees the Buddha.🔽It purifies the buddhaverse, which is the field of oneself and others.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi sems can gyi zhing yongs su sbyong bar byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi zhing ma gtogs par sangs rgyas kyi zhing zhes bya ba gzhan med de /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi sems can gyi zhing yongs su sbyong bar byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi zhing ma gtogs par sangs rgyas kyi zhing zhes bya ba gzhan med de /
translated: There is no buddhaverse apart from the field of sentient beings,

original: rnam par rig pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is mere representation.

original: gang rnam par smin pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa la rtsol ba med pa'i phyir don dam par rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i spyod pa'i sa thams cad yongs su rdzogs te /
analyzed: gang rnam par smin pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa la rtsol ba med pa'i phyir don dam par rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i spyod pa'i sa thams cad yongs su rdzogs te /
translated: The concentration of maturation is the perfection of all the stages of practice with effort in the ultimate, because there is no effort on the eighth stage.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid du gnas so //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid du gnas so //
translated: The virtues are present in the nature of maturation.

original: de bas na sngon ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'i rnam par smin par gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams lhun gyis grub pa nyid du byang chub sems dpa' la nye bar 'du ste /
analyzed: de bas na sngon ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'i rnam par smin par gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams lhun gyis grub pa nyid du byang chub sems dpa' la nye bar 'du ste /
translated: Therefore, the concentrations of maturation that were previously entered into are spontaneously accomplished for the bodhisattva.

original: de bas na mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “equipoise. ”

original: spobs pa'i klung ni spobs pa'i rgyun dang / tshul dang / spobs pa rgyun @152a * //
analyzed: spobs pa'i klung ni spobs pa'i rgyun dang / tshul dang / spobs pa rgyun @152a * //
translated: “The river of eloquence” is the stream of eloquence, the manner of eloquence, and the continuous eloquence.

original: du 'byung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: du 'byung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the meaning of “continuous eloquence. ”

original: rdzus shing skye ba ste zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa yan chad ni mngal na gnas pa med de /
analyzed: rdzus shing skye ba ste zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa yan chad ni mngal na gnas pa med de /
translated: “Born supernaturally” means that from the eighth stage on there is no womb.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i don du ni de lta bur yang ston to //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i don du ni de lta bur yang ston to //
translated: But in order to develop living beings, they manifest in that way.

original: dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa'o //
translated: “The stage of seeing what is white” is the stage of the practice of faith.

original: rigs kyi sa zhes bya ba ni bzod pa chen po'i sa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi sa zhes bya ba ni bzod pa chen po'i sa'o //
translated: “The stage of the family” is the stage of great patience.

original: brgyad pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'jug pa'i sa ste /
analyzed: brgyad pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'jug pa'i sa ste /
translated: “The eighth stage” is the stage of entry into the result of stream-winning.

original: de ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa nas bzung ste bgrangs nas brgyad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa nas bzung ste bgrangs nas brgyad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Counting from the stage of the result of the perfected being, it is the eighth.

original: mthong ba'i sa zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i sa zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa'i sa'o //
translated: “The stage of seeing” is the stage of the result of stream-winning.

original: bsrabs pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i sa ste /
analyzed: bsrabs pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i sa ste /
translated: The stage of thinning out is the stage of the once-returner,

original: de'i 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa srab mor byas pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: de'i 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa srab mor byas pa tsam du zad do //
translated: for him the desire realm attachments and so on are merely thinned out.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa ni phyir mi 'ong ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa ni phyir mi 'ong ba ste /
translated: The stage of freedom from attachment is the stage of the non-returner,

original: des 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang gnod sems yang dag par bcad pa dang 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: des 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang gnod sems yang dag par bcad pa dang 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba yin no //
translated: for he has completely eliminated desire for desire realm objects and the malice that is its root.

original: byas pa rtogs pa can gyi sa ni dgra bcom pa nyid de /
analyzed: byas pa rtogs pa can gyi sa ni dgra bcom pa nyid de /
translated: The stage of the one who has realized what had to be done is the stage of the arhat,

original: bya ba byas so zhes khong du chud pa ni byas pa rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba byas so zhes khong du chud pa ni byas pa rtogs pa ste /
translated: for he has realized that what had to be done has been done.

original: de 'di la yod pas na byas pa rtogs pa can zhes bya ste dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: de 'di la yod pas na byas pa rtogs pa can zhes bya ste dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: He is called the one who has realized what had to be done because he has that realization.

original: yang na 'di byas pa khong du chud pa'i ngang tshul can yin pas byas pa rtogs pa can te /
analyzed: yang na 'di byas pa khong du chud pa'i ngang tshul can yin pas byas pa rtogs pa can te /
translated: Or else, he is the one who has realized what had to be done because he has the nature of having realized what had to be done.

original: de'i sa ni byas pa rtogs pa can gyi sa'o //
analyzed: de'i sa ni byas pa rtogs pa can gyi sa'o //
translated: His stage is the stage of the one who has realized what had to be done.

original: theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This has been the explanation of the one who has set out in the Great Vehicle.

original: de ltar theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the one who has set out in the Great Vehicle,🔽then, since it was asked, “From where does that vehicle come forth?”

original: de'i 'og tu theg pa de gang nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba zhus pas gsum pa brtsams te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu theg pa de gang nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba zhus pas gsum pa brtsams te /
translated: the third chapter was begun.

original: khams gsum nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: khams gsum nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: It comes forth from the three realms and🔽it abides in the state of omniscience.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang na ba der gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dag la yang khams gsum nas nges par 'byung ba yang yod pas de bsal ba'i phyir khams gsum nas byung nas rnam
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang na ba der gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dag la yang khams gsum nas nges par 'byung ba yang yod pas de bsal ba'i phyir khams gsum nas byung nas rnam
translated: Since there is also a coming forth from the three realms in the vehicles of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas, in order to eliminate that, it is said, “Having come forth from the three realms, it abides in the state of omniscience.”

original: pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas theg pa chen po la bya ba gnyis yod par bstan te /
analyzed: pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas theg pa chen po la bya ba gnyis yod par bstan te /
translated: This shows that the Great Vehicle has two functions.

original: theg pa chen po ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas par @152b 'gyur zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: theg pa chen po ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas par @152b 'gyur zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For it is said, “The Great Vehicle comes forth from the three realms and abides in the state of omniscience.”

original: de yang gnyis su med pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni gnyis la tha dad pa yod do snyam du log par zhugs pa rnams la 'bras bu tha dad pa med par ston te /
analyzed: de yang gnyis su med pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni gnyis la tha dad pa yod do snyam du log par zhugs pa rnams la 'bras bu tha dad pa med par ston te /
translated: Moreover, “in a manner that is nondual” means that for those who have wrongly engaged in thinking that duality exists, the nonexistence of a difference in effect is taught.

original: theg pa chen po la 'bras bu'i gnas skabs na sangs rgyas nyid du zad pas theg pa chen po dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la 'bras bu'i gnas skabs na sangs rgyas nyid du zad pas theg pa chen po dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la tha dad pa med do //
translated: In the context of the effect, there is no difference between the Great Vehicle and the knowledge of all aspects, because the Great Vehicle is exhausted in buddhahood.

original: de bas na gnyis su med pa nyid de /
analyzed: de bas na gnyis su med pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, it is nonduality.

original: de'i phyir chos 'di gnyis ni ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos 'di gnyis ni ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Hence, it is said that “these two dharmas are neither conjoined nor disjoined,” and so on.

original: gcig pa dang tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid med par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gcig pa dang tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid med par bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches that they do not have the character of being the same or different.

original: ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for “neither conjoined nor disjoined,”

original: gcig pa med pa'i phyir ldan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig pa med pa'i phyir ldan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: they are not conjoined because they are not the same.

original: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir mi ldan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir mi ldan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: They are not disjoined because they are not different.

original: 'dzugs par mi byed pa'i phyir gzugs med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzugs par mi byed pa'i phyir gzugs med pa'o //
translated: It is formless because it does not establish form.

original: bstan par mi nus pas bstan du med pa'o //
analyzed: bstan par mi nus pas bstan du med pa'o //
translated: It is imperceptible because it cannot be shown.

original: 'di gnyis kyis ni 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba med par bstan te /
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyis ni 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba med par bstan te /
translated: These two demonstrate the absence of apprehender and apprehended.

original: gang gi phyir 'dzugs par mi byed pa de'i phyir 'dzin pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dzugs par mi byed pa de'i phyir 'dzin pa med pa'o //
translated: Because it does not establish, there is no apprehender.

original: gang gi phyir bstan par mi nus pa de'i phyir gzung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bstan par mi nus pa de'i phyir gzung ba med pa'o //
translated: Because it cannot be shown, there is no apprehended.

original: thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni dbang po dang / yul ltar thogs pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir yul dang / yul can med par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni dbang po dang / yul ltar thogs pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir yul dang / yul can med par bstan pa'o //
translated: This “unobstructed” demonstrates the absence of object and subject, because it does not have the characteristic of obstruction like a sense faculty and object.

original: de ltar mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa ste /
translated: Thus, because it is without characteristics, it is without characteristics.

original: gnyi ga yang mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir /
translated: Because both are without characteristics, they are the same in being without characteristics.

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Thus, it is said to be the same in being without characteristics.

original: rab 'byor mtshan nyid med pa'i chos la ni 'byung ba 'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor mtshan nyid med pa'i chos la ni 'byung ba 'am /
translated: Subhūti, dharmas that are without characteristics do not arise,

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: nor will they arise,

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: that thusness is not newly produced.

original: 'di ltar yongs su grub pa'i chos ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad dang bral zhing rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar yongs su grub pa'i chos ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad dang bral zhing rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: Thus, the perfected nature is free from all the characteristics of the imagined nature and is pure by nature.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin gyis nges par 'byung zin pas de la glo bur gyi nges par 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin gyis nges par 'byung zin pas de la glo bur gyi nges par 'byung ba med do //
translated: Therefore, since it is by nature already liberated, there is no adventitious liberation in it.

original: rab 'byor mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams las nges par 'byung bar 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid 'byung bar 'dod du zad do zhes bya ba la sogs pas glo bur gyi nges @153a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams las nges par 'byung bar 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid 'byung bar 'dod du zad do zhes bya ba la sogs pas glo bur gyi nges @153a * //
translated: Subhūti, whoever wishes to emerge from phenomena that lack characteristics would be wishing for the emergence of thusness.

original: par 'byung ba med pa de nyid rgya cher bstan to //
analyzed: par 'byung ba med pa de nyid rgya cher bstan to //
translated: This and more extensively explains that there is no adventitious liberation.

original: de bzhin nyid ni rang bzhin nyid kyis cis kyang ma gos shing nam mkha' lta bu la nges par 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni rang bzhin nyid kyis cis kyang ma gos shing nam mkha' lta bu la nges par 'byung ba med do //
translated: Thusness is by nature uncontaminated by anything and is like space, so there is no liberation.

original: de bas na rab 'byor de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ni khams gsum nas nges par 'byung ba med do zhes bya ba gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na rab 'byor de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ni khams gsum nas nges par 'byung ba med do zhes bya ba gsungs pa'o //
translated: The reality-limit is not two, nor is it divided.🔽The reality-limit is not something to be purified.

original: de bzhin nyid ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba kun brtags pa gang yang med na /🔽gang gi phyir de de las nges par 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba kun brtags pa gang yang med na / gang gi phyir de de las nges par 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: The reality-limit is not something to be purified.🔽The reality-limit is not something to be purified.🔽The reality-limit is not something to be purified.🔽The reality-limit is not something to be purified.🔽The reality-limit is not something to be purified.🔽The reality-limit is not something to be purified.🔽The reality-limit is not something to be purified.🔽The reality-limit is not something to be purified.🔽The reality-limit is not something to be purified.🔽The reality-limit is not something to be purified.🔽The reality-limit is not something to be purified.🔽The reality-limit is not something to be purified.🔽The reality-limit is not something to be purified.🔽The reality-limit is not something to be purified.🔽The reality-limit is not something to be purified.🔽The reality-limit is not something to be purified.🔽The reality-limit is not something to be purified.🔽The reality-limit is not something to be purified.🔽The reality-limit is not something to be purified.🔽The reality-limit is not something to be purified.🔽The reality-limit is not something to be purified.🔽The reality-limit is not something to be purified.🔽The reality-limit is not something to be purified.🔽The reality-limit is not something to be purified.🔽The reality-limit is not something to be purified.🔽The reality-limit is not something to be purified.🔽The reality-limit is not something to be purified.🔽The reality-limit is not something to be purified.🔽The reality-limit is not something to be purified.🔽The reality-limit is not something to be purified.🔽The reality-limit is not something to be purified.🔽The reality-limit is not something to be purified.🔽The reality-limit is not something to be purified.

original: de bzhin nyid la sogs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings kyi mthar thug pa'i bar 'og nas 'byung ba dag ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la sogs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings kyi mthar thug pa'i bar 'og nas 'byung ba dag ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The reality-limit is not something to be purified.🔽The reality

original: spong ba'i dbyings dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dbyings dang / 'gog pa'i dbyings zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid de nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i spros pa thams cad spong ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir spong ba'i dbyings zhes bya'o //
analyzed: spong ba'i dbyings dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dbyings dang / 'gog pa'i dbyings zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid de nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i spros pa thams cad spong ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir spong ba'i dbyings zhes bya'o //
translated: The realm of abandonment, the realm of freedom from passion, and the realm of cessation are thusness, because it is the cause of the abandonment of all the fabrications of the addictions and the knowable.

original: srid pa gsum gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rgyu yin pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad las 'das pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dbyings zhes bya'o //
analyzed: srid pa gsum gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rgyu yin pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad las 'das pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dbyings zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the realm of abandonment because it is the cause of freedom from passion for the three realms of existence and because it transcends all the worlds.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad 'gog pa'i rgyu yin pas 'gog pa'i dbyings zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad 'gog pa'i rgyu yin pas 'gog pa'i dbyings zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the realm of cessation because it is the cause of the cessation of all suffering.

original: ming dang mtshan ma dang brda dang / tha snyad dang / gdags pa zhes bya ba tshig lnga po dag gis ni kun brtags pa bsdu ste /
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma dang brda dang / tha snyad dang / gdags pa zhes bya ba tshig lnga po dag gis ni kun brtags pa bsdu ste /
translated: The five terms name, sign, symbol, convention, and designation include the imagined.

original: dper na ba lang gi rdzas la ba lang zhes bya ba ni ming ngo //
analyzed: dper na ba lang gi rdzas la ba lang zhes bya ba ni ming ngo //
translated: For example, the term cow is the name.

original: lkog shal dang mjug ma la sogs pa ni mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: lkog shal dang mjug ma la sogs pa ni mtshan ma'o //
translated: The dewlap, the tail, etc. are the characteristics.

original: zal mo'i bu dmar mo'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni brda'o //
analyzed: zal mo'i bu dmar mo'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni brda'o //
translated: The son of the red cow, the son of the white cow, etc. are the conventional symbols.

original: ba khrid de shog pa zhos shig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni tha snyad do //
analyzed: ba khrid de shog pa zhos shig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni tha snyad do //
translated: Bring the cow, bring the calf, etc. are the conventions.

original: brjod pa thams cad ni gdags pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pa thams cad ni gdags pa'o //
translated: All the expressions are the designations.

original: skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang zhes bya ba ni tshig lnga po dag gis yongs su grub pa bsdus te /
analyzed: skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang zhes bya ba ni tshig lnga po dag gis yongs su grub pa bsdus te /
translated: The five terms, beginning with “non-production,” include the Absolute Body.

original: skye ba med pa'i phyir mi skye ba'o //🔽'gag pa med pa'i phyir mi 'gag pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i phyir mi skye ba'o // 'gag pa med pa'i phyir mi 'gag pa'o //
translated: It is non-production because it is not produced.🔽It is non-stopping because it does not stop.

original: gos pa med pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med @153b pa'o //🔽rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i phyir rnam par byang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gos pa med pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med @153b pa'o // rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i phyir rnam par byang ba med pa'o //
translated: It is non-defilement because it is not defiled.🔽It is non-purification because it is pure by nature.

original: rnam par dag pa'i rgyur mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i rgyur mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: It is non-conditioning because it is the cause of purification.

original: mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'o //
translated: It is not something to be brought about.

original: da ni theg pa gang du gnas par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni zhus pa bzhi pa brtsams te /
analyzed: da ni theg pa gang du gnas par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni zhus pa bzhi pa brtsams te /
translated: Now, the fourth question is begun: “In what vehicle will they stand?”🔽Subhūti, that vehicle will not stand anywhere.

original: rab 'byor theg pa de ni gang du yang gnas par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba ni ji ltar nam mkha' gang na yang mi gnas pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po yang mthar phyin cing chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid yin pas gang du yang gnas🔽par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor theg pa de ni gang du yang gnas par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba ni ji ltar nam mkha' gang na yang mi gnas pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po yang mthar phyin cing chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid yin pas gang du yang gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as space does not stand anywhere, so also the Great Vehicle, having reached the end, does not stand anywhere, because it is the nature of the Dharma Body.

original: theg pa chen po 'ba' zhig gnas par mi 'gyur bar ma zad kyi /
analyzed: theg pa chen po 'ba' zhig gnas par mi 'gyur bar ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only does the Great Vehicle not stand anywhere,

original: kun brtags pa dang / yongs su grub pa'i chos thams cad kyang gang na yang mi gnas so zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: kun brtags pa dang / yongs su grub pa'i chos thams cad kyang gang na yang mi gnas so zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: but also all imagined and perfected phenomena do not stand anywhere.

original: chos thams cad gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos thams cad gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because all phenomena are non-abiding.

original: kun brtags pa ni med pa'i phyir gang na yang mi gnas so //
analyzed: kun brtags pa ni med pa'i phyir gang na yang mi gnas so //
translated: The imagined does not stand anywhere because it does not exist.

original: yongs su grub pa ni gzhi dang brten pa med pa'i phyir gang na yang mi gnas so //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa ni gzhi dang brten pa med pa'i phyir gang na yang mi gnas so //
translated: The perfected does not abide anywhere, because it has no basis or support.

original: 'on kyang theg pa chen po de ni mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gnas pa med pa nyid de'i gnas pa yin par tha snyad gdags par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang theg pa chen po de ni mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gnas pa med pa nyid de'i gnas pa yin par tha snyad gdags par bstan pa'o //
translated: Nevertheless, that Great Vehicle abides in a manner of non-abiding. This teaches that the non-abiding itself is the abiding of that.

original: de bas na de bzhin nyid ni gnas pa yang ma yin mi gnas pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin nyid ni gnas pa yang ma yin mi gnas pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that suchness is neither abiding nor non-abiding.

original: don dam par brten pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir gnas pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par brten pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir gnas pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Ultimately, it is not abiding because it lacks the characteristic of support.

original: mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid du gnas pa'i phyir tha snyad du mi gnas pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid du gnas pa'i phyir tha snyad du mi gnas pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Conventionally, it is not non-abiding because it abides as the characteristic of non-abiding.

original: de bzhin du gnas pa dang / mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas pa dang / mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, this should be applied to all characteristics of abiding and non-abiding.

original: mi gnas par gnas pa'i tshul dang / bskyod du med pa'i tshul gyis gang du yang gnas par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba ni rten gyi dngos por gang du yang gnas par 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: mi gnas par gnas pa'i tshul dang / bskyod du med pa'i tshul gyis gang du yang gnas par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba ni rten gyi dngos por gang du yang gnas par 'gyur ba med de /
translated: It is not located anywhere, by way of not being located in a location, and by way of not being moved.

original: de bas na mi gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na mi gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “non-located.”

original: mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gnas pa dang / brtan pa dang / phyin ci log med pa'i phyir gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gnas pa dang / brtan pa dang / phyin ci log med pa'i phyir gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is located by way of the characteristic of non-location, and it is called “located” because it is stable and free from error.

original: des su zhig nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni zhus pa lnga pa ste /
analyzed: des su zhig nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni zhus pa lnga pa ste /
translated: “By whom is there liberation?” is the fifth question.

original: theg pa de gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'o //🔽gang @154a * //
analyzed: theg pa de gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'o // gang @154a * //
translated: “What is that vehicle?” is the Great Vehicle.

original: nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni gang zag go //🔽gang gis nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni lam gyi chos gang gis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni gang zag go // gang gis nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni lam gyi chos gang gis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “By whom is there liberation?” is the person.🔽“By what is there liberation?” is the Dharma of the path.

original: rgyu gang gis nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu gang gis nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “By what cause is there liberation?”

original: gang nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni srid pa las so //
analyzed: gang nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni srid pa las so //
translated: From what does one definitely emerge? From existence.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir bdag mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni gal te bdag la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa yongs su zin na /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir bdag mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni gal te bdag la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa yongs su zin na /
translated: The phrase because of complete purity, the self is not apprehended means that if the self and so on, or form and so on, were to be appropriated,

original: yongs su grub pa shin tu rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de nyams par 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa shin tu rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de nyams par 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
translated: then that perfected nature which is completely pure would be impaired.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang mi dmigs pas chos 'di dag thams cad dmigs su ma mchis pa lags zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa sngar smos pa thams cad kyi gtan tshigs zhus pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang mi dmigs pas chos 'di dag thams cad dmigs su ma mchis pa lags zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa sngar smos pa thams cad kyi gtan tshigs zhus pa'o //
translated: Bhagavan, by not apprehending what are all these phenomena not apprehended? He asks this in order to demonstrate the reason why all the previous non-apprehensions are non-apprehensions.

original: de la 'gres gsum ste /
analyzed: de la 'gres gsum ste /
translated: There are three sets of three.

original: thog mar de bzhin nyid la sogs pa mi dmigs pa ni ches de dag dmigs su med pa'i gtan tshigs kyi 'gres dang po'o //
analyzed: thog mar de bzhin nyid la sogs pa mi dmigs pa ni ches de dag dmigs su med pa'i gtan tshigs kyi 'gres dang po'o //
translated: The first set of three is the reason why those are not apprehended.

original: de'i 'og tu de bzhin nyid la sogs pa ci'i phyir mi dmigs snyam du the tshom du gyur pa dang / de bzhin nyid la sogs pa de dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid mi dmigs pas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de bzhin nyid la sogs pa ci'i phyir mi dmigs snyam du the tshom du gyur pa dang / de bzhin nyid la sogs pa de dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid mi dmigs pas /
translated: Since the intrinsic identity of suchness, etc. is not perceived, it is said, they are not perceived.

original: dmigs su med do zhes bya ba ni 'gres gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs su med do zhes bya ba ni 'gres gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second permutation.

original: de nas stong pa nyid thams cad dang / sa la sogs pa'i chos rnams mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni 'gres gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de nas stong pa nyid thams cad dang / sa la sogs pa'i chos rnams mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni 'gres gsum pa'o //
translated: Then, the non-perception of all emptinesses and of phenomena such as the earth is the third permutation.

original: dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa zhes bya ba ni lhag mthong gi gnas skabs 'ba' zhig la bya ste /
analyzed: dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa zhes bya ba ni lhag mthong gi gnas skabs 'ba' zhig la bya ste /
translated: The stage of bright vision is only the state of insight,

original: mos pa spyod pa'i sa la'o //
analyzed: mos pa spyod pa'i sa la'o //
translated: on the stage of devoted practice

original: rigs kyis zhes bya ba ni rigs kyi gnas skabs la sa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rigs kyis zhes bya ba ni rigs kyi gnas skabs la sa zhes bya ste /
translated: The stage of lineage is called a stage because it is a state of lineage.

original: rigs kyi sa zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i gnas skabs ma lus par bstan to //
analyzed: rigs kyi sa zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i gnas skabs ma lus par bstan to //
translated: The stage of lineage is taught as the state of the roots of virtue that are conducive to penetrations.

original: bcom ldan 'das theg pa chen po zhes bgyi ba 'di ni zhes bya ba theg pa chen po ni sngar bshad zin pa snyam na skabs gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das theg pa chen po zhes bgyi ba 'di ni zhes bya ba theg pa chen po ni sngar bshad zin pa snyam na skabs gang yin zhe na /
translated: The Great Vehicle has already been explained. But if one thinks, What is the context?

original: de yang bden mod kyi /
analyzed: de yang bden mod kyi /
translated: That is true, but

original: sngar ni theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i sgra bshad pa las /
analyzed: sngar ni theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i sgra bshad pa las /
translated: previously, in the explanation of the term one who has entered the Great Vehicle,

original: 'jug pa'i skabs su pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa gzungs kyi sgo'i mtha' la thug gi bar du sgrub pa'i chos rnams theg pa chen po yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i skabs su pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa gzungs kyi sgo'i mtha' la thug gi bar du sgrub pa'i chos rnams theg pa chen po yin par bstan to //
translated: in the context of engagement, the Great Vehicle was taught to be the phenomena of practice from the perfections up to the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: da ni theg pa @154b de gang nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa nges par 'byung ba'i gnas skabs nas 'bras bu'i theg pa chen po sangs rgyas nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: da ni theg pa @154b de gang nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa nges par 'byung ba'i gnas skabs nas 'bras bu'i theg pa chen po sangs rgyas nyid du bstan to //
translated: Now, from the context of definite emergence, the Great Vehicle of the result is taught to be buddhahood, with the question From where will that definite emergence occur?

original: de bas na da ni 'bras bu'i theg pa chen po 'di la /
analyzed: de bas na da ni 'bras bu'i theg pa chen po 'di la /
translated: Therefore, now, in this Great Vehicle of the result,

original: theg pa chen po'i nges pa'i tshig dang / theg pa chen po'i chos rnams yang bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i nges pa'i tshig dang / theg pa chen po'i chos rnams yang bstan par bya ste /
translated: the etymology of the Great Vehicle and the phenomena of the Great Vehicle should be taught.

original: 'di ni gnas skabs so //
analyzed: 'di ni gnas skabs so //
translated: This is the occasion.

original: lha dang mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lha dang mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Having surpassed the world with its gods, humans, and asuras, he will go forth.

original: de'i slad du theg pa chen po zhes bgyi'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i slad du theg pa chen po zhes bgyi'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: For that reason it is called the Great Vehicle.

original: 'gro ba ni 'dir theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni 'dir theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, going is called the Great Vehicle.

original: nges par 'byung ba che ba gang yin pa de theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba che ba gang yin pa de theg pa chen po'o //
translated: The greatness of going forth is the Great Vehicle.

original: gang gi phyir 'jig rten gsum po zil gyis mnan te thams cad las nges par 'byung ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig rten gsum po zil gyis mnan te thams cad las nges par 'byung ba de'i phyir /
translated: Because it surpasses the three worlds and goes forth from all of them,

original: 'di'i nges par 'byung ba che bas theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i nges par 'byung ba che bas theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: its going forth is great. Therefore it is called the Great Vehicle.

original: theg pa chen po de ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa ste zhes bya bas ni de nyid kyi che ba nyid sgrub ste skabs 'byed pa che ba dang / skye ba dang / 'gag pa la sogs pa med pa dang / dus kyis ma bsdus pa dang rgyu rnam pa gsum gyis nam mkha' dang 'dra bar bstan to //
analyzed: theg pa chen po de ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa ste zhes bya bas ni de nyid kyi che ba nyid sgrub ste skabs 'byed pa che ba dang / skye ba dang / 'gag pa la sogs pa med pa dang / dus kyis ma bsdus pa dang rgyu rnam pa gsum gyis nam mkha' dang 'dra bar bstan to //
translated: The greatness of opportunity refers to the fact that the Mahayana is like space, because it is not obstructed by the activities of all sentient beings, because it is not diminished by the development of all sentient beings, and because it is not increased by the entrance of all sentient beings.

original: dper na nam mkha' la sems can thams cad skad cig gcig la ji ltar 'dod pa'i spyod lam thams cad kyis gnas kyang dogs pa med pas go skabs phye ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' la sems can thams cad skad cig gcig la ji ltar 'dod pa'i spyod lam thams cad kyis gnas kyang dogs pa med pas go skabs phye ba de bzhin du /
translated: For example, space is not obstructed by the activities of all sentient beings, because they can stand, sit, and so on, in any way they wish, and because it is not diminished by the development of all sentient beings, because it is not diminished even when all sentient beings develop, and because it is not increased by the entrance of all sentient beings, because it is not increased even when all sentient beings enter it.

original: theg pa chen po 'di la yang skad cig gcig la sems can thams cad cig car lhags nas thams cad shes pa nyid dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'khod nas gnas kyang go skabs yangs pa'i phyir gnod pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: theg pa chen po 'di la yang skad cig gcig la sems can thams cad cig car lhags nas thams cad shes pa nyid dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'khod nas gnas kyang go skabs yangs pa'i phyir gnod pa ci yang med do //
translated: In the same way, in this Mahayana, even though all sentient beings come at once in a single instant and all of them enter the knowledge of paths, the knowledge of all aspects, and abide there, there is no obstruction at all because of the vast opportunity.

original: dper na nam mkha' ni dus 'di la 'ongs so byung ngo zhes bya'am /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' ni dus 'di la 'ongs so byung ngo zhes bya'am /
translated: For example, it is not possible to say that space has come from somewhere,

original: song ngo 'gags so zhes bya ba 'am /
analyzed: song ngo 'gags so zhes bya ba 'am /
translated: has gone somewhere,

original: gnas pa'i skad cig gi dbang gis gnas so zhes bya bar brjod du mi rung ste /
analyzed: gnas pa'i skad cig gi dbang gis gnas so zhes bya bar brjod du mi rung ste /
translated: or that it abides in terms of the instants of its presence.

original: theg pa chen po yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: theg pa chen po yang de bzhin no //
translated: The Mahayana is also like that.

original: dper na nam mkha' ni sngon gyi dus de na byung ngo //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' ni sngon gyi dus de na byung ngo //
translated: For example, it is not possible to say that space existed in the past,

original: phyi ma'i dus de na 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi ma'i dus de na 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: that it will come into existence in the future,

original: bar gyi dus de na yod do zhes brjod par mi nus te /🔽theg pa chen po yang de bzhin no zhes de'i rim gyis 'gres gsum gyis @155a * //
analyzed: bar gyi dus de na yod do zhes brjod par mi nus te / theg pa chen po yang de bzhin no zhes de'i rim gyis 'gres gsum gyis @155a * //
translated: or that it exists in the present.🔽The Mahayana is also like that.🔽This is taught by the three examples in the same order.

original: bstan to // de nas gnas brtan gyis smras pa'i 'gres nyid la /
analyzed: bstan to // de nas gnas brtan gyis smras pa'i 'gres nyid la /
translated: Then, in the same order as the elder’s examples,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mngon par dgyes par mdzad nas sngar bshad pa'i rim gyis pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa chos kyi skus bsdus pa dang / theg pa chen po nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mngon par dgyes par mdzad nas sngar bshad pa'i rim gyis pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa chos kyi skus bsdus pa dang / theg pa chen po nyid du bstan to //
translated: The Bhagavān, being pleased, taught the Mahāyāna itself by way of the previously explained stages, subsuming the dharmas of the perfections and so on under the fruitional self-arisen gnosis, the dharmakāya.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pas de ltar theg pa chen po bstan nas de'i 'og tu gnas brtan gyis lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan nas /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pas de ltar theg pa chen po bstan nas de'i 'og tu gnas brtan gyis lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan nas /
translated: Having taught the Mahāyāna in that way by way of the six perfections and so on, the elder Subhūti then outshone the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: theg pa de nges par 'byung bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba dang / theg pa de nam mkha' dang mnyam pa ste zhes bya ba dang / bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na nam mkha' ni sems can grangs ma mchis tshad ma mchis /🔽dpag tu ma mchis pa rnams kyi go 'byed do zhes bya ba dang / 'ong ba'am /
analyzed: theg pa de nges par 'byung bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba dang / theg pa de nam mkha' dang mnyam pa ste zhes bya ba dang / bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na nam mkha' ni sems can grangs ma mchis tshad ma mchis /🔽dpag tu ma mchis pa rnams kyi go 'byed do zhes bya ba dang / 'ong ba'am /
translated: He said, “The Mahāyāna will definitely deliver those who have entered it,” and “The Mahāyāna is equal to space,” and “Bhagavān, for example, space provides room for countless, limitless, and immeasurable sentient beings.”🔽He said, “The Mahāyāna is neither coming nor going,” and “The Mahāyāna is not a basis for the mind.”

original: 'gro ba mi dmigs zhes bya ba dang / sngon gyi mtha'am /
analyzed: 'gro ba mi dmigs zhes bya ba dang / sngon gyi mtha'am /
translated: The phrase the person is not observed is a reference to the past.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' mi dmigs zhes bya ba tshig lnga gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' mi dmigs zhes bya ba tshig lnga gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The five phrases the going of a person is not apprehended, the coming of a person is not apprehended, the past of a person is not apprehended, the future of a person is not apprehended, and a person is not apprehended were spoken, and the Bhagavān said to Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du theg pa de ni lha dang mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jug rten zil gyis mnan nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes smras pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshig de dag so sor smos te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du theg pa de ni lha dang mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jug rten zil gyis mnan nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes smras pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshig de dag so sor smos te /
translated: Subhūti, you said, 'That vehicle will surpass the world with its gods, humans, and asuras and go forth.' He spoke those phrases individually,

original: de dag rgya cher bstan to //
analyzed: de dag rgya cher bstan to //
translated: and they were extensively taught.

original: rab 'byor gal te 'dod pa'i khams de bzhin du gyur te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te 'dod pa'i khams de bzhin du gyur te /
translated: Subhūti, if the desire realm were to become thus,
